name: Puppy Care
description:
Story:
Congratulation, this is your first day of a professional vet at Puppy Care Hospital. Before you get too excited, I know there are many patients queuing outside. As the CEO of this hospital, I need you to get to the position right now. Be careful, beside finding a right diagnosis, you also need to estimate carefully how many puppies we should accommodate. We are counting on you! Let's get started!

Game Aim:
<Puppy Care> is a fast and simple card game for 2-4 players. In this game, your task is to save as many puppies as you can. You hold a hand of puppies suffering from different sickness. Identify what kind of care they need and send them to have treatment. However, medical resources are not unlimited and you have to compete with other players to get what you need! Remember, accurate estimation is always the key to winning!
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Crowbar Hotel
description:
Everyone is innocent, Nobody is talking, and it is 500 feet to freedom… in the Crowbar Hotel! In this set-collection, hidden-movement, and push-your-luck one vs all game for 2-5 Players. Players take the role of either Mangy Prisoners or the Greedy Prison Guard in order to either craft, or disrupt a escape from jail before time runs out.

Lock yourself in and experience the desperation of 1960’s jailhouse life, as you search wisely while avoiding the guard to find the items to craft yourself escapes using items like homemade Grappling Hooks, Metal Shears, or Makeshift Shovels.

PRISONERS - The player(s) who take the role of prisoner have to escape from Crowbar Hotel by collecting sets of cards to craft items that will allow them to escape at certain marked points on the board

GUARD - The player playing the role of the guard must stop the prisoners from escaping. At the end of the 6th round if the prisoners have not escaped the needed amount. The guard is the victor.

BRIBES - Prisoner Players may spend cash or items of value to the guard in order to avoid detection or being caught for a shakedown or returned for rollcall

USE CONTRABAND TO ESCAPE - After Collecting sets of cards they complete a set to make items such as homemade Grappling Hooks, Metal Shears, or Makeshift Shovels to help escape and win the game!

---

This game uses hidden movement and set collection to create a both thrilling and enjoyable experience for everyone involved. 2 player games are very cat and mouse, but when in larger groups (3-5) prisoner players must work together to both collect sets and avoid the ever growing faster prison guard.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Hidden Movement, Set Collection

name: Desert Eagles: Air Battles Over Israel, 1948
description:
“Yakum purkan min shemaya.” (Salvation will come from heaven). –Line from an Aramaic prayer.

Desert Eagles is an introductory level game about aerial combat set in the 1948 Arab-Israeli War. Israel’s victory in this war assured its status as an independent nation, and set off decades of conflict with its Arab neighbors that lasts to this day.

Each copy of Desert Eagles is composed of the following:

• One 8.5 by 11 inch map with turn record track.
• One sheet of 40 double-sided, un-mounted counters.
• 3 pages of rules.

Players will also need a standard deck of playing cards to play the game.

Desert Eagles is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by David Prieto Gómez.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Dark Force Incursion: Forest Expansion
description:
These are the Forest Expansion rules for Dark Force Incursion (DFI), a roll and write game that is for one person, taking 20 to 40 minutes to play. This expansion deals with the addition of the forest hex tile to the game.

Forest tiles are never written in. They present an opportunity to take short cuts to new areas of the map and yet can result in your army being lost if the area is busy. You will never see a dark army emerge from a forest.

-description from designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Golden Horseshoe Harness Race Game
description:
Official Harness
Fascinating Action!
Get out of the stand and drive your own horse. Use real strategy, tactics and techniques to win.

Four games in one:
Races
Time Trials
Match Races
Run Championship Heats

Players throw dice and move around the game board. The first to cross the finishing line after going around the track 1.5 times wins the race.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: The 1967 Annual
description: The 1967 Annual is a 64 page compendium of great new content for 7TV 2nd edition. This softback book features new articles, profiles, programme guides, the new Ratings War campaign rules and stories as well as 68 new profile cards, 12 ratings war cards and 4 new Daredevils gadgets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Street Masters: Chian and Dan
description:
Two winners of a contest had their likenesses immortalized into a pair of Ally/Rival cards for Street Masters.

These cards were available as promotions at GenCon 2019 and as a digital print and play.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Mobsters
description:
As a member of a notorious family, you are sent out to take over and control a new city. Explore the city and take the crucial points with your mobsters to collect resources. Expand your family by hiring new mobsters, building safehouses and having shootouts, street fights, to weaken your opponents. Take out your competitors to gain sole control of the city.

Players place city tiles to make up the city and move their mobsters to the best tiles to collect resources. Those resources can be used to hire new mobsters, build safehouses and take special actions.
Some city tiles have special public buildings like the city hall, the courthouse, police station... The player that has taken control of 4 public buildings, wins the game.

Be aware, your opponents can thwart you with all kinds of contracts, steal your resources and attack you directly.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Blood Red Skies: Messerschmitt Bf 109G Squadron
description:
The Messerschmitt BF 109 was the real workhorse of the Luftwaffe throughout the Second World War, being the most produced fighter aircraft in history, with a total of 33,984 airframes produced between 1936 and April 1945.

The Bf 109 was flown by the three top-scoring German fighter aces of World War II, who claimed 928 victories between them while flying with Jagdgeschwader 52, mainly on the Eastern Front. Pilots of other Axis nations also achieved ace status in the cockpit of a Bf 109, including pilots from Italy, Romania, Croatia and Hungary. Through constant development and improvements, the Bf 109 remained a potent and competitive aircraft.

The G series, or Gustav, was introduced in mid-1942 taking its cues from the prior F series (which featured new wings, an improved cooling system and adjusted fuselage aerodynamics). The G series further improved upon the engine, mounting a more powerful 1,475 PS DB 605 engine. It had a multitude of variants, ranging from high altitude fighters with pressurized cockpits to photo-reconnaissance and even a two-seater trainer. As the war wore on, further variants were introduced with water injection boost and high-performance superchargers added, to meet developing tactical requirements.

The Bf 109 achieved more aerial kills than any other aircraft of World War II. Many of these were against an inferior (in both training and equipment) Soviet Air Force during Operation Barbarossa. The operation resulted in the loss of 21,200 Soviet aircraft, of which, about half were to combat.

As the war progressed and the Allies made increasing bombing incursions into German territory, the environment became ever more target-rich for Bf 109 pilots, allowing for over 100 individual Luftwaffe pilots to be credited with 100 aerial victories each. This group in total claimed almost 15,000 kills - resulting in more than 2500 Luftwaffe pilots to be considered aces.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Battle Balloons
description:
You are the captain of a hot air balloon fleet, trying to pop your opponent's Crown Balloon to emerge from battle victorious. Navigate the skies of random chance and rely on strategic trickery to pop your opponent before you yourself are popped.

More simply, the goal of the game is to pop the balloon/Blink your opponent designated as the “Crown” before they pop the balloon/Blink you designated as your “Crown.” Players take turns single clicking their opponent's balloons to reduce their health and eventually pop them. Watch out for any Trap balloons! These are Blinks that will cause you to lose immediately if you pop them. The catch is, the location of each player’s respective Crown and TrapBust balloons will only be known to them. It’s a game of hidden information and bluffing! Two players recommended, but can easily accommodate more!

Setup
Distribute Balloons
Divide the Balloons/Blinks evenly among the players. Each player clusters their balloons together, and assigns each balloon a color.

Single-click a balloon to cycle between Red (high health), Blue (medium health), and Green (low health). For even fair play, make sure each player has the same number of each color. To give one player an advantage, allow them to have more high-health balloons.
Create Special Balloons
Decide how many Crowns and/or Traps each player will have. Again, for even play, each player should have the same amount.

Long Press a balloon to designate it as a Crown. Single-click it to cycle between the Crown and Trap Balloon designation. Crown Balloons appear yellow, and Trap Balloons appear purple. Long-pressing again will reset it back to a regular Balloon.

While creating these special balloons, make sure to hide your selection from your opponent - this step is where your strategic trickery begins! It might seem obvious to always select a Red Balloon as your Crown since they take the longest to pop. But your opponent knows this too, so they may start clicking the Red Balloon first. Knowing that, you could instead select a Blue Balloon as a Crown, making your opponent waste 3-6 clicks popping a non-Crown Balloon. Let the game theory begin!

Triple click one balloon on each player's cluster to move to start the game. Your Crown and Trap balloons will now appear as regular balloons, and the health of all balloons will be set based on their color.
Gameplay
On their turn, players take on of two actions:
Attack
Click an opponent's Balloon to reduce its health, shown by the number of faces lit. Each click reduces health by 1. When a balloon is reduced to 0 health, it pops, revealing whether it was a Crown, a Trap, or neither.

[diagram of slowly reducing health and death]
Fortify
You also can use your turn to fortify your own balloons. Remove a single balloon from your cluster to activate it - a single white face will appear on the Balloon. When you reconnect that Balloon to the cluster, it will transfer 1 unit of health to the Balloon it touches with the activated face.

Only balloons with at least 1 health remaining can be used to Fortify, and Balloons with 6 health cannot receive fortification.

Win Condition
There are multiple ways to win Battle Balloons. If you pop all of your opponent’s Crown Balloons, you are the winner!

[diagram of winning]

If, instead, you pop your opponent’s Trap Balloon, they are the winner!

[diagram of losing]

To reset the game, double-click any Balloon in your cluster to go back into Setup.
Alternate Setup
If you are playing with very few Blinks, you can instead give all Blinks to a single player and let them make the setup, then pass the entire cluster to the next player. That player then plays through the game with that cluster, counting the number of rounds it takes to win or lose.

In addition, you can play with more than 2 players. In a multiplayer game, you choose who to attack on your turn. If a player’s Crown Balloons are popped, they are out of the game. If you pop a Trap Balloon, you are out. The last player standing wins.
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points

name: Dynamo
description:
In the far-off future year of 1902, our Steampunk world will run on the greatest of all inventions: the Dynamo.

Dynamos are powered by touch, but each charge only lasts about a second. If a Dynamo runs out of power before being recharged, it will burn out and die. Once activated, Dynamos must continue to be recharged by touching them before they die out.

Dynamo is 3 party games in 1 small package!



Power Struggle
Dynamo power is scarce, and you must fight to keep the lights on. The goal is simple: be the last person to keep your Dynamo alive and operational.
Setup
Distribute 1 Dynamo Blink to each player. Players should place their Dynamos on a table or other flat surface, keeping a finger on their Dynamo at all times. Players can change the color of their Dynamo by double-clicking it.

For a more intense game, try playing without a flat surface. But be careful! Dynamos are tough, but not unbreakable!
Gameplay
All players begin the game at the same time by activating their Dynamos with a single-click.

Your goal is to keep pressing your Dynamo to keep it alive... by any means necessary! Distract, tempt, bargain, and befuddle your opponents on your path to victory.

If your Dynamo dies, you’re knocked out of the round.

Win Condition
The winner of the round is the last player to keep their Dynamo alive and operational.

After a Dynamo dies, it can be reset for the next round with a double-click. It will glow with a new randomized color to indicate that it's ready for play.



Bulb JugglerYou are a street-performer, and juggling Dynamos is your bread and butter. Try to keep as many of your Dynamos lit as you can before dropping one!

Setup
Gather Dynamo Blinks together into a group. Double press them to put them in the ready state, each with a random color gently pulsing.

You can also play with a friend by starting with one Dynamos and having them pass you additional bulbs while you play.

Gameplay
Start the round by single pressing any Dynamo. As it starts to fade, continue to add more Dynamos to the game as you play, pressing their buttons to keep them alive. If any of your Dynamos die the game has ended.
Win Condition
The game ends when at least one Dynamo dies. Keep count of how many you can keep alive before any of their lights go out.



Electron DriftElectron Drift is a “hot potato” meets “egg toss” style game for 2 or more players, using Dynamo Blinks. Pass Dynamos back and forth, keeping the current flowing before losing the charge!

Setup
Players sit around a table or across from each other. Assign one Dynamo Blink to a starting player. For added complexity, try letting additional players start with Dynamos.

Gameplay
The starting player single presses their Dynamo to start the one second charge. Then they pass the fading Dynamo either to the player next to them or across from them.
Players continue to pass their Dynamos back and forth until one dies. The player responsible for letting the Dynamo die is eliminated from the game.

The player nearest to the knocked out player may pick up the Dynamo, reset the charge with a double click, and pass it along to continue the game.
Win Condition
The game ends when only one player is left standing. The last player to keep the Dynamo alive is the winner!

If only playing with 2 players, players may alternatively pass the Dynamo back and forth, keeping track of how many passes they make before their Dynamo dies.
mechanics: Action Timer

name: Song for War: Mediterranean Theater
description:
November…1942. World War 2 ravages the globe in a bloody conflict for the very soul of humankind. Across the war-torn regions of the Mediterranean, the Axis powers of Germany and Italy control much of the theater. But the mighty nations of the United States and Great Britain are on the move, launching a massive offensive —code-named Operation Torch.

But where will the secret Allied fleet choose to land its assault? Will they reclaim air superiority, control the sea, and gain a foothold in the underbelly of Axis-held Europe, or will Axis forces repel the Allies back in a storm of blood and fire?

Song for War: Mediterranean Theater is a tabletop strategy game based in the contested regions of southern Europe, north Africa, and the Mediterranean Sea during World War 2. Representing one of four nations, players must work together as the Allies (US or Great Britain) or Axis (Germany or Italy). Players have the option to set strategy, move units, attack and defend as individual nations or simultaneously as the Allied or Axis team. Innovative mechanics allow players to deploy their land, sea, and air units strategically as combined forces, with faster units moving first and more often, followed by heavy units with stronger firepower. Take strategic objectives, control shipping lanes and resupply, deploy new technologies and units, and recreate historical events to defeat the enemy and win the day.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Hidden Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Rapid Fire! Able Archer 83-84
description:
Rapid Fire! Able Archer 83-84: A Cold War rules adaptation for use with Rapid Fire!

Modifications to Rapid Fire!:

Tank and Anti-Tank firing. (D6 roll changed to a D10),
Addition of Anti-Tank Guided Weapons such as TOW, Sagger missiles,
Air support works which is listed in the Aircraft Sequence of Action,
Rules for special artillery munitions, counter-battery fire and new tactics,
new vehicle stats for IFVs (Warrior, Bradley and BMD-2) and tanks,
Cold War scenarios,
two quick reference sheets that incorporate the rule changes.


These rules also work perfectly well for the Arab Israeli wars of 1973 and the Invasion of Lebanon in 1982.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Dispel The Darkness
description:
The Curse is growing stronger. The terrifying effects are noticeable by all. The Crown Prince has sent out a call for help and you are a commoner looking for adventure. You are one of few who become a “Volunteer”...those who decide to answer the call.

The goal sounds simple enough: Make your way to Oakhaven Castle to meet the Crown Prince and hear his request. He believes there are ancient scrolls that uphold the Curse and by finding the scrolls, they can be destroyed and end the Curse once and for all. However, the last six ancient scrolls are guarded by Dark Guardians, ancient creatures transformed by the Curse to protect the scrolls. No one has been successful in retrieving these last six scrolls.

As you journey through Oakhaven you will meet others and learn details that help you learn of Oakhaven's history, the Curse and ultimately reach a conclusion about what is really happening within the kingdom. The paths you choose will bring you to the final chapter where one last decision will change you and the kingdom forever.

Dispel The Darkness is a cooperative game for 1 to 6 players. Yes! You can play this solo! A cooperative, light-weight RPG, card drafting, dice rolling experience, with an end-game twist that will leave you speechless. This gateway RPG will introduce non-gamers to the fun, dungeon-crawling experience with a story to keep everyone riveted until the end. With high player interaction, downtime is nonexistent.

As players progress through the story making choices presented by the 70+ page Story books, they gain XP by drawing cubes. XP is then used to purchase items and skills to level-up and protect themselves from the inevitable confrontation with the Dark Guardians. Drawing too many red Threat cubes will initiate a Threat Event, so be prepared to battle each time you level up!

Story Battles introduced throughout the game will challenge players to strategic fights that aren't often found in most dungeon-crawling board games. Through Dispel the Darkness' serpentine battle system, characters must be well-balanced and thoughtful about how they approach each battle.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Variable Player Powers

name: Victory at Sea: Admiral Graf Spee & Admiral Scheer
description:
The Deutschland-class of warships were relatively small, by battleship standards, but were well armoured and carried the type of armament traditionally seen only on battleships. This led to them being nicknamed ‘pocket battleships’.
Superb commerce raiders, the Admiral Scheer successfully plied the Atlantic and Indian Oceans, disrupting merchant shipping wherever it went, whilst the Admiral Graf Spee was famously cornered during the Battle of the River Plate and scuttled herself soon after.

Contents:
2 Model Ships
‣ 1 Admiral Graf Spee
‣ 1 Admiral Scheer
2 Deutschland-class Ship Cards
Damage Sliders

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Sweet Monster
description:
A GAME OF MEMORY AND DEDUCTION
OBJECT: feed the little monsters by remembering where their favourite sweets are.
In this game, 12 double-sided tiles (with a monster on 1 side, and a sweet or rotten fish on the other) are placed in the middle of the table with monster sides facing up. When it is their turn, each player throws the 2 dice to get one monster and one sweet. Then they must turn the tile over that shows that combination. If they pick the right one, they win a token. Any tiles that are turned over are left with the new side facing up. Careful: if a player turns a tile over to find a rotten fish, they will need to give one of their tokens back! The game ends when a player wins their 5th token.

+++ A good memory and powers of deduction are a must if you’re going to find the right tiles!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Memory

name: Knock Knock!: First Words
description:
Knock Knock! Who is it?
... It's Knock Knock! First words - a brand new game created for babies (yes babies!), toddlers and up!

There's fun behind every door in this card game with 7 different ways to play. Knock on the door and see who's there, learn new words, match cards, make sets, play memory pairs and more! Each card is illustrated by Parker Jacobs (designer behind the preschool hit Yo Gabba Gabba!) into 4 familiar sets (food, toys, animals and clothes) giving you new ways to bond with your children.

Knock Knock! first words is the first in a range of card games designed to grow with your family. The games and activities are suitable for different stages of development and can be played by children of different ages at the same time.

7 in 1 games and activities for 1 - 4 players aged 0+ to 3+. (6 are co-operative, 1 competitive.) The colourful, A6 sized laminated cards are designed for little hands and made from FSC card in the UK. (Single use plastic free.)

—description from designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Memory, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Mini Quest 2
description:
The Mini quest on steroïds!

Same as before, 1 to 5 heroes wander the hex-map, defeat counter-monsters, solve card-quests, and gain experience in the form of stars.

But when a hero wins his 3rd star, the Boss rises and terrorises the peninsula. The heroes have to vanquish it before the capital city is destroyed.

You'll need dice (at least three, 6 is better, 6 per player is best), pencils, erasers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points

name: Crownfall
description:
Crownfall is a 2-4 player game where players take turns flicking their army of Blinks at their opponent’s Blinks to try to knock them out of the battlefield.

SETUP
CHOOSE YOUR BATTLEFIELD
First, choose a smooth surface such as a floor or tabletop to be your battlefield, and set the boundaries of your arena (the edges of the table, or lines on the ground). Then create a real or imaginary line to divide the battlefield in half and choose a side. This determines where you can place your army during
the game.

ASSEMBLE YOUR ARMY
Next, take an even number of Blinks and divide them in half between the players. If playing with more than 2 people, players will need to group up into 2 teams.

Each team clusters their Blinks together and then single-clicks any Blink to swap between the two team colors.
To muster an army, triple-click any Blink in the cluster to turn it into a Crown. All other Blinks will become the army. Blinks will assign themselves one of 9 roles depending on how many Blinks they are away from the Crown Blink. As you play, try to find a unique setup formation that creates your
perfect strategic army.

Finally, each team distributes their army throughout their side of the battlefield, making sure that no two Blinks are touching. The game then begins with the starting player’s turn.

GAMEPLAY
The goal of Crownfall is to reduce your opponent’s Crown to 0 health. Each turn, a player can perform up to 2 actions. A player can use one or both of their actions to flick one of their Blinks, generally with the goal of knocking enemy Blinks off the table, but sometimes to accomplish other strategic ends. Unless otherwise specified, a player cannot flick or activate the ability of the same Blink more than once in the same turn.

Players can also choose to activate the power of one of their army Blinks as an action. Many roles have a power that can be activated with an action, but several have passive powers which do not require an action. All powers are detailed at the end of the rules. If, during play, a Blink connects to another Blink, you must separate the two by 1 inch and rotate them so that they are no longer aligned to each other. Some powers may affect this rule.

If a Blink falls off the table or out of the bounds of the battlefield as the result of a flick, whether intentional or by accident, that Blink is dead - unless it’s a Crown or affected by a special ability. Set your dead Blinks to the side, out of the battlefield’s boundary but within reach of the players.

WIN CONDITION
The first player to lower their opponent’s Crown to 0 health wins!

To reset your army and start a new game - cluster your Blinks together and triple-click one of them to reset the cluster back to setup.

VARIANT RULES
Crownfall has multiple rule variations and alternative modes of play. For all variations and a more in-depth explanation of the rules, see the full instructions document online at blinks.games.
mechanics: Flicking

name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Faster Than Light
description:
This new additional rules set, Battlestar Galactica – Faster than Light Expansion Pack, enlarges the Battlestar Galactica – Starship Battles game, introducing many optional rules allowing the players to broaden their game experiences and possibilities.

In this pack you will find additional rules for planetoids and clouds, introducing new kinds of planetoids as the orbiting planetoid; all the rules for a spaceship to take–off and land; the use of missiles, expanding the firepower of the spaceships you can play with, both old and new ones, increasing the game options guiding your missiles in a search of enemy targets; and finally Advanced FTL movement rules that allow the players to really jump along the game surface, avoiding opponent attacks and execute deadly surprise attacks on enemy spaceships.

This set includes all game components needed to play with these new rules: new markers, counters, rulers, and a useful navigation panel to assemble to jump through the stars with the new advanced FTL rule.

Jump into your seat and start your engine — there’s a war to win!

-description from publisher's website

On December 29, 2020, Ares games announced that due to end of licensing, this product would only be released as a free PDF.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Movement Template, Player Elimination, Programmed Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Hatamoto: Rivals
description:
In Hatamoto: Rivals, you play as one of legendary samurai Takeda Shingen's renowned 24 generals. From the 12 generals available to choose, each with his own unique ability, you must manage your province well enough to provide Shingen with the troops and supplies he demands for his war effort.

You can recruit Infantry and Cavalry, build more Rifles, and grow more Rice, but will it be enough for his next order? Pay your rival Hatamoto a small favor to make him more pliable, and then request help to fill Shingen's order for you this turn. But helping you gets him half your Honor reward...

Players must balance their own province's production with currying favor with their rival Hatamoto to fill as many of Shingen's requests as possible. Whichever Hatamoto ends the game with the most Honor will be named Shingen's next Taisho.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Automatic Resource Growth, Contracts, Cooperative Game, Investment, Negotiation, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: HamJack
description:
Get ready to stack and attack! Play a fast-paced card game of sandwich action, or learn the deeper tactical mode to make your topping king of the sandwich.

In the Gas Station Sandwich mode, you compete to add your topping cards on the sandwich faster than anyone else. Toppings must match, but bread is a wildcard: anything can go on bread, and bread goes on anything, except bread doesn't go on bread. Bread on bread is not a sandwich.

To win the game here, you race your opponents through 4 hands of 4, playing a card each turn. But if you can overlap more than 2 symbols on the sandwich, madness can ensue. Overlap 3, and give an enemy a card! Overlap 4, and you chain another turn, to place another card.

For the Tactical Sandwich War, territory cubes are added and you can protect parts of the sandwich as your own as you fight for dominance, representing one topping. To win the game, be the first to reach 25 of your topping on the sandwich. On your turn, you play a card with the goals of covering opponents' toppings with bread, gathering guard cubes, blocking off portions of the sandwich for your own use, protecting your own toppings... or preparing to ruin someone else's day.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Layering, Matching, Take That

name: Eight Gods
description:
Eight Gods is a quick 2-6 player card game played in taverns and homes throughout the Wandering Sea (i.e. the Sleeping Gods world). Rules are also included for a solitaire game commonly played in the Wandering Sea.

In more detail, Eight Gods can be played by 2 - 6 players in about 20 minutes. Each round, players are dealt a 6 card hand. Then, they give two cards away, play their hand, and score their hand. Scoring also happens in the gift and play phases, so there are many opportunities to score points and various strategies are viable. The game has a variable ending, once enough Gods are asleep. It is a morphed form of cribbage that very loosely tells the story of putting the Gods to sleep.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Melding and Splaying, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Progressive

name: 箱庭キングス (Hakoniwa Kings)
description:
箱庭キングス (Hakinowa Kings) is a game from Japan themed around the seasons, with cards representing people from kingdoms that identify with Spring, Summer, Fall, and Winter. Players use cards like workers in a worker placement game. An opening card draft allows you to build a winning strategy from the very beginning.

Players compete to accumulate 15 resource points or construct 3 buildings to win. All players begin with the same 4 unbuilt buildings and 6 drafted cards. Buildings not only lead to a possible victory, they also provide helpful bonuses as long as they remain complete. Each turn progresses through 4 phases: the Seasonal Phase, Construction Phase, Action Phase, and End Phase.

In the Seasonal Phase, players take different actions depending on the season marked on the Season Board. In Spring, players gain a free card. In Summer, players can build for free. In Fall, players gain free resource points. And in Winter, players reduce the resource points or hurt the buildings of unprotected players.

In the Construction Phase, buildings that are partially built will progress on their own. Players may also spend a resource point to help one building along. In the Action Phase, players will play Action Cards. Some cards can only be played in certain seasons or when players have completed certain buildings. If no player has reached a victory condition in the End Phase, players continue with the next season.

Choose your cards wisely as you decide your path to victory!

user summary
mechanics: Open Drafting, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Dragon Lords: Heroes and Villains
description:
Dragon Lords: Heroes & Villains is our first big box expansion for Dragon Lords: The Battle of Darion. This expansion adds powerful new dragon, knight, unit, upgrade, spell, and order cards to your Dragon Lord army. Also included are new dragon miniatures, player mats, dragon dice bags, and Dragon Lord custom dice.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Moving Multiple Units, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ancient Greek City States 5thc BC
description:
The board game Ancient Greek City States is a turn based economic and war game, for 2 to 4 players, set during the 5thc B.C in southern Greece. The game includes 1 map of Southern Greece 32” x 36” at 8 miles to the inch, circa 5thc B.C., 1,680 economic chits, 1,960 military and control chits, 760 number counters, 3 player aids, Greek money and 4-6sided and 4-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play various city states providing the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of the 5thc BC. See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, City Building, Civilization, Economic, Political, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Income, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Investment, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Square Grid

name: The Age of Iron & Steel 1870 to 1929
description:
The board game The Rise of the Iron & Steel Industry of the United States and Canada is a turn based economic game set in the late 19thc and early 20thc in the eastern USA and southern Canada. The game includes 1 map of the eastern USA and Canada 36” x 48” at 28 miles to the inch, circa 1920’s A. D., 3,200 number counters to record your sites, 50 pages of commodity charts listed by state, multiple player aids and 4-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play various sectors of the Iron and Steel industry and their related finished products providing the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of the Iron & Steel industry in the late 19thc and early 20thc United States and Canada. The price does not include shipping and handling. See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Income, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Investment, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Coin Curling
description:
Coin Curling is a board game for people who like sports. It is a fast-moving tabletop game of skill, dramatic comebacks, and good-natured competition.

Coin Curling is easy to learn. First - spin the coin. Second - while the coin is still spinning, tap the coin one time toward the center. Third - the team with their coin closest to the center scores.

After all 8 coins have been played, the "end" is over, and the team with the coin closest to the center scores. They get 1 point for every coin that is closer that the other team's closest coin, and the other team gets 0 points. A recreational game goes to 5 ends and can be played in as little as 20 minutes.

If you can spin a coin, you can play Coin Curling. Coin Curling is great for adults, but it is also fun for the whole family ages 8 and up. You can play individual 1-on-1, and a full team game is 2-on-2.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game, Sports
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Monopoly: New York City Edition
description: Interested in beating Donald Trump at his own game? With this New York City version of classic Monopoly, the most prized real estate in the Big Apple is available, and at bargain rates. The Brooklyn Bridge has never been so cheap--$100 for the whole thing--and for only $60, take Staten Island as well. Comes with eight unique pewter tokens, including a top hat and a racing car, as well as the usual stacks of money, dice, and Chance cards. Take a whirl around the board, land on Times Square or Broadway, then see if you can pick up a penthouse on Central Park East for a song.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Income, Investment, Loans, Ownership, Trading

name: Monopoly: Venetian Palazzo Las Vegas
description:
One of the largest casino complexes in the world has teamed up with the world's most famous board game to bring you MONOPOLY's The Venetian Palazzo Edition.

Buy Sell and Trade the most popular locations in the complex in an effort to own it all: Wheel and deal VIP lounge, High Limit Slot Salon, and St. Marks Square are just some of the locales you can own in this version.

Includes:
60 minute speed play rules
32 houses renamed suites
6 collectible tokens
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Investment, Loans, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination

name: Snakes Magic & Ladders
description:
Snakes Magic & Ladders is an easy, fun yet challenging board game played with 2-5 players. If you can throw the dice, you'll start playing in less than 5 minutes! The game is simple, fun and full of cool ways to beat the game! Grab a power-up and enjoy a super boost, keeping you invincible for as long as you can avoid the dangers and traps as you climb to spot 100! The more players, the more fun! You can: - Climb Ladders - Attack Other Players - Get Power-ups - and much more! Think you got what it takes to win the game by reaching spot #100 first?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Bolt Action: Campaign – D-Day: US Sector
description:
Bolt Action: Campaign – D-Day: US Sector

This 150+ page book focuses on the conflicts of the US Sector in 1944, from the road to Carentan to the assault on Fort Montbarey.

This book allows you to recreate the actions of not only the US forces, but other Allied Forces in the Sector, ranging from SAS, Partisans (maquis) and German Belligerents.

Packed with 12 detailed scenarios and a smattering of new interesting unit choices, you are sure to enjoy either defending or liberating France and the Low Countries.

-description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Norse Dwarf Hero Class
description:
A hearty and stout folk, the Norse Dwarves of Nidavellir are legendary craftsmen and miners, renown throughout the Nine Realms for their mastery of the forge and their love of gold. With the ability to craft items from gold and Dark Stone, while smashing enemies with their blacksmith's Rune Hammer, the Norse Dwarf is a powerful addition to any Viking raiding party.

This new Norse-themed Hero Pack contains all of the cards, Hero Character Sheet, Upgrade Chart, and rules needed to play a Norse Dwarf Hero in your games of Shadows of Brimstone, including 2 high-detail plastic models to represent the Male and Female versions of the Hero Class.

-description from Kickstarter campaign
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombies en el Pacífico
description:
Zombies en el Pacífico is an expansion for Guerra en el Pacífico. In this scenario, Zombies have arisen in Victorian England and are overrunning the world. Only in South America there is still some resistance, as the old enemies Chile, Peru and Bolivia combine their forces.
In this game, one player plays the zombies, the other players play the humans and try to defeat the zombie hordes, trying to stop their naval units at sea, and also fighting those that came ashore on land.
Battles are fought by dice rolls, with different units having different probabilities. Human units can withdraw if in a tight spot (zombies can't). Humans can also recruit new troops, including heroes with special abilities, while the zombies can turn defeated humans into zombies. Humans win if they can defeat all zombies, if the health level reaches 10 points or the infection marker reaches the field for "human victory". Zombies win if the infection marker reaches "zombie victory", or if they defeat all humans or occupy all three capitals.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Gin-Go
description:
In a Rummy style of play, put down your spreads and place your chips to match each placed card. Two opponents (or teams of two) play from either end, in a tit-for-tat strategy trying to knock off each other's chips using card spreads to build a connecting link from their Ace to King row. Build your link, break theirs and hold that link until the hand is played out is what makes Gin-Go an exciting, fun and challenging game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Name Place Animal Thing
description:
Name Place Animal Thing is a family deduction card game for 2-6 players. This game can be played by ages 9 and up.

This game exercises your brain as it involves all players to be attentive, continuously making them think, deduce and be alert al all times. It's an easy game to setup which only takes a couple of minutes. Players would need to eventually guess the four cards which are hidden from them at the beginning of the game. A dice makes the game more exciting as it allows players to perform certain actions depending on what is rolled. In this game it is easy to fool any opponent by asking for cards they already have and making it tough for everyone else to follow.
It is a great game for family bonding!

Best played with 4 players!
mechanics: Deduction

name: Wilderness Dice: BYOD – Ancient Expansion
description:
Expand Wilderness Dice with this standalone-expansion that adds up to two additional players, or play Wilderness Dice using any combination of animal decks. The key to expanding Wilderness Dice is making sure to include the proper number of dice. For the first two players, add 12 dice. Each additional player should add 3 dice to the total. Players will still only complete three rounds of dice rolls. This does mean that more players will have leftover cards at the end of each round.

The Ancient expansion includes both Dinosaurs and Cryptids. Naming the set was difficult, and ultimately is named in honor of the two animals being vastly older than any other animal in Wilderness Dice (if cryptids actually existed, they’d surely be old). We hope that players choose these decks because they are fans of dinosaurs or the legendary beasts.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Take That

name: Crawlout
description:
Crawlout is a print and play solo dungeon crawl using a deck of 8-bit heroes, villains, snags, and items, and a set of d6s.

Draw a party of three adventurers - those you don’t get are then shuffled in to become additional foes. Deal out cards until you have a dungeon of five foes, keeping any items which come up.

Roll dice and place them on your heroes to activate their powers and skills and try to defeat or recruit the enemies. Different powers need different rolls. Use items, overcome snags, take damage, replenish the dungeon, and go round again. If you manage to defeat all of the deck, you win.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Wyrd: The Darkness
description:
The Darkness is the first expansion for Wyrd: The Descent.

Emerge from the Hollows, beaten and weary only to Descend again and again, for the World of The Living is ever threatened by The Darkness that surrounds it.

But be careful, the Horrors are not the only threat. Demons claw their way into reality, and will take Possession of you should you delve too deep.

For you are not Wyrd yet.

In The Darkness you will attempt to link your games of Wyrd: The Descent together by developing your Wyrd and avoiding the risk of Possession.

This is the full colour rulebook for The Darkness updated to 2.15 including an updated FAQ, clarifications to the Laws of Possession with examples and the Sigils for the modular PnP Hollows tiles in the reference section. There are also two play sheets to print out to draw your Hollows on, with and without a grid.

You will need a copy of Wyrd: The Descent 1.2+, a set of RPG polyhedral dice and a pen and some paper to play.
categories: Ancient, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Storytelling

name: TaleMore: Fantasy
description:
The Eternal Lands are on the verge of destruction. After 1000 years of peace and harmony, the Dark Lord Asgamon has risen from the depths of the world to terrify the land and its people.

Slip into the role of one of the eight intrepid heroes and face the darkness. Gather your servants of light around you and defeat Asgamon and his entourage.

Embark on a journey full of danger. Always face new dangers and grow stronger step by step. This is the only way to gain access to the dark fortress. But are you strong enough to defeat the Lord of Darkness?
mechanics: Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: Escape from Corregidor
description:
In May 1942, 18 American crewmen scuttle their US Navy minelayer ship based in the Philippines to prevent it from falling into the hands of the invading Japanese forces. Using a 36-foot US Navy motor launch, the 18 sailors, led by Lieutenant Commander John Morrill (player), begin their 2,000-mile journey through Japanese infested waters in an attempt to reach Darwin, Australia.

Escape from Corregidor is a Print & Play historical solitaire board game of danger and survival. As their leader, you will attempt to lead your 17 men to safety 2,000 miles away in Australia. The dangers you and your men will possibly face include dehydration, starvation, hostile natives, tropical diseases, poisonous snakes, inclement weather, and Japanese enemy aircraft and ships.

Game components include navigation mats, calendar mat, a tables book, and a counter sheet with various counters to location and status of the boat along it's route.

The player moves his boat game counter across the various navigation mats during his journey.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Nautical, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Iron Thunder
description:
Iron Thunder is a WWII strategy game where you can command tanks, infantry and manage resources to lead your nation to victory!

Key features:

2 or 4 Players
3 Battle Modes (all modes can be played 1v1, 2v2, or 4 player free-for-all)
Choose your battleground by placing your HQ and terrain features
Fight under variable weather conditions (weather affects both military operations and logistics, so you need to react accordingly!)
Command infantry and 4 types of armoured units
Manage resources for calling reinforcements, producing goods and executing advanced manoeuvres
Execute special manoeuvres and tactics by playing cards
Up to 5 different victory conditions, depending on the Battle Mode


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Income, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Order Counters, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Set-up

name: VITA MORS: Expansion Pack
description:
本擴充包共有５張人物卡。起始配置時使用此組人物卡取代原奴隸牌背的人物卡後即可開始遊玩。

The pack includes 5 character cards. When setting up the game, simply replace the Slaves deck with this pack of cards, and you're ready to go!

５枚の人物カードがこの拡張に入ってます。初期配置の時、奴隷クラスの人物カードの代わりにこちらの人物カードを入れて遊びます。
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Negotiation, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Voting
publishers: Play With Us Design (玩聚設計)

name: Grim Fantasy
description:
The game of Grim Fantasy is a fantasy skirmish wargame between two or more players, with games of up to four players working quite well. The game is set in a dark fairy-tale world that is inspired by European lore as transported to colonies in a New World.

Quick synopsis:
Set in the Village of Armbraid, the Pilgrims that have come from the Old Word are discovering that their new home is not as safe as they thought it would be. Creatures from the Great Woods raid their small village, wreaking havoc when they come.

Nearby the Natives are friendly, but wary. Some say that they know the land and what it can do.

The land appears to be strange and changes both people and objects, some say that even the Scarecrows move around at night...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Tick-N Timebomb
description:
Play as one of six unique characters, each with their own special abilities and stats. Try your luck with each draw of the cards, then use Action cards to save yourself while making life difficult for others.

Players take turns drawing cards and adding them to their hand, with Explosives adding up until a Boom card is drawn and the hand explodes causing a ton of damage to their Character.

But don’t worry, they’ve added a way to ditch those Explosives and hand them off to other players... Action cards. Use these to get rid of your hand before its too late.

Play your cards right and be the last one standing (or sitting) to win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Unmasqued
description:
Unmasqued is a game of deduction and patterns. The player moves the Detective around the ballroom to find pairs of cards that score the most Rumor Points. Throughout the game, Rumor Points can be turned in for Clues, allowing the player to narrow in on the identity of each culprit. The player wins the game by confronting both culprits before the end of the third hour.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Grid Movement, Pattern Recognition, Slide/Push, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Action Dice Football
description:
Action Dice Games! Super Fun Game - Portable, Playing Dice : Perfect For Tailgating at Games, Travel, Home, Parties, Gifts, Stocking Suffers and anywhere you want to play a full sports game fast and realistic. You call the plays and decide when to go for the bomb or long shot! Solo or versus, these games are action packed.

This game can be single or two players. Anyone can play! To play the game simply choose one of the five offensive plays and roll the dice to see the result. Each team gets a chance to move the ball down field to score points by calling their own plays.

Keeping track of time in this football game is easy. Provided are score sheets. Each time a play is finished the user will record the down and yardage on this score sheet. After 30 plays are completed, it will show the final score for that quarter of play. The team with the most points wins the game. If the score is tied then an overtime quarter will begin.

What makes Action Dice Games unique is the fact that they are pocket sized, accurate to the professional leagues and very fast results. There is no play art, player strengths or formations. The result is based off the play you call and the situation you call the play during these games will determine the winner.

Unlike other football games that don't include actual downs and distance, this game does! Just about every down and distance is in this game. Each yard matters here.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Murder in 3B
description:
The Hideaway Motel is one of the seediest places in Valley Falls. Want to score drugs? The Hideaway is your place. Want to buy a handgun that’s had the serial number filed off? The Hideaway is your place. Want to step out on your husband? You guessed it. The Hideaway. As a result, nobody is surprised when a girl is found dead in room 3B. That's the kind of thing that happens regularly here. You've been asked to consult on the case. Are you up to the task? Just about everyone staying at The Hideaway is harboring a secret of some sort, and it's up to you to determine who is responsible for the Murder in 3B.
Difficulty Rating – 5/10
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Skull: Aztec
description:
Set of 4 coasters with alternative art. They can be used to replace the originals from the base game or to increase the player count to 7.

They came free with purchase of the main game in participating FLGS.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Legacy of Atmos: The Tellus Crusade
description:
Legacy of Atmos is a game of epic tactical skirmish-based warfare for 2-4 players with deck-building elements and a character fate and alignment system!

You will command a small force of legendary Characters and models that are fighting a battle which forms part of the larger on-going conflict.
This box set’s release follows the events of Highlord Godrey Ronin and his crusade against the mysterious Tellus Commune.
Will you choose to defend the mystical Tellus Forest, with their strange creatures and savage Karath Tribes, or pursue Godrey’s quest for his House's vengeance?

The game is played by first selecting your Legendary Character and building your army and deck list. Players will fight over zones of control that increase their Supremacy Points at the end of each round. Each player will also bring with them 3 secret "Gambits" with them into a game. These Gambits support an intense variety of playstyles and gives the player Supremacy Points when completed. The player with the most Supremacy Points at the end of 5 battle rounds wins the game!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Tug of War

name: MountStop!
description:
In MountStop!, each player is a seasoned climb leader and wants to prove to the world that they are the best; but so as a few others! For that, they need to win the biggest mountain climbing competition in the world by leading different teams to conquer the most famous mountains in the world.

In your turn, choose which mountain you want to climb and which of your teams you want to lead on this expedition. The higher the mountain the more points you’ll get if you reach the peak. You can also try to complete one or more of the random quests to gain more points. You’ll climb by rolling dice, one die for each climber on your team.

If all of your climbers are injured, your expedition was a failure and the next player starts his/her turn.

When any player successfully uses all her/his teams to conquer mountains, the game ends and the player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Drunken Adventures
description:
Each player should have three 12oz beverages in front of them (alcoholic or nonalcoholic). The game involves rules that can either add sips or remove sips from a player's glass

Each turn players will roll the die and move their bottle cap piece to the corresponding square. There are 36 squares in the game. The squares may have you draw a card, play a mini-game, or require action. Each square will either decrease the number of drinks in your glass or increase your lifespan, so to speak. (I.e. giving drinks increases your glasses capacity while taking drinks lowers it)

Be among the first three players to make it to the finish line without finishing your three drinks. The game is a race to the finish with a gold medal (1st). silver (2nd), and bronze (3rd).

After a player gets sent back to the start or finishes their three drinks and is forced back to the start, they are not required to follow the “lifeline” rule but must follow the drinking rules.

The game ends when three players have reached the finish, achieving gold, silver, and bronze. Once a player has reached the finish, they are exempt from mini-games or drinking aspects of the game (unless they choose to join the fun).
mechanics: Race

name: BIO
description:
Bio takes the color/ card type matching mechanic we all know and love and turns it into an adrenaline-fueled fight for your life! Push, Run, Hide, and Kill your way through an endless horde of zombies in an attempt to be the first to escape the facility.

Players draw cards using a modified UNO game mechanic and try to escape before the deck runs out. Some cards can turn players into Zombies. When this happens, players still try to escape.

The first human player to get rid of all their cards (escapes), wins. Alternatively, a zombie player must escape before the last human player dies.

As part of an elite biological threat elimination squad, you find yourself deep in the heart of an underground military complex known to be in possession of a deadly new chemical weapon. It quickly becomes clear things are far worse than expected when buried in the thick darkness of the subterranean halls you discover actual zombies! The deafening roar of automatic gunfire erupts as you pump round after round into the horde, filling the narrow corridors with muzzle flashes and gore. As the sprinting river of gnashing teeth and rotting flesh pours out of the dark, you realize the futility of your defense and turn back toward the exit. Overwhelmed and starving for ammo the mission priority shifts from completion.. to survival.

Can you escape this nightmare? Or will you become part of it?
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Horror, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Hand Management, Hot Potato, Layering, Matching, Move Through Deck, Race, Real-Time, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That

name: Mistsmall: Mistfall in 18 Cards
description:
Mistsmall is posted with permission from NSKN Games. Mistsmall is only for personal print and play game for free download. You can find the files for Mistsmall in the files section.

Mistsmall is a fan-made game that reduces Mistfall to 18 cards and a few tokens. Mistsmall uses the game's original art, helping capture the feeling of playing big Mistfall. Play as Crow, using your feats, gear and resolve to traverse dangerous regions and defeat The Abomination.

Players will move from location to location, playing cards from their hand and using their gear to manage the current encounter, deal damage to and block damage from enemies, and manipulate the board state.

The game ends in victory when players reach the final location and defeat the special encounter. The game is lost when players must take damage but are unable to. Players take damage by Burying cards from their hand, deck and discard pile.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #83 – Savoia Cavalleria
description:
The Charge of the Savoia Cavalleria at Izbushensky Khutor (hamlet) in the Volga Region was a skirmish between the Italian Cavalry 3rd Regiment "Savoia Cavalleria" and the Soviet 812th Siberian Infantry Regiment in August 1942. Although it was a minor encounter in the larger Eastern Theatre of Operations, the Charge of the Savoia Cavelleria has historical significance as one of the final major cavalry charges in armed warfare, and its actions resonated with much propaganda throughout Italy.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Italian Soldiers, Soviet Hostiles, Missions, Locations, Objectives, Skills, Weapons and Equipment. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

3 Italian Calvary Player Soldiers
3 Italian Calvary Non-Player Soldiers
2 Italian Calvary Squad Soldiers
4 Missions
4 Objectives
12 Locations
3 Weapons
3 Gear
2 Skills
18 Soviet Hostiles
2 Events
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Competing Cat Castles
description:
Four kingdoms exist, in the four cardinal directions of the map. The snow leopards in the mountains to the north, the jaguars to the east in the plains, the tigers to the south near the jungle, and the lions to the west in the grasslands. These four kingdoms have been at war for as long as can be remembered - and they’ve built nuance to their battle plans over centuries. Can you lead your Kingdom to victory?

Competing Cat Castles is a game of deduction, risk, and luck for 2-4 players. Your goal is to win more competitions than your opponents. Each round you will select one of the nine cards representing the key players in each kingdom. Every cat plays a part, from the Monarch down to the youngest baby. Several of these key players have abilities that can hinder your opponent, or boost your next turn. Players play their chosen cat face down and reveal them simultaneously. The cat with the highest power wins, after any abilities have been applied.

Keeping track of who your opponents have played and who you have to counter them will lead to victory, but never discount luck.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management

name: Interplanetary: Supply Drop – Expansion 1
description:
This first expansion for Interplanetary, titled Supply Drop, simply adds additional components which are added to the base game's pool of these components. Material of the following types is added:


more directives cards, which increase the variety of the player's goals and thus the number of possible campaign deck configurations
additional parts, allowing the player to construct new installations with fresh boons and to bestow new abilities to one's spacecraft
additional outposts, increasing their number from 4 to 6, thus allowing for new tactics in a playthrough
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Interplanetary: Unity – Expansion 2
description:
The second expansion for Interplanetary, titled Unity, enables cooperative gameplay, transforming the base game's solo experience into a two-player one.

The majority of the base game's rules as well as its general gameplay structure remains unchanged.

—description from the designer
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Contracts, Cooperative Game, Finale Ending, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Score-and-Reset Game, Variable Set-up

name: Welcome to Screamland
description:
Screamland is Valley Falls' #1 haunted house attraction. Customers drive from all over
Thornmire county to experience the fun and frights that Screamland has to offer. The experience becomes all too real,
however, when Bekah and Erich Rosenbalm go missing. Their last known location? You guessed it: Screamland. You and
your colleagues at the Will Street Detective Agency are hired by Bekah’s parents to find the missing couple. Will you
confront humans wearing the faces of monsters or monsters wearing human faces? In Valley Falls, anything is possible!
Screamland is ready and waiting for you. Get your ticket now for the scariest attraction in Valley Falls!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

Difficulty Rating -TBD

Originally released as the monthly subscription mystery for October 2021.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Colorful Skies: Volume 2 – WWI Air War Scenarios for Check Your 6!
description:
This is a third-party supplement that provides additional World War I scenarios for Check Your 6!. This 48-page book covers 46 historical scenarios, all from 1918, including major engagements of the American Aero Squadron (many with Eddie Rickenbacker) and the last battles of many leading aces.

Note: The original Check Your 6! rulebook and Colorful Skies (Volume 1) are required to use this supplement.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Colorful Skies: Volume 3 – WWI Air War Scenarios for Check Your 6!
description:
This is a third-party supplement that provides additional World War I scenarios for Check Your 6!. This 78-page book covers 61 historical scenarios, focusing on actions in (northern) Italy with Italian and British forces vs Central Powers from 1916-1918. New balloon busting rules are also included.

Note: The original Check Your 6! rulebook and Colorful Skies (Volume 1) are required to use this supplement.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Erune: Miniature Set – Set de figurines
description:
This set adds new monsters not in the core box. It contains
2 Rats
2 Skeletons
2 Skeleton Archers
2 Living Armors
2 Goblins
2 Goblin Archers
2 Goblin Riders
2 Orcs
1 Troll
2 Gargoyles
2 Evil Dogs
1 Fiens
1 Witch
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Goetia: Nine Kings of Solomon – Blessed Cherries Promo Tile
description:
UK Games Expo 2021 promotional Scry Board/Dark Board tile.

Dark Board text: “You sense a Demonic presence! Whilst walking the hallways of UK Games Expo, you can taste the sweetness in the air! It must be the Cherry-Demon who in exchange for some resources will grant you its powers!”
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Marvel HeroClix: Avengers – War of the Realms Booster Brick
description:
Be the Mightiest in All of the Realms!

Thor and the Avengers take on Malekith and other Asgardian threats!

Based on the realms-shattering The War of the Realms event, this HeroClix set combines some of the coolest Thor stuff with the hottest game play of the year!

This 5-figure booster release features fan-favorite characters like Thor, Captain America, Mary Jane, Gamora, Wasp, Angela, Yondu, Nova, Black Widow, and more!
Avengers The War of the Realms has more characters with RALLY that was first introduced in X-Men Rise and Fall earlier this year as well as brand-new mechanics like Recruiter!

MISSION POINTS make a triumphant return, and players will unlock all-new ways to win!

Shifting Focus is back too, so players will get to plays many versions of their favorite characters!

Also find brand new “Legacy” cards for figures that might already be in your collection!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Before the First Emperor
description:
The game takes place over the five hundred years of "Spring and Autumn Period" and "Warring States Period" in ancient China, before the power structure of old age undergone total collapse and the world was eventually taken over by the First Emperor of Qin.

Before the First Emperor is a euro-style game developed around two core mechanisms of "selective worker placement" and "variable resource generation". Players are provided with multiple paths to victory.

In their turn, each player can place workers on one of the 12 action spaces on the main board and perform the corresponding actions, or place them in their own Domain tiles to generate resources. They can also fulfil contracts and use special powers as free actions.

After 8 to 10 rounds the game comes to a conclusion. Players sum up points gained from their contracts, Virtue Tracks, Provinces, Fiefs, office buildings and the King's Favours to determine who's the First Emperor.
mechanics: Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Dungeonbowl
description:
When Blood Bowl 3rd edition was released in 1994 Games workshop soon also made an article with new rules for Dungeonbowl. The rules was published in White Dwarf 225, September 1998. Now it was much more narrow corridors and not so much space to move around. The new rules gave a more claustrophobic feeling to the game. Dungeonbowl changed a lot with these new things.

Dungeonbowl are two fantasy football teams playing a game in a dungeon. First they have to find the ball in one of the chests. Then they have to score a touchdown in the opponents endzone to win the game.

The original game was Elves, Dwarfs & Dungeonbowl from 1989. In December 2021 there was a third version of the game in Dungeon Bowl.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Escape the Mardi Gras Murders
description:
You have been invited to a Mardi Gras party in the heart of the French Quarter. The other guests have arrived and we are eagerly are awaiting our host… when the murders start. One by one, each of the guests is to meet their end and it is up to you to solve the crime before you become the final victims. Work with your fellow players to solve a series of mindbending puzzles as you work your way through cajun culture and New Orleans lore, but this is also a competition among yourselves. After each puzzle, a different guest is eliminated in an over the top murder… and it is up to you to compete against your opponents to see who can figure out which of the remaining guests committed the crime. See if you can be the first one to solve the case of the “Mardi Gras Murders!”

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Varia Starter Set
description:
The Varia Starter Set is a card & dice dueling game where players select from one of two fantasy-themed classes. Players take turns planning out a course of action before rolling dice to see whose tactics come out on top. By using a combination of weapons, armor, and cards in hand, players create a plan of attack (or response to an incoming attack) each turn. The goal is to knock the other player’s health points to zero through clever card combinations, while simultaneously preventing your own defeat by planning tactical defensive moves.

Gameplay is divided into two major phases. The planning phase sees players laying out their actions for the turn, which represent attacks and blocks that the players will perform. The resolution phase has players rolling combinations of dice as dictated by the cards they played in the planning phase in order to determine what attacks hit or miss, and what damage (if any) is dealt or avoided.

The starter set includes: Volcanic Warrior & Shadow Assassin.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Track Movement

name: Transcendent
description:
Compete as a scientist or alchemist in this Scientific Revolution themed deck builder. Using a starter deck of 10 cards, generate resources and acquire better cards from the market to create the best deck to complete your hidden objective before your opponents.

Merge your basic resources of fire, earth, air, and water to create purified elements which then merge to become game bending scientific achievements to tilt the game in your favor. Use advantages to help yourself and others towards their goals, or use sabotages to bring them to their knees.

The choice is yours in the quest to become Transcendent.

During their turn, players will begin with a Research Phase, where they add to their non-AEther resources. They will then proceed to their Experiment Phase, where they will have two labor points to choose any two of playing a card, resetting the market, increasing a resource, merging an element or achievement, or acquiring a card from the market. The last phase is the Clean-up Phase, where the player will discard their hand and draw a new one.

The game ends when a player has completed all the criteria on one of their hidden objectives. Play continues to finish up the round, with tie breakers being based on remaining resources at the end of the game.
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Dice
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hidden Victory Points, Kill Steal, Market, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tennidice
description:
Who is the luckiest tennis player in the world?
Tennidice is a 2-or-4-player game that simulates an actual tennis match. Instead of using rackets, you need some dice, and also, you use the strategy cubes to strengthen your abilities to win, but sometimes lucky opponents don’t allow you to succeed!

You can play Tennidice in two different modes:
1. Tie-breaker mode (15minutes)
•This mode simulates a real tennis tie-breaker. The first one who gets the 7th point wins the match.
2. A 2-set-match game (60minutes)
•This mode simulates the whole tennis match of two sets. The player who succeeds in two sets of three wins the match.

Each round of Tennidice starts with serve and continues in
rally until a player wins a point.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Death Ride Normandy: Juno Beach
description:
The Canadian 3rd Infantry Division, landing to the west of the 3rd British Infantry Division, made good gains on D-Day and looked like it would be able to advance on Caen on the 7th without problem. After consolidating for the night the Candians moved out smartly in the morning to the south along the road to Carpiquet Airport to the west of the city of Caen. Not long after starting out, and strung out in a long column, they came under intense and sustained fire from the 12SS Panzer Division. The fight between these 2 divisions would become legendary during the campaign and filled with vicious combat.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Battle's Shadow: The Battle of Fort Donelson, February 15, 1862
description:
“Events have cast on our arms and hopes the gloomiest of shadows.” –Jefferson Davis’ diary entry about the fall of Fort Donelson and the surrender of nearly 15,000 Confederate soldiers.

Battle’s Shadow is an historical simulation of the battle fought on February 15, 1862 at Fort Donelson. The fort was a Confederate stronghold on the Cumberland River, and key to the rebels retaining control of Kentucky and Tennessee. General Ulysses S. Grant’s Army of the Tennessee and Admiral Andrew H. Foote’s ironclad gunboats had laid siege to the Confederate fort, trapping the Confederate Army of Central Kentucky. On the morning of February 15th the rebels launched a desperate attack in attempt to breakout. Can you do as well or better?

Each copy of Battle's Shadow is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch map sheets
176 un-mounted, double-sided counters
8 pages of rules

Each turn in Battle’s Shadow represents one hour of time. Infantry and Cavalry units represent regiments (III) or battalions (II). A hex on the map is approximately 200 meters across. Battle's Shadow is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Tim Allen.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Hazardous Movement Scenario Pack 1: A World at War
description:
Hazmo's debut scenario pack, A World at War, consists of 10 scenarios compatible with the Advanced Squad Leader game system. A description of each scenario is detailed on the image of the back cover above. A wide variety of combatants (including - but not limited to - Russians, Germans, SS, Free French, British, Italians, Japanese and Chinese) and terrain types (including city, bocage, countryside, hill and village) will challenge even seasoned players' skills, while the high fun and replay potential of each scenario will provide you with unmatched value for your purchase. Finally, reliable player support on this website will supply you with answers to any questions you may have. In this way, Hazmo aims to optimize your gaming experience!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: WARCHESS
description:
This wargame was designed by O’Farell & Robinson and printed by Hely’s of Dublin in the 1940s (most likely the early 1940s). It may very well be a prototype. The game was first owned by a Dublin printer in the 1940s and remained within the same family until 2022.

Similar to some other wargames of the era, the objective is to capture the enemy’s GHQ using a variety of combat units while defending your own GHQ. In WARCHESS the units are comprised of infantry, tanks, artillery, forts (which remain stationary once placed), trucks, and trains. The latter two allow you to move eligible units a greater distance. WARCHESS is played on a game board showing a map of Western Europe with square “hexes” created using a vertical and horizontal grid.
