Contemporary games to this include Dennis Wheatley’s Invasion (1938) and Campaign (1935) by Wills & Hepworth Ltd. Campaign would be the most similar in play, with WARCHESS being more complicated due to the availability of more unit types.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Gunshin: Three Kingdoms
description:
“Empire, long divided, must unite; long united, it must divide. Thus it has ever been.”
- opening lines of Romance of the Three Kingdoms

Gunshin: Three Kingdoms is a competitive or cooperative historic battle game for 2 to 6 players. Set in the miracle era of ancient China – Three Kingdoms – where battles were fought, power was seized, and heroes were born.

Each player controls and manages a campaign, which possesses cities, armies, heroes, and gold, aiming to defeat enemies and conquer China. Heroes, in addition to playing an important part in history, also serve a crucial role in the pursuit of victory of the game, where each Hero has its own specialized ability(ies) and corresponding types of troops (cavalry, archer, infantry). Players are faced with unlimited strategic decisions ready to be made - Strategies behind how the player allocates resources, how he/she controls the map and orchestrates beneficial battles, how, when, and where to deploy appropriate Heroes and troops, and even how to negotiate with other players – all of which will be the key to victory. Players are encouraged to implement new strategies and tackle situations in different ways, ensuring no two games play alike.

With a realistic landscape game board, the richness of historic content, and multi-dimensional gameplay mechanisms and strategies, players can immerse themselves in an unprecedented, revolutionary experience.

—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Miniatures, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Player Elimination, Resource to Move, Role Playing, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Love Battle! High School: Our Powers Combine! Promo Cards
description: A set of 5 promotionals card that require a pairing of two set characters in the same room to activate. Released in the 2022 Convention season.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Animated Series Booster Brick
description:
Batman: The Animated Series was the Batman of a generation. It’s consistently praised by critics, and was nominated for more than 20 awards during its run. More than 25 years later, it’s still one of the top superhero cartoons of all-time. For the first time ever, these versions of your favorite Batman characters come to HeroClix!

In addition to the heroes and villains of Gotham, fans will be delighted to learn that there are characters from Justice League Unlimited, Batman Beyond, and the Super-Friends! The HeroClix team has taken special care to showcase characters from beloved episodes that have never been Clixed before like Zeta, Leslie Thompkins, Maxie Zeus, Kyodai Ken, The Clock King, The Phantasm, Riddler’s Robot Minotaur, Apache Chief, and others!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Thrown Under the Bus: The Game of Office Politics
description:
Thrown Under the Bus, the light hearted Game of Office Politics, TUtB is packed with cringeworthy buzzwords and all-too-familiar office tropes that will keep players entertained while they steal credit for coworkers’ hard work in an attempt to advance up the corporate ladder. But be careful. Fellow associates are attempting to do the same thing, and once you play a dirty trick on them, they now have access to this new trick. Anyone who has worked in an office environment knows there is no more brutal kill-or-be-killed workplace than the modern office setting.

Thrown Under the Bus (TUtB) is designed so that non-gamers could easily learn and enjoy but still has the complexities and advanced tactics that will keep seasoned gamers engaged. TUtB hits that delicate balance while creating a fun thematic experience. An average game takes between 30 and 60 minutes depending on group size of 2-6 players and their experience level. The Ages 16+ is more of a theme suggestion, the mechanics and rules can easily be understood by younger players but we felt why get them jaded about work before they enter the workforce. Let them discover that joy the same way we did…

Don’t let the cut throat theme fool you, Thrown Under the Bus is fun and cathartic release at the end of a long week of dealing with your coworkers quirks and protecting your station at work.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Take That

name: Marvel HeroClix: Avengers Fantastic Four Empyre Booster Brick
description:
This 5-figure booster release features fan-favorite characters like Captain America, Mr. Fantastic, Spider-Man, and Deadpool, and their enemies like Super-Skrull, Magneto, Ultron, and more!

Empyre has more characters with RALLY that was first introduced in X-Men Rise and Fall earlier this year as well as brand-new mechanics like Recruiter and Follow-Up!

Chases from all different kinds of stories are included in this set including new versions of beloved characters like Thor, Herald of Thunder and Norrin Radd, Sorcerer Supreme!

Also find brand new “Legacy” cards for figures that might already be in your collection!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar General's Handbook Pitched Battles 2022-23 Season 1
description:
This essential supplement gives you new ways to enjoy games of competitive Warhammer Age of Sigmar for the first season of 2022-23, including updated battleplans and Pitched Battle profiles for every unit and army. This pack includes two books: the 96-page spiral-bound hardback General’s Handbook, and the 34-page softcover Pitched Battle Profiles book.

Inside this season's General’s Handbook, you'll find:


An introduction to setting up Pitched Battles for matched play games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar, including guidance on the Battle Ready standard of painting for your miniatures, and a comprehensive list of the official publications which can be used in Pitched Battles
Detailed background information for Gallet, the wind-blasted continent of Ghur where the action takes place. You’ll learn all about this arid landscape, the beasts that dwell there, and the tunnels underneath it
Region of War rules for Gallet, the Splintered Land, with special rules that focus on empowering Battleline troops, a terrifying new Realmsphere spell for all Wizards, and an aggressive Realm Command available to all players
Two additional core battalions that players can include in their army: Expert Conquerors, well-versed in seizing objectives, and Bounty Hunters, tasked with bringing down the mightiest foes
Six grand strategies that dictate an army's goals in battle by offering victory points if completed by the end of the game, whether you spread your veterans across the battlefield in a Show of Dominance, or eliminate your opponent's core to demonstrate that there's No Place for the Weak
Eight battle tactics that can be used to gain an advantage each turn by earning additional victory points, such as taking revenge for fallen warriors with An Eye for an Eye, or choosing to Outmuscle your opponent's veterans by driving them from an objective
12 battleplans for setting up games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar, with a variety of special rules and victory conditions, such as claiming volatile amberbone deposits in the Realmstone Cache, fighting over the twisting tunnels of the Nidus Paths, or struggling to the bitter end in a claustrophobic Turf War
Updated warscrolls for the following 17 endless spells: Horrorghast, Aethervoid Pendulum, Chronomantic Cogs, Emerald Lifeswarm, Geminids of Uhl-Gysh, Malevolent Maelstrom, Prismatic Palisade, Purple Sun of Shyish, Quicksilver Swords, Ravenak's Gnashing Jaws, Soulsnare Shackles, Suffocating Gravetide, The Burning Head, Umbral Spellportal, Soulscream Bridge, Shards of Valagharr, and Lauchon the Soulseeker
The core rules and player's code for games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: ResiDuel Card Game
description:
Residuel is a 30 minute 1v1 card duel game with a unique mechanic that places importance on adaptive strategies rather than pre-planned ones. Cards are played for effects that complement each other, however each card you play provides your opponent with materials from which they can create Servants that will punish you until you are able to destroy them.

You must consider whether you'll be able to deal with the creatures your opponent might create using the resources you played cards provide them with.

The player best able to set-up and knock-down the constructs of their enemy will assume the role of create, their enemy fading into history as but another trial overcome.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards

name: StoryTime: Animal Tales
description:
Story Time (ပုံပြောမယ်) is a board game for people who love games and storytelling. Players of all ages can unleash their imaginations using our carefully illustrated abstract game cards featuring various animal tales.

In Story Time, you will work in teams and try to relay correct information to your partner(s) through storytelling using carefully illustrated abstract art cards. However, your opponents will be trying to disrupt your team so you have to think carefully not to fall for their tricks. Each team takes turns storytelling and disrupting and will compete to see who crosses the finishing line first.
mechanics: Storytelling, Targeted Clues, Voting

name: Goetia: Nine Kings of Solomon – Sacrifice Promo Tile
description:
GenCon promotional Scry Board/Dark Board tile.

Dark Board text: “You sense a Demonic presence! Whilst walking the halls of GenCon, you hear the strange chanting of Desciplees. Their current sacrifice draws forth a Demon! In exchange for some resources the Demon will grant you its powers!”
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Goetia: Nine Kings of Solomon – The Witch Promo Tile
description:
Promotional Scry Board/Dark Board tile.

Dark Board text: “You sense a Demonic presence! It’s The Witch! Possessed by most powerful game designer of all! ALL HAIL Kristian and his Demons! Thanks for helping me make this game a reality!”
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Operation Iron Brain: The Siege of Beirut, June-August 1982
description:
Operation Iron Brain: The Siege of Beirut, June-August, 1982.

For over a year the Palestinian Liberation Organization (PLO) had bombarded Israel’s northern province of Galilee with artillery and rocket fire. On June 6, 1982 the Israeli military invaded southern Lebanon in an operation dubbed “Peace for Galilee”. The Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) quickly defeated the PLO’s armed forces and drove north. Although the declared aim of the Israeli offensive was to clear a 40 kilometer “buffer zone” along the Lebanese/Israeli border, Israeli Defense Minister, Ariel Sharon, was determined to eradicate the PLO once and for all, and hopefully kill its leader, Yassir Arafat. With new orders the IDF crossed the Litani River and drove on Beirut where the remnants of the PLO’s forces were retreating, and where most of their refugee camps were located. What ensued was an escalating conflict that threatened to engulf the entire mid-east once more in conflict and bring Lebanon to the brink of abyss of genocidal civil war.

Each copy of Operation Iron Brain is composed of the following:

• Two 11 by 17 inch hex map sheets
• One sheet of 140 double-sided, unmounted counters
• One Players’ Aid Sheet
• 8 pages of rules

Armor and Infantry (Militia, Regular, Heavy Weapons) units are all Battalions. Airborne and militia units are companies. A hex on the map is about a half mile across. Each turn represents two weeks of time. The game is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by David Gomez Prieto.

-description from designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: TGC Community Anthology
description:
The Game Crafter Community Anthology Volume One is the very first collection of games designed by members of The Game Crafter’s vibrant community for the TGC Community Anthology Competition.

With 78 games from Abducted to Zombomination, there’s something for everyone. Just turn the page to fight zombies, clean up the beach, battle aliens, run your own pizza place, become the most popular kid in school, play some beach vollyball, and so much more!

Each game takes up only two pages, which lay flat for easy play. All the pieces you need are included along with a handy cloth bag for storage.

Pick and choose or play through them all to find your favorites! With play times ranging from under five minutes up to an hour, you’re sure to find something to play with family, friends, or even solo. You may never be bored again!

Thanks to the generosity of the game designers, The Community Anthology is being offered at production cost. That means no mark up, no profit sharing - just 162 pages of fun for as little money as possible. It’s only 60 cents per game!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Die Dohlen vom Dohlenfelsen
description:
Die Dohlen vom Dohlenfelsen ("The Jackdaws of the Jackdaw-Rock")is a wooden family game from 5 years, made in the Urdonautal in the heart of Bavaria. Who remembers best which caves the jackdaws bring the magic stones to and, with a bit of luck, will reach the bulging caves. You always have to keep an eye on which caves the most jackdaws have flown to and which cave has not been cleared out for a long time. Whoever has collected the most stones by the end of the game is the winner.

Die Dohlen vom Dohlenfelsen is a memory game with 3D construction and a sophisticated 'cave system' into which small pebbles are thrown. If you want to clear out a cave, pull the plug out a bit and the magic jackdaw stones will crackle out of the game like in a slot machine. The game is stored in a yellow cotton bag that is certified with the Oeko-Tex label. This bag serves as a base when playing, so that one can speak of an 'unpackaged game'. In addition to the 3D game board, the game also includes 6 game figures. Also included: 22 wooden foundation stones, a handful of hand-sorted pebbles, a small piece of twig peeled with a pocket knife as a stone pick and a color cube. The silhouette of the jackdaw rock is hand-cut. Also the bite of the beaver is sometimes bigger, sometimes smaller, sometimes bitchy and sometimes jagged and sometimes other accessories have been gnawed on a bit. Each game is therefore unique, which is acknowledged with a consecutive serial number and the name of the summiteer who owns the game. These two pieces of information are found on the front of the Jackdaw Rock game board.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory

name: Obelus
description:
Vast obelisks, existing beyond time and space, are believed to represent the very essence of purity and chaos. Unknown powers endlessly summon, shift, and banish these obelisks, igniting massive rifts between dimensions. Through these rifts, Mensors have learned to channel their powers to manipulate this phenomenon. They have come to call this eternal cycle... Obelus.

Obelus is a light-weight, 2-player abstract strategy game, playable in 10-15 minutes. Taking on the role of a powerful Mensor, you will summon obelisk shaped dice onto conflux cards, shift your obelisks according to the number showing, and banish your opponent’s obelisks. Through clever maneuvering, banished obelisks may be reformed, creating a rift that prevents further summoning on that conflux. You win when your opponent cannot legally summon or shift an obelisk!

Two game modes are included:
- Chaos: In this mode, dice are initially rolled into the center of the game area, adding a layer of emerging strategies in how players will make best use of the numbers rolled.
- Pure: This mode offers perfect information. Dice are never rolled, offering players full control over their chosen number as they are summoned and shifted around the game board.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Pattern Movement, Rondel, Static Capture

name: Dragon Ball Z: Duel Battle Saiyans
description:
Compose your team and face an opponent in this miniature duel game!
Find the universe of Dragon Ball Z with your favorite characters and their special techniques in epic clashes for the quest of crystal balls

After composing your team according to the skill points of the different characters, go in search of the crystal balls! Would you rather face your opponent directly or search the board for bonuses?

On your turn, you can activate your characters one after the other, by rolling their action die. You can then perform 3 out of 5 possible actions: remove an immobilization, move, search, attack, acquire a capsule card. In addition, you can also launch a special attack like the famous Kamehameha!

KO opposing characters to earn victory points.

The game ends if a team is completely knocked out or after 7 rounds of play. The player with the most victory points wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Movement Template

name: Fateforge: Chronicles of Kaan – Clash of the Immortals
description:
In Clash of the Immortals, you set off on an epic journey across the continent of Kaan – a journey that will take you from dragon’s lairs among icy mountain peaks, across vast steppes where a young warlord is raising a horde to challenge the throne, and to the cursed ruins of an ancient city deep in the desert wastes. You will find yourself tipping the balance of power between two immortal leaders with vast ambitions – the Ilkral, undying ruler of the Kartaçöl empire, and Lady Bekasi, the undead lich who is the true force behind the throne of the old Kaan. Your homeland – and all of Kaan – is bound up in their ruthless designs, as they vie with each other to gain an ancient weapon that could lay waste to the world. What Fate will you forge for the lands of Kaan?

Clash of the Immortals is the first expansion for Fateforge: Chronicles of Kaan containing a new campaign, a completely new gameplay mechanic and a new hero, among other things. The new campaign sees our heroes move out of Easafir and its environs, where the campaign of the base game takes place, and journey across Kaan.

The expansion adds a new gameplay feature: party skills. These are powerful skills that the whole party can contribute to in order to unleash group moves that add a new level of coordination and complexity to the game.

Clash of the Immortals also features a new hero, the Enchantress, whose powerful magic makes her play differently from other heroes. The expansion contains two new floorplan sets, the desert ruins and mountain sets, along with new story scene tiles. Finally will come across new side quests, rest locations, enemies, weapons and items.

The Limited Deluxe Edition of the Clash of the Immortals expansion includes deluxe enemy discs and deluxe tokens that will fit with your Limited Deluxe Edition Base game components. The Boss Box includes the Boss miniature featured in the expansion.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Materia Prima: The Last Stand
description:
The weakened villagers cannot withstand the threat of the Inquisition much longer. They must get ready for the last great showdown to protect their homes.

Dive deeper into the world of Alka Sowa. The expansion "the Last Stand" contains a mini-campaign, which consists of two full-length scenarios and offers some new gameplay mechanics.

To play the expansion you need both Materia Prima - The Alchemists Guild and Materia Prima - The Inquisition.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Puttycat Brawls
description:
Puttycat Brawls is a strategic, deck-building, turn-based card game, whose main protagonists are cats.
Two opposing factions meet at the Battlefield. The game is intended for 2, 4 or 6 people, as long as both sides have the same number of Players.

The opposing parties start with a certain amount of Resources. The aim is to use units, spells and strategies to reduce the opponent's Resources. Each Player has 6 fields on his disposal where he can place his army. The formation is important, thus, proper deployment of troops is essential.

The game ends when one party reaches 0 on the Resource bar.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Interrupts

name: Serena
description:
In Serena, you will be playing a young fox of good breeding in Venezia trying to win Serena’s heart.

However the task is not an easy one. Other contenders have come tonight with the same goal as you.

You will need to use deduction and logic to discover the identity of your competitors. At the bar or on the dance floor, don’t stop at anything to unsettle other suitors and win Serena’s eternal favours. Your love will be sealed with a waltz under the full moon’s intense glow.

each player carries out 1 and only 1
action before moving on to the player on his left, who then becomes the active player, and so on until
one player wins the game.

When it’s his turn to play, a player may carry out:
- An action at the bar (3 types of action possible) which consists mainly of exchanging cards
- An action on the dance floor (3 types of action possible) which consists mainly in accusing other players
- An action on a gondola: winning the game.

The first player who discover Serena by deduction win the game.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hidden Roles

name: Star Wars: Legion – Echo Base Defenders: Battle Force Starter Set
description:
Your players can begin building their Rebel armies making their stand against the Empire with this pack for Star Wars: Legion!

The Rebels at Echo Base used their ingenuity and courage to make a stand against an overwhelming Imperial force and this pack captures their rebel spirit with units that form the cornerstone of players’ armies. Featuring four units of Rebel Veterans, two units of Tauntaun Riders, and a 1.4 FD Laser Cannon Team all led by Rebel hero Leia Organa accompanied by Chewbacca, R2-D2 and C-3PO, this pack gives players a stout force to hold off any opponent.

Players will also find the Command Cards for Leia Organa, R2-D2, and Chewbacca alongside copies of the four generic Command Cards and three new Command Cards designed for the exclusive use of the Echo Base Defenders Battle Force. Finally, 33 reprinted upgrade cards invite players to fully outfit their Rebel force to fit their strategy.

Contents:
37 Miniatures
15 Unit Cards
16 Command Cards
33 Upgrade Cards
2 Token Sheets
1 Insert Sheet

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Star Wars: Legion – Separatist Invasion Force: Battle Force Starter Set
description:
A mighty Separatist Invasion force is your players’ to command with this new Battle Force pack for Star Wars: Legion! Led by the nefarious General Grievous, this pack puts the wide variety of Separatist battle droids and heavy vehicles at players’ disposal, including three units of B1 Battle Droids, two units of Droidekas, an AAT Trade Federation Battle Tank, and a unit of IG-100 MagnaGuards.

Accompanying these units are three new Command Cards for use exclusively by the Invasion Force as well as reprints of General Grievous’ three Command Cards and copies of the four generic Command Cards. Finally, a set of 31 reprinted upgrade cards gives players everything they need to customize their Invasion Force and conquer systems across the galaxy.

Contents:
52 Miniatures
9 Unit Cards
10 Command Cards
30 Upgrade Cards
1 Token Sheet
1 Insert Sheet

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Star Wars: Legion – Blizzard Force: Battle Force Starter Set
description:
Carrying out the orders of Darth Vader himself, the renowned Blizzard Force crushed the Rebel resistance on Hoth, and Star Wars: Legion – Blizzard Force contains everything players need to construct and play their own Galactic Empire armies, including the commander version of Darth Vader from the Star Wars: Legion Core Set, three units of Imperial Snowtroopers, an AT-ST, a unit of 74-Z Speeder Bikes, and a new Stormtrooper Heavy Response Unit.

In addition to these units, players will find a complete set of basic command cards, reprints of Darth Vader's three command cards from the Star Wars: Legion Core Set, and three new command cards representing the tactics used by the Imperial forces on Hoth for use exclusively by Blizzard Force. Rounding out this set are 26 reprinted upgrade cards that give aspiring Imperial commanders everything they need to outfit their Battle Force and crush all those that stand in their way.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Norse Yhetee
description:
One of the great mysteries of Norse teams is how they ever managed to convince the blood-crazed and savage Yhetees to play Blood Bowl. That said, fans of Norse teams are too enthralled by the displays of Yhetee brutality to ask many questions! These hulking, muscular beasts are equipped with dagger-like teeth and rending claws and, of course, an unkempt mane of white fur – perfect for blending into a mid-game snowstorm and catching an unsuspecting ball carrier off-guard.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Elestrals
description:
Elestrals is a brand new trading card game from the mind of Dan "aDrive" Clap. Dan and his team have been very involved with many different TCGs, like Pokemon.

In a game of Elestrals, your Spirit cards are your most important resource: they are your health and fuel when playing cards and attacking your opponent! Knowing when to use your Spirits and when to save them is a key strategy.

There are five types of Spirits. Most decks have a mix of different types, and the Elestrals and Runes that you Cast will often need specific Spirits or even combinations of them!

To get started, each player has to have the following:

A Spirit deck with exactly 20 Spirits in it. You can mix and match different Spirits or play as many of the same ones as you like!
A Main deck with exactly 40 cards in it. This is where your Runes and Elestrals go; you can only have up to three copies of any single card, so you need some variety.


And that’s it! You can look through your own Spirit Deck any time you like and ask your opponent how many cards are left in their Spirit Deck. But you never* get to look through your opponent’s decks, so you won’t know exactly which Spirits they have left. Once your Main Deck is shuffled at the start of a game, you can’t look through it unless a card tells you.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: Donjon & Procrastination
description:
In "The Tournament" of Dungeons & Procrastination, you play as an enchanter participating in a summoning tournament. The arena's stands are packed with spectators!

Estimate the power of the opponent's summons in a tense face-off and cast a support summons if necessary, or would you rather bluff your way through a stunt?
That's when the dice are rolled, these 6-sided artifacts will grant your team its full power!
Which of the enchanters will win this tournament?
During each round, you must discard your opponent's cards and place them in your "Champions" pile with the highest score.

A round consists of 5 phases:

The Duel
Summoning Support
Artifact Throwing (Dice)
Combat Resolution
End of Round


During this rounds each player will secretly choose a card from their hand as fighter and may add a support. Each card have a value and a special effect that can lead to victory!

Then each player will roll a 6-sided die and add the value of the die to their card score.

If a player has played a Support card during the round they will roll an additional die and add the value of that die to their score.

The player with the highest value sends the opponent's card(s) to their "Limbo" pile, knocked out, face down. They places their winning cards in their "Champions" pile, face up.

Then each player draw a card of their deck and adds it to their hand.

The game ends when a player has no more cards to play at the beginning of a round.

The player with the most cards in their Champions pile wins the game!

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Bataille pour le Climat
description:
A cooperative game with the goal of saving humanity from self-destruction.

The game’s objective is to reduce the global greenhouse gasses of the 9 regions by 2/3 before turn 36.

Each player takes the role of a knowledgeable leader by using special cards from the 6 influences in the game: Political, Industrial, Military, Education, Media and NGO. Each player also chooses to work with an influential employer, giving them access to different skills and powers.

Each turn, the active player draws and adds influence cards to their hand, before revealing an event for the turn. After the event, the player can perform up to 2 actions to finish their turn.

The events represent: a number of major tipping points for the planet; a drop in oil production; or human consequences, which can be changed by a players' action using their influence cards.

The characters can move to different regions and change the electricity production, or to implement some Permanent Solutions with long term effects.

Different calamities come from the events, like riots becoming conflicts and then into war, or shortages of food becoming increasingly scarce, before a famine occurs, and lastly epizootics become epidemics and then pandemics. All of these calamities create refugees in search of a better life.

Each region has a specific "level of life" from 1 to 4, mirrored by the equivalent consumption of oil and electricity.

The players run versus the GHG, the global shortage of oil and demography.

The global greenhouse gasses of the 9 regions starts at 100, and must be reduced to 33 before turn 36.

Bataille pour le Climat is a full cooperative game, where each new run plays drastically different from the last.

Some actions are determined by rolling a D8, which can be modified with the use of certain cards.

The game is based on the courses of Jean-Marc Jancovici at the Ecole des Mines de Paris, and the solutions proposed for decarbonization are those of the French think tank, The Shift Project. All the equivalent statistics and data found in the game have been checked by the volunteers of the Shift Project, "les shifteurs", to be globally accurate with the real world.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up, Voting
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Ludus Humanum Est

name: Teddies vs Monsters
description:
Teddies vs Monsters is a fast-paced, real-time card game that promises a great balance between quick fun and a strategically driven gameplay.

In this game, you need to choose your side:


Play as a Teddy and protect the kids. or
Play as a Monster and let the feast begin!


With your side chosen, you'll need to try to outmatch your opponent by collecting symbol cards in proper order before they do. By doing so, you will be able to claim a Kid's bedroom as yours. The team with the most bedrooms wins the game!

But be careful! The other team will of course try to sabotage your game at all times! Can you win before they do? Or can you do the same to them and come out victorious?

Let's figure it out! T vs M

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Team-Based Game

name: Munchkin Babies 2: Stork Naked
description:
Did you enjoy the sweet feeling of playing Munchkin Babies? Have you been experiencing signs of baby fever? You’re in luck: Munchkin Babies 2 – Stork Naked will give you that newborn feeling again, without any labor on your part! Add this 56-card expansion to your Munchkin Babies game – or any fantasy Munchkin game.
It's all Developmentally Appropriate, and after all that fighting, the babies will surely Sleep Through the Night.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: GoodCritters: Game Boy Geek 2022 Promo Pack
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter campaign.

This pack contains all 8 promo cards that have been released through 2022:


Blackmail
Crystal Ball
Custom Tommy
Magician's Jewel
Rare Fossil
Vintage Wine
Cheap Knockoffs
Royal Dice
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Magic: The Gathering – Dominaria Remastered
description:
This all-reprint limited edition expansion celebrating the 30th anniversary of Magic: The Gathering features the return of hundreds of cards from across the history of the game, all centered around the world of Dominaria, where it all began.

Dominaria Remastered reprints 261 different cards (101 commons, 80 uncommons, 60 rares, and 20 mythic rares) and was available (in limited quantities) in draft boosters and collector boosters.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Wings of Glory: Tripods & Triplanes – Invasion
description:
This is an expansion for Wings of Glory: Tripods & Triplanes including all Kickstarter stretch goals.

Allows tripod vs. tripod combat, solo play, combat against WWII planes (you will need Wings of Glory WWII miniatures)

Includes the following miniatures (with their cards):

Mk. I "Locust"
Mk. II "Scarab"
Mk. III "Squid"
Mk. IV "Cuttlefish"
Navarre's Nieuport 16
Von Richtofen's Fokker Dr.1
Weber's Albatros D.V
Kissenert's Sopwith Camel
Fonck's Spad XIII


Accessories:

Rules for all accessories and stretch goals
Additional Counter Set
Additional damage decks
WWII Counter set (x2)
Game mat
Mini posters
Deck holders
Sword&Sorcery Scroll Cards
Sword&Sorcery Enemy Cards
Additional damage decks
WWII damage chit bags
Extra energy cubes
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Movement Template, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Clin9ic
description:
This is the second game of the Wave#2 of the Nano9games series.
Clin9ic is an Hospital Building game that uses 9 cards, 9 cubes and 9 dice.
Cards are used for:

4 Floor cards for your Clinic Building
3 Action cards to perform Actions
1 Care Planification Card
1 Track Card


Dice are used to track several parameters and are never rolled

the number of Patients
the illness of Patients
the number of Doctors
the skill of Doctors
the number of Nurses
the number of orderlies
the number of Gardens
the number Cylinders
the number of Entrances


Cubes are used to track

Money (1)
Popularity
Cars
Parking lots
Rounds
Money (2)
Number of Treated Patients


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Mission to the Moon
description:
Players are split into two competing space agencies. They spend their turns building rockets, launching rockets, or playing cards that can either help with building/launching or can disrupt/hinder their opponents. The more parts that are added to a rocket, the better chance of a successful launch, which is determined by a roll of a die. Players can either choose to be safe and build parts on the rockets to increase the odds of a successful launch, or can risk taking a dangerous launch that has the potential to crash and destroy the progress they have made on their project. Agencies go through a total of five projects, ending with the Mission to the Moon, the first agency to achieve this last project wins the game.

Compete with your friends in a fast paced strategy game to see who can lead their space agency to the Moon first! This game is easy to learn, but has many different strategies you can employ leading to fun replayability. This game combines the fast pace risk taking of a dice game with the cunning strategy of a card game. How will you lead your space agency? Will you play it safe or take risky launches? Will you focus on your own projects or use espionage to disrupt your opponents?
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Dice, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: The Elder Scrolls: Betrayal of the Second Era – Valenwood
description: The Valenwood expansion brings the home of the Bosmer into The Elder Scrolls: Betrayal of the Second Era. Featuring a new map, new enemies, new equipment, and a new set of quests, encounters, and delves, this expansion is packed with elements that can be used in this new region and throughout your games as a whole. Plus, grow your character building options with the new Security and Illusion skill lines and the Arcanist and Burglar classes.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Set-up

name: CIVITAS 2230
description:
The year is 2230. Giant City-States known as the Great Civitas have replaced nations. You control your own cyberpunk city and choose to rule it as you wish. Entice the planet's people to flock to your utopia or manipulate, steal, conquer, crush your way to victory.

CIVITAS 2230 is a strategic game for gaming groups that love tactics, political swindling, challenging scenarios and total story immersion. A "learn as you play" game that can be tailored to fit the time you have at the table, as well as your choice of cooperative, versus. or solo modes.

The game is controlled by a rigid Game Round structure. Players play out from their starting rectangular Presidential Mats and build their city by placing the Hexes they can afford to build. Hexes provide further bonus resources (Reputation, Ether, Ion, Material Cubes, or Policy Points) to allow for more Hexes to be drawn and placed in later turns, thus increasing the size and power of the player's city.

Workers are placed to activate certain Hexes, and unique characters, known as CNXpats, provide more extraordinary bonuses and special abilities to manipulate play in favour of the player who activates them. Other elements like drawing further Hexes, bidding for policies and earning additional bonuses for a player's total population, make up the rest of The Game Round.

Players win the game by reaching either 25 or 50 overall Reputation depending on the scenario.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Tile Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Cups 'N' Dice
description:
Cups 'N' Dice is a boardgame that provides many of the public domain cup and dice games all in one game set. This includes "Farkle", "Yatzy", "Bunco", "Mia", and many more games. These games normally involve pen and paper scoresheets, but cupsndice.com provides them in a digital format.

Most of the games provided by Cups 'N' Dice are public domain. By pairing the game set with a digital UI at the website, cupsndice.com also provides games that are unique from the public domain. This includes "Cant The Dice Game" a team based secret signal game, and traditional "Liar's Dice" with the newly added power-up dice, team-play and mystery-cup.

Speaking of Liar's Dice, the website provides a rule generator that can create over 200,000 variations of "Liar's Dice" games. You can play the simpler presets, but once you get comfortable with the game you can randomize the rules and play a different version of "Liar's Dice" every time
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Dice, Educational, Electronic, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Constrained Bidding, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: Mighty Gnomes
description:
According to legend, mighty gnomes dwell in the deep forest. As the chef of the mushroom tribe, you seek to prove to the king that you are his best leader, but there are many competitors. Consequently, you seek the aid of mighty gnomes. They will join your tribe if you gather enough resources in the forest and climb up the ladder to activate actions in the attic. Their powerful abilities will help you improve your actions, and their scoring criteria allow interesting combos and engines to achieve victory!

Heigh-ho, heigh-ho, to the kingdom I love to live! Right before the king's inspection, hardworking gnomes try to improve their kingdom in just 5 days. They summon 4 gnome groups every day and assign 3 of the best to each task. In the evening, after a long day of hard work, the gnomes are tired. Gnomes unassigned rush to their cozy bedroom because the next day they must work before others are fully rested. How impressive will the kingdom be after 5 days?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Zombicide: Virtues of the Bushido
description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive character pack brings you 7 samurai Survivors, all honorable and brave. Even in the face of overwhelming odds of a zombie horde, these unwavering samurai are prepared to lay down their lives for the greater good.

This Pack contains:

7 Survivors
7 Survivor ID Cards
7 Equipment Cards
1 Reference Card

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Teotihuacan: New Priests
description:
Two new priest promos, one for solo play. They are part of the Teotihuacan: City of Gods – Deluxe Master Set but are also available separately.

Effects:

Huitztlampaeh
At the start of your turn and only once per turn you may add 1 to the power of a worker with 1 power

During ascension, you may never choose the reward giving you your fourth worker.

Piltzintecuhhtli
After Ascension, the new worker is always placed on board 6, then Teotinot immediately resolves its Nobles/Conquest (6) action without needing or spending wood.
Do not power up a worker after this action.
mechanics: Area Movement, Rondel, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Ruler of the Realms
description: Set in a medieval fantasy setting known as the Aetherverse, four royal siblings battle each other for dominion over the world. Take control of a regent with unique abilities and construct an army of your design to claim the throne and vanquish your enemies. Ruler of the Realms offers different ways to achieve victory and with a game board that changes on a game to game basis it will continue to challenge your strategic mind.
categories: Economic, Medieval, Miniatures, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Moving Multiple Units, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Tile Placement

name: King of Battle
description:
King of Battle is a strategic modern battlefield game for two players. It was designed by a US Artillery Officer, and was made to teach modern battlefield tactics to tabletop game players.

By planning artillery strikes one turn in advance, you will attempt to predict where your opponent will move their pieces, and then deal deadly artillery strike damage to the targeted square. Your tanks and infantry will attack in real-time as you maneuver your pieces to avoid your opponent’s artillery strikes and advance to victory.

Win the game by destroying your enemy or forcing them to surrender. You must surrender if you destroy too many of your own units through poor artillery planning, or if you find your artillery is outnumbered by your opponent's. Artillery is king, and you cannot function without them.

Due to variable terrain placement, every game explodes with new strategies. Guessing where your opponent will move their pieces provides an addictive twist on modern strategy games. The end game never drags; it is designed to provide a quick ending, so that you can start the game again.
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Grid Movement, Pieces as Map, Programmed Movement, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Dead Poets Rise
description:
Players choose a dead poet to resurrect from obscurity by reaching the Center Ring and successfully overcoming the challenge of the Sphinx guarding the exit to the World of the Living.

Players become poets by creating their own poem in progress as they are prompted during game play!!

Prompts can come from great lines of poetry, random internet searches, or even from the last words of your recent text message!
Sabotage is also lurking– you might draw the card that makes your opponent move back 3 spaces or they may draw the prompt that allows them to give you a word you have to insert into your last line– or worse!
The Dead Poets you and your opponents are trying to rescue lived in different time periods and different countries, each with their unique poetry legacy to discover and inspire!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: DiceBlitz Hockey
description:
Introducing "DiceBlitz Hockey" - the exhilarating print-and-play ice hockey game that brings the thrill of the rink right to your tabletop! With fast-paced, quick turns, the game activates single players, keeping you on the edge of your seat as you strategize and maneuver your way to victory.

The game is still in "alpha" mode and is available as a print-and-play game for you to try out! Simply print, assemble, and let the action unfold as you roll the dice and experience the excitement of ice hockey like never before.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Push Your Luck

name: Party Wanted
description:
Welcome to Party Wanted, an exhilarating fusion of deck-building and roguelike gameplay, crafted for 1-8 players seeking a truly cooperative gaming experience. In Party Wanted, players embark on a journey through the Pyramid of Chaos, where they'll vanquish monsters, tackle powerful bosses, and above all, party as a unified team!

Adding a twist to the traditional card game format, Party Wanted offers optional drinking rules as well as social games that bring even more fun to the table, making it a perfect choice for game nights.

Whether you're looking for an epic solo quest or a vibrant co-op game to play with friends, Party Wanted delivers a captivating blend of strategy and excitement. Get ready to assemble your party, conquer the chaos, and join the fun!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Puzzle Strike 2: Troq and River
description:
This promo pack contains two new characters: Troq, the Well-Meaning Beast and River, the Dancing Fencer. It was originally included as part of the Puzzle Strike 2 Kickstarter as well as orders directly from Sirlin Games.

Troq's Character Cards
Ready to Smash - Add two purple gems to your super meter.
Giant Growth - Ante two extra gems (this card's effect is ongoing using the creature slot like Midori's Dragon Form from the base game).
Beast Unleashed - If you have at least 8 gems, draw two cards and crash.

River's Character Cards
Fencing Skills - Draw 3 cards, put the skill cards in your hand and discard the rest.
River Dance - Swap x5.
River Stance - +3 action points, you can only play cards that cost 0 or 1 this turn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Nice to Know! Animals
description:
Nice to Know: Animals is a 1-6 players wildly competitive entertaining card game that aims to provide unique facts about the animals. It's the first game in the "Nice to Know" series

In this game, each player becomes a zoologist on a mission to study different animal species. You'll earn points by researching animals, completing secret quests, and preparing for the epic endgame scoring.

The game flow is simple and allows for various strategies. Here's how it goes down:


Draw your secret quests
Gain research points
Travel the world by paying the cost or using the sponsor flights
Research animals


But wait, there's more! As you strive to win the game, you'll also stumble upon the most unique animal facts you've ever encountered. Who knew that sloths have secret dance parties when no one's looking? Or that penguins enjoy listening to heavy metal music? Well, not those ones but real ones. Get ready to have your mind blown with every quest completion!

Oh, and for all you solo players out there, we've got something extra special. Introducing our "Artificial Animal" (AA)! Solo play just got a whole lot wilder with five levels of difficulty. Brace yourself for the wackiest animal encounters you can imagine!

With a whopping 82 different animal species and a total of 182 animal cards, you'll never run out of outrageous information. And believe us, these animal facts are a rollercoaster of emotions. One moment you'll be laughing , and the next, you'll be shedding a tear... Get ready for a wild and emotional animal-filled adventure!

Nice to Know: Animals is more than just a game; it's a funny journey into the animal kingdom. So gather your friends and family, embrace your inner zoologist, and get ready to learn, laugh, and have a blast like never before!

description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Questions and Answers, Set Collection

name: Maestras de la Pintura
description:
He has arrived in the city. The best museums have to create a new exhibition made up of works by great artists that have been forgotten.

Like a good adviser, you will have to assemble the best collection, in order to attract all the attention of visitors and onlookers, for which you will have to create a set collection of 8 pieces of art, in 8 rounds, with different parameters that will be scored the best art collection at the end of the game.

________________________________

Ha llegado a la ciudad. Los mejores museos tienen que crear una nueva exposición compuestas por obras de grandes artistas que han quedado olvidadas.

Como una buena asesora tendrás que montar la mejor colección, para así atraer toda la atención de visitantes y curiosos, para lo que tendrás que crear una colección de 8 obras de arte, en 8 rondas, con parámetros distintos que puntuarán al final del juego a la mejor colección.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: WARS Fantasy
description:
This new version of the WARS series has been completely revamped to take place in a fantasy world. The battles are set to occur on the lost continent of Gamora, where players' armies will have to face a new adversaries and conquer rich territories.

In this game release you will find, in addition to a new and full-color graphical layout:

3x Armies (The Sylvanids, the Knights of the Silver Marches and the ancient Eternals)
100x Detachments Bases (representing all the army units)
45x Battle cards
27x Army specific Strategic Cards
24x Base Strategy cards
80x Counters
10x Scenic elements

With WARS Fantasy, players will now experience an added layer of strategic unpredictability through the use of Battle Cards, which has been added to the classic Alternate Command Activation system. They players will still have the option of choosing Strategy Cards, which have made the WARS system popular amongst three-dimensional battle games enthusiasts.

Despite the changes, the game still maintains its ease of play and quick duration, which lasts around 60-90 minutes. Additionally, its compact size, only requiring a table of 80x100 cm, makes it one of the most convenient options for organizing tournaments or events.

In summary, WARS Fantasy is not only simple to learn but also an engaging game that provides a thrilling experience for all players. The game's updated elements have breathed new life into it, making it an excellent choice for those looking for a fresh, exciting battle game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Fields of Fire III: The Parachute Regiment
description:
Arnhem, The Netherlands, 1944: 2 PARA’s chaplain is pinned down by German fire while trying to cross the street to get to injured soldiers. The commanding officer of A Company, Major Digby Tatham-Warter, runs to him and says, "Don't worry about the bullets, I've got an umbrella” before escorting him back across the street.

In this new, stand-alone volume from the team behind Fields of Fire Deluxe Edition, Fields of Fire Volume III sees the long awaited introduction of the British to Ben Hull’s masterpiece of tactical infantry command. From the burning streets of Arnhem to war-torn Helmand Province, Afghanistan, and via the bleak South Atlantic Falklands Islands, we follow the 2nd Battalion of The Parachute Regiment, commonly known as “2 PARA”, across over 60 years of military history.

As Britain’s elite Airborne Infantry, the Parachute Regiment are used as spearhead troops and are often inserted behind enemy lines, by parachute or in modern times by helicopter. Lightly equipped due to the nature of their insertion, they need all their training, resilience, and fighting spirit to survive until other units can fight their way to them.

Highlights – What’s New in Volume III


When the company radios fail, make do with more uniquely British options like bugles.
Use unique British weaponry such as PIAT anti-tank weapons during WWII and vehicles like Scorpions and WMIK in the more modern theatres of the Falklands and Afghanistan.
Urban Defensive missions! Fight amongst rubble and fires, and try to hold on to your pocket by whatever means necessary as the enemy attacks utilizing a completely new urban offensive enemy hierarchy chart.
Experience the constraints of modern day combat as you try to determine whether groups of people and incoming vehicles are hostile or merely civilians going about their lives.
Collapsing buildings, an enemy helicopter assault, mine-sweeping duties, night assaults, and much, much more!


—description from the publisher
categories: Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Asli
description:
Asli is a territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board). There is also an off-board location called prison.

This game is based on Lifeline.



DefinitionsA group is a stone along with all stones one can reach from it through a series of steps onto orthogonally adjacent stones of its color.

A group is alive if there is a free path along the lines of the board between that group and another group of its color. The path does not need to be a straight line. A group is also alive if there has never been more than one group of its color on the board. A group that is not alive is dead.

A territory is an empty point along with all points one can reach from it through a series of steps onto orthogonally adjacent empty points. You own a territory if all stones orthogonally adjacent to it are of your color.

An incursion is a placement by one player in a territory owned by the other player. An incursion is minimal if it causes exactly one enemy group to be moved to the prison.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform exactly one of these actions:


Remove an enemy stone from the prison.
Place a stone of your color on an empty point, then move all dead enemy groups to the prison. If the prison now contains stones of both colors, remove pairs of opposite-colored stones from it until at most one color remains.


At the end of your turn, there must be no dead friendly groups on the board. You cannot make a minimal incursion if your opponent just made a minimal incursion.

The last player to perform an action wins. If a stone placement recreates any previous board position with the same player to move, the game ends in a draw. This is possible in theory, but probably requires colluding players.

Before the game begins, to make it fair, the first player places a number of black stones in the prison, and then the second player chooses sides.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Enclosure, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Wutaki: Agendakarten
description:
Promotional cards from Spiel Essen Fair.
Goal cards to earn extra points.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Chennis
description: Chennis is a Kyoto Shogi variant where pieces promote or demote on every move, creating a highly dynamic rally over a tennis court-themed board. Captured pieces may be dropped or "served" back onto the board, as in Shogi, and Kings are restricted to their own court or the net, similar to Xiangqi. Chennis also includes pieces not found in International Chess such as the Cannon and Soldier from Xiangqi, and the Ferz from Shatranj. Drops, alternating piece promotion, and restricted King mobility mean that there are surprising diversity of ways to mate your opponent and win despite only beginning the game with four pieces plus the King.
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Petra: Era of Prosperity
description:
You are among one of the leaders of the Nabataean people. Guide them as they build Petra during its era of prosperity. Build great monuments, grow frankincense and myrrh, build prosperous trade routes, and journey across the lands of ancient Jordan. Players will do all of this on a shared map in this civilization building roll & write game.

Players will build Petra by drawing on an expanding shared map, as opposed to traditional Roll & Write games with individual player sheets.

This game uses push your luck mechanics, asymmetric player abilities, dice drafting, and variable scoring to produce an engaging, fun, strategic and highly replayable game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Zombie Survival Infection
description:
In Zombie: Survival Infection game you control of a camp of survivors attempting to outlast the undead. How you approach your survival is your choice. You can make allies by helping others, try to stay neutral, break a truce when it benefits you the most or go on the offensive. Just remember no matter what you choose your fellow camps are going to do everything they can ensure their survival.

Unique mechanic of Passing the Die can be used to build alliances or weaken enemies. Players knocked out before the game ends play as the zombies. If all survivors are knocked out at the same time the zombies win!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Passed Action Token, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Trading

name: Freaky Rumors
description:
Everyone in this surreal apartment building loves rumors and especially loves gossiping about them with their neighbors.
Your goal is to come up with the best background story for a given rumor that is spreading around town and get crowned as the Rumor Freak.

HOW TO PLAY

Every player chooses a character and takes the corresponding


Character Card in front of them, along with a marker.

A random player starts the game by saying, "Rumor has it that... and draws one card from each deck, placing each card faceup in the following order to complete a sentence: WHO > DID WHAT> WHO > SPICY DETAIL. This player is now the active player.
Start the sand timer. All players (including the active player) have 1 minute to come up with a scenario and a background story for the rumor (why it happened, how things ended up that way, secret motives, or whatever you like). Be as bizarre and disturbing as you can be. Keep notes on your Dry-Erase Card so that you don't forget.
Once the sand timer is up, each player unravels their story, starting with the active player and moving clockwise. Try to be as convincing as you can and persuade everyone you have the real story.
Then, every player votes for the best story by writing their favorite character name on their card. And no, you cannot vote for yourself.
When everyone is ready, reveal your votes. Every player gets as many points as the votes he/she has received. If someone is voted by all, he/she gets one extra point.
Circle the number of points you received on the numberline of your Character Card and update it after every round to keep track of your total points.
With each new round, someone new becomes the active player.
The game ends when all players have been the active player once (for 5-6 players) or twice (for 3-4 players).
The player with the most points is deemed the absolute Rumor Freak of the Town.


FUN FACT: If the WHO card starts with "my" (example, my mom) we're talking about the active player's real mom. Not their character's mom. Their real mom. Enjoy the chaos.

SPICE UP THE GAME
Looking to spice up the game even more?
Instead of drawing the first WHO card, the active player can come up with a person they know (famous or not) and write it out on the WHO Dry-Erase Card.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Voting

name: BarbeCubes
description:
BarbeCubes is a cooperative dice game about barbecue for the whole family!

Pick up the orders, roll the dice to match the ingredients, and avoid burning the food with the coal!

Your goal is to deliver 7 orders correctly and the whole table works together to make the barbecue a success!
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Push Your Luck

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Three Sisters and Haunted Sisters Promos
description:
These cards were available exclusively during the Forbidden Fortress Kickstarter. When extra Harianagos were added in the pledge manager, these promo cards were included:

The Three Sisters - Epic Threat, D3 Harianagos.

The Haunted Sisiters - Epic Threat, 3 Harianago apparitions.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Lobotomy 2: Manhunt – 2023 Promo Characters
description:
2023 Promo characters.

Eight new promo characters (character cards and miniatures) for Lobotomy 2: Manhunt.

List of Characters:


Friday Black
Rubens Horntail
Anthony V. Nation
Jim Mose
Powder Blue
Carrie Iceshow
Ellen Shroomsafe
Pedro Lastivez
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Death Path: Solitary Assignment
description:
Death Path: Solitary Assignment is a solo/one-player card & dice game for ages 12+.

The Death Path takes the violence and brutality of a gladiatorial fighting pit combined with a challenging and complex labyrinth.

Citizens watch the action unfold live on their holo-terminals while chosen Subjects enter the Death Path ready to battle for their survival. Within the Death Path, Subjects will also encounter Pathfinders: Government-controlled robots whose sole mission is to challenge Subjects by rigorously testing their combat skills — and to provide even more brutal entertainment for the revelers viewing at home.

During their journey through the Death Path, Subjects are presented with many options within the maze representing multiple routes. The correct path of survival could be a Hidden Path that leads directly to the end of the maze. The incorrect path may just turn out to be a Dead End with no options but to retrace one’s steps.

A Subject’s prize for winning the Death Path? The Subject gets to live and enjoy all of the fame, glamour, and riches of a celebrity, while the Government logs another elite soldier for their impending war for control of the world.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gun and Gun: W SHOUT
description:
A new product of the long-awaited [Gannagan] series, a [new] high-speed two-gun battle card game dedicated to all musketeers.

It is possible to play this alone as well as combine it with the past set as a stand-alone basic set.

Show the overwhelming power difference to your opponent with the new ability [Overclocking]!

Four musketeers and six machine guns are newly recorded!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Interrupts, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Turf Wars Upgrade
description:
A new mechanic introduced in Iceborne, turf wars sees some monsters go head-to-head on the board — often while you're caught in the middle!

This upgrade deck adds the new turf wars mechanic and more to your Monster Hunter World board game. It comes with more than 50 cards, including:


Turf war behaviours for 6 World monsters
Handy player reference cards explaining turn sequences and status ailments
Potion and whetstone cards


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Warfighter: Fantasy Expansion #4 – Joanna: Human Paladin
description:
This Warfighter Fantasy Expansion adds 48 cards and 6 Counters to your Backpack!

No evil may stand against the Holy might of an empowered paladin!

This expansion offers 48 cards including:

6 Player Hero cards
6 Squad Hero cards
1 Deity card
8 Divine Power cards
16 Skill cards
1 Weapon card
4 Armour/Shield cards
1 Gear card
5 Item cards

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warfighter: Fantasy Expansion #9 – Plumeria: More Hostiles and Flame
description:
This Warfighter Fantasy Expansion adds 48 cards and 6 Counters to your Backpack!

"...they're getting more numerous, but the Fire Wolves are allies, so there's that..."

This expansion offers 48 cards including:

6 Squad Hero cards
2 Skill cards
15 Location cards
19 Hostile cards
5 Action cards + 1 Location Marker

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gods of War: Togo
description:
Gods of War: Togo is a naval wargame that puts you in command of mighty battleships, nimble cruisers and fast destroyers from the turn of the 20th century in conflicts such as the Spanish–American and Russo-Japanese wars. With careful planning, clever manoeuvres and accurate artillery salvos, you will sink the enemy fleet.
Beautiful models and rules that you can learn in 15 minutes guarantee a great adventure.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Template

name: Breaking Moon
description:
Welcome to the captivating world of Breaking Moon, an immersive board game that places you and your fellow players at the forefront of humanity's struggle for survival. The moon's catastrophic collision with an asteroid has shattered it into pieces, plunging the Earth into chaos. As the sea levels rise and catastrophe looms, corporations unite to construct a lifeline: a space station to shelter the remaining population.

In Breaking Moon, players collaborate to achieve to complete the space station before the encroaching waters submerge Earth. With each turn, you must strategize, cooperate, and harness your ingenuity to navigate the challenges that stand in your way.

Designed for 2 to 5 players, Breaking Moon offers a dynamic and engaging gameplay experience that revolves around thoughtful decision-making and strategic planning. The game mechanics intertwine seamlessly to create a unique blend of resource management, worker placement, cooperative gameplay, and technological advancement.

Your journey begins by assuming the role of a member of one of the unique families in the game, each with its own distinct abilities. As you move your helicopter token across the game board, you'll need to choose wisely between gathering vital resources, completing essential actions, and evacuating survivors to the safety of the space station. Be mindful of the sea levels, as the rising tides can reshape your strategies and dictate the fate of your survivors.

Whether you're researching new innovations, converting resources, training scientists, or trading on the market, each action contributes to your journey's success.

With the moon's degradation comes uncertainty, as Breaking Moon cards introduce unexpected events that will test your adaptability and resilience. As you strive to complete sections of the space station, allocate population cards to higher ground, and make crucial decisions, you'll feel the weight of the world on your shoulders.

Breaking Moon weaves an enthralling narrative, blending strategic gameplay with an urgency that mirrors the impending crisis. The space station's construction is a race against time. Will you contribute or will you focus on your own goals? It is up to you.

Are you ready to join the ranks of those who dare to reshape the future of humanity? Will you rise to the challenge of constructing the space station and securing a future for the human race? The countdown has begun, and the destiny of Earth hangs in the balance.

Welcome to Breaking Moon, where survival is a test of strategy, cooperation, and the unbreakable human spirit.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Income, Market, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Ivion: The Bear & The Badger
description:
Ivion combines the intensity of a fighting game with the strategy of deck-building card games to create an experience unlike any other. In Ivion, your deck IS your character, and you build it from a variety of classes and specializations. Each character type has numerous cards from which to choose, along with wildly different playstyles. Mix and match them to create your own, unique character!

THE RUFFIAN tumbles through life, never staying anywhere too long. In her wake, she leaves behind broken jaws, empty purses, and filled hearses. Instead of working for her coin like an ordinary sap, she'll get hers with a growl, grab, and a club to the gut.

THE FRIAR roams the countryside, bringing aid and cheer. He claims the Lady herself guides his humble path, though if that's true, she seems to have a soft spot for taverns. He’s not versed in violence, but he does believe in beginner’s luck.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Interrupts, Take That

name: Ivion: The Noose & The Goose
description:
Ivion combines the intensity of a fighting game with the strategy of deck-building card games to create an experience unlike any other. In Ivion, your deck IS your character, and you build it from a variety of classes and specializations. Each character type has numerous cards from which to choose, along with wildly different playstyles. Mix and match them to create your own, unique character!

THE EXECUTIONER delivers heads for the Baron. By decree, the townsfolk gather to watch his handiwork. The condemned, however, has broken free. And it's laughing at him. He whets his axe; it will start shrieking soon enough.

THE POACHER only follows the laws he can read. As he puts it, can't none get the rule outta him to save the king, mind. Not so. He just live by his code, skin the deer and sell the pelts for shoes, snacks, and trap stuff. Now that's make sense, traps... Couldn't even say how many he hid all about the Kingswood. Might as well be the Trapswood even. This new headsman tho got weird. Couldn't as fun to escape from as the last one. Too stiff to fluster. Nothing a log to the face won't do in though.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Interrupts, Take That

name: The Night Cage: Shrieking Hollow
description:
You awake in the dark with nothing but a candle and...have you done this before? The déjà vu is less troubling than the change it implies. Was the ground always this unstable around you? When the tunnels crumbled into pits, did they always scream? And why does it feel like those screams are getting closer?

The Shrieking Hollow is an expansion that adds a new threat and a new space to explore within The Night Cage. Pits now connect prisoners to the Hollow, where The Other lies in wait. Over the course of play, The Other will rise up out of the Hollow and attack the prisoners, destroying any part of the maze it encounters. If the prisoners are brave, they can leap into a pit and fall to the bottom of the Hollow where the dim light of their candles will stop its advance, temporarily. However, they can't hold it back forever, and prisoners that stay too close to The Other will be attacked when it lurches toward the flickering light it despises.

If you are looking to increase the dread and horror of the original game, The Shrieking Hollow is for you.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Finale Ending, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Machinate
description:
Bid. Build. Betray.

Outbid and outplay your opponents as you race to be the first one to complete your robot. Decide when to stockpile your money and when to buy robot parts, minibots, and utilities. Use powerful effects to help you claim victory or destroy your opponents as they try to do the same.

Each game of Machinate creates an evolving marketplace. No card has a set price. Each new game you play changes your approach. As you learn about the card effects and auctions, you change when and how much you spend. Each player gets a fresh infusion of credits and participates in auctions every turn, keeping everyone at the table engaged. And with utility cards that can be played on any turn, you always have an opportunity to influence the game.

Powerful and unique card effects let you play with different strategies every game. Each deck has a total of 100 cards, with 69 unique abilities and art across robot parts, minibots, and utilities. Unique utility and minibot cards allow you to stay in the game, even if you are running low on credits. This creates a natural balance where every player is competing right to the end. There's always a chance for a dramatic underdog victory.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Negotiation, Science Fiction
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Cloudspire: Crosspire Landmark
description: This is available from the 2021 Promo Pack, it includes the Crosspire chip and Landmark Spire Instructions card.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeons and Naggins
description:
Play as the Pintman and defeat Cromwell using a chicken fillet roll and a bag of cans in this Irish comedy board game designed for non-gamers!

Dungeons and Naggins is a co-op board game with an Irish comedy theme, and optional drinking game rules. It's great craic and it's easy for non-gamers.

You flip cards, roll dice, and gather loot, trying to defeat the boss and win.
Quick Setup, 2-6 players, 30 mins

Pour a drink and grab some friends, it’s time to play Dungeons and Naggins!

HOW IT WORKS:

HOW TO PLAY:
Players work together as they face the cards in the dungeon deck. Setup the Dungeon deck and flip the first card to begin

The Dungeon Deck = Enemy + Encounter + Little Goblin Fella cards + the Boss.
Most cards will ask one or all players to roll the D20, then add your hero's skill points (or subtract your weaknesses!) Rolling high is good, low is bad.
Gather Items to recover HP or give you an advantage in combat.
Help each other to survive!

On your turn you and your allies will have to roll your D20 to overcome encounters. Add or subtract your hero skill modifier

Defeat enemies by rolling 13 or higher, removing enemy tokens. If tokens remain, your party loses health

Watch out for little goblin fella cards. Gameshow rounds to give or take your Health or items!

Keep turning and defeating cards until the boss is dead or one of you is!

Dungeons and Naggins is:
Quick & easy to set up, perfect for new players and non-gamers
Fun and simple to play, plus optional drinking game rules!
Funny, with authentically Irish humour
Easy to carry with you to the pub or a party!
Endlessly re-playable, You'll meet different cards every time!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Oranienburger Kanal: Café am Kanal Promo Card
description:
Essen spiel 2023 promo card

[5g4d]

When activate this card you can build 1 or 2 new bridges (if you built a canal or path near this card).
mechanics: Action/Event, Worker Placement

name: Algae, Inc.
description:
Algae, Inc. is a company that produces and processes different kinds of algae into cosmetics, bioplastics, and biodiesel. You manage one of these sectors of the company, trying to create an efficient assembly line; manage your team of operators, engineers, and scientists; and help expand the company to several locations all over Europe.

As the company becomes more and more successful, you try to achieve certain milestones before other departments may do so because as much as you like to see the whole company perform well, you would like to get that extra bit of credit compared to your peers.

Algae, Inc. is a medium-heavy strategy game that combines resource management, tableau building, and multi-processing. Each player has a unique player board and must adapt their strategy to the department they've chosen to manage. As the game progresses, you have to hire more staff, optimize your processing line, and keep a close eye on what your colleagues are doing. You also have to make crucial decisions as you decide to free up space on your science board by either unlocking engineer tiles (that will improve your factory) or science tiles (that will allow you to improve your actions). It's a meticulous game that reveals its true depth the more you play it as every decision you make will affect the next one.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Income, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement

name: Dualities
description:
In Dualities two players (Even and Odd) compete to get the highest score by claiming certain lines on a hexagonal board with five hexes per side.

The game commences with the empty board and players alternate turns placing one domino-style tile (formed by two hexagons of two different colours, black and white) on a free space of 2 adjacent hexes of the board. The game ends when there’s no free space to put a tile.

To get the score players add up the lines they have claimed; Even claims a certain line if the number of black hexagons along this line is even. Similarly, Odd claims a line if the number of black hexagons along this line is odd. White hexagons are neutral.
