There are two different ways of scoring taking into account: a) only the 9 lines parallel to a certain direction (basic play) or b) all the lines (27) parallel to the 3 different directions in the board (expert play).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement

name: Fox-3
description:
Fox-3 is a tactical level miniature game in which players go head to head with an opposing squadron of jet fighters. The goal is to eliminate the opposing fighters by outsmarting, outmaneuvering and outgunning them.

Set in an alternate history where the world has spiraled into constant conflict, your first choice is which side you're on: are you with one of the sovereign Nation states, or one of the threatening Villain states? Or would you prefer to be able to join the highest bidder as part of one of the world's leading Private Military Contractors? Each of these factions will give access to a selection of fighter jets - some more advanced than others, but all with a unique character and play style.
After selecting your jets, missile loadouts and pilots, you're ready for take off and engage the hostiles.

The unique and intuitive movement system takes in account critical aspects of Basic Fighter Maneuvering such as speed and altitude - don't expect to do that sharp high-g turn when you're flying the speed of sound..
Evade incoming long-range missiles, fire your own missiles when you have a clear shot, or switch to guns when the bandit's too close.

The Fox-3 core game contains everything to get you playing, including 6 miniatures of 3 different jet fighter types.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Flying Frog DiceFest 2023 Goody Box
description:
You can purchase the DiceFest 2023 Goody Box only during DiceFest Weekend and only on the FFP Web Store!

Includes:


A Flooded Cave / A Transporter Room Map Tile with Map Cards
DiceFest-Exclusive Veteran Huscarl Miniature with “Fallen Titan Helm” Base
New Team Abilities Pack (3)
Extended Art Card: Demonic Speed
Lost Explorer’s Helmet
Viking Battle Axe
Targa and Jargono Combo Threats
DiceFest 2023 Keychain


- Description from the publisher

All elements are for Shadows of Brimstone this year.
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Wizards of the Grimoire: Shifting Sands
description:
Wizards of the Grimoire: Shifting Sands is a stand-alone expansion. The game can be played by itself or can be paired with the Wizards of the Grimoire base game to create a colossal 140-card spell deck!

In this two-player strategy card game, you must defeat your opponent and restore peace to Sablehaven. Draft new spells and relics, cast them, manage your cooldowns, and deal massive damage.

Wizards of the Grimoire: Shifting Sands introduces 70 totally new and unique spells including a new spell type - relics! These spells have been captured within magical items and can be released to have an effect a single time. Relics allow you to quickly learn new spells and flexibly change your tableau.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: La Vallee de la Mort: The Battles of Na San and Dien Bien Phu
description:
La Vallee de la Mort: The Battles of Na San and Dien Bien Phu is a new edition of the games published by The Microgame Design Group and Against the Odds. This new edition has the two games on Na San and Dien Bien Phu, as well as ones on Operations Albatross and Condor all in one package. It also incorporates all of the accumulated addenda from the earlier editions into all of the relevant components.

Each copy of Vallée de la mort should contain the following components:

• Two 11 by 17 and two 8.5 by 11 inch map sheets depicting the terrain the battle was fought over along with charts and tables, and a Terrain Key. Note: The Terrain Key on the Dien Bien Phu map is used for the other two maps as well.
• 352 double-sided, un-mounted units.
• 30 pages of rules and charts for the three games.

Not supplied with this game but needed for play are one or preferably two six-sided die.

The new High Flying Dice Games edition of La Vallee de la Mort is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Tim Allen.
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling

name: Kinfire Delve: Callous' Lab
description:
In Kinfire Delve: Callous' Lab, a tactical and cooperative card game for 1-2 players, you will fight your way through the well deck of challenge cards to reach Callous, the Master of the Well, and face him in an epic final battle.

Callous' Well is made up of four challenge cards, with Callous himself in the middle. As a challenge is defeated, another takes its place, with 57 challenge cards in total. As you face the challenges of the Well, you may play a skill card from your hand only when it matches the color of the challenge card, e.g., if you're facing a red challenge card, then you may play only a red skill card. Some cards have two colors, and some are white, that is, wild. If the card you play does not defeat the challenge, you'll be able to add some progress to it and attempt it again, though you may suffer a penalty for doing so.

Other seekers can provide help by playing one of their own cards as a boost, but beware. Running out of cards nets you an exhaustion card before you can draw a new hand. Exhaustion cards are never good, but some are worse than others.

Defeating a challenge provides you a reward, such as regaining health or delving deeper into the Well, which is represented by discarding unseen challenge cards. Once you've made your way to the bottom of the Well, you'll face Callous himself. All Seekers share a health pool, and if the pool reaches zero, you're defeated. This is a game that requires teamwork and persistence as the wells of Atios are unpredictable and quite dangerous.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards

name: Whatever the Cost: The Battle for Corregidor February, 1945
description:
Whatever the Cost is an introductory level mini-game on the final US airborne offensive in the Pacific Theater against the Japanese held island fortress of Corregidor. The Japanese took the US fortress in May 1942, completing their conquest of the Philippine Archipelago. When he was ordered earlier to evacuate Corregidor and take command of Allied forces assembling in Australia, General Douglas MacArthur vowed to someday return. The recapture of Corregidor was seen as both necessary to complete the liberation of the Philippines, and for MacArthur, personal redemption for the earlier US defeat and surrender.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Eschaton: Iconoclasm
description:
Iconoclasm is a cooperative expansion for Eschaton. Through deck-building, players will be raising cults alongside one another, forging an alliance to wage war against the Inquisition. As the cults are rallied, players will amass armies in the realm to fortify the Dark One’s empire. It is imperative that the cult leaders work together to hold the Inquisition at bay and ensure the arrival of the fires of Armageddon.

In an effort to out-maneuver the rallying cults, the Inquisition will make strategic incursions across the realm, strengthening their resolve and bolstering their resources. As their grip on the realm tightens, so too does their tactical advantage and ferocity. They will stop at no end to see the Citadel fall and the Dark One banished to the void.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Graffiti duel
description:
Tactically choose your sprays. Find the best combination to paint the most creative work and beat your opponent in this Graffiti Duel.

Choose from your spray cards to build your 3x3 grid, the player whose spray column is closest to the value of the mural will win their points.

Combine spray and make scoring combos to be the best graffiti artist in this Graffiti duel.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: QuizWiz
description:
QuizWiz is a cooperative trivia game in which players work together to match countries with accurate statements about them.

During gameplay, participants take turns assigning Country cards to Statement and Condition cards. Communication is restricted, as players can't reveal or discuss their cards unless they play Country card to Debate. Players together as a team may discuss where to play Country that's on Debate. But be cautious — the number of Debates is limited, and once exhausted, players must rely solely on their individual insights.

The game ends when at least two cards have been assigned to each Statement and Condition card. Players then flip all Statement cards to check their answers.

Featuring 126 Statements that may or may not be true, corresponding to 72 Country cards, QuizWiz provides great replayability. Players can select any of 14 setups, categorized into three different difficulty levels, adding an extra layer of variety to the game. Or they can go for up to one hour-long campaign with 3 games of increasing difficulty levels.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game

name: Tiny Epic Cthulhu: Cult of Chaos
description:
In the Cult of Chaos expansion, a wicked Cultist of the Shrine emerges, determined to thwart the players' efforts and empower the Great Old One. This malevolent figure seeks to plunge the world into eternal chaos and darkness.

The Cultist of the Shrine possesses the ability to traverse various locations, casting powerful incantations and summoning his devoted followers to wreak havoc upon the unfortunate town. These loyal disciples will go to great lengths to impede your progress and obstruct your path to victory.

Prepare to face the treacherous Cultist as he orchestrates his sinister plans, maneuvering strategically and employing dark magic to fulfill his nefarious objectives. Only by overcoming their malevolent schemes can you hope to restore order and prevent the world from descending into eternal darkness.

The Cult of Chaos expansion also features additional heroes to play, town locations to explore and Great Old Ones to defeat.

It comes in a box of the same height and width (1/2 the depth) and quality of Tiny Epic Cthulhu.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: KALLAX: The Boardgame
description:
In KALLAX, your goal will be to fill your shelf with game boxes, following the placement instructions: the right game in the right place for the best collection ever.

A game round is composed of the following 3 phases:

1. Replenish up to two retail slot (facultative)
At the start of your turn, add game boxes drawn from the bag in up to two of the five retail slot. A retail slot cannot accommodate more than 4 Game Boxes.

2. Buy games
Buying consists of pick up game boxes from the retail slots in the center of the play area. You can only purchase one Game Box per retail slot. The purchased game boxes are placed in your shopping cart. The total volume of your purchases during your turn must not exceed the capacity of your shopping cart.

3. Storing your games and organizing your shelf
All the game boxes purchased during this round + one and only one from the unplayed pile are stored in your shelves.

A complete shelf compartment (fully filled) allows you to instantly validate a storage ojective. You score 1 point per game box in the compartment you just completed. You advance your pawn on the score track of the total points thus obtained.

Extra points are scored at the end of the game for objectives and contracts achieved. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Crawler's Grimoire: DungeonQuest Promo Pack (fan made expansion)
description:
A pack of 6 promo cards for the Crawler's Grimoire DungeonQuest expansions: 3 for The Undead Merchant, 2 for Events and 1 for Haunted Halls. These were included with orders that purchased all 3 sets of Crawler's Grimoire expansions. Included:

1x Selenic Spear
2x Death Coin
1x Pack Mule
1x Glowing Mark
1x Stalk Card
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Les Veilleurs
description:
A game book set in the Austerion world.

Similar to a "Choose your own adventure" book, with added component, you can play either an agent of the gods or a cultist of the Titans, both adventuring in the Bleak vale region to investigate strange occurrences following an earthquake.

You choose the character, its build, take the decision across the adventure, including fighting alone or with your troups.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Mice at Arms
description:
Someplace where the wind blows over the fen, the copse becomes the thicket, and the thicket opens to the meadow...a great mouse empire fell. Deceit and skullduggery from the noble houses led to the Dark Ages. Now 100 mouse kingdoms fight to keep what is theirs, and take what isn’t. You rule one such kingdom and war is upon you!

Mice-at-Arms is a fast-play skirmish miniature game. Each army is composed of about 5 units (7-23 models total). There is minimal record keeping and the average game takes about an hour to play. The rules are designed to be simple and straightforward, but with levels of tactics that can be skillfully implemented to defeat your opponent.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: SCUD248 Lawless First Wave
description:
As the captain of a United Federation of SCUDs ship, you defend SCUD248 from attacks by Lawless ships.

You and your fellow UFS Captains have devised a friendly competition to capture the most Lawless ships.

Choose which Lawless ship you want to capture, roll the dice and see if you are successful.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Matching

name: Sludge War
description:
Sludge encourages players to build grim fantasy armies using various historical miniatures. The rules represent a black powder age with a fantastical emphasis on powerful knights and dark magic. Battle hardened line infantry will form the backbone of an army. These core troops are supported by noble knights and strange magicians.

Sludge is an invitation to collect and convert an army from a dark ahistorical setting, and a delightfully dark battle game with a brutal and distinct play style.

This is a stand-alone game originally released as part of BLASTER: Games Anthology 03 with clarified rules and expanded with faction-specific units.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Set-up
publishers: Electi Studio, Metal King Studio, Micro Art Studio

name: Parable Kingdom
description:
As the steward appointed by the King of the Parable Kingdom, you've been entrusted with the responsibility of overseeing the realm during his absence.

In this game inspired by biblical parables, each location on the board corresponds thematically to different parables. On your turn, you have the opportunity to traverse the kingdom's roads, reaching various locations to perform actions such as gathering sheep, cultivating wheat, receiving blessings, building reputation, and ultimately acquiring the talents necessary for victory.

Upon the King's return, will he deem you a good and faithful servant?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Rondel, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: MeatEater Trivia Board Game
description:
This board game is the ultimate test of your outdoor knowledge! It’s based on the MeatEater Trivia Podcast, hosted by Spencer Neuharth, which you can find on the MeatEater Podcast Feed and MeatEater Youtube Channel.

The game contains 800 questions from the categories hunting, fishing, conservation, cooking, woodsmanship, gear, wildlife, and natural history. This is trivia you won’t find anywhere else.

And here’s the coolest part: We’re donating $1 from each sale to conservation projects. That means your purchase will help fund things like land access and wildlife habitat. It’s quite literally the only board game where conservation always wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Great War at Sea Jutland: North Sea 1914
description:
“ Great War at Sea: Jutland Second Edition is a game tightly focused on the Battle of Jutland in May and June 1916. Jutland: North Sea 1914 extends the story into the battles that happened, or could have happened, before the Battle of Jutland: Helgoland Bight, the Scarborough Raid, the Yarmouth Raid and more.

Jutland: North Sea 1914 adds 43 more scenarios to Jutland Second Edition, all of them set in 1914, the first year of the Great War. During these early months, leaders on both sides thought they could reach a decision at sea, and that they needed to hurry, since the war would be over by Christmas time.

We use the same approach as Jutland Second Edition: a deep dive into the history of the campaign, using the game scenarios to help tell the story. It’s taking the old advice to “Show, Don’t Tell” to a whole new level. You don’t have to be content with just reading about the campaign, at the key moments, you can play out the situation and see why the admirals made their choices, and how you might have done better (or not).

You’ll need Jutland: Second Edition to play most of the scenarios, and Cruiser Warfare Second Edition to play all of them.”

Note: This is designed to expand Jutland Second Edition which is the 2023 version of GWAS Jutland. Older printings of Jutland First Edition may lack some of the rules that are in the Second Edition core rules.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Chronicles of Light: Darkness Falls (Disney Edition)
description:
In Chronicles of Light: Darkness Falls (Disney Edition), players work together to form dynamic alliances of Disney and Pixar heroines, including Moana (Moana), Violet (The Incredibles), Maid Marian (Robin Hood) and Belle (Beauty and the Beast).

Materializing as radiant crystal versions summoned into the realm, the heroines drive back shadows of infamous Disney villains and restore the Realm of Light. Along the way, the team explores a brand-new illustrated world and encounters familiar characters, items, and creatures on their quests. The game's diverse missions and modular board generate new adventures every time it's played.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Catapult
description:
Catapult is a decisive two-player army game of total annihilation.

Rules:

The goal of Catapult is to capture all your opponent's pieces.
Starting with light, players move one of their pieces each turn.
If you cannot make a legal move, you must pass.
Pieces move in a straight line, up to its range, passing only enemy or empty spaces, and capturing all passed enemies, including one landed on. Note, you do not have to land on a piece to capture it.
Each piece has default range of 1. Range is doubled for each of the three forward directions in which its movement is blocked
Non-capturing movements (a move that only passes and lands on empty spaces) must be in one of the three forward directions, towards the opposite corner.
Capturing movements (a move that lands on or passes through 1 or more opponent pieces) may be in any of the eight orthogonal or diagonal directions.


Optional balancing mechanism:
This game can optionally be played using the dagger. Dark would start out in possession of it. On your turn, you may pass the dagger to the opponent. If you do, for this turn, make two moves instead of one.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Square Grid

name: D-Day Dice: Goldly Go!
description:
D-Day Dice: Goldly Go! is an expansion set for D-Day Dice, 1st & 2nd Edition and the upcoming D-Day Dice: Pacific.

Sent from the USS Enterprise (CV-6), a small crew led by its valiant captain joins the Allied Forces on D-Day morning...

This mini expansion adds of lot of exciting content to D-Day Dice, including Gold dice, strange adventures, and
6 Legendary Units with a twist. Each led by a unique Captain, these Units have access to a brand-new feature, the “Crewmembers”, a pool of Specialists with specific talents.
Joined by their special red-shirted Servicemen, these brave explorers face many dangers as they risk their lives to fulfill secret missions. Will their exploits help the Allies win the day, or will their presence on the battlefield attract unwanted attention?

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Matching, Multiple Maps, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: D-Day Dice: Landships
description:
This mini expansion for D-Day Dice 1st and 2nd Edition and the upcoming D-Day Dice: Pacific is inspired by Word Forge Games' solo game Landship, by Scott Czysz.

It will test the limits of your dice management. Will you use your dice for precious resources or will you sacrifice them to activate your powerful Landship Crewmen?

Contains 1 Legendary Unit (Landshipmates), 2 War Stories (Tanks a Lot & Assemble the Crew), 4 Landship Crewmates (a card type exclusive to this expansion), 1 Vehicle (Tankette) and 1 rulecard.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Four Forests
description:
In Four Forests, players each take on the role of one of the Guardians of the Enchanted Forests. Prepare your forest for the arrival of various mythical creatures by planting vegetation that has specific appeal to each creature. Ensure that the creatures attracted to your forests are considered the most prestigious by secretly casting votes.

In more detail, Four Forests is played across four rounds. Each round, each player draws four plant cards, then takes four actions simultaneously:

• Cultivate: Place one plant card from your hand into your habitat.
• Harvest/Burn: Place one plant card from your hand face down next to one of the four creatures in play to upvote or downvote their appeal.
• Pollinate: Pass a plant card to the player on your left, while receiving one from the player on your right.
• Prune: Discard a plant card from your hand.

Your hand size increases by one plant card each round, and at the end of four rounds, you score cards in your hand and habitat. Reveal the cards in front of each creature to determine its prestige; if a vote card was played upside down, it counts as a downvote, lowering the value.

Score points for each plant card in your habitat and hand based on which creatures they appeal to. Whoever has the most points wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Napoleon's End
description:
Napoleon's End presents four battles on the Seine, February-March 1814.

BATTLES SIMULATED
The first of the four battles occurred on the 17th and 18th of February: Mormant took place 3 days after the Battle of Vauchamps, covered in "La Patrie en Danger." The last two battles were fought in late-March: Arcis followed 8 days after Reims, from "Napoleon Retreats." With all three games you can contemplate a 12-battle Grand Campaign.

Here you have a series-first, a 40" map (which extends La Patrie East map with the potential for a 9' long map). The Mormant and Montereau maps combine to make one 44 x 34" map. The Arcis map is square-on with Arcis dead center and the Aube dividing the map in half. All four quadrants have troops moving through. Arcis was perhaps the Emperor's worst-planned mistake.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Movement Points, Zone of Control

name: Stoicheion: Elemental Clash
description:
“Stoicheion” is an old Greek word that meant “the most basic part of something.” Most notably, it was used to describe the classical elements and the mysterious spirits made from them.
Here, you ARE a Stoicheion: a fluid being formed from different elemental energies. While prowling about some unknown part of the world, you and your companions discover a mana pool, a well of that same energy that gives you strength and vitality. So naturally, you fight over it.

The game lasts for 6 rounds. Players start each round by refilling their hand (tableau) with elemental cards from a shared deck. A shared resource pool called the mana pool is also filled. Players are randomly assigned to spaces along a board called the Leyline. Their position shows their current "Element." The adjacent elements on the Leyline determine which card effects they can use.

Players take turns completing 3 actions to move, acquire cards, and use effects. The last rounds provide boosted versions of the 3 actions. Each of the 9 Elements has a unique effect and point distribution.

After the final round, players will count points from cards in their hand that match their element on the Leyline. Highest point total wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Resource to Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Moonlight Brewers Triple Fermentation
description:
Synopsis:
Every night, a dark veil envelops the forest of Loupblonc. The echoes of terrifying roars, war chants, and the clinking of beer glasses resonate and mingle with the rustling of the trees. At the heart of this nocturnal theater, where only the brave dare venture, stands the sanctuary of the Monks of Loupblonc. Guided by ancient devotion and an insatiable thirst, these secluded heroes dedicate themselves body and soul to their ultimate quest: to brew the most enchanting elixir the world has ever known, beer. Their secret? Werewolf blood, a rather uncooperative ingredient to be honest...

In Moonlight Brewers, you take on the role of Trappist monks competing to create the supreme beer. But this challenge can only be met on a full moon night, when the werewolf animals are out. Both predators and prey, these creatures represent a real danger, but also a vital component for the concoction of the much-coveted brew.

To brave the night and concoct this exceptional beer, you will need to develop breathtaking strategies, while counting on a bit of luck.

Gameplay:
Following the first edition of this game released during the first french lockdown (covid), we have chosen to keep only the basic concept, while completely rethinking the gameplay to offer a more strategic, more dynamic, and above all, more entertaining experience.

In turn, each player can perform one of the five available actions: move, gather ingredients, equip, hunt werewolves, or attack other monks. Actions can be carried out simply to obtain lower quality resources or more diligently for better benefits. However, being diligent generates noise and requires rolling a die. Our cunning monks can influence the outcome of their dice by consuming beer, at the risk of becoming clumsier and noisier.

Noise attracts the various werewolves, who will not hesitate to attack you fiercely.

Campaign:
Moonlight Brewers Triple Fermentation also includes a campaign of 14 scenarios (10-12H of gameplay) that will take you from moon to moon in search of the title of the best brewer of the year. Inspired by the live-action role-playing games of the Yucca Company, this adventure promises twists and surprises.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Concilium Urbis
description:
In the future the engine that drives the economy is the operation of mines and it is Crystalon Celestia which is the most valuable mineral, thanks to its immense potential energy. The six great kingdoms of Infiniton have colonised Celestia Quasaris, an uninhabited planet where large quantities of this precious resource have been detected. Each kingdom erects its own mining city to extract and exploit the mineral. The rulers of each kingdom meet annually in the Concilium to define the rules that govern the new planet.

GAME IDEA

Concilium is a citybuilding game in wich there are scoring cards called Law cards. All tiles in your city will get points at the end of the game as shown by the law cards. During the game you can change this score using the voting procedure.

Within the Laws deck, for each Law, there is a card which increases the score ratio for the card and another that decreases the score ratio. Despite two cards being removed from the deck at the beginning of the game, it is important you manage this information to make your votes count.

The most phases of the game are simultaneous, which gives it dynamism and agility.

Game Round

Concilium is played over a total of 7 rounds. Each round contains 4 phases.

1 REVEAL TWO LAW CARDS

2 CONSTRUCTION

Draw four tiles from the bag.
Divide them into two groups of two tiles and pass them to the player on your left or right, according to what the card on top of the Laws deck indicates.
Choose one of the groups of two tiles you have received and build them in your city along with the two tiles returned to you.

3 PRODUCTION
Each of your Factories convert a Mineral from your Mines to Energy, if available.
Put one of your discs on a Civilisation card of your choice, returning 6 Energy from your Factories to the supply.

4 VOTING

Collect one vote for each Tower tile and two for your Concilium tile.
Carry out the voting for each Law card, one by one. In the event of a tie, the Law is rejected.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up, Voting

name: Expresso
description:
Step into the fast-paced world of coffee culture with Expresso, a thrilling card game for 2-5 players where speed and strategy brew the perfect blend of excitement. In Expresso, players race against each other to fulfill coffee orders and become the ultimate barista.

Set in a bustling café, players take on the role of skilled baristas, vying to complete orders before their opponents. Each turn, players have 2 options, Play a Card OR Guess a Card. Every card you play gives out information about your hand, allowing other players to deduce and steal cards from your hand. Play cards strategically and carefully because only the most efficient and cunning barista will claim victory.

Expresso features a unique blend of card mechanics, including hand management, set collection, and a dash of luck. With a variety of ingredients each sporting their own unique rules, this game is a fast, fun, and fresh experience.

Are you ready to take on the challenge and race to caffeinated glory in Expresso?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Deduction, Hand Management, Memory, Multi-Use Cards

name: La Fallera Calavera 4
description: Expansion for the La Fallera Calavera games, with 30 new cards ready to play. Just add the cards to any La Fallera Calavera game and play. Only available during 2024 for the 10th anniversary of the first game.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Stem & Branch
description:
Lovingly inspired by the heavenly stems & earthly branches of the Chinese zodiac: in Stem & Branch, you’ll race to build your tableau of zodiac animals, helping them to ascend through the two 60-year cycles, which the deck perfectly matches.

Summary

Summon animals to improve your tableau & ascend to collect elemental stems to master each element. This is done by drafting cards from a shared display and playing cards from your hand into your personal tableau. Card costs are relative to their levels and element type, with costs being paid by discarding matching element cards or animals of the same type. Costs are also supported by all of the animals in your personal tableau of the matching element types. There can be only one of each animal type in all players tableaus, so plan carefully to time your ascensions when playing older animals to remove your opponents younger ones.

The game takes place over two rounds which represent the moon and sun cycles. Once the draw deck runs out the 1st time, the moon cycle completes, triggering a short scoring event. Afterwards, all cards are shuffled for the 2nd round, or sun cycle. The game ends once the deck empties a 2nd time, which triggers final scoring.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting

name: Dwarves: Reclaim Your Kingdom
description:
Dwarves: Reclaim a Kingdom is a cooperative board game for 1-6 players where each player assumes the role of a Dwarven noble who leads a group of workers and warriors to reclaim their lost kingdom and defeat the enemies who seek to claim it as their own!

Throughout the game you’ll travel around your city, search ruins to uncover long lost buildings, train new and advanced workers and root out the enemy who lurks in your city!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – That's Good Business Squad Pack
description:
A legendary pirate and his band of outlaws join Star Wars: Shatterpoint in this new Squad Pack! Hondo Ohnaka is the charming and quixotic leader of the Ohnaka Gang, and this pack adds him to the game as a new Primary Unit in the Clone Wars era. He is joined by his second-in-command Gwarm as a Secondary Unit and a pair of Weequay Pirates as a Supporting Unit to help him carrying out his schemes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Overflight!
description:
Overflight! is a solitaire aerial reconnaissance wargame about the CIA’s TOP SECRET U-2 spy plane. It is set in the Cold War from 1956 to 1960. This is the second book of the Special Mission Series from Historic Wings, a publisher whose mission is to publish aviation games that are true to history. Not only will you learn about the CIA's covert air force and the U-2, you will have the chance to see how you would have fared had you been in charge.

The importance of the U-2 program to the US and Allied intelligence communities cannot be overstated. U-2 overflights provided 90% of all intelligence regarding the Soviet military during one of the most critical periods of the Cold War. The program was indispensable to US national security.

Amazon Link: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0D1QKXK74/?tag=article-boardgameg...
Blue Panther: https://www.bluepantherllc.com/products/overflight

In the game, you play both in the role of the CIA’s U-2 Program Director -- historically, Richard Bissell -- and, when you fly missions, you take on the role of the pilots themselves as you navigate over Soviet-controlled territory to photograph your targets and, if all goes well, return safely. All of the pilots in your CIA Pilot Roster are recruited from the US Air Force and “sheep-dipped” – thus, they’re “officially civilians”. Two other pilots are drawn from the ranks of the Royal Air Force (RAF), just as in history.

In 1956, your missions will seem easy. The Soviets have little chance of intercepting your U-2s as they soar beyond the reach of even the highest-flying Soviet interceptors. However, with each passing year, the Soviets will deploy newer, better aircraft like the MiG-21 and Su-9. Ultimately, you will face SA-2 “Guideline” Surface to Air Missiles (SAMs), the very missile that shot down Francis Gary Powers on his U-2 flight on May 1, 1960, an event that ended CIA’s overflights of the Soviet Union.

Among your assignments will be photographing important targets, such as Tyuratam, where the Soviets tested Intercontinental Ballistic Missiles (ICBMs) and the facilities at Aralsk-7, a secret Soviet biological weapons research site, and more.

Be prepared to sweat out your missions -- will you succeed or will one of your pilots die trying?

The game was developed from declassified TOP SECRET and SECRET documents sourced from the CIA. It is a narrative-style game with extensive decision-making and features a mid-sized tabletop footprint and easy-to-learn rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Dice, Political, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Star Wars: Legion – Republic Clone Commandos
description:
The Galactic Republic's elite Clone Commandos enter Star Wars: Legion in this pack! As the preeminent soldiers of the Grand Army of the Republic, Clone Commandos are deployed to the most dangerous missions and this pack adds a unit of four Clone Commandos to players' collections. Two unit cards allow these miniatures to be deployed as either a standard Support Unit or as the renowed Delta Squad. Additionally, two upgrade cards make the Clone Commandos even more hearty with their signature Katarn Pattern Armor and give them even more tactical flexibility with two configurations for their DC-17m ICWS Blaster Carbines.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Red Partisans: The War Behind Army Group Center, 1941-44
description:
Red Partisans (RP) is a two-player simulation of the brutal fighting that took place behind Army Group Center on the eastern front in 1942-44. The Partisan player, representing the Central Staff of the Partisan Movement, must destroy as many targets as possible, interdict the Axis armies’ lines of supply and control as much terrain as possible. The Axis player must keep open his side’s lines of communication, destroy as many Partisan units as possible and capture forced laborers for the German economy.

Each hexagon on the map represents 20 miles (32.4 km) from side to opposite side. The units of maneuver are Partisan “detachments” (company equivalents) and brigades. Axis units of maneuver vary in size from whole divisions down to
battalions. Each full turn represents two to three months, based on seasonality.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: NEON HOPE
description:
Will the tech giants take over?
Or is there still hope for a glitched utopia?

In NEON HOPE, you have the chance to fight back against cyberpunk’s grim vision of the future. Dystopia seems inevitable, but the worst is yet to come. You can still change the world for the better – do not lose hope!

This cooperative game takes interactive storytelling to the next level, where your multi-layered decisions will shape a branching narrative.

NEON HOPE brings together strategic card play and captivating storytelling in a unique European science-fiction setting.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Events, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: At the Wedding Table
description:
A 2-player, 18-cards game about sitting guests at your own wedding.

Players take turns to place one of the three available double-sided guest cards in a shared tableau, with each guest having their own preferences regarding their neighbors. The game ends after the table is full. The winner is the player whose guests scored more points total (whose guests had more fun at the wedding)!

Solo mode with beat your own score type included.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Electro & Sandman & Shocker & Vulture
description:
Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Electro & Sandman & Shocker & Vulture features a sinister line-up of some of Spider-Man's most noteworthy foes.

Electro, Sandman, Vulture, and Shocker give players even more options when building their Spider-Foes and Criminal Syndicate squads. Supplementing these characters are Sandman's two Sand Constructs that act as Grunts on the battlefield. In addition to miniatures and Stat Cards for each character, players will also find 6 Team Tactic cards that give them even more ways to accomplish their nefarious schemes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: I C E: Edifices & Guilds
description:
This is the first expansion of I C E. We introduce the game-changing variants of Edifices (soft legacy), the additional Guild Favor abilities, two more Guild player boards (Alchemists and Enlightened), and more!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Legacy Game, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Gangs of the Undercity
description:
Gangs of the Undercity is a 28mm miniatures skirmish game, set in a dystopian future-fantasy universe, where players fight for dominance of their turf in the sprawl of Neo-Babylon. Features detailed, wondrous miniatures and various modes of play. 2 or more players can battle in a traditional wargame format, can join together in co-op mode, or enter the story of GotU in the campaign scenarios.

Magical powers and wondrous creatures have existed alongside the mundane since before recorded time. As the tide of progress turned, magic began to lose its unique dominance as new and oppressive technologies emerged. Now, in a world similar to our own, magic and technology compete to hold the world hostage; the powerful using them to create empires of wealth and dominance. Resistance, while it may be insane, is the only sane response left in this dark world.

—description from the designer

There is a free version of the rules available here!
https://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/351221/Gangs-of-the-Und...
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Paw Wars
description:
There is something that cats love more than their toys, and that is ... the toys of others!!!!

In Paw Wars we will have to roll the dice to be able to steal toys from the center of the table and claim them as ours, be careful with the little paws, because if they come out, the others will be able to steal toys directly from our warehouse, only the fastest ones will be able to keep the most toys and be crowned as the king of the cats.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Speed Matching

name: Die Drei Kolosse
description:
Die Drei Kolosse ("The Three Colossi") is an immersive puzzle game with exciting audio plays and themed puzzles. You open mysterious envelopes with puzzle items that look like they're from a real escape room. In between, you read dialogues in distributed roles and make important decisions.

Story: A solitary village. Three colossal statues. A terrifying monster. On behalf of the mayor of Bad Wahrfels, five experienced professors travel to a tiny village at the foot of the "Three Colossi" - three gigantic stone statues of 16th century lords, carved into the rock faces of three mountains. It is said that one of them turns into a monster at night. Together, our protagonists want to put a stop to the monster using the logical and well-founded methods of science. After all, monsters don't exist. Right?

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die Drei Kolosse ist ein immersives Rätselspiel mit spannenden Hörspielen und thematischen Rätseln. Ihr öffnet mysteriöse Umschläge mit Rätselgegenständen, die wirken, als wären sie aus einem echten EscapeRoom. Zwischendurch lest ihr Dialoge in verteilten Rollen und trefft wegweisende Entscheidungen.

Story: Ein abgelegenes Dorf. Drei kolossale Statuen. Ein furchterregendes Monster. Im Auftrag des Bürgermeisters von Bad Wahrfels begeben sich fünf erfahrene Professor:innen in ein winziges Dorf am Fuße der “Drei Kolosse” - drei gigantische Steinstatuen von Fürsten aus dem 16. Jahrhundert, gehauen in die Felswände dreier Berge. Man erzählt sich, dass sich eine von ihnen des Nachts in ein Monster verwandeln soll. Gemeinsam wollen unsere Protagonist:innen dem Ungetüm mit den logischen und fundierten Methoden der Wissenschaft Einhalt gebieten. Monster gibt es schließlich nicht. Oder?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: The Search for the Lost Dutchman′s Gold Mine
description:
As described by Dr. Scott Simmerman, the publisher:

Lost Dutchman is a well-designed team building game that focuses on collaboration, leadership and engagement. It is designed to be facilitated by a trainer or consultant interested in generating discussions about the organizational culture and framed around desired outcomes. It comes with extensive debriefing ideas. It is a business simulation but useful for schools and other organizations looking to improve collaboration.

It is normally played with 5 / 6 people on a team, with 3 to a 100+ teams. It can play with as few as 6 people but the design works much better with 12 or more. It is proven to scale up really well for large group events of 150 to 250 or more people.

Dutchman is designed for large team building / strategic planning events but works well for small group classroom training situations. We sell versions for different size groups.

The Design:

The challenge is to collaborate, rather than to compete, and to share resources and do sufficient planning to optimize overall results. The reality is that teams often choose to compete, thus making choices that sub-optimize results.

Components include a colorful map, a Grub Stake of resource cards, planning tools, job aids and other information about the game and the goals. Putting on cowboy hats and bandannas, the group settles in to briefly hear the history of the Lost Dutchman's Mine and to learn the mechanics of the challenge.

The team is given 20 days of 2 minutes each to manage their journey to the mine and back home to Apache Junction. They can choose from 3 paths with different risks, planning for weather changes and focusing on the optimal use of resources. Teams are given the opportunity to gain additional information valuable to their journey's success but must decide if they are willing to delay their start by one or two days in order to obtain this information. After being given the introductory information, the team has 15 minutes to plan. They must work together to make decisions about tactics, resource management, direction and risk.

The 20 days of play (roughly 35 minutes) begin and are marked by lots of lively interaction among players and teams in the spirit of collaboration and competition. During this time, they'll discover the impact of their early decisions on their results. They can choose to get advice or collaborate with others.

The goal is to get to the mine, mine as much gold as WE can, and return to Apache Junction. All teams are successful, but the ones that plan and collaborate will optimize their results. Debriefing can focus on collaboration, planning, leadership, motivation, optimization of organizational performance results and many other themes.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting

name: Water Polo: Light edition
description:
The game represent a realistic simulation of water polo. The game lasts 4 x 10 minutes, but it can also be played for a certain number of goals.

In each turn the player who attacks rolls three dice and moves three pieces and the ball. The player who is defending rolls two dice. The attack is limited to five turns.

Content:
Box 24 x 24 x 4 cm (9,5 x 9,5 x 1,5 in); Board 47 x 47 cm (18,5 x 18,5 in); 2 cardboard goals; 15 pieces; 2 markers, 5 dice; score counter and rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Movement Points, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: SHASN: AZADI
description:
SHASN: AZADI is a semi-cooperative political strategy board game where players play as revolutionaries, trying to free their country from the grips of a tyrannical imperial power. If they succeed, only one will emerge as the leader of the new nation.

Each player must work with their compatriots to topple the Imperials and gain freedom for their nation. But every time a player takes a turn, the Crown will march forward and the Imperials will take a turn, launching devastating attacks against the revolution.

Players can combat the Imperials by resolving Azadi Cards. From Jallianwala Bagh to the battle of Yorktown, each Azadi Card is a unique event from history.

Each Azadi Card has two sides, presenting players with two divergent paths of resistance. Will players take the path of peace and sit on a hunger strike, or will they take up arms and assassinate their oppressors? Each choice in an Azadi Card belongs to a certain Ideologue. Players must choose their path wisely, for their choice will unlock a new zone, and a Resistance Card belonging to that Ideologue, strengthening that Ideologue for the rest of the game.

For every action you complete on an AZADI Card, you will gain legacy. Spend your legacy to erect Monuments to your sacrifice and earn new powers once your nation gains Azadi. If players resolve the number of Azadi Cards required by their difficulty, and a final Foundation Card before time runs out - Azadi will be theirs.

But the new sovereign nation will need a leader. Players must compete in the first democratic elections of their country to see who will be declared winner.

What will you stand for? And what will freedom cost?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Political, Territory Building
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Events, Map Addition, Market, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Cats' Warfare
description:
You are a Ruthless Politician trying to win the elections. Move the Públic Opinion on your will, accuse your opponents, be a turncoat.... and maybe look for the social breakdown!

Nine cards are displayed in a row, and a public opinion card moves under them. Each player have one secret role indicating one or more cards of the row. All players keep playing cards, at the same time, one card each time but altogether, until the public opinion card reaches one of the cards in the extremes or you have played 10 cards each. Once it's the end, if you have the card depicting the one above the public opinion, you are the winner!!

Eres un político despiadado intentando ganar las elecciones. Mueve la Opinión Pública a tu antojo, acusa a tus oponentes, sé un chaquetero,.... y quizás busca la rotura social!

Se ponen nueve cartas en línea, y una carta de opinión pública debajo de ellas. Los jugadores juegan cartas, de una en una pero a la vez, hasta que la cata de opinión pública alcanza uno de los extremos o se han jugado diez cartas por jugador. Al finalizar, si tienes la carta indicando la que esta debajo de la opinión pública eres el ganador!

https://www.cawagirona.com/general/cats-warfare/

Lo podeis encontrar a
https://vialudica.com/shop/product/alt-cw-cats-warfare-12317
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: World in Flames Collector's Edition Super Deluxe
description:
It is the dawn of September 1939, and the dark clouds of war hover over the globe. China and Japan have already been at war for more than 2 years and now a Continental war is about to become a worldwide war, a World in Flames.

You, as leader of your nation, must guide your country through its darkest days, enhancing your economy, working with allies, building the units you need and then employing them effectively to defeat your manifold foes.

You are in charge of your country from 1939 until 1945 or until you conquer or fall. How you use your assets is up to you. Each country has its own special abilities and capabilities based on your country's skills aptitude and leadership. And of course there is the all important field of diplomacy where how you negotiate the minefield of international relations can be the difference between victory and defeat.

Only one player can win, but you have to be on the winning side to be that player. So you want to help your allies JUST enough so your side wins but not so much that it is not you that gains all the glory you clearly deserve. Give my chums all support short of help is my war-winning strategy.

World in Flames shows the entire world and will be the world's biggest boardgame. That's right, for the first time ever all maps and displays will be hard-mounted boards with bound edges.

Furthermore all the counters are now die-cut not knife cut so no more flash and no more wrestling with the cardboard stem before it gives up its precious offspring counters. The game is sumptuous, with some of the most beautiful counters ever printed. Each one lovingly hand-crafted and individually assessed and valued. The overall look of the game and counters is a work of art.

World in Flames can be played from 2 to 6 players (and can easily be played solitaire too). There are 20 campaigns you can play, from the hour long Victory in The West campaign to the 150 hour Global War mega campaign. World in Flames is the ultimate gaming challenge.

The World in Flames Collector's edition Super Deluxe Games' Set consists of the:

World in Flames Collector’s Edition Deluxe game (CS 1-9, 18-22, 24 & 46-55)
America in Flames game (CS 26-28);
Days of Decision III game (2 x CS 13 & 3 x CS17);
Patton in Flames game (CS 31-35);
Africa map (full-colour 514 x 534 mm paper map);
Scandinavian map (full-colour hard-mounted 504 x 210 mm map);
Khaki in Flames kit (CS 40-45), (only required for America in Flames and Patton in Flames, all World in Flames Collector's edition Commonwealth counters are now in Khaki);
Free 2 year licence to download the World in Flames Collector's edition (Virtual) companion (which includes high quality images of all the counters, maps and rules graphics and text as well as all the technical data and production specs on all the combat aircraft and naval units of world war II), available now
most recent 2 Annuals ~ currently Millenium WiF Annual (incl. CS 30, Politics in Flames) & 2008 WiF Annual (incl. CS 39, Factories in Flames);


for a total of 2 magazines, 4 games, 7 expansions, 1 virtual companion, 15 maps and 9240 counters (and a couple of pages of rules:)!

GAME RATING
Scope: Global Strategic
Complexity: Scenarios - Moderate, Campaigns - High
Solitaire: Highly Suitable
Players: Up to 6
Ages: 12 to Adult

(from ADG website)


List of all modules:

World in Flames Classic
Africa Aflame
Asia Aflame
Planes in Flames
Ships in Flames
Mech in Flames
America in Flames
Days of Decision III
Patton in Flames
Scandinavian map
Khaki in Flames
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Mythos: Vengeance of Ognyan
description:
Mythos: Vengeance of Ognyan is a combat-driven and strategy dependent RPG board game. It follows the steps of three heroes, who set out to slay a legendary Zmey, who has risen from the grave. Vengeance of Ognyan is a core-set and includes everything you need to play in a total of 4 game modes!

During the Vengeance of Ognyan campaign, players will be able to pick one of three available heroes to venture out alone or in a party with one goal: to slay Ognyan once and for all. Each character has their own mechanics and relations to the others. Every one of them has their own die, stats and skill trees. During turns, players will have a chance to move and then initiate combat, but dice will determine the success of their announced actions. Positioning also plays a large part of strategizing your way to victory: while standing next to specific characters, you gain different buffs or debuffs.

During the Campaign players will follow open-ended quest-lines, which can lead them through different routes to victory or failure. Each quest is tied to a location and a setup. Every location has its own rule set. You place your heroes, arrange the enemies and proceed with combat until you achieve victory. That can mean different things, depending on your current quest goal - like slaying all enemies or surviving an onslaught for a given number of turns. During a campaign run, players will have to complete numerous encounters, cleanse dungeons and participate in many events before the party reaches Ognyan’s Lair. You can also invite a more experienced fourth player to join you and act as your guide through the world of Mythos, but if you do – their word becomes the law of the game, as long as it’s fun for everyone!

With every battle, the heroes grow stronger through a leveling system. If a player can bank enough experience tokens, their hero can level up. The player will have to choose one of two available skill options and with each choice their hero will become a unique result of their play through. But watch out – enemies gain levels proportionally to the party as well!

After you've mastered the game's rules and mechanics, you can try one of the other game modes present: Ognyan Unleashed, RNG Challenges and Player versus Player Combat are there for more experienced adventurers or those, who are looking for a fast battle without context. Better yet - now that you have these tools at your disposal, you can design your very own epic adventures and share them with the Ognyan Slayers community for a chance to win awesome rewards!

The World of Mythos awaits you. It's time you rise and put an end to Ognyan's tyrannical reign once and for all!

You can have a look at the Mythos: Vengeance of Ognyan public rule book here: http://1am.studio/Mythos-Vengeance_of_Ognyan_DigitalRulebook...


The Vengeance of Ognyan core-set is the based on the "Mythos" franchise by 1AM Studios, which is inspired by ancient Slavic mythology.


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Sally Face: Strange Nightmares
description:
Bring the world of Sally Face to the tabletop with Sally Face: Strange Nightmares. Strange occurrences are happening at Addison Apartments. Explore the apartments as Sal and his friends, and work together to investigate the surrounding mysteries.

Play through different episodes with events and characters that echo the video game. Players must solve mysteries, stop cultists and prevent the Red Eyed Demon from spreading corruption while advancing through the story.

Players roll custom dice and use the results to perform a variety of actions to solve mysteries but if they dabble too much the powers of evil may become too strong to stop. Unsolved mysteries allow the Red Eyed Demon to spread corruption and the heroes may lose their lives or sanity. However, death and insanity aren’t the end. Heroes may persevere while mad or as ghosts. Such a fate brings the Red Eyed Demon ever closer to his goal of total domination. Players who complete the story face a climax which is a different challenge in each chapter.

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: RimRats
description:
"Only the strongest rat clan will reign!"
Follow the Prophet's call into the shadowy world of 'RimRats'!

Take control of a mutating rat clan! With clever deck building and strategic map control, guide your swarms. Only one clan will fulfill the prophecy and rule over all.

Join the battle for dominance!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction

name: ATS:  Road to Bataan – Mabatang line 1941
description:
From the Critical Hit webpage:

Welcome to the ATS ON THE ROAD TO BATAAN, a historical module that depicts the fierce fighting for the Abucay/Mabatang Line from 11-15 January, 1942. Situated on the on the Bataan Peninsula, this position ran through Mauban on the coast of Manila Bay (east side) to Mabatang on the coast of the South China sea. ATS ON THE ROAD TO BATAAN contains eight scenarios, all playable on the historical map included. You also receive a Battlefield Walkaround booklet plus a special set of counters. You get two sheets of the Philippine Scouts Personnel, all the vehicles and guns needed, PLUS A COPY OF THE JAPANESE FULL ATS SHEET ... all the combat counters you need to play! Just bring markers, ATS Rulebook and play aids.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: #demidancer
description:
The game "#demidancer" is like the Dance Class Dash, which girls in dance class relate to, but plays as a super-fast dexterity and sequencing card game for two.

A 2-player dance themed card game of speed, coordination and anticipation. Place the right dance gear article on top of the next and be first to play out all your cards to win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Speed Matching

name: Paupers' Ladder: This Cobbled Isle
description:
“Along with the hustle and bustle of my home, I finally realise the greatest adventures to be had were here beneath my feet all along.”

This Cobbled Isle adds a City Region deck to Paupers’ Ladder and The Moon Towers, so now you can explore Brighthelm’s colourful streets. Then there’s The Cutty Wren, a merchant ship that sails the coast buying and selling exotic wares.

There are also Dice Dens, Special Quests, more Birds, Curses and Talents, and 2 new game modes:

THE TIMELY PAUPER
Play a shorter game for fewer Virtues.

WE, THE COLLECTIVE
A co-operative game. Can you learn your Virtues together before Brighthelm falls?
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Delvers of Eldrisar
description:
Delvers of Eldrisar is a deckbuilding game focused on providing a deep strategic experience immersed in beautiful art while maintaining fast-paced and intuitive gameplay.

In Delvers of Eldrisar you take on the role of an ambitious warlock, kept alive long beyond your natural life by the power of your Essence Relics. Your goal is to conquer all of Eldrisar, but to do so you must eliminate any and all potential adversaries.

Each player starts the game with a small deck of 10 cards, representing their current resources in Eldrisar. Players take turns, utilizing their Minions, Treasures and Incantations to build their decks and attack their opponent. The first player to capture all of their opponent’s Essence Relics is the winner!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Nocturnes
description:
You have all agreed to be research subjects for studies on sleep and dreams. The researchers are primarily interested in psychological responses to terror and have invited you to participate in an overnight experiment. However, as the game progresses things spiral out of control.

You all have a preset number of starting sanity points kept in front of you. You begin the game on the starting tile which will expand to create the game board. The game proceeds with players laying down tiles and moving from one tile to the next. Most of the tiles contain nightmares that slowly remove sanity points from the players who land on them. A few tiles do not initially remove sanity and you must strategize to take advantage of those.

You also have action cards to impact player sanity, impacting the tiles or the other players. Cleverly combining tiles and action cards can do a lot of damage. All players lose sanity, and once a player reaches zero sanity they are out of the game. The person who keeps at least one sanity the longest wakes up with sanity intact, winning the game.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Blood & Plunder: Raise the Black
description:
This is all you need to start playing Blood & Plunder. Raise the Black will bring the Blood & Plunder universe to the 18th century and will include all new plastic kits and ships that will be fully customizable. The starter kit will be centered around the infamous encounter of Blackbeard Vs. Maynard. Everything needed to play will be included in the player 2 starter set, 2 forces , 2 legendary captains , dice, tokens, activation deck, movement templates, 2 sided player mat and more!

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Turn Order: Random

name: Close Quarter Battle: Miniature Combat Field Manual
description:
Close Quarter Battle (CQB) is a fast-paced miniatures game that follows the action of small Fireteams against enemy insurgents. Strike squads are made up of highly trained operatives who are sent on clandestine missions to disrupt the enemy.

Games are played between two opposing players. One player controls the insurgents and the other controls the operatives. Players are encouraged to play through each campaign as one side and then switch sides to play the campaign again. A campaign of CQB tells a story as it follows the operatives from mission to mission.

The Rules
Quick-to-learn rules, presented as core rules and advanced rules, ensure you will get your models onto the battlefield as quickly as possible. Core rules are easily remembered while advanced rules can be referred to as needed.

The presentation of the Close Quarter Battle – War on Drugs rulebook focuses on the Drug Wars, but you can easily adapt these rules to any modern conflict.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Bumblings: the funtasy card game
description:
Bumblings: the funtasy card game is an entertaining card game featuring comic fantasy creatures, funny names, great illustrations and and a lot of unexpected events during the exciting battles.

This is a 2-4 player duelling game that's played by using the player's own deck. This deck can be a Starter deck, which is ready to play with, or players can build their own deck from Bumblings cards. There are Common (C), Uncommon (UC) and Rare cards (R) by their rarity. Cards in Starter decks have a special rarity (STARTER), they cannot be found in other boosters.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: One Page Skirmish
description: One Page Skirmish is a single-paged ruleset designed to be played with just a handful of miniatures. With simple combat mechanics and a dynamic campaign, the game serves as a great way to explore the world of Warhammer Fantasy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: NAVY: Academy
description:
Use cunning tactics and long-term strategies to defeat the enemy!
Naval Academy (aka Epic Naval Battles) invites 2 players to replay epic historical naval engagements of World War 2.

Through a series of scenarios, arranged to form campaigns, you can recreate some of the most famous battles of the Atlantic and Pacific theatres.

The basic game mechanics are focused around creating a sandbox, so that players can design their own campaigns and battles, trying to answer the eternal "what if?" questions about historical events.

The game consists of:
- a modular board depicting varied terrain (with open seas, islands, and coastlines included)
- two sets of detailed and functional fleet vessels and markers
- several decks of cards with rule explanations, in-game events, and special commands, used in different scenarios outlined in the rulebook
- the rulebook, which includes ready-to-play scenarios and sandbox rules for creating your own naval engagements.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: A Death in the Red Light
description:
Amsterdam, 1988. The Red Light District is a hive of sex and drugs. You take the role of a Police Detective. A dead body has turned up on the streets. You must examine the clues, follow the leads and solve the puzzles in order to uncover the truth of what happened in this real historical case.

In a combination choose-your-adventure and puzzle game, there are multiple paths you can take to solving the mystery. Play alone or with friends. The game can be played online or printed out at home.

The Noir graphic style and jazz soundtrack work together to immerse you in the grimy police work of the Red Light District.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Targeted Clues

name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Shadow of Venjix Theme Pack
description:
Venjix is here! This sentient virus, and his lieutenant Tenaya 7, laid waste to Corinth before his eventual defeat… or so we thought. For a time he lay dormant, before rising once more as Evox, a powerful Avatar entity who threatened the world of the Beast Morphers Rangers — including newcomers Nate Silva and Steel!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: TSWW: Barbarossa
description:
From Diffraction Entertainment:
."The world will hold its breath" claimed der Fuhrer as German and Axis troops crossed the borders of the Soviet Union. Barbarossa is the TSWW game covering the entire Eastern Front from June 22nd, 1941 until June 30th, 1943.

From the back of the box:

Fully researched game modules covering the war-changing campaign(s) in the USSR from June 1941 through June 1943
20 state-of-the-art maps covering east-central Europe from Poland to beyond the Ural Mountains.
7840 world-class die-cut counters covering Axis, Soviet, and Western Allied forces.
Extensive rules and charts included in this game, thus continuing the TSWW Game Series covering World War II in its savage entirety.
Two D10 Dice.


Scenario and Campaign list:
In addition to the entire campaign, the following scenarios and campaigns are included in the game:


Learning Scenarios:
Target Berlin.
Stuka.
Panzers Los!
The Battle of the Barents Sea.




Crimea Scenarios (Discovery Group):
The 'Neck' Taken.
The Crimea Invaded.
The First Assault on Sevastopol.
The Soviet Amphibious Attack.
Trappenjägd.
The Final Assault on Sevastopol.




From the Danube to the Don.
The Crimean Campaign.
Kalinin--The Northern Gateway to Moscow.
Operation Mars.
Operation Uranus.
November II 1942.
Northern Finland 1941-1942.
Fall Blau: The 1942 Campaign.
Rommel Goes East.
Hitler Goes East.
Barbarossa Extreme.
The Beginning of the End.
Enemies of the Blood Royal.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: The Runelords Board Game
description:
The Runelords Board Game is a hybrid tabletop gaming experience for one to four players based in the world of the best-selling fantasy series by legendary author, David Farland.

Players first choose from four dynamic runelords, each with their own reinforcement cards that have a physical presence on the battlefield (standees) and support cards with additional spells and abilities that are drawn and played from a hand during battle.

Reinforcements are sent into hex-based combat where players will enjoy simple but robust tactical engagement with win conditions based on the game mode chosen from the Battle Compendium before play.

What makes this game so unique is Sovereignty! Sovereignty is a stage of play where players take the pre-built armies of their selected runelords and mash them into a deckbuilding, resource management engine. Then, after several rounds of play, players will take the armies they've built onto the battlefield for a unique, more strategic gaming experience!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chaining, Closed Drafting, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Open Drafting, Storytelling

name: Vilar de Mouros 2018
description:
Vilar de Mouros 2018 is an expansion for Vilar de Mouros with 8 new cards (7 game cards and 1 bonus card) and a note pad to add the points.
Two of the new game cards (Pretenders and Peter Murphy) are upgrades, so we recommend that you play without the original ones.
If you want to keep them, we recommend that the 2 cards from the same band cannot be held by the same player at the end of the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Music
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: CoderMindz
description:
From the box:

It's the year 2045. An Artificial Neural Network has been created. Bo, Mo, Po, and Jo need to be trained. Once trained they can help recognize images.

But here's the twist - in a world full of bots, you are still the Master Mind. Train the bots with the Code Cards and help them infer the images. Pick one of the 4 set of images: robo-animals, neural dataset digits, robo-edibles, and robo-vehicles. There are 6 levels that teach Artificial Intelligence concepts on top of coding concepts.

The idea is easy - play a board game, train bots with code, and learn AI - all in a fun and exciting Neural Adventure!

...

CoderMindz is a card-based programming game for ages 6 and up. The goal is to use the cards you draw each turn to move your Bot across the grid on the board to get from your Start to your End. The cards use various types of coding commands, starting with Move and Zap, and building on that with Conditionals, Loops, and Functions.

Six different levels of game play move you from learning the cards (basic and advanced training) to using those cards to move about the gameboard and pick up items (image recognition) and finally to programming the Bot's entire journey at once and then "running" the program to see if you're successful or need to go back to debug. Along the way, you can Zap another Bot (in your line of sight) back to their Start. The first Bot to their End spot is the winner.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Obscure Battles 4: Sand and Flies – The Mesopotamian Campaign in WW1
description:
"Sand And Flies". Volume 4 in the Obscure Battles series, the series take the player to the Mesopotamia Campaign in WW1.

The Mesopotamian campaign was a campaign in the Middle Eastern theatre of World War I fought between the Allies represented by the British Empire, against the Central Powers, mostly Ottoman Empire and a few German units.

A more difficult place to fight would be hard to find. Flies attacked the troops, soldiers froze during the winter nights and were overcome by heat during the summer. Dust turned to mud when the banks of the Tigris overflowed during the rainy season.

A war no side wanted but compelled to fight, the affair was mostly a see-saw string of battles both against each other and the elements. Senior commanders from both died from cholera during the campaign!

The Battle of Kut and the subsequent Siege of Kut changed the campaign dramatically. The surrender of an entire division was a shock for the British Army. Massively reinforced, the British managed to take Baghdad 2 years later after some very bloody battles but never advanced further.

The game has


Over 100+ counters



Battalion to Corps HQ sized units



Aircraft, Gunboats, Armored Cars, Tribal and Line Infantry, Cavalry and riverine transport units



Motor Transport Mode: Motorization was used extensively in the later stages and rules allow for "motorized" infantry units to advance faster.



Seasonal flood dangers



"Maude's road" and "Blockship Attacks"



Out of Communication and Out of Supply rules that are very easy to track



Solo Play Algorithm that lets players design a grand strategy and then implement it tactically.


The game comes with a 22-page rulebook with charts and 2 scenarios that come with rules for exploitation and flank attacks, special conditions for being Out of Supply and Out of Communication. The complexity level is Simple ( with no optional rules to Semi-Complex ( with optional special rules )

The game introduces an "Order of The Day Marker" pull system to the OB mechanism that randomizes the fire and movement but simplifies the routine chores and allows much faster gameplay.

Players must collect and husband their precious RP points to mount and sustain offensives. Also - they can "purchase" Leaders to help their units.

Provided are large 0.8-inch counters at 256 DPI that can be scaled even more or down ( just apply the same scale adjustment to the map ). There is a 55 x 36-inch map formatted for home printers
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid, Turn Order: Random

name: Inventures
description:
Inventures, Birtle Game’s first title, is a collaborative storytelling adventure game coming soon to Kickstarter.

In each game, players create their own characters and go on challenging adventures together. Victory comes down to how well you know your character and fellow players.

In Inventures, there’re no dice, game master, or numbers to track. Instead, Inventures relies on a powerful and novel game mechanic involving symbol interpretation.

When your character faces a challenge, you choose between options, each composed of a randomly drawn ACTION and OBJECT card.

You secretly pick which option best represents how your character would solve the problem. If the other players successfully guess which option you chose, your action succeeds and the story progresses.

Because of its modular symbol interpretation system, you can use Inventures to play stories in any setting imaginable: Westerns, SciFi, Fantasy, or a game set in the world of your favorite books or movies!

Games can be as short as 45 minutes and as long as weeklong campaigns.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Negotiation, Role Playing, Voting

name: StegegetS
description:
StegegetS is a roll and write game set in space. Easy enough for the whole family to enjoy. All players use the same common, beautiful map-sheet for writing and creating a memorable score image.

Roll the 7 dice to get combinations that lets you land on the available planets, moons, and other objects in our solar system. Draw directly on the sheet to show where you go and what you score. When you landed somewhere it becomes your spot, no one else can score for that combination.
