In this thrilling miniatures skirmish game, will your gang become notorious gunslingers on a quest for glory or nameless corpses in a shallow grave? With every step, you'll encounter opportunities, but only the quick and the cunning will survive. Do you have what it takes to rise above the rest and build a legendary gang?

Immerse yourself in Bloodstone's open world, brought to life through your miniatures and scenery. Engage in heart-pounding shootouts, daring robberies, and high-stakes jailbreaks. With intuitive game mechanics designed to capture the tension and excitement of the Old West, Dead by Lead delivers Western skirmish in bold new ways.

What’s in the book:


A complete set of skirmish rules
Detailed character and gang creation
Ongoing campaign rules
Six gameplay scenarios


What do you need to play?


Six to twelve Western miniatures or figurines to represent your gang of characters.
One twelve-sided (d12) and several six-sided dice (d6) for each player.
A tape measure or ruler for measuring distances in inches.
A standard deck of playing cards.
Dead by Lead is best suited to a flat 3' x 3' playing area to represent the battlefield.
Various western terrain or model scenery (red dirt, train tracks, rivers, rocks, city buildings and crates) for visual and tactical interest.
A pencil and tokens to help you keep track of various game mechanics. We recommend using six-sided dice as counters, as several dice are easier to manage than a score of tokens.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mind Cycling
description:
The aim is to become the best "Mind Cycling Manager" by winning the most medals with your team: medals are awarded to the race winner (the cyclist who crosses the finish line first), the best sprinter (the cyclist who finishes the "sprint" section first), the best climber (the cyclist who finishes the "mountain pass" section first), and the best team (based on the places of the cyclists in each team in the final classification of the race).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Track Movement

name: Custer's Last Stand 150 Year Commemoration
description:
The Battle of the Little Bighorn, also called Custer’s Last Stand, marked the most decisive Native American victory and the worst U.S. Army defeat in the long Plains Indian Wars. Fought on June 25, 1876, near the Little Bighorn River in Montana Territory, federal troops led by Lieutenant Colonel George Armstrong Custer were attacked by a band of Lakota Sioux and Cheyenne warriors. This game is primarily a solitaire game with the player controlling the US 7th Cavalry.
If all Indian Leaders OR all 6 villager disks are eliminated, the game ends immediately and the 7th Cavalry are victorious. If either of these happen, the remaining Indians are assumed to surrender and agree to return to their reservation. Otherwise, the Indians have won.

A two-player variant is possible with the 2nd person controlling and rolling dice for the Indigenous American forces. Historically this battle was very lopsided, perhaps 600 Cavalry vs. 1,000s of braves. In the game the Cavalry will usually lose. When there are two players consider switching sides after the first game and compare results.

The game emphasizes theme and playability rather than strict historical recreation. Playing as the 7th Cavalry you won't know how many enemy units you will face.

-description from designer
categories: American Indian Wars, Dice, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Last Hundred Yards: Volume 5 – For King & Country
description:
The Last Hundred Yards Volume 5: For King & Country joins the Last Hundred Yards family as British and Canadian Forces retake western Europe from German occupation. The pack contains ten/twelve Missions that occurred in 1944 during the Normandy landings and breakout phases from June through August and Operation Market Garden in the Netherlands in September. Players must own The Last Hundred Yards Volumes 1 and 2 to play Volume 5.

By 1944, the Red Devils of the British 1st Airborne had a proud tradition of parachute and glider drops in North Africa and Crete. The men in distinctive red berets had gained a well-deserved reputation for courage and effectiveness as the “tip of the spear” to take key locations behind enemy lines and hold them for the attacking force as an efficient and effective fighting force. In For King & Country, you will take the experience gained from Airborne over Europe and extend it to these British elite forces for airborne missions into Arnhem as part of Operation Market Garden and behind the German lines at the Caen Canal in the dark hours before D-Day. The bridge was later renamed “Pegasus” in honor of the Red Devils' mascot.

Enter into the decisive phase of the war and storm Juno beach with the new and untried Canadian 3rd Infantry Division. Push inland towards the Caen-Bayeux railway line and take the airfields at Carpiquet, against the initial counterstrokes made by the 21st Panzer Division. Finally, join operations aimed to take Caen with its vital road network and face the fury of the unbloodied 12th SS Panzer Division equipped with the best weaponry and equipment available, finally unleashed and sent forward against the invasion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Escape from Rotter Mansion
description:
High on a hilltop, there stands a dilapidated old mansion. Some say the place is haunted but you and your friends don't believe in such myths. Except for the one about Old Man Rotter's gold that still remains in the place. What will you find inside Rotter Mansion? - vast riches or the wrath of a vengeful spirit?

Escape from Rotter Mansionc is a push-your-luck dice game for 1-4 players. In it, you and a partner meeple try to escape from a ghost in a haunted mansion. Will you reach the exit in time or will you be trapped inside forever?

Escape from Rotter Mansion is a bespoke board game created by designer Scott Rogers (Rayguns and Rocketships, ALIEN: Fate of the Nostromo). Only 10 copies of the game were offered for sale in the Fall of 2023 while Rogers battled cancer.

The game features luxe components created specifically for the game by Panda and includes a cloth playmat, metal coins and a velvet "coffin lining" in the box. The project was a labor of love for Rogers and is truly a unique collector's item.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: We All Take from the River
description:
We All Take from the River is an educational game of resource management and social deduction. You play as neighbors along a river, each with a unique set of objectives to complete over the course of several days. Sometimes you and your neighbor's objectives will overlap and sometimes they will clash.

Turns begin at the top of the river and proceed downstream. Players build and move structures along the river to control when they act, competing for the best spots available. Players at the top of the river will have the advantage of acting first, while players at the bottom of the river will have access to more resources that gather as the waters flow. If a player pollutes upstream, it may have negative consequences for their neighbors below.

Any combination of players may win by the end of the game so long as each of them have completed their objectives. Or, if the estuary becomes clogged with pollution and the river ecosystem is destroyed, every player will lose.

—description from the designer
categories: Deduction, Educational, Environmental, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Semi-Cooperative Game, Trading

name: Paupers' Ladder: The Gift Bearers
description:
Snow caps the peaks, the carols slowly fade to silence and the lilac sun sets one last time. Tucked up in their beds, the good folk of Brighthelm wonder what splendid gifts they will wake up to. And that’s where YOU come in.

The Gift Bearers adds a wealth of festive expansions to Paupers' Ladder, The Moon Towers and One Lonely Pauper. Challenge opposing Paupers to pull your crackers, give gifts in the name of generosity, and play 4 new Christmas themed Paupers and Birds.

Whether you’re dishing out socks to your fellow player, a delicious necrotic jelly to a necromancer or just planting buttonbush in the beaches, It’s time to spread some joy across the land!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Terraforming Mars: More Terraforming Mars Kickstarter Promo Pack
description:
A set of 20 promo cards for Terraforming Mars that were revealed as daily milestones during the More Terraforming Mars Kickstarter campaign (Prelude 2, Automa, Milestones & Awards, etc.):


2 corporation cards
Kuiper Cooperative
Tycho Magnetics




4 prelude cards
Anti-Desertification Techniques
Established Methods
Giant Solar Collector
Strategic Base Planning




14 project cards
Aqueduct Systems
Astra Mechanica
Carbon Nanosystems
Cyberia Systems
Hermetic Order of Mars
Homeostasis Bureau
Kaguya Tech
Mars Nomads
Martian Lumber Corp
Neptunian Power Consultants
Red Ships
Solar Logistics
St. Joseph of Cupertino Mission
Teslaract
categories: Economic, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Income, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tags, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Escape the Horde
description:
In this fast—paced card game two Factions (Survivors and Infected) fight for supremacy in the Wastelands. Survivors must work together to outrun Patient Zero and their horde of zombies, using weapons, cunning and strategy. Patient Zero and the Infected attack relentlessly trying to infect and Turn all Survivors.
​
Survivors win when the last card has been drawn from the Stack and they have not been Turned, or if they survive the Countdown Clock. Patient Zero and Infected Survivors win when they infect and Turn all Survivors.

What makes our game so much fun is that all players stay in the game right to the very end — some still as Survivors, others as Infected.

—description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Kingdoms
description:
Take on the role of legendary leaders as you fight to defend your territories and eliminate your foes in this chaotic card game of conquering. With a unique blend of action cards, attacks, and ambushes, every turn is filled with suspense and intrigue.

But beware - losing your last territory draws a dreaded
Death Wish, unleashing chaos and potentially changing the course of the game.

Outwit your opponents, defend your lands, and seize victory in this fast-paced game of skill, cunning, and alliance.

How it works:
Every player starts with territories that make up their kingdom. They take turns attacking opponents territory cards while defending their own territory cards from other attacks. Players can select a special character to play as which each have unique abilities that effect the gameplay.

—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Fighting, Medieval, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Drawing, Kill Steal, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination

name: D-Day Dice: To Do or Die
description: An almanac of rules old and new, maps, history and interesting facts and materials for use with D-Day Dice.
categories: Book, Card Game, Dice, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Survive Until Daylight: Story Mode
description:
The expansion pack “STORY MODE” holds several scenarios (～ 20) offering narrative gameplay options and 10 modifiers. Spice up your game and dive into the world of SURVIVE UNTIL DAYLIGHT!

A few mod examples:

Crit! (-) Remove “1 damage” cards from the combat deck.

Collateral (-) All enemies inflict 1 splash damage.

At War (+) Your “first player perk” is always activated.

Epic baby! (+) Add the “epic” ammo and weapon cards to the rubble deck.

A few stories examples:

PVP: (2P+) Switch from a co-op game to a competitive game. Eliminate the players at the table to win the game.

Collector: (2P+) Keep all enemies you killed as trophies. At the end of the game, the player who has racked up the most kills win the game.

Secret raider: (4P+) Before you begin a game, shuffle the “secret raider” deck. Each player draws a card randomly. One of them is the secret raider. Their goal: ensure the downfall of the group. Uncover who this secret betrayer is to win the game. But guess wisely!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Push Your Luck

name: 3 Magi
description:
Embark on an enchanting adventure in 3 Magi, a captivating game that follows the three wise men on their legendary trek across the desert to meet the newborn King.

Players assume the roles of the Magi. Manage resources, skillfully craft gifts, navigate the terrain with the help of the navigation board and encounter characters that may aid the Magi's mission.

As the Magi, players must gather and combine resources to craft gifts for the King, each worth victory points. Players travel across desert tiles, entering iconic locations such as “Jericho", "Jerusalem", "Herod's Palace" and "Bethlehem". The tiles have unique actions allowing players to choose a particular route and resolve actions. Use the navigation board for bonuses & extra actions. Manage & combine your cards on hand to further your Magi in the game.

3 Magi offers a unique gaming experience, weaving together elements of resource management, worker placement, card hand management and crafting. Immerse yourself in the timeless narrative of the 3 Magi as they seek Jesus the King.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Dream-Eaters: Campaign Expansion
description:
There is a hidden realm outside the world of the waking: a realm of whimsy, imagination, and nightmares. After occult author Virgil Gray writes about his adventures in these “Dreamlands”, you decide to set forth and learn the truth for yourself. Nothing could have prepared you for the terrible wonders that dwell on the other side…

In The Dream-Eaters Campaign Expansion, one to four investigators take on the roles of either a group venturing into the Dreamlands or their companions who have been left in the waking world. Together, these divided groups must confront not one, but two ancient terrors vying for control over both worlds. What is real, and what is fiction? And what secrets await in the dark, forbidden places beyond the gates of sleep?

This expansion combines all of the campaign and scenario content from the original The Dream-Eaters cycle, which was the fifth cycle of expansions for Arkham Horror: The Card Game. Players only need a copy of the Arkham Horror: The Card Game Revised Core Set to dive into the story.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Events, Hand Management, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: TaroQuest
description:
A Strategy based card game that utilizes astrology and tarot cards to create a unique game experience. 2-4 players compete as one of the 12 Astrological signs with the goal of winning by balancing their Energy Centers.

TaroQuest is not like other strategy card games, with gameplay designed to create dynamic twists and turns. No game of TaroQuest is the same, with hours of memorable entertainment that can last a lifetime. The esoteric meanings of tarot cards are incorporated, which leads to some exciting game sessions that players enjoy talking about long after a game has ended.

A truly unique game, TaroQuest will not look or play like other strategy card games. There are no need for expensive booster packs with bulk filler cards or expensive cards to chase. You will need a shrewd mind and a bit of luck to determine when to play your cards to achieve victory.
Everything you need for this new gaming experience is contained within.... TaroQuest! Your Journey Awaits!

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Horror, Mythology, Party Game, Religious, Renaissance
mechanics: Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Interrupts, Kill Steal, Lose a Turn, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Stacking and Balancing, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Château Combo
description:
A quick and nifty card game by the publisher of Faraway.
Each player will spend coins to draft 9 cards from 2 open markets on the table (the lower and upper city), creating along the game a 3x3 square of people interacting with each other to trigger instant effects and end-of-game bonuses.
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: DRAFT
description:
If you enjoy the drafting mechanic in card games, then DRAFT - the Ultimate Card Drafting Game is a must have for your game shelf. Players have over a dozen ways to draft cards in this set-collection style card game.

Players will play three rounds of three phases each drafting cards into their collection of cards. At the end of three phases scoring takes place. Three or more cards with the same color, shape, number, or even sequential run are eligible to score. You can even double up your points by creating sets that have two similarities such as a run with all the same color.

The player with most points at the end of round three is declared the winner, but watch out for those auction/bid points you make during the game because they subtract points from your final score at the very end. Draft is a game for 2-5 players that plays in 20-40 minutes and is fun enough for every member of the family, but has just the right amount of strategy to make even the most seasoned gamer appreciate the gameplay.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Unfinished Business: Final Chapter
description:
New York, 1927:
Dear Cousin Otti. Welcome back to New York. It's been 13 years since your escape to Palermo and voices say the city has changed. The family is still going strong, but be warned. People never change and the dons of other families are after our money like never before. Times have gotten rougher and so have the methods. Keep your men ready, the big moment is just around the corner. - Don Carlo

Immerse yourself in New York in the 1930s and take on the role of one of eighteen different family heads in "Unfinished Business - Final Chapter" and do everything you can to create a financial legacy. Collect valuable possessions in your safe, speculate on winnings from the betting shop or network with influential personalities to get money from the bank. Be surprised by a variety of new events, new citizens and action possibilities that will take your previous Unfinished Business gaming experience to the next level. Take advantage of your new, unique character abilities that are available to you in three levels: Get extra money aside, steal from enemy safes, gain additional knowledge or always have the right "answer" up your sleeve. How will you earn money for your family? Will you challenge the bank at roulette, opt for honest investments or prefer an ambush? But be careful, if you brag about your wealth, you will quickly arouse the interest of the other dons and may be brought back down to earth with a loud bang!


Use your basic game box as a new inlay for the new big box
Enough space for base game, all expansions and promos
Space for sleeves
33 new events and actions
18 playable dons with different abilities
7 player expansion
22 additional property cards
Epic Game module
Car bomb game module


—description from the publisher (translated)

New York, 1927:
Werter Cousin Otti. Willkommen zurück in New York. Seit deiner Flucht nach Palermo sind 13 Jahre vergangen und Stimmen behaupten die Stadt hätte sich verändert. Die Familie ist immer noch stark, aber sei gewarnt. Menschen verändern sich nie und die Dons anderer Familien trachten nach unserem Geld wie nie zuvor. Die Zeiten sind rauher geworden und die Methoden auch. Halte deine Männer bereit, der große Moment steht kurz bevor. - Don Carlo

Taucht ein in das New York der 30er Jahre und übernehmt in „Unfinished Business – Final Chapter“ die Rolle eines von achtzehn verschiedenen Familienoberhäuptern und setzt alles daran ein finanzielles Vermächtnis zu erschaffen. Sammelt wertvolle Besitztümer in eurem Safe, spekuliert auf Gewinne aus dem Wettbüro oder vernetzt euch mit einflussreichen Persönlichkeiten um Geld aus der Bank zu erhalten. Lasst von einer Vielzahl neuer Ereignisse, neue Bürger und Aktionsmöglichkeiten überraschen, die eure bisherigen Unfinished Business Spielerfahrungen auf die nächste Ebene bringen. Macht euch ab sofort eure neuen, einzigartigen Charakterfähigkeiten zu nutzen die euch in drei Stufen zur Verfügung stehen: Schafft zusätzliches Geld bei Seite, stehlt aus gegnerischen Safes, erlangt zusätzliches Wissen oder habt stets die richtige „Antwort“ im Ärmel. Wie wollt ihr das Geld für eure Familie verdienen? Fordert ihr beim Roulette die Bank heraus, entscheidet euch für ehrliche Investments oder doch lieber einen Hinterhalt? Aber Vorsicht, wer mit seinem Reichtum prahlt weckt schnell das Interesse der anderen Dons und wird unter Umständen mit einem lauten Knall zurück auf den Boden der Tatsachen geholt!


Nutze deine Grundspielbox als neues Inlay in deiner neuen Big Box
Genug Platz für Grundspiel, alle Erweiterungen und Promos
Platz für Sleeves
33 neue Ereignisse und Aktionen
18 spielbare Dons mit verschiedenen Fähigkeiten
7 Spieler-Erweiterung
22 zusätzliche Besitzkarten
Modus - "Episches Spiel"
Spielmodul Autobombe


—description from the publisher (German)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: LUZ
description:
As you enter the Cathedral, you're suddenly gripped by the magnitude of the challenge ahead. Compose with color and light to leave your competitors in the shadow!

In this trick taking game, hold your cards in your hand without looking at them. While you know the suits, only your opponents know the values of your cards.

Look at your opponents' hands to deduce the value of your cards and bet the number of tricks you think you will win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Trick-taking

name: Advanced Tobruk 2016
description:
What started it all is NEW again and then some! Advanced Tobruk, nominated for 'Board Wargame of the Year' is getting its first makeover in over a DOZEN YEARS and things are heating up in the desert ... the war is breathing again outside of Agedabia ... and breathing new life into Erwin Rommel's quest vs. the Desert Rats. Expansions will bring battles ranging from Beda Fomm to El Alamein!
ALL new counters with camo galore to go with desert sand! New maps with the LARGEST HEXES IN THE HISTORY OF THE SYSTEM in a completely scalable game set that can be expanded literally into infiinity. New overlays to go along with the set, new color AFV Cards, wrecks on the back of all vehicles, all in 3/4" size, all scenarios re-done for the new materials and in COLOR > plus new play aids in desert themed colors, folding > ready for ACTION!
Ownership of the ATS Rulebook 2014 and standard system markers is required to play.
This is a VERY LIMITED SPECIAL EDITION ATS MODULE that you can get, here, by ordering as long as this page is up. Each copy contains:
>> 7 sheets of color die-cut counters, all NEW in Olive Drab, new leaders, and more!
>> A Full set of scenarios depicting the Battle of Gazala > new takes on the core scenarios 1-8 with the new boards and overlays!!
Play Aids and AFV Cards in COLOR.
Color folio with charts on inside, a first!
A complete complement of expansions, Gamers Guides coming, just for the new generation!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Fractured Galaxy
description:
A 4X space empire game for 2 - 4 players (expandable to 1 - 8) with a unique action deck upgrade system and fast paced play with little player down time. A game can be played in under two hours.

Each player has a deck of ten action cards of six different types, during a turn a player plays one action card and discards the other. The actions allow the player to move his fleet, explore the galaxy, attack, trade, research, produce goods and ships and finally perform diplomacy.

As the game progresses tiles are placed during explore actions which opens up a board that is always different with varying groups of spacial anomalies and systems making for difficult tactical decisions and shaky alliances.

During the game players will research better cards which replace their basic action cards. With only ten cards in a deck at one time you know the action you need is just round the corner.

When all the space tiles are used up the game ends prompting the end scoring where players gain points for different things including systems they occupy and fully upgrade, money, technology researched and wealth accumulated.

Ship Designs by Alexander Farquhar and Chris Winterburn
Early Concept Artwork by Alexander Farquhar
Final Illustration by Gary Myers
categories: Exploration, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: A Battle of Onin
description:
A Battle of Onin is a strategic trick-taking card game, designed for between 2-4 players. It offers some mechanics reminiscent of classic games such as Spades, Euchre, Pinochle and Hearts, but with incredibly nuanced gameplay.

How to play:
13 cards are dealt to each player. Each player sets a bid for how many tricks they'll try to win; high card wins the trick! Collect too many tricks and over time you will become corrupted and your influence will suffer. Collect too few tricks and you won't keep up with your adversaries! Strategize with your enemies to survive; you may have to make risky decisions in the process. But remember, allegiances change rapidly. Score the most influence points to win without being negatively affected by your corruption.

What separates A Battle of Onin from other traditional trick-taking games?

A reimagined 52 card deck along with familiar mechanics offers a new challenge for experienced trick-takers; while players who are unfamiliar with the genre will learn with ease.

With a cohesive blend of subtle complexity, cooperative elements, and unique strategies, A Battle of Onin requires the ability to play offensively and defensively simultaneously; as every hand can and must be strategized to your advantage...even the "bad" hands.

A Battle of Onin is designed to be color-blind friendly. For players who are colorblind, we have kanji symbols denoting color and faction; Featuring four unique characters that are easily distinguishable. Provided is a key to help translate the symbols and play seamlessly.

Because we know that skill levels vary, what makes this game stand apart from the rest is it's malleability. A Battle of Onin is Modular. We encourage you to play the multiple variants of gameplay we detail that fit your skill/enjoyment level. From basic, to advanced to expert mode. We also encourage you to implement your own ideas and house rules to maximize your fun-factor. Be creative and make the game as enjoyable as possible!

Beyond all that is the ease it takes to learn, set up, shuffle up and play. Though it takes minutes to learn, new players can play competitively almost immediately. This gives A Battle of Onin re-playability. Most of the time, we don't just play one game. We play 2 or 3.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Follow, Force Commitment, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Semi-Cooperative Game, Trick-taking

name: First Monday in October
description:
On the first Monday in October, the all-powerful Justices of the U.S. Supreme Court gather each year in their "marble palace" to decide the fate of a nation. Each player represents a long-standing institution or school of thought attempting to gain renown by shaping the composition of the high court, taking sides in landmark cases throughout the history of the United States, and determining the governing laws of the land. Players need to use their limited influence and actions wisely to manipulate the judicial philosophy of the Court and to prevail in as many cases as possible.

Over the course of two hours, First Monday in October — for which designer Jason Matthews worked as lead developer — re-creates the history of the U.S. Supreme Court from 1789 to the present day, through three distinct eras: Era I represents the founding of the Court in 1789 through the Civil War in 1865; Era II represents the time period from 1866 until the seminal decision of Brown v. Board in 1954; and Era III represents the modern era from 1955 until 2010.

The game revolves around the following four judicial philosophy tracks:

Commerce Clause: This track represents the scope of Article I, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution, which grants Congress the power to "regulate commerce" among the several states.
Equality & Liberty: This track broadly represents the scope of individual equality and liberty, including but not limited to the 14th Amendment (i.e., equal protection, due process, and privacy rights).
Free Speech: This track represents the obligation in the 1st Amendment that Congress make no law abridging a person's freedom of speech, and the scope of permissible restrictions on that freedom.
Executive Power: This track broadly represents the scope of Article II of the U.S. Constitution, which enumerates the powers of the executive branch, including the Office of the President and law enforcement.


Shifting each philosophy one way generally represents a more expansive Federalist interpretation of the above constitutional provisions that supports a stronger centralized federal government, whereas shifting each philosophy the other direction generally represents a more narrow Anti-Federalist application of these provisions that supports a more decentralized approach to government with less power concentrated at the federal level.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses

name: Hexes of Sygon
description:
Your wizards gaze across the mystical planet of Sygon. Volatile volcanoes have blazed away much of the world, except for a precious clearing of land. Here lies the various landscapes of Sygon: meadows, swamps, dunes, mountains, forests, and caves.

Each landscape hosts an unique spell component crucial to developing civilization on Sygon. Collect gold and the various spell components - flower, elixir, spice, powder, mushroom, and crystal - and maneuver your wizards to conjure towns, workshops, and markets to quickly advance your civilization. Use alchemy or forage to obtain components outside your grasp.

Sygon relies on you to bring prosperity to its ravaged lands. However, you are not alone. Wizards loyal to other civilizations plot to loot you and compete for control of the planet. Be wary of where you place your towns and wizards and build walls to protect them against thieving wizards and volcano eruptions. Rise from the ashes and bring glory to your civilization on Sygon.

For the game setup, the players will construct the randomly generated hexagonal game board of flower, elixir, spice, powder, mushroom, and crystal hexes and randomly assign a gold value to each hex. Players will begin the game by placing 2 towns in snake draft order. Each town is placed on an unsettled hex of choice with either 1 or 2 walls in the same hex. A player places their 3 wizards in hexes with their towns on their first turn.

On a player's turn, they will move their wizards, conjure buildings, and cast spells in order. Each building type (town, workshop, market, and wall) contains an unique resource combination, and a player's wizard must be in a hex for them to build there. Action spells consist of wizards foraging component cards from the various landscapes of Sygon, stealing gold from nearby opponents, and protecting from stealing. Additional spell cards (charm, fissure, vanish, blizzard, power trip, & foresight) may be added to this base 2-4 player game.

The goal of Hexes of Sygon is to accumulate enough and the most sorcery points (SP) of all players at the end of a round of turns to win, where SP are awarded through buildings.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Map Deformation, Market, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Zone of Control

name: ONUS! Under the Eagle
description:
Simon Scarrow's Eagle book series takes us back to the times when Claudius was emperor in Rome, beginning with the invasion of Britain, through the adventures of his characters Macro and Cato.
With this expansion of ONUS! you will experience first hand, the battles of the books, commanding Roman troops or enemies of the Empire, from skirmishes of a few men to large armies, even playing alone!

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Sigil: Powers of War – Base Set
description:
Description from the publisher:

Sigil: Powers of War is an action packed fantasy based strategic battle game with 8 customizable factions. It takes all the excitement of dice combat and combines it with pre-built deck construction that allows for multiple strategies for victory. Choose your Sigil, build your army, and prepare for War!

Each player start the game with a Sigil of Power related to their faction of choice, a 5 card starting hand, and a powerful Warlord who can advance your front lines by placing mana generators and pushing back the enemy. These mana generators allow units to spawn at them when summoned and also generate mana on every turn giving the player the power to cast multiple and increasingly powerful spells.

The goal of the game is simple... destroy your opponents Sigil which starts with a 20 point life counter. The first person whose Sigil's life counter reaches 0 loses. This is accomplished by using your Warlord, the action cards in your hand, and multiple units who can be summoned throughout the battle. Combat is strategy based with a touch of luck based on dice combat.

Gameplay is expandable up to 6 players and the base set out of the box can be played with up to 4 players. Multiple game variants and player count game options.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid

name: Tombed
description:
Tombed is a dungeon-style game from 2 to 5 players set in Egypt in the 1940s with a fantasy hue. In this game, a group of adventurers enters an ancient Egyptian temple to fulfill a contract that will make them rich and famous. What the brave adventurers ignore is that their presence will awaken ancient pharaohs...

One of the players controls one of the possible Pharaohs (each with different abilities and powers), while the others each play as one of the adventurers. The Pharaoh player tries to gain enough power to return to life, and the adventurers try to accomplish their contracts and to leave the Temple alive.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth – Orie Box
description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 4 fighters and everything you need to play:

Orie - A deliberate counter-attacker, Orie can boost her attacks with strong defense, then seize the advantage to unleash a relentless assault.

Waldstein - Maximize Power! Waldstein's attacks do huge damage and have gigantic range. Watch out for disruption though!

Merkava - Merkava's unpredictable ranges and movement will disrupt foes' strategies and maximize the advantage of his flexible play style.

Wagner - Wagner utilizes powerful boosts to raise her stats and crush rivals. She intimidates foes to control their tempo and keep them on the back foot.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Guards of Atlantis II: Tabletop MOBA – Devoted Hero Pack
description:
Heros included in this pack:

MISA the Samurai - Will fight against the overwhelming odds to protect her master.
SILVERARROW the Pathfinder - never imagined that she would leave the Forest, until the Oracle uttered the words.
URSAFAR the Savage - when she roars, the beasts cower in their ice caves and the tribesmen put fresh fish outside their igloos, to appease the great bear.
TALI the Spiritcaller - The spirits called her after she saved her village from the frost beasts.
WHISPER the Outcast -was the Grand Judicator of the Underkingdom when he condemned a powerful noble.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Plunder
description:
A very strange game from the Thomson Bros. Each player attempts to collect a set of 4 items and deliver them to his home. You go to stores owned by other players and buy them but early in the game it becomes night and then the only recourse is to steal them. It looks like a monopoly clone on the surface but is much more chaotic. One player plays a thief who can move pretty quickly using special paths. One player is the Mayor who has a lot of money. The other players play merchants who have a store and residence.

4 tokens are placed in each store and any player (except a thief) may enter a store and buy one. You can only carry one item at a time but you may drop any item at any time. You can enter stores that are closed and residences to steal items but if caught you may end up going to jail which is harsh.

This game falls in the light and wacky catagory.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Upon The Risers: D-Day
description:
Blood Upon The Risers: D-Day is a scenario book for NUTS! 2nd Edition. It takes place on June 6, 1944 and covers the actions of small bands of American paratroopers of the 82nd Airborne Division during the early parts of Operation Neptune, a portion of the Overlord invasion plan.

Inside Blood Upon The Risers: D-Day you will find:
• Special Airborne rules that will make your paratroopers different than normal soldiers.
• New rules for the different types of terrain you will fight in.
• Tabletop artillery rules.
• New weapon and vehicle stats.
• Ten linked scenarios covering the actions on the 6th of June.

The scenarios provided in the book are fictional, though based on actual events, and are intended to be played solo (or cooperative) from the American side. The scenarios can easily be modified to be played head-to-head with another player taking on the forces allocated to the German side. The scenarios are also designed to be played in sequence, with the result of the previous mission affecting the next. However, they may also be played as standalone scenarios with little-to-no changes.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: CanCan
description:
CanCan, the game of color and creation, is a puzzle-building game using square multicolored tiles on a black gameboard. CanCan is all about color. Tiles are placed edge to edge by matching color. Match shapes too and you get rewards! You win by building good relationships! It’s suitable for players age 5 and up. It’s non-verbal, entirely visual, and thus globally accessible.

All the CanCan tiles are different. Every game creates a new picture. You can play CanCan in several ways. You can play by yourself, collaborate with others, or play competitively. In CanCan we build a picture together: each move creates the context for every following move. You can play to win, but you win by creating the best possible color relationship for each moment. The better the relationships and the more you learn to think ahead with your tile placement, the more complete your finished picture will be, the more fun you’ll have.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Highways & Byways
description:
Highways & Byways is a casual family game - great for board gaming couples and families! Race across the United States in your first used car. You're on a mission to explore all places beautiful and forgotten before your vacation is over.

Start the game by picking a Start Space and a Vehicle. Each Vehicle gives you different abilities, such as moving a little faster under certain conditions or immunity to negative events. Plan your route by choosing byways. Then travel across the country a little bit every day, planning around highway construction, moody weather, and your car's pesky tendency to break down!

The first player to travel all their Byways and circle back to their Start Space is the winner. Each player's route is determined by Byway Cards, which are drafted at the beginning of the game. After routes are chosen, players receive a hand of five Event Cards, one of which is drawn by the clockwise player right before the player can move. Whatever is written on that Event Card - good or bad - happens to the player who is about to move. Players can then travel up to six spaces per turn, trading in each unmoved space for the ability to discard an unwanted Event Card and draw a replacement.

Each time the game comes back around to player 1, a new Construction Card is flipped. Construction Cards block off some of the fastest roads in the game. After five Construction Cards are drawn, players pass their Event Cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Maximillian 1934
description:
Maximillian is a tabletop vehicle combat game set in a dystopian 1930s World. Players battle with heavily armed cars and bikes amid the roar of engines powered by alcohol and aviation fuel!
Power-slide and corner your way around the table and/or terrain, by using a special cornering template. Driving skill, the size and handling of a vehicle, and vehicle’s speed influence success or failure in a turn or manoeuvre.
Get your vehicle ready and we’ll see you out there on the roads, driver! Tally-Ho!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Movement Template

name: Good Dog, Bad Zombies: Unlikely Allies
description:
The second expansion for Good Dog, Bad Zombies.

With Unlikely Allies, you’ll add four new non-dog playable characters to your game: a cat, a goat, a baby pig, and a parrot. Each character comes with a unique power that can’t be found anywhere else!
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Zombies
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Bearithmatic
description:
This set of beautifully illustrated cards with thirteen different animals set across the four seasons offers a range of educational matching and addition-based card games. Get all ages engaged, with breath taking scenery and cute critters from around the world.

Kick off with Bearithmatic to build the largest wildlife reserve, or enjoy one of the other four classic games included in the accompanying rulebook.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: DKR Rally Raid
description:
Welcome to DKR Rally Raid, considered one of the toughest and most famous rallies in the world. Try to finish each stage in the shortest time possible, carefully following the roadbook. Overcome the inconveniences that arise, taking care of the car from the difficulties of the terrain and enduring the unfavorable weather to win this difficult competition. Let's race!

The objective is to finish 6 stages obtaining the lowest overall time. Each stage consists of going with your car from point A: start; to point B: finish line. In each game turn you must roll 2 dice, assign one for your direction and one for your speed, and find out their meaning in the roadbook to move the car according to your choice. In each stage, the terrain and the weather will make your life difficult. At the end of some stages you can repair damage to the vehicle, but sometimes you will have to repair damage in the middle of the race. At the end of the sixth and last stage, the winner will be the one who gets the lowest overall time.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Race, Simulation

name: Jinns of the lake
description:
On the fortieth day in the desert, a traveler discovers the Lake of Wishes. The Jinns of the Lake hire him as an architect to help them to build the Towers of Dreams. Whoever builds the most beautiful towers will win. A game of strategy where diplomacy and negotiation are used to support the spirit of conquest.

To earn the most points by building "Dream-towers" covered by your color (a Dream-tower has maximum 4 floors made of 1 pawn of each color).

Each player in turn moves a Dome-pawn of the color(s) they control, either to its right or its left, to stack on another Dome-pawn.

A Dome-pawn of strength 1 must be placed on the first free dome (alone or already stacked) to its right or its left.
A Dome-pawn of strength 2 must land on the second free dome (alone or already stacked) to its right or its left.
A Dome-pawn of strength 3 will necessarily land on the third free dome (alone or already stacked) to its right or its left.
A Dome-pawn of strength 4 will necessarily land on the fourth free dome (alone or already stacked) to its right or its left.


When moving, players may move their Dome-pawn alone, or with the entire tower, or only part of the tower they control on top.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Pantheon War: Olympus
description:
The gods have descend to the Mortal Realm, choosing their candidate, to represent them as their Avatar in the great "Pantheon War".

Play the ability of the respective gods in the form of cards, strategically plan your cards around to defend or create chaos to other Avatars within the battlefield. Destroy all other Avatars and allow your god to be the Grand Diety.

Pantheon War: Olympus is a fast-paced free-for-all battle card game designed for 2-4 players, where you play as the Avatar of your chosen gods. During your turn, you may play up to 2 cards against other players to destroy them , or play it onto yourself. When another Avatar attacks you, you may play Reaction cards against them.

The game ends when all players except you are eliminated. So come join the chaos and let your god to be the Grand Deity.
mechanics: Turn Order: Progressive

name: Space Port: Commerce
description:
Great adventures take place in a galaxy rich in resources and opportunities, but also divided into various regions and systems controlled by different alien races, with their own characteristics, cultures and technologies.

In this vast and enigmatic corner of the universe, the endless dance of stars and nebulae hides a complex network of competing alien civilizations. Every corner of this galaxy is a treasure trove of resources, technologies and deep secrets that have attracted five alien races willing to fight for economic dominance.

In this setting of intergalactic complexities, each race finds itself at The Spaceport, where their aspirations and ambitions collide, tensions rise, alliances change, and the future of the galaxy hangs in a delicate balance.

Prepare to enter a world of cosmic intrigue, shifting alliances, and astonishing discoveries as you compete for economic dominance in a galaxy full of wonders and challenges.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Economic, Science Fiction
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Guards of Atlantis II: Tabletop MOBA – Defiant Hero Pack
description:
Heroes included in this expansion:
GARRUS the Gladiator - He was the reigning champion of the Arena until his defeat at the hand of a stranger, who tricked him into losing his temper.
NEBKHER the Harbinger - an enigmatic traveler covered in exotic garb, face hidden behind a terrifying mask.
CUTTER the Skycaptain - She traded her life of a noble-born debutante for that of a swashbuckler and a scoundrel.
TRINKETS the Scavenger - He was expelled from the Drakenhuff when he almost destroyed the entire city.
BAIN the Bounty Hunter - Same say he is a nobleman, looking for his lost sister, some say he is just an ordinary drunk.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Sky Relics
description:
Description


Sky RelicsSky Relics is a 1:2400 scale tabletop miniature skirmish level interactive miniature Board War game, utilizing dynamic play with a random chance in the form of Dice and strategic gameplay elements through a Living Card based system.

In the realm of Sky Relics, players take on the roles of characters, called captains, in the fictional world of Targus. Players build and develop their Captain, Ship design and adventure within a narrative laid out by the optional Campaign play and through a process of structured decision-making and various actions taken within the game.

"Sky Relics is a battle fleet game, where players command fleets to do battle in the skies for their Nation or for glory and riches. Iron Sky Hulks soar through the clouds hunting the next battle as their barrels heat up with Shells ripping through the air slamming and decimating heavy armor. Life and death range on in the skies high above Targus, but will you, brave hero, be one who truly lives?"

'About'
Sky Relics is a Tabletop Miniature Battlefleet game, where players command fleets to do battle in the skies for their Nation or for glory and riches. Iron Sky Hulks soar through the clouds hunting the next battle as their barrels heat up with Shells ripping through the air slamming and decimating heavy armour. Life and death rages on in the skies high above Targus, but will you, brave hero, be one who truly lives?

With this exciting Sky Relics two player core box set, launch two mighty opposing factions with all the material you need to wage epic battles, including crafted ship miniatures with flight stands indicating firing arcs.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Siberian Manhunt
description:
During the height of the Cold War, the US mounted a surveillance program over the Soviet Union, flying U-2 spy planes at high altitude to avoid radar and fighter interceptors. Not every pilot returned...

Siberian Manhunt is an asymmetrical hidden movement game for 2 players. One player takes the role of a U-2 spy plane pilot who has crashed behind enemy lines and must escape across the border into China. The fugitive must use their wits to navigate the dangerous landscape, survive encounters with predatory animals, and avoid starvation and hypothermia, all while being pursued by the KGB. Do they dare enter towns, risking detection by the local authorities, or will they strike out into the wilds and rely on their wilderness survival skills to stay alive?

The other player is a Soviet general assigned to capture or kill the fugitive. At their disposal is the full might of the USSR: KGB agents and Yakut trackers, the Red Army, aerial searches, road blocks, and propaganda campaigns. But the Soviet government is fickle and not all Russians are loyal communists--and sometimes the hunted is deadlier than the hunter.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement

name: Cthulhu: Death May Die – Fear of the Unknown: Unknowable Box
description:
Unknowable Box contains all Kickstarter exclusive stretch goals for Cthulhu: Death May Die - Fear of the Unknown unlocked during the campaign.


28 Investigators miniatures and boards
7 Monsters with Unknown Monster card
NUG & YEB elder ones box
Unknown Monsters cards for Unspeakable Box Monsters
2 Relic cards (Pumpkin, Skull)
Lost Episode 4 Box: Hypnos
Lost Episode 5 Box: Dreams in the Witch House
Lost Episode 6 Box: The Colour Out of Space
Lost Episode 7 Box: The Horror in the Museum
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: The Fields of Normandy XL
description:
This is a sequel to The Fields of Normandy 2. It is a stand-alone game, not an expansion. It is a solitaire wargame.

Due to a range of factors, many troops from the 82nd and 101st Airborne Divisions were scattered and struggled to come under the control of division headquarters. Many of these troops formed into small groups, organised by officers and NCOs and fought behind enemy lines for up to five days. Although mainly fighting for their own lives, these groups also helped to clear significant parts of the more organised German resistance.

This game is a fairly quick playing, highly replayable and fun experience, whilst maintaining the need for tactical thinking and decision making.

If you have played The Fields of Normandy 2, then you will already be familiar with many of the rules for The Fields of Normandy XL. However, there are some material differences to look out for:
Maps consist of almost twice as many hexes – 48 hexes compared to 28.
There are now 15 potential enemy positions for each mission compared to 12 and these are, to some extent, positioned randomly each time rather than being fixed.
Missions run to a maximum of 14 turns compared to 10.
Maps include a new Terrain feature – Walls (instead of fences, which had no gameplay effect). Walls do have gameplay effects.
Your US force now includes two new Units – a Lieutenant Unit and a Sniper Unit which both have their own Order charts.
The Lieutenant now calls in Artillery strikes and therefore US Rifle Squads no longer do.
US Rifle Squads can now clear Mines (or more thematically perhaps, establish a clear route through them).
There is now a stacking limit of three US Units per hex.
A German Tiger (tank) might appear!
German Snipers are now a separate unit and operate independently to Rifle Squads.
German Artillery usually has more than one possible location hex per map.

In the game, you will be controlling small groups of soldiers consisting of three Rifle Squads, a Machine Gun Team, a Bazooka Team, a Mortar Team, a Sniper Team and a Lieutenant, moving them around the hex maps and undertaking other orders to achieve the objective.

The Fields of Normandy XL is an accessible, portable, solitaire "hex and counter" style war game in a book.

12 Full colour mission maps, rules and a counter sheet are included (to be mounted on card). You will need to provide 2 six-sided dice.

-description from designer
categories: Book, Dice, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Union City Alliance
description:
A Cooperative Superhero Deck and Board Building game for a team of 2-4 Players. Each chooses an iconic champion to play as and work together to confront and defeat a central supervillain. Each hero has their own unique starter deck of Origin cards that highlight that character's unique strengths and skills. Each Hero also comes with a Deck of super-powerful Solo Cards that only they have access to, featuring their most powerful abilities.

On their turn, players will explore to add new map panels to the board. Each Map Panel contains new Union Cards to add to their deck. There are also City cards with Challenges to overcome and Enemies to defeat, collecting outrageous rewards. Beyond that, Map Panels have Actions and special set-ups so you never know what's going to be around the corner! Players control how the board is built and a one-of-a-kind Map is constructed each game.

All the while, the Peril of the Supervillain grows, their plot escalates, and they unleash minions, maniacal machinations, and bring their own formidable combat prowess to bear. Each Supervillain has their own means of conquering the city, each time you build the board it is different, and each Hero has their own powers that they can add to and hone as part of your own Union City Alliance!

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction

name: Prodigy GC
description:
"What is this? A prodigy? A collective hallucination? This is not a movie. This is not a child’s play. This is not even the real world, as you’ve known it until now, at least...This is more".

For fifteen years players had to customize their own deck: now, at last, they can customize their cards too!

Prodigy Game Cards is a card game, you don't collect it, proper for experienced players; every player drives a group of people "special" in it: these people are called WIPper, in specific places around the world, that in order to prevail on the adversaries fight for many purposes.

These characters, at first sight, seem just common people, but possess increased ability that we called "prodigies." It is a WIPper who succeeds in these "prodigies". Who is not able to do it, is without bond. Four types of bond exist and each is represented, in the game, by a different color:

Molecular - yellow: those people that can modify their phisical structure and their molecular density in different ways.
Elementary - green: they possess the ability to channel, to send forth and to check different types of energy using the body as catalyst.
Feral - red: they possess a combination of Dna human and animal, that allow them to possess animal physical powers.
Psionic - blue: they are the WIPpers that possess some superior mental abilities.

To play a game of Prodigy Game Cards it needs at least two players. Every player must possess WIPper (the protagonists of our history), Places (where they fight) and a deck of Prodigies (the special actions that are able to do).

With Prodigy Game Cards you can directly reach a new level of personalization: the Prodigies have the technology Scracth&Play, developed in collaboration with Cartamundi, that allows the players to personalize, in phase of construction of the deck, every single paper.

Every Prodigy possesses three levels of power: low, middle and high.
According to the strategy and experience, and according to the objective that the player want to get during the game, he decides what value "to release." To increase a low value, is necessary to remove the patina that covers the left yellow panel of the paper; to increase the value, without going to far, it is recommended the panel (orange) found to the center; if you need values of maximum power, it needs to set the right the panel (red) free.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Modern Warfare, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Captain's Log #13
description:
Excerpted from the back of the book

Best of Nexus
The best of the classic NEXUS files, completely revised and updated for the Captain's Edition!

Featured Scenarios & Items: Complete rules for the ISC (including Order of Battle, Counters, and rules) published here for the first time! Federation & Empire tactic notes & combat missions. Scenarios: The Hydran Expedition and The Second Federation-Kzinti War.

Also includes: Klingon Battlecruisers (four previously unpublished SSDs); Tactics; and Academy (the Commander and his cadets discuss classic SFB strategy & maneuvers).
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Mobile Suit Gundam: One Year's War
description:
Mobile Suit Gundam : One Year's War is a fan-made wargame series based on the famous Japanese anime Mobile Suit Gundam in 1979. The game recreates the famous battles on Earth like Zeon's assault on Jaburo..
In additions to mobile suits (mechs), there are tanks, fighters, bombers & capital ships.

It's the first game in the series which covers Zeon's assault on Jaburo base at the end of Nov U.C.0079. It's an epic tactical wargame with various types of units. Each player commands a battalion of mobile suits which have different characteristics. Some MS are good in close combat. Some are good for long-range support. Some MS can even move under water. As in the anime, there are ace pilots who may turn the tide of battle.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Maelstrom's Edge: Battle for Zycanthus
description:
Description from the publisher:

Maelstrom's Edge is a tabletop war game using detailed plastic miniatures that fills the gap between small scale skirmish games with several individual models per side and large scale war games with scores of models per side. Maelstrom's Edge uses about 20 to 30 models a side, making it easy to model, easy to paint and easy to play. Forces consist of several small-sized units, which is why we call the game a 'squad-based skirmish game'. Because it is a miniatures game, you get to assemble and paint your own models to pit against an opponent on a table dressed up with terrain to form your battlefield.

The conflicts on your table take the form of missions set in the desperate Maelstrom's Edge universe, populated by the Epirian Foundation and their robotic forces, the secretive Karist Enclave supported by the alien Angels, and various other factions. The content below highlights our game, background and models, and how you can get started.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Rosita & Eugene Booster
description:
This booster pack contains 2 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Rosita and Eugene to your games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Trudvang Legends: Thorn Beast
description:
Thorn Beast is a plug-and-play expansion that features a mythological, monstrous draconic beast from Trudvang that can be either a plague upon the land or a companion, a dragon-like creature that you can ride and soar across Trudvang with if you engage in bonding and taming it. Caring for a partially insane beast is a risky yet rewarding experience! As a modular expansion, Thorn Beast is compatible with any Adventure, whether the core box, Lost Story, or expansions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Incinerator
description:
The rangers have been captured and thrown into a dark dungeon, but this is no ordinary prison - it’s the Incinerator! This new mini-supplement for Rangers of Shadow Deep contains two scenarios usable with rangers of any level, as well as a new, potential, auxiliary companion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Rise TCG
description:
Rise is a unique trading card game set in a fantasy multiverse infused with powers and magic.

Rise is a card game based on deck construction, strategy, inertia and luck.
You can play it alone (dungeon mode) or in duel, and especially in multiplayer.
Evolve your summoners and unleash your power to be the only player to have at least 1 of his summoners still alive.

The first season contains 306 different carefully designed and illustrated cards.

Rise is much more than these few lines, to really know and discover the game, with its possibilities, its gameplay and its depth, I invite you to discover all the informations on the wiki page of the project: rules of the game, the complete list of cards, the history and much more!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing, Sudden Death Ending

name: BrewBiz KC card game
description:
Build a beer lineup with 5 popular categories: Lager, Wheat, Ale, IPA & Stout, as you experiment with 4 flavor sensations: Sweet, Sour, Bitter & Umami.

To win a round, you’ll also need a Brewery card & one of their 'Signature Brew' cards.

But, if other players develop a ‘Flavor Specialty’, they just might cut into your profits!

Each set features 3 Kansas City area microbreweries and 4 of their signature brews.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Townsfolk Tussle: Odd Jobs
description:
The Peddler has gotten herself into a bit of trouble. After a rough night of gambling with the locals, she bet it all and lost all her wares—but don't worry, the Peddler's always got a plan! In the Odd Jobs expansion, you’ll be taking on new roles and working some odd jobs to help the Peddler restock her shop. Scavenge the Hoselands’ nooks and crannies for anything that could be of use; you’ll need to get creative if you want to survive. With a new plethora of gear and roguelike elements, it's a new way to play Townsfolk Tussle!

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Square Grid, Team-Based Game
publishers: Frosted Games, Lucky Duck Games, Panic Roll

name: Marvel United: Multiverse – Promo Team Decks
description:
A set of 15 different Team decks, the majority composed of 6 cards each, for a total of 92 cards!


X-Force
West Coast Avengers
Savage Avengers
Resistance Against Apocalypse
Illuminati
X-Factor
Excalibur
New Mutants
Infinity Watch
Inhumans
Fantastic Four
Force Works
Defenders (Manhattan)
Marvel Knights
Alpha Flight


When adding a Team Deck to your game, all Heroes being used must be part of the same Team, and the Hard Challenge difficulty level should be used. That Team deck is shuffled and placed facedown within view of all players, with 2 cards revealed to form the Team Display. These are essentially Hero cards, with Action symbols at the bottom and a Special Effect. On their turn, a Hero can choose to either play a regular turn or they can choose to play a Team turn. In that case they don’t touch their Hero cards (neither drawing nor playing) but choose instead one of the Team cards in the Display and play that card in the Storyline, as if it were their own card. Immediately a new card is drawn from the deck to fill the Team Display (until the deck runs out). This not only brings a different flavor to the match, but also gives Hero more options of what to do on their turn. However, there is a downside to playing as a Team. Most Team decks have at least one card with a mandatory negative effect. This is in effect as long as that card is faceup on the Team Display. In order to shut it down, a Hero must take one for the team by taking a Team turn, choosing the negative card, and playing it facedown in the Storyline. There’s no “I” in Team!

All Teams in this set require the use of Heroes who are part of exclusive expansions or Stretch Goals from previous campaigns, which is why we’re offering them as an exclusive Optional Buy, so backers can decide whether they want it or not. In the lists below, these exclusive characters are shown in italics. Although, of course, most of these Teams also have additional members which are part of boxes that are (or will be) available on retail. Also note that many of those Teams might still be bolstered by Heroes revealed over the course of the Multiverse campaign.

-description from Kickstarter campaign
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Amenaza Gigante
description:
In a world where steam and gears reign supreme, the tranquility of the cities is threatened by the arrival of a Mechanical Giant. Its origin and motivations are a mystery, but driven by an inexhaustible energy, this colossus of metal sows chaos in its wake, leaving behind ruins and hearts filled with fear. Faced with this unprecedented challenge, three brave heroes of diverse skills and origins unite with a common goal: to stop the unstoppable machine of destruction. Together, they must face unimaginable dangers, test their wits, and risk everything to protect humanity and restore hope. The fate of all now depends on the courage and determination of these three heroes.

Game Development:
The game consists of resolving: 1) the Giant cards, 2) the Heroes' rondels, and 3) the City cards. These mechanics are explained in detail later, but it is most important to understand this sequence.
If the Giant cards run out, it is considered that the Giant has reached the City. From then on, the sequence is: 1) The City receives 2 points of damage, 2) The rondels are resolved, and 3) The City mechanics are resolved. This continues until the Giant is defeated or destroys the City.


Introducción:
En un mundo donde el vapor y los engranajes dominan, la tranquilidad de las urbes se ve amenazada por la llegada de un Gigante Mecánico. Su origen y sus motivaciones son un misterio pero, movido por una energía inextinguible, este coloso de metal siembra el caos a su paso, dejando a su estela ruinas y corazones llenos de temor. Ante este desafío sin precedentes, tres valientes héroes de diversas habilidades y orígenes se unen con un objetivo común: detener la imparable máquina de destrucción. Unidos, deben enfrentar peligros inimaginables, poner a prueba su ingenio y arriesgarlo todo para proteger a la humanidad y restaurar la esperanza. El destino de todos depende ahora de la valentía y determinación de estos tres héroes.

Desarrollo del Juego:
El juego consiste en ir resolviendo: 1) las cartas de Gigante, 2) los rondeles de Héroes y 3) las cartas de Ciudad. Más adelante se explica en detalle estas mecánicas pero lo más importante es entender esta secuencia.
Si se acaban las cartas de Gigante, se considera que este llegó a la Ciudad. A partir de entonces la secuencia es: 1) La Ciudad recibe 2 puntos de daño, 2) Se resuelven los rondeles y 3) Se resuelven las mecánicas de la Ciudad. Esto continúa hasta que el Gigante sea derrotado o destruya la Ciudad.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event, Bias, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Events, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Rondel, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Stat Check Resolution, Stock Holding, Variable Player Powers

name: Raven Manor
description:
Something strange has been happening in the Manor lately. Black feathers appeared all around the Manor, seemingly out of nowhere. Members of the Family started to act out of character and some have died under mysterious circumstances. But these are no accidents - someone is pulling the strings behind the scenes and he needs to be stopped as soon as possible. Can the surviving members of the Family find and kill him before it’s too late?

Raven Manor is a social deduction party game with stunning dark graphics, inspired by Sin City comics and with easy-to-learn rules that lead to deep gameplay.

One of you will play as the Raven. The rest will take on the role of the Family. As the Raven, your goal is to possess or kill the other players. As the Family, you must use your wits and deduction skills to uncover the Raven's identity and eliminate them before it's too late. Death doesn’t stop you from enjoying the game. If you’re killed, you’re playing just as before, but with a restriction - from now on you can’t kill anyone else. No more waiting for other players to finish the game!

Use deduction, lie, bluff and simply have a good time with your friends. Will you be able to catch the Raven?
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: For All Mankind
description:
For All Mankind is a fast-paced game of strategic exploration, clever trades, and diplomatic shenanigans. Build your empire across the ever changing solar system (careful, the planets move!). Gather, trade, and invest your resources. And do whatever it takes to stay ahead of the competition.

Expand: Grow your empire with colonies (more loot!), research (more power!), and espionage (more nukes!).

Scheme: All is fair in interplanetary domination, but you would never double-cross a friend… right?

Profit: Be the first to reach 10 points, and see your name etched in the stars forever!

Learn to play in about 15 minutes.
Finish a game in about 60 minutes.
The most fun you’ll ever have blowing up your friends in space, guaranteed!
mechanics: Chaining, Income, Negotiation, Resource to Move, Take That, Trading, Variable Set-up

name: Sea of War
description:
Sea of War is a tactical naval warfare card game, based in the age of the wooden battleships, that you can take anywhere and play with anyone!

Each game is made for 2-4 players, but you can combine game sets and expand play space to add in as many players as you would like.

The object of the game is simple... Destroy all of your enemies ships before they destroy yours! Be the victor by rolling attack dice against their ships and hope they don't succeed on their rolls to defend.

The game includes rules for beginner, intermediate, and advanced play, so your game can be changed to fit your desires!
This rule set allows for approachable, exciting, and challenging strategy based play!

It is a turn based game. Each turn you will roll a die to see how many of your ships (cards) will move . Will you get to move your entire fleet? Or will you hit the Doldrums and just twiddle your thumbs?

Once your ships have moved into firing range of an enemy ship, you can send a cannonball volley over to the enemy ships! Roll to attack!
It is that simple. Well... So it seems.

The beginner rules are great for those new to tactical style games.
Those more familiar with Tactical warfare games will enjoy the intermediate and advanced rules. These rules allow you to make the game a little more difficult, testing the strategy skills of your friends and yourself!
Will you use tactical ramming to cause more damage before you give the full broadside? Or will you use a hit and run tactic with your small, fast ships?

Finally, the versatile campaign options let you have a fleet you can boast over…! Until they are sent to Davy Jones’ Locker, that is!

Sea of War was created to give those that love tactical play a chance to get their friends involved without having to spend hours to learn. A game that you can learn quickly and play anywhere.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Good Dog, Bad Zombie: Weird Smells
description:
In the first expansion, Weird Smells, you’ll add new adventures, strategies, and components to the game! Chase the golden bone around the city, go on missions to help hoomans in need, join forces with the zombie slayer, and learn tricks like “Roll Over!” to help you take on the apocalypse.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – The Official Rules
description:
Hello again, sports fans! Blood Bowl – the legendary game of fantasy football – returns for a new season of ultra-violent sports mayhem. The plays are bigger, the hits are harder, and every game will be filled with moments to remember.

No two matchups are the same. From the moment your team stomps out on the gridiron, your grit, wits, and capacity for grievous violence is put to the test. The action’s fast and furious, but if you keep your head in the game you just might best your opponent and score the most points – or make sure they can’t get back up to stop you. Fame, wealth, and glory await if you win…

Every coach, whether fresh-faced and green or hoary old pros, needs a copy of this essential update.

This 136-page hardback book is absolutely stuffed with everything a budding coach needs to know about Blood Bowl.


The History of Blood Bowl: from the ancient origins of the game, surrounded in myth and legend, to the evolution of the modern sport. The story of Blood Bowl is as wild as the fanatics who love it.
 Rules and Regulations: streamlined and updated for the Second Season Edition. Everything is explored in detail, from the basics, to recruiting a team, through to the actions your players can take, and the aftermath of the game.
 League vs Exhibition Games: Blood Bowl can be played as one-off matches, and long-running leagues with loads of coaches competing for the top prize. Learn all about both.
Blood Bowl Teams: Updated rules including new Region and Team Special Rules, a tiered ranking system, and rosters for all 21 current teams.
 Star Players: Every named Star Player now has their own Special Rule. Find current profiles for 23 of them here.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Violent Skies: 1940 – Dynamo to the Blitz
description:
Sat inside the cockpit with the engine rattling through your bones, you turn to engage. Managing your energy and fuel, can you gain position to get a shot off? Or will the bandit get the better of you? Sometimes it is better to disengage than push a losing fight.

Violent Skies is a solitaire game of aerial combat in the Second World War. Using a game card that acts as your Cockpit and also as a mission generator. The player and Bandit take alternating actions to try and get a shot on the opposition's aircraft.

This first season of games puts you in the cockpit of the main fighters during the tumultuous months after the invasion of France. Starting with the aerial operations over Dynamo (the Dunkirk Evacuation) to the Battle of Britain and the last daylight bombing raid as the Blitz starts, you will be flying sorties, shooting down bandits and trying your best to survive.
Each sortie lasts between 5-10 minutes, and the player has a logbook to advance their career. As the player completes a campaign, they have the option to keep the logbook and continue their career in different aircraft and theatres.

All is needed is at least four D6, a small marker for the advantage track, and a pen or pencil for the logbook. Everything else is included in the minimal construction print and play PDF. Three optional counters are included and need to be folded and cut out but the rest is ready straight off the printer.

Included as flyable aircraft are the Spitfire MkI/II, Hurricane Mk1, Bf109E3/4, Bf-110C.

Each aircraft comes with two sortie cards (your cockpit and mission generator), campaign tables, optional damage table, Skills sheet and counters.

There are Logbooks for the Lufrwaffe and RAF in low ink and full colour, as well as a detailed example of play.

-description from designer
