.....and remember, watch out for the "Hun in the Sun" and never underestimate a "fat old puffer"
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Daitoshi
description:
We have finally perfected the power of steam, and we can now use it to our advantage! We live in an unprecedented era of progress, and new steam-powered inventions are developed faster than ever. Cities are growing, trade is flourishing, and we are developing our most ambitious machine ever: a giant contraption that will bring even more progress to the city. Yes, some trees are being cut down, and the river doesn't flow as plentifully as before, but there's still an abundance of trees and water, and we can use the extra space to expand our city — and it's not like the old creatures on those forests can do anything about it.

On your turn in Daitoshi, you either produce or move your magnate to a new district in which you will be able to send your workers to work, command the exploit of forest or river hexes to fuel your endless need for steam, and perform an action to expand and show your greatness to the city.

These actions not only help you in your search for acknowledgement, but help all the inhabitants of the big city. You will expand the city and electrify its districts, discover and develop new steam-powered inventions, and trade with faraway cities. You may even help the city build its gargantuan project: the mega-machine. Some forests might be cut down, and some rivers may be dried up, but in your generosity, you will help the displaced workers from those areas by giving them new jobs at your service.

Old legends suggest the forests and rivers are guarded by Yōkai, but progress can't be stopped because of some old fairy tales. Just in case, though, it could be wise to participate on some reforestation projects and hide your participation in the abuse of the natural resources...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Arkendom Conquista Starter Set
description:
Arkendom Conquista Starter Set is a competitive game of cards and dice for 2 or 4 players, which simulates field battles in the fantasy world of Arkendom.
By leading their armies against enemies, players can take control upon terrains and resources to secure victory.

Arkendom is a mysterious world rich of amazing landscapes
and mythological beings, first of all the ancient Titans of the past. After their fall, humans became the leading force of recent history, through the pride for their various cultural legacies. Some populations live deep in their Middle Ages, while some more advanced ones are stepping in their Renaissance. The actual present is an age of discoveries, wars, exoduses and trades, in which humans try to comprehend and to master the many wonders of this ancient and magical world.

—description from the publisher (translated)

ARKENDOM CONQUISTA è un gioco competitivo di carte e dadi per 2 o 4 giocatori che simula battaglie nel mondo fantasy di Arkendom.
Guidando le loro armate contro i nemici, i giocatori possono prendere il controllo di territori e risorse per assicurarsi la vittoria.
Arkendom è un mondo misterioso ricco di paesaggi strabilianti e di esseri mitologici, primi fra tutti gli antichi Titani del passato. Dopo il loro declino, gli umani sono diventati i protagonisti della storia recente, forti delle loro varie individualità culturali. Alcuni popoli sono in pieno Medioevo, mentre altri sono sulla soglia del loro Rinascimento. Quella attuale è un’era di scoperte, guerre, esodi e commerci, in cui gli umani tentano di comprendere e dominare le meraviglie di questo antico e magico mondo.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Command Cards, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Income, Interrupts, King of the Hill, Line of Sight, Re-rolling and Locking, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Square Grid, Stat Check Resolution, Tags, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Covert Cues: The Deduction Game
description:
Covert Cues is an ingenious social deduction game for 3-12 players about slick double meanings and spy talk, revolving around the premise of 2 hidden individuals attempting to discover who each other are by referencing their secret code word without being caught by the public.

"The Hacker and the insider Admin have planned to finally meet face to face at the monthly office meeting, in order to finalise their plans to blackmail the company.

Amongst a group of regular users, the Hacker and the Admin will attempt to identify each other by using their hidden code word.

However, the company has been made aware of the potential of an inside job and users will be alert and observant for any suspicious behaviour. If their plans are exposed, there will be drastic consequences."

Here is the Link to Order!
https://covert-cues-the-deduction-game.backerkit.com/hosted_...

Play the online version of the game here: https://tabletopia.com/games/covert-cues-the-deduction-game
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Player Judge, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game

name: Henchmania: Second Edition
description:
In this cross between Game Of Thrones and Monty Python become a medieval Lord and puppet master, and use your monstrous and loyal henchmen who will do ANYTHING to help their master satiate his thirst for prestige!

A second edition with a lot of changes: new gameplay, new design and even 2 new expansions to come!
These 2 new expansions will be included in the box during the Kickstarter campaign (from the main pledge). They also will be available separately as an upgrade pack for the ones who owns and supported the first edition

Henchmania is a strategic board game taking place in an odd medieval universe. Each player is the Lord of one family, among four. With the help of your loyal henchmen, capture parts of the city and use your influence to win the battle! The objective is to win as many prestige points as possible in four days, or to be the first player to reach 30 prestige points. There are many ways to earn (and also lose) prestige points! At the end of each day, everyone counts their points before the beginning of the next day.

So battle, strut, pray, denigrate... It's a no-holds-barred war to become the new seneschal of Montfleury!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: War of the Ring: The Card Game – Fire and Swords
description:
This second expansion for Ian Brody's War of the Ring: The Card Game introduces new scenarios to the base game, including one that allows to play with up to six people.

In addition to that, War of the Ring: The Card Game – Fire and Swords features 60 faction cards, 9 new paths, 9 new battlegrounds, and 13 skirmishes, a new type of battleground to represent the smaller settlements and fortifications of the War of the Ring, places like the Fords of Isen and Bree. This expansion adds three new factions to the game: Northmen for the Free Peoples; and Easterlings and Ruffians for the Shadow.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Novel-based
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Apex K-Truck Racer
description:
Apex K-Truck Racer is a resource allocation competitive racing board game in which two to six players take on the role of truck drivers who guide their vehicles, fueled by kinetic power cubes, on smuggling missions through the abandoned streets and roads of the old world. The K-trucker who earns more reputation points throughout the game is declared the winner.

Thematically, the game begins immediately after the players have successfully stolen from a Corporation Conglomerate, collecting some cargo and a bit of information that reveals secret warehouses along the escape route, where more resources are hidden. Each game represents a smuggling run from point A, the Conglomerate gates, to point B, the agreed-upon Drop Spot.

The game is played over a series of rounds in which each player takes actions to manage the allocation of K-Cubes on different areas of the truck to add speed, power-up its guns or to activate the drone sidekick that improves the vehicle. By doing this, truckers create unique strategies to achieve different goals during the mission, which reward them with prestige among their peers and employers.

Players must be quick because the Corporation is hunting down the smugglers to recover its resources. Players must also keep an eye out for the other Truckers, who will try everything they can to collect additional cargo and get to the destination first, even if that means shooting down another truck.

—description from the designer

AWARDS & HONORS

2018 - Luso Design Awards (Portugal) - Product Design - Bronze
2018 - Luso Design Awards (Portugal) - Product Art - Bronze
2018 - Catarse Board Game Prototype Contest (Brazil) - Top 5
2018 - The Game Crafter´s Board Game Rules Sanity Test - 66/80.
2020 - The Game Crafter´s Board Game Rules Sanity Test - 77/80.
"Trucker combat race game has easy to follow rules and looks like it can carry a heavy load of fun." (Gamecrafter, June 2020)
mechanics: Action Queue, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Banker of the Gods
description:
Banker of the Gods is a game about superstitious civilizations competing on a friendly stock-market set in an ancient Japanese-inspired world. It has a unique stock-market mechanism that allows for deduction of market trends before you invest for the next round. There are over a million different kinds of markets to be generated. The market may booming during this game, and other games you will have a depression to survive or thrive in.

A medium-weight worker placement game for 1-5 players. In this alternate universe China, Egypt, Greece, and Rome have been attracted to a lucrative stock-market on Oki island in ancient Japan. Besides stocks you may also try to succeed at having other players honor your Gods and harnessing their powers, or by dabbling with products like Sake (linked to the price of rice), or helping islanders by giving them home-loans for the best locations, or even trying your luck with tea-leaves at the Geisha house, among other things. All illustrated in a colorful Japanese wood-block art style.

Traditionally stock market games have unfriendly take-that, Banker of the Gods doesn't.
vMaster the ancient art of banking to become the Banker of the Gods.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement, Worker Placement

name: Warfighter 101: Asian Thunder
description:
(from publisher's website)

The Iranian push toward the Azeri capital of Baku has to go thru the border city of Salyan. As the Azeris and Iranians battle it out, the Russians and Americans both make cameos. Lots of open tank country surrounding a city that hugs a river, and makes for some challenging maneuver

Asian Thunder covers the opening battles of a hypothetical war between Iran and Azerbaijan. On their march north, the Iranians must subdue the border city of Salyan, but the Azeris are defending on their home turf.

A challenging map has a swath or urban terrain along the river, with wide-open flanks. Forces include Iranian and Azeri infantry, armor, recon, and attack helicopters. Local insurgents, Russian paratroopers, and a company of American infantry also make appearances.

The Warfighter series brings modern maneuver combat to the tabletop at the tactical level. Units are platoons and sections, with some individual vehicles and leaders. Counters are a robust 7/8" square, with values for firepower, armor, range, and movement, plus the occasional frontal armor of zone of control. Maps are designed to correspond to US military maps, replacing 1000m grid squares with large hexes. Scenarios are written as 5-paragraph-style Operations Orders, which are kept under wraps so neither player knows his opponents' exact mission.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Paired Up: Fame & Fortune
description:
The Fame & Fortune card set expands Paired Up with more cards. On each card, one pair is shown in red as a "fame and fortune" pair, such as a famous celebrity couple.

Expands:

Paired Up
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game

name: Hawalis
description:
Hawalis is an old game for two players that belongs to the Mancala family of pit and seeds games. This game is played in Oman.

The game is played on the board with 4 rows of pits. At the beginning of the game each pit contains two seeds. The goal of the game is to capture all opponent's seeds.
mechanics: Mancala

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module G3A – Supplementary Annexes
description:
From the back of the book:

Module G3A: Supplementary Annexes includes additional annexes with key daya covering the entire Alpha Octant, completely updated and in some cases entirely new.

Table of Contents: Covering the entire Star Fleet Battles game system for the Alpha Octant.

Annex #5 Abbreviations: An updated and complete list of all those codenames and pesky acronyms.

Carrier Escort Tables: AN entirely new annex never before available in printed form, this lists every carrier in the Alpha Octant and its ever-changing escort and fighter groups.

Master Scenario Index: Listing every ALpha Sector Star Fleet Battles scenario, including year, number of ships, which empires were involved, and special features. A secondary index allows players to access the Master Scenario Index by year.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Destruction of SPI Center
description:
"Destruction of SPI Center" is a tongue-in-cheek wargame by Greg Costikyan, self published when he was a playtester at SPI.

The map was inspired by what looks like a fire alarm/evac map like you may see posted in your workplace.

The idea is the SPI trolls (playtesters) are in revolt against their SPI masters, Howie Barasch, Jim Dunnigan, Terry Hardy et al.

The object is to run around knocking people out in an attempt to take over the building, the SPI guys can knock out playtesters and drag them to the elevator, having the security guard remove them from the building.

The weapons are dice, the soda whoosh guys have their soft drinks, a few other items to spice up the mix, a Sherman tank in the store room!

Victory is gauged on how quickly you clear the building, taking into consideration that the pizza delivery every night at 8 pm stuns the playtesters into a mass move to the break room!

The game also includes the lyrics to "We're an Armenian Band"
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Badges & Bullets
description:
Badges & Bullets is a cooperative game set in the old west. Players will take turns protecting the town's bank from pesky outlaws and preparing for inevitable jail breaks. The game is won once all outlaws are successfully routed, and the day is lost when the towns funds have all been robbed or all the deputies are dust in the wind.

To help them in their goal, they can visit town locations such as the saloon, mines, train station, etc. Each location offers different tactics in dealing with these desparadoes.

Players will also have a choice of which role they want to fill in the town, such as the sharpshooter, the preacher, the town drunk, or even the sheriff himself.

The town needs your help but you're gonna need quick wits and an even quicker trigger finger to save the day.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Blitzkrieg Met: Stonne
description:
Blitzkrieg Met: The Battle of Stonne: May 15-16, 1940, is an introductory level game of the battle between the Allied Armed forces and Germany's Wehrmacht on May 21st and 22nd, 1940. he Germans launched Operation Yellow, the invasion of France and the Low Countries, on May 10, 1940. The main German offensive, dubbed the Sichelschnitt (razor cut), struck through the lightly defended Ardennes Forest and emerged at Sedan. Alarmed at the prospect of a German breakout here, and the collapsing defense at Sedan, the French ordered an immediate counter-attack. General Heinz Guderian, however, had already ordered the bulk of the German panzer formations to breakout from the Sedan bridgehead, and ordered the Gross Deutchland Regiment, with a supporting Kampfgruppe formed from the 8th Panzer Division to take and hold the high ground at Stonne, to guard the German's bridgehead over the Meuse River and expanding flank. For the first, and only, time during the 1940 campaign, Guderian's Panzers ran into the premier French tank, the Char B1-Bis, as the French counter attacked to reduce the Sedan bridgehead. Over three days, the town of Stonne changed hands 17 times as German and French armored forces dueled for the strategic high-ground overlooking Sedan.

This is the fifth game in the Blitzkrieg in the West Series, covering the battle at an operational scale. The game is designed for 2 players, taking on the roles of the French and German commanders, but is suitable for solitaire play as well.

The High Flying Dice Games edition features all new graphics by Bruce Yearian.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1.5 hours
Hex: 1/2 miles / 0.8 kilometer
Units: Company

Game Inventory:
One 11x17" full color map
One single-side printed un-mounted countersheet (180 1/2" counters)(mounted counters are optional)
One 6-page rulebook
Two Player Aid Charts (TEC/CRT)

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 1.5 to 2 hours
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: The Replay World of International Athletics: Part II – The Field Events
description:
Statistical sports game. Part two of a series of two games, the first featured Track Events. Now the throwers and jumpers take centre stage.

Masses of athletes rated in various areas dependent on their event and abilites. Dice rolls are compared to charts to determine the outcome of an action.

Replay your own Olympics at home.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Liberators!
description:
Liberators! Books and Miniatures allow you to recreate the Wars of South American Independence on your game table. Liberators! Books give you all the information you need to learn about and game this fascinating period. The books include the history of the conflict; organization, tactics and uniforms of the armies and scenarios to play including map and order of battle information. Liberators! Miniatures are a museum quality range of "heroic" scale 15mm figures that allow you to build the armies listed in the scenarios...or to create scenarios of your own!

The game features:


Players take the role of a brigade or division commander in the South America Independence War in the XIX Century.



Take your side as Liberators Armies of the North “Simon Bolivar” or South “San Martin” Against the Royalist Spanish Army Forces.



Build your armies with information on military uniformology, the colors pattern and symbols of the XIX Century independence Era; like Gran Colombian Army, Llanero/Peasant infantry, Argentine Grenadiers, Royalist/Spanish Infantry or even Irish/British legion forces involved in the conflict.



The game is tactical in nature, focusing on the movement of individual battalions and regiments of cavalry and use of artillery units.



The game is designed to cover different periods of time, divided into several volumes, including data on the theaters of operations involved in every war and the organization of the armies involved.



Numerous scenarios each side and ready to be played
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Dogknot
description:
Knot so very far away - is a 'Special' place. A warm and wonderful place.
It is known as "The World That's Knot"
It is home of all the Knots that have abandoned their place in the trees - and lumber - in search of their family. The "Knot Family".
The Dogknots are a precious pet of the Knot family. They are sweet and playful, however very protective of the Knots.
The Dogknot's only flaw - they are fascinated by the 'Butterknotfly'
They are easily sidetracked when a 'Butterknotfly' is present, and are very likely to forget what they were doing adn wander off to follow the 'Butterknotfly'.
Dognkots protect the 'Knot Family' from the 'Termiknots' as their long tongues can lash out in a heartbeat and snap them up.
The Dogknots often lose their way back to "The World That's Knot", and the Knot that collects the most Dogknots to return to "The World That's Knot" is honored as the 'Knot Hero'.

Dogknot consists of 3 individual games which can be played separately or together.

Dogknot: Return the lost 'Knot Hero' to the "World That's Knot" and celebrate becoming the 'Knot Hero'. Roll for a Dogknot card or retrieve them by landing on a draw card square.

Knotdoing: Add even more excitement and challenge by combining the fun of charades using the "Knotdoing" cards.

Knot Poker: Substitute the draw cards with "Knot Poker" cards. At the end of the game each player exposes his best five cards to strive for the best "Knot Poker" hand.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: A Call to Arms: Star Fleet – Gorn Fleet Box
description:
Publisher's Blurb:

The Fleet Boxes are designed for use with any game set in the Star Fleet Universe, including A Call to Arms: Star Fleet, Star Fleet Battles, Federation Commander, and Starmada. Each contains enough ships for a complete fleet in these games and will allow players to quickly expand their forces.

This box set contains 16 ships for the Confederation of the Gorn, along with 6 shuttles and a pocket rulebook – all you need to start playing!


Dreadnought
Battlecruiser
Destroyer x3
Light Cruiser x3
Medium Cruiser
Heavy Battlecruiser
Fast Battlecruiser
Heavy Destroyer x2
Battle Destroyer x3
Shuttles x6
Pocket Rulebook


This product is being done as a joint venture with Amarillo Design Bureau, inc., under the strict terms of their contract with Paramount Pictures Corporation.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: PowerBot Dice
description: A Robot dice combat game with 2 leveling cards(Hit, Power), also a Combo card. Remove your opponents Life points to be the last PowerBot standing.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Question Quest: The Language Card Game
description:
From publisher:

Welcome to the world of Question Quest! It's a wondrous place where language learning happens amid adventure, excitement, and strategic gameplay.

Each turn players compete for Crystal Points by asking and answering questions in conversational English. But things get wild when Special Cards like "What's your answer?" and "Tell me more!" enter the mix! The Crystal Rush is on!

Question Quest is a card game for 2-6 players, playable in 20-40 minutes.

Players take turns asking each other questions in English. Players score points by answering questions correctly or by asking questions that their opponents answer incorrectly.

The game ends when the last card is drawn or at the end of the allotted time. The player with the most points is the winner!
mechanics: Storytelling

name: History Maker Baseball: Famous Fall Classics Card Set
description:
"Famous Fall Classics" Card Set expansion for History Maker Baseball

Individual cards for over 400 real-life big-league baseball players based on eight different World Series championships: 1947, 1954, 1965, 1968, 1971, 1972, 1985 and 1986.

1947 AL New York vs. 1947 NL Brooklyn
1954 AL Cleveland vs. 1954 NL New York
1965 AL Minnesota vs. 1965 NL Los Angeles
1968 AL Detroit vs. 1968 NL St. Louis
1971 AL Baltimore vs. 1971 NL Pittsburgh
1972 AL Oakland vs. 1972 NL Cincinnati
1985 AL Kansas City vs. 1985 NL St. Louis
1986 AL Boston vs. 1986 NL New York

Includes 27 cards for each team, individual cards for each of the series' actual umpires, as well as ball park cards and suggested batting orders.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Honor Bound
description:
From the publisher's website:

Read your opponent! Bluff your way to victory!

The game is about analyzing the state of play and using the knowledge to anticipate your opponent's moves. This cuts both ways: the abilities of the cards you select, your posture, your banter, and the content of your character all give your opponent insight into what your move may be - if you let it.

Gameplay is similar to Rock, Paper, or Scissors however, you declare what attack you intend to use prior to revealing it. If you lied, well, that's fine, but if you told the truth you gain Honor Points which will enable you to deal more damage later on! Do you dare risk dealing more damage at the risk of becoming predictable?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Top Gun
description: Top Gun is a military aviation exercise. Each player has 6 aircraft. All take off from the same runway. During the flight planes can be shot down if it stops on a field where anti-aircraft guns operate. Every plane that succeed to land on second runway gets one point. During the flight, the planes can drop a bomb on a target. Each target hit is worth 1 point. Planes can also shoot down planes from other teams. For each downed plane also receives one point. When all the airplanes complete their flight - the players count points. The winner is the player who has the most points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: The Lost Land Adventure
description:
THE LOST LAND ADVENTURE is a board game that features dinosaurs and with innovative components that makes it stand out to other games its type, such as:

Random box system that makes each match different from the other
Play as the great T. Rex or play as your favorite dinosaur
You have fun learning or learn having fun with the trivia cards
Situations, traps and objects that can change the results


LA TIERRA PERDIDA AVENTURA es un juego de mesa con dinosaurios pero que tiene componentes innovadores que lo diferencian de los demás, cómo:

Sistema de casillas aleatorias que hace que cada partida sea diferente
Juega como el T. rex o como tu dinosaurio favorito
Te diviertas aprendiendo o aprendes jugando con las tarjetas trivia
Situaciones, trampas y objetos que pueden cambiar el resultado de la partida
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Educational, Fighting, Mature / Adult, Prehistoric
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battle of France
description:
Battle of France is a board game for two players. There are three levels. In the first level are single engine fighters. In the second level are added twin engine fighters. In the third level participate bombers.

The main characteristic is that the game board is covered with a net of equilateral triangles. The vertices of these triangles are points at which players hold the position and move figurines.

The objective is to shoot down all enemy planes. One figurine can shoot on enemy figurine by moving behind it. The game continues until one player runs out of the plane (first and second level). The main objective in third level is for bombers to pass into bombing zone.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simulation

name: 7 Summits:  A Mountaineering Challenge
description:
7 Summits: A Mountaineering Challenge is a game for one to four players in which players test their mountaineering skills against the highest mountain on each continent. First player to climb the seven mountains wins the game!

Choose which mountains you want to climb at your own pace and in any order that you want. There are ten different mountains from which to choose, each with unique statistics and rewards for successfully climbing them.

Use up to four gear pieces to prevent deadly accidents represented with a roll of the dice. Upgrade your acclimatization to prevent altitude sickness. Choose which climber cards you want to upgrade as you draw them to increase your movement speed on a mountain.

There are many risks for which you must prepare in this difficult challenge of climbing the highest mountain on each of the seven continents, and there are many people who want to climb them before you do. How will you attempt this deadly challenge?
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Sector Prime
description:
Sector Prime is a fast paced, light 4X board game using a balanced dice rolling mechanic that avoids a runaway winner and also keeps the game exciting and balanced right to the end. The unique design of the tiles provides a completely new game board each time, requiring players to adapt the strategies each time they play!

Each player represents a mining faction seeking to control the mining rights to the sector. You need to control enough planetary systems to mine the needed materials to complete the construction of your Mining Station
In each turn there are 3 phases:

(1) Explore.
By a roll of the dice move your mining drones to new planet tiles.

(2) Expand or Exterminate.
You must choose to either invade and attack another mining faction OR to build defenses, new routes of exploration or a section of your Station thus bringing you one step closer to victory.

(3) Exploit.
In this phase you gather the results of your mining operations. You can simply gather the minimum OR you can gamble by pushing your drones produce double. Be careful, because this isn't always successful.

The first player to complete construction of their Station wins the game!
categories: Dice, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Hallux Rigidus
description:
Each person plays the role of a character that returns to the town of Hallux Rigidus to gather evidence to discover the cause of the horrors that plague this small community.
Once the cause is discovered, the players travel to the location in an attempt to end the horrors and save the town. The first player to successfully accomplish this, and retain his or her sanity, is the winner!

Don't share your evidence with each other, one of you is the antagonist.
mechanics: Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Stormcloud Attack: The Ancient & The Greater Good
description:
From the publisher:

The sky shall be your grave.

The galaxy of the 41st millennium burns, trapped in an unending war, with every race set against every other, in all imaginable theatres of war. A vital component of these battles is the desperate struggle for aerial superiority: wings of aircraft engaging in spectacular dogfights, weaving through storms of bullet hell, swooping into valleys to shake off enemies before unleashing incredible firepower, climbing at stunning speed to gain the perfect angle for a volley of missiles… the skies darken with fleets of combat aircraft vying for superiority, with the unfortunate second-best falling from the sky in spiralling pieces.

Stormcloud Attack: The Ancient & The Greater Good is an exciting stand-alone boxed game for two players, pitting flying machines from the 41st millennium against each other in thrilling single combat. It features a Necron Night Scythe and a Tau Empire AX38 Razorshark Strike Fighter, with an eighty-page softback Flight Manual detailing the awesome rules for stunning dogfighting manoeuvres, with a massive selection of missions, duels and dogfights.

CAMPAIGNS

The included Flight Manual contains a comprehensive guide to running your own Stormcloud Attack campaign – any number of players can take part, tracking the exploits of their pilot over the course of several engagements with a Pilot Record Card, watching them grow from a fresh-faced rookie to a grizzled fighter Ace. Each rank they gain grants them new and better abilities, meaning you can become a death-dealing monster of the skies and send your mates crashing and burning. Remember, there are no points for second best!

There’s even an exclusive transfer sheet with Ace decals and more included.

Also included are optional rules for Air Assaults – create special operations, capture ground targets and transport troops to and from important mission objectives.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Connections Card Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

The 'Connections Card' Game is all about conceptually connecting words found on adjacent cards. It can be described simply as a cross between Scrabble™ and Dominoes.

The game contains 124 cards with 496 English words. Each card has four family-friendly words (one per edge) and a point value between 1 and 5.

There are 17 ways to play the game.

In the basic Classic Mode, players compete to get the highest score by connecting related words. For example, TEACHER can be connected with STUDENT, SCHOOL, RESPECT, LEARNING, JOB as well as a dozen other words.

Hilarious dialog begins when someone attempts a dubious connection and has to “sell” it to the group. This makes it a game about connecting people.

This family and party game is for use at home and school as well as corporate office team building.

The compact box is suitable for travel, camp and cottage.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Voting

name: Loot Pirates
description:
Loot Pirates is a pirate-themed party game where the players point guns at one another in order to divvy up the pirate loot.

Each player takes the role of a pirate crew with one player acting as captain. Each round, the captain calls out "Ready! Set! Aim!" and players simultaneously point their guns at each other in order to acquire their targets doubloons. Players parlay and negotiate in order not to get shot. Alternatively, they may run away. Any pirates left standing at the end of the round get a share of the booty. Gameplay continues until the loot is all divvied up. The pirate with the most loot at the end of the game wins and becomes captain for the next game.
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Nautical, Negotiation, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Anomaly
description:
Anomaly is a 4x sci-fi board game experience about deep space exploration, resource management, space stations and combat which plays in 30-60 minutes.

Anomaly is a science fiction board game for 2-4 players about deep space exploration, resource management, space stations and combat. Take control of one of four alien races, each with their own unique abilities and tactics. At the helm of your civilization’s deep space explorer fleet you must explore the universe, expand your territory, exploit every resource and, if it comes to it, exterminate your opposition.

Anomaly is designed as a full 4X experience that plays out within a time frame of 40-60 minutes. Anomaly offers high-grade components and a simple set of rules that allows for both tactical and strategic decision-making as well as fluid, immersive game play.

As you explore the universe, you will discover Anomalies that generate the win conditions for each particular game. Four unique player races, 6 Anomalies, 38 Upgrades and a random combination of 19 different space Sector tiles will grant you many hours of deep space exploration!

-- description from the publisher:
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1994 Cards
description:
Payoff Pitch Baseball: 1994 Cards is a set of 1,018 cards — including players and parks — printed on high-gloss heavy cardstock for use with the Payoff Pitch Baseball base game.

L/R splits on batter cards as with all Payoff Pitch Baseball sets.
mechanics: Dice Rolling
publishers: PT Games, Inc., Sideline Strategy Games

name: Dust Tactics: KV-47B (TSH) Light Gun Walker – "Natasha"
description: The most common variant of tropical KV47 in use, with its dual Howitzers Natasha has a very interesting weapon system when facing elite infantry. Its explosive shells are very efficient against any cover behind which enemy soldiers could hide.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Nuclear War: 250 Megatons
description:
Destroys 60 million.

Promotional card (no details available).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Rhino The Game
description:
Rhino The Game® is a trick-taking card and token game for 2 to 6 players. A Rhino deck consists of 55 premium playing cards: a special set of 52 playing cards numbered 0-12 in four color suits, along with two "Big Five" Bonus cards, and one Super Safari card. Each player begins the game with their own set of five special character tokens representing the "Big Five" African mammals - rhinoceros, elephant, lion, leopard, and Cape buffalo. Each token has unique properties to influence game scoring and may only be used once during the course of the game.

The object of the game is to bid correctly on the exact number of tricks that a player will take (win) in each subsequent round of play. Points are awarded for a correct bid and are either zero or negative for an incorrect bid. The player with most points after all rounds have been played is declared the winner. The game is played in 13 rounds with the number of cards dealt per round varying from seven to one and back to seven. Player strategy combining with statistical probability (chance) interacts the effects of dealt cards, Bonus Cards, and the character tokens. Multiple skill levels of play and a partner option with 4 or 6 players is available. Designed for ages 14 and up. However, younger precocious children may also pick up this game rapidly especially when guided by an experienced player.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Oathen
description:
A highly replayable fantasy based game designed to mimic the feel and pace of competitive arena e-sports. Oathen uses six heroes with their own unique playstyles and skill decks, it comes with three game modes, and a dynamically changing arena that makes each match unique.

Adventure into a randomly generated game board full of traps and treasures, where you will battle it out for the title of arena champion. Players will pre-plan their turns ahead of time, studying their competitors and finding the right combination of abilities to grant them victory. Will your oathen hero unleash a flurry of blows against your target? Or will the other players play defensively to negate your attacks?

Combat carries out one ability at a time, each player playing their next chosen action. The strongest of abilities will then go on cooldown, and will be unavailable for use until a certain number of turns has passed. Plan correctly, and you could pull off amazing combos - fail, and you may be exposed to such attacks yourself.

The arena is constructed with 36 of 52 total locations, providing boosts and traps that can alter your battle, and making every game into a unique match. Oathen also comes with different game modes, including arena, capture the flag, and round table.

Choose between six Oathen champions to play as. Each one plays differently with 20 unique abilities to plan - including an ultimate ability that can turn the tides of battle. Future expansions will increase the number of heroes to 24, including defensive characters, healers, and devastating damage dealers.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: BRAINBO!
description:
Players race to get rid of all their seven cards by matching them with the card uppermost on the discard pile. There are no turns, so players have to keep their eyes open and brains switched on.

The game's matching mechanics are based upon the Stroop effect. Two different modes mean that things are never simple and the matching method can reverse at any given moment; colour>word or word>colour.

Punishments for incorrect matches and two different types of special cards spice things up a bit.

—description of the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Hamadryad 1797 / HMS Mahonesa 1796
description:
The HMS Hamadryad, before her capture, was named “Ninfa” — a 36–gun Spanish frigate built at Mahon, on the island of Minorca. After her capture, Ninfa was taken to Gibraltar where she was commissioned under Thomas Elphinstone as HMS Hamadryad. After capturing two privateers, her career as an English ship was a short one, as she sank whilst trying to shelter from a storm in Algiers Bay, on 25 December 1797.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the British Mahonesa class frigate “HMS Mahonesa 1796”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Battlegroup: Torch
description:
EGYPT, 1942... After defeat at the Battle of Gazala, the British 8th Army has been chased back through the western deserts, fighting a rearguard action to hold the line near a railway halt called El Alamein. Here, the tide of the desert war would turn decisively in the British’s favour. At El Alamein Rommel’s weary army was repeatedly defeated and forced into a very long retreat to save itself. Meanwhile, American and British troops land on the shores of Morocco and Algeria in Operation Torch, with the plan to cut-off the Germans by capturing Tunisia. A hard seven-month campaign would follow in the final struggle to capture North Africa.

• BACKGROUND A general overview of the later North Africa campaign, from Gazala, through three battles at El Alamein to Operation Torch and the Allies’ attack into Tunisia. With British, American and French forces of 1st Army in the north and 8th Army pursuing Rommel’s Panzer Armee Afrika to the Mareth Line, and then beyond, in the south. This book covers the desert fighting from May 1942 to May 1943 and the Axis’ ultimate surrender in Tunisia.

• ARMY LISTS Nine army lists designed to be played with the character of the principal combatants for North Africa: the veteran Deutsche Afrikakorps for 1942 and Defenders of Tunisia for 1943, Italian armoured and infantry divisions to face British (and Commonwealth) armoured and infantry divisions. Also, for Tunisia, the first combat operations for the US 1st Armoured Division and US infantry divisions, as well as ex-Vichy French ‘March’ divisions, now turned against their former Axis allies.

• SPECIAL RULES New special rules to adapt the core Battlegroup rules to the later North African battlefields. Recreating the character of desert fighting, with its dusty conditions, reliance on tank warfare and mobile formations, and the wearing effects of the harsh conditions. Also rules for the colder, muddy, difficult hill-country of northern Tunisia, a very different type of battlefield, all helping to create games with the distinctive feel for the end of the ‘desert’ war.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Breakaway Football: Weather Expansion
description:
Football is not only a game of X’s and O’s strategy, but also a game of mud and rain, of wind and frigid cold, of players adapting to the environment and mastering the elements to achieve victory.

Extreme cold has shaped the mythology of Pro Football, from the “Ice Bowl” in Green Bay to the “Freezer Bowl” in Cincinnati and “Red Right 88” in Cleveland. Snow, sleet, ice, and extreme cold change the conditions of the game and, as such, force coaches to adjust their strategies.

Rain imbues football with an epic scope. Weather is the great equalizer, where elite athletes are hobbled by wet hands, soft earth, and standing water. Add in wind and you’ve got "football weather."

With this new Breakaway Football: Weather Expansion, you can now experience these same epic coaching conditions at your own table.

The expansion set includes three custom play mats themed for Rain, Snow, and Wind. To achieve the effect of playing in weather, the expansion features two new Game Day decks - one themed for "Rain Day" and another cold weather "Snow Day" -as well as forecast cards with specific modifiers for each weather condition.

Wind is handled through new cards on the board that apply modifiers, making the kicking game more challenging. Strong enough wind can even affect the passing game.

The rule book for the Weather Expansion not only outlines these new mechanisms but also includes two templates for the new weather decks, which allows one card pull to determine the specific game conditions (forecast, wind speed/direction, temperature).

Experience epic drama in the elements with the Breakaway Football: Weather Expansion!

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management

name: Arcmage
description:
A libre fantasy style strategic card game

As you battle your opponents summoning creatures and casting spells, you’ll have to defend your cities, manage your resources and power supply and conjure up a strategical plan to beat your opponents. Will you be the one that brings order to the warring factions in Irdiya? Will you challenge all and utter the words ‘Amin duna, ilya lanta’?

This turn based game allows a player to gather resources, build cities, cast and move creatures, recruit an army, play magic spells or interrupt an opponents' play. Each turn the player may launch an attack on an a target city. On opponents' turns players may have to bravely defend their cities against the marauding enemy's army. Lose all of your cities and you're out of the game.

Following the tradition of many great CCG's, the game supports both casual as in depth strategic game play. Furthermore it offers an unique resource system and adds a spacial dimension that lets the player decide how and where to deploy their creatures.

—the arcmage team
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): Lizardmen
description:
Warhammer: Lizardmen is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Lizardmen faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: F.O.E.: Fortitude of Empires
description:
F.O.E. - Fortitude of Empires is a sci-fi dice battle board game, set in a solar system with multiple planets and 4 warring factions: The Narr, Eldin, Solitude and Sorn empires. The object of the game is to take over as many planets in the system while crushing the other empires and holding on to the planets you already occupy. Each turn players have the option to move one of their fleet of upto five ships, collect credits from occupied planets, terraform planets or install planet defences, upgrade their pilots, attack other empires (planets and ships) using battle dice and 6 dials ( Weapons / Shield / Armour / Agility / Special / Promotion ) on their empire’s combat boards which surround the main playing area. The battles can easily turn on the throw of a dice or the turning of a card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: DreadBall: Nemion Oceanics Sphyr Team
description:
The Sphyr are a solid and well-rounded team that draw on the heightened senses of their aquatic ancestry. They are hard to surprise, and are masterful in the use of their fifth limb - their powerful tail. They eschew fancy tactics, but have little in the way of obvious weaknesses. For this reason they are a reliable team that is far harder to beat than many opponents expect.

—description from the team card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dog Boats: Battle of the Narrow Seas
description:
Dog Boats: Battle of the Narrow Seas is a tactical-level wargame where you (as the Captain) take the command of either a Royal Navy Fairmile D motor gunboat (MGB) squadron or Vosper 72' motor torpedo boat (MTB) squadron in either the English Channel or North Sea from 1943-1944. Your main goal is to survive the war while sinking as many enemy ships as you and your squadron can.

Enemies you and your crewmen will face include a variety of enemy ships, including E-boats, R-Boats, and patrol aircraft. Weather conditions and sea state are also modeled.

The player will move his squadron through various travel boxes on a map of the English Channel or North Sea during each mission on his way to the patrol area, then must successfully return back to home base.

Game components include a crewmen placement mats, strategic map mat, several Tables books, crewmen status sheets, campaign log sheet, and counter sheets representing individual MGBs, MTBs, enemy aircraft, warships, etc.

—description from the designer
categories: Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: False Gods' Fall
description:
An asymmetric, dynamic, strategic and combat game themed in a sci-fi and horror world where different realities, technologies and dimensions gather fantasy beings into a unique and deadly 3D scenario.

FGF (False Gods' Fall) is turn based game (first a Hero then a God, then a Hero, then a God and so on) where you can play as one of the Heroes. At the beginning of the game you will get a random objective, to achieve it,you will be able to equip your self with weapons, armors and other interesting tools that will help you reach your goal. Your character is also able to evolve into whatever you chose from a set of new abilities and improvements to your actual skills, for example, you can make grow another limb to your body or wings to fly. Once you get your goal, a portal will open for you to escape and win the game.

You can also chose to play as the GODS and the goal will be to eliminate the Heroes and stop them to escape through a portal. As the Gods, you do not need trivial items to be better, instead, as the rounds pass by, you will be able to summon random Gods that will arrive with a random Aberration, powerful minions under your control that if are compatible with your God, special skills will be unlocked (for the God and the Aberration) creating new and more interesting strategies to fight against the Heroes. You win the game if you kill heroes or if you are able to evolve up to the maximum power (11 rounds) before any Hero can escape through a portal. If nobody chooses to play as the Gods, the cards of the Gods have their own A.I. with a set of simple instructions that players will have to execute during each Gods turn to give them autonomy.

All these happens in a unique and innovative 3D tile system which round by round will be dynamically changing by rotating tiles, adding or removing barriers that blocks the access to adjacent tiles, increase terrain highness and, change of weather!

A fantastic feature from FGF's Dynamic 3D Tile System is that you can use it for other existing combat board games and RPGs and add them its unique features and benefits (rotation, dynamic, block access, space elevations, art customization), that way you will refresh and boost their game experience!

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Horror, Maze, Miniatures, Mythology, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: American Fleets: The United States Navy in World War II (2012 Standard)
description:
For the first time statistics for US ships and aircraft, and all their weapons and sensors are available in Command At Sea(CaS) 4th Edition standard.

American Fleets includes over 250 ship classes and over 190 aircraft, many of which have not appeared in CaS format before. All earlier listings for these ships and aircraft have been reviewed and updated to include information from newly available references, and great strides have been made in reconciling conflicting or incorrect sources. Damage data and other game-related information has also been updated to the CaS 4th Edition standard.
More than making the information compatible with Command At Sea, the data is now in the same format and uses the same standards as Harpoon and Fear God & Dread Nought, the other core games in the Admiralty Trilogy.

All ships and aircraft extant from 1939 to late 1945, including several projected and/or hypothetical platforms are also here, such as the first South Dakota(BB-49) and the P-75 Eagle. Late or post-war platforms include the Montana and Midway classes, as well as the P-80C Shooting Star and the B-32 Dominator.

American Fleets has been updated to use the 2012 Standard, an improved formula to calculate a ship’s damage points.

Please make sure that all ships on both sides in a scenario are using either the older 2006 Standard, or the new 2012 Standard.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: Gunfights & Gamblin': Six-Shooter Expansion
description:
The explosive Old West action of Gunfights & Gamblin' just got bigger! In The Six-Shooter Expansion, you get two brand new characters, multiple ways to set up the town, lots of unique items and tense new game play!

Turn your four player gunfight into a six player gunfight and see who's left standing once the dust settles!

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex – Space Wolves
description:
From their unassailable polar stronghold, the Fang, on the frozen death world of Fenris, the Space Wolves cast off into the Sea of Stars seeking out Mankind’s most vicious enemies to defeat in glorious battle. Each Space Wolf is a warrior of legend whose heroic deeds are recorded in epic sagas. They are Space Marines, the deadly creations of the Emperor and the genetic heirs of the Primarch Leman Russ. As the Imperium shudders under the weight of invasion, the Space Wolves are needed more than ever to drive back the endless hordes of piratical xenos, foul warp-spawn and loathsome heretics.

Codex: Space Wolves contains a wealth of background and rules – the definitive book for Space Wolves collectors. Within this 144-page hardback, you’ll find:

- The Sons of Russ: the origin and history of the Space Wolves, an iconic and fiercely independent Chapter of the Adeptus Astartes who have existed for over ten thousand years. This section spans their ancient origins, through the Great Crusade, the burning of Prospero to the present time;
- The Death World of Fenris: notable as especially harsh even amongst the death worlds of the Imperium, Fenris is a world of fire and ice – this section details just how brutal life on this inhospitable planet can be;
- Rites of Initiation: the act of turning a mortal man into a Sky Warrior is long, punishing and arduous – surviving the process detailed here is to prove one’s cunning, strength and fortitude beyond question;
- The Great Companies: an explanation of the manner in which the Great Companies are led, and which of the Wolf Lords is granted the status of Great Wolf at any given time, with background on the 13 Companies;
- Aspects of the Wolf: the heraldry and iconography of the Space Wolves, with examples of decorated weapons;
- Annals of the Space Wolves: a lengthy and detailed timeline from the inception of the Space Wolves at the dawn of the Imperium, through ten thousand years of conquest, to the return of the Wulfenkind and the current dire state of the galaxy;
- Background on each unit available to a Space Wolves army;
- A showcase of beautifully painted Citadel miniatures, with example armies featuring everything from individual images of models to battle scenes on terrain.

Rules

Everything you need to get a Space Wolves army primed for games of Warhammer 40,000 is in here:

- 77 datasheets providing rules for using every Space Wolves unit in your games of Warhammer 40,000;
- Armoury of the Fang: profiles for all weapons and wargear of the Space Wolves, ranged and close-combat;
- Points values for all miniatures, weapons and wargear for use in Matched Play games;
- Armies of Asaheim: rules for Battle-forged armies, including;
- Army abilities that reflect the methods of war of the Space Wolves on the tabletop.
- 27 unique Stratagems;
- 6 unique Warlord Traits usable by any Space Wolves commander;
- Relics of the Fang: 6 unique weapons and artefacts available only to Space Wolves;
- Tempestas Discipline: 6 psychic powers specific to Space Wolves models with the Psyker keyword;
- 6 Tactical Objectives unique to the Space Wolves.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of Valor: Franco-Prussian War 1870 - 71, Republican Period
description:
AOV Franco-Prussian War 1870 - 71, Republican Period is an independent Age of Valor (AOV) expansion chapter or mini-module for Age of Eagles II, also known as Napoleonic Fire & Fury. It covers the part of the war between the French Republican Government of National Defense and the North and South German Confederations. As such AOE II is needed to properly play this game. In most cases all rules changes have been imbedded in the Data Charts as well as the charts and tables on the Quick Reference Sheet. All players need to do is use these new specifications or DRMs with the original rules, then play as normal. Any changes unique to the Republican phase of the Franco-Prussian War, the subject of this expansion set, are included for both the conflict overall, and the included battles of Coulmiers (a victory for the French) and la Lisaine (a defeat) scenarios.

The AOV product line is sold direct thru digital distribution, though hardcopy versions are available from certain retailers. It is 34 pages long. Kindle formatted products are sold exclusively thru Amazon, while digital downloads exportable to PDF format may be purchased via Google Play.

Online, public research portal for this game and its historical period (to include flags for miniatures, official histories, Public Domain military maps, images and publications - all copyright friendly and FREE to download) at https://tinyurl.com/AOV-FPW-Reference-Portal.

-description from the designer.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Turn Order: Random

name: Slam Wars: Wrestling Legends of the Superstation
description:
Slam Wars is a card battle game that celebrates the various wrestling territories that existed from the 1940's until the 1990's. It captures the unique flavor of the territory by using historical wrestlers, tag teams, managers, promoters, announcers and referees. Each Slam Wars set is a standalone game, but can be seamlessly integrated with any other Slam Wars set to form a larger playing pool.

Slam Wars: Wrestling Legends of the Superstation comes in a 2-piece full-color dual deck poker box and includes a 20-page full-color instruction guide. There are a total of 90 playing cards:

44 solo wrestlers
16 tag teams
13 stat boosters
10 common match stipulations
6 special grudge match stipulations
1 championship


A round of play is called an "event" and consists of 7 matches (4 solo and 3 tag team). Seven match stipulation cards will be exposed, one for each match of the event. Each wrestler and tag team card is rated in 5 different categories (represented by symbols that match the stipulation cards). The objective is to strategically place the cards you were dealt in matches where they can perform the best (i.e. have high ratings). Like a good wrestling booker, you are trying to maximize your wrestler's strengths and minimize their weaknesses. After comparing the stats in that particular category, the card with the higher rating wins the match-up. Whichever player wins a majority of the 7 matches wins the event and is awarded the championship card. The holder of the championship card has an advantage heading into the next round of play. Much like poker, the rounds can continue until the participants decide to end it.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Ack Ack, Sinjin & Avery
description:
Whether through Strength, Intelligence or plain dumb Luck some Raiders survive everything the Wasteland throws at them and come back for more.

Sinjin and his right hand woman Avery head up a gang of Raiders that often cause trouble in the Goodneighbour area. Bringing high ranged ability to the table and some unique buffs to support their followers they make good leader choices for any game.

Ack-Ack and her gang set up base in the Olivia Satellite Station. Known for her raids on local farms and settlements, always punctuated by the rapid fire of her favourite Minigun.

This boxed set contains three 32mm scale multi-part high quality resin Raider miniatures, each with a unique scenic base, to allow players to expand their Fallout: Wasteland Warfare games.

Contents:

1 x Sinjin
1 x Avery
1 x Ack Ack
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Death Ride Normandy: Operation Tonga
description:
This game is based on the parachute and glider landings by the British 6th Airborne Division east of the Orne River.

The British 6th Airborne Division has the mission of parachuting into the area east of the Orne River in order to hold the eastern flank of the entire invasion.

Death Ride Normandy - Operation Tonga:
Merville, Houlgate, Troarn, and Mezidon Maps
10+ Counter Sheets
5x Scenarios Based on each day, and a smaller Scenario each for 7-10 June
6ABD Order of Battle
51ID Order of Battle
711ID Order of Battle
346ID Order of Battle
Merville WNs
Drop and Landing Charts
Supplemental Rules
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Code On
description:
A pathogen is causing a pandemic! Scientists are mystified as to which gene is causing global fatalities, provoking you to start a quest to uncover the pathogenic gene sequence. The genetic processes of mutation and indels hinder your discovery progress. Utilise your intellect, together with the powers of base sequencing and CRISPR base editing technologies, to correctly reveal the pathogen gene sequence. Crack the pathogenic code to enable scientists to develop a vaccine to save humanity from an impending health crisis.

During each turn, players have to guess a hidden part of the pathogen genetic sequence. With every guess, the player is granted information about how accurate their guess was. Using deduction and reasoning skills, player record this information and use it to get closer to cracking the true genetic sequence!

Each turn, players can opt to use one of their wildcards, which can either help (Helper cards) them or hinder (Hinder cards) their opponents discovery progress. Play these cards wisely though, as you are only limited to a couple per game!
A player wins when they crack the full hidden genetic sequence!

Can you crack the genetic code?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Induction

name: Battlegroup: Stalingrad
description:
After Operation Barbarossa failed to defeat the Soviet Union in 1941, the war on the Eastern Front must continue. This time, the Germans prioritised their efforts in the south, towards the oil fields of the Caucasus region in Fall Blau (Case Blue). German and Axis armies will advance east, into the Caucusus’, along the Don river and across it to the Volga. Their sweeping summer advances will bring them to the city of Stalingrad. The infamous Battle of Stalingrad will become a turning point in WWII, a savage house-to-house battle through the ruins of the city to halt the Germans and draw-in ever more forces, until a Russian counter-offensive can be launched to encircle the entire German 6th Army.


HISTORICAL BACKGROUND


A complete overview of war in southern Russia in 1942, starting with preliminary operations in the spring, the the start of Fall Blau, the Battle of Voronezh, Operations on the Don, Operation Edelweiss’ drive into the Caucasus region, the Battle of the Don Bend and the panzers’ drive to the Volga and Stalingrad. Inside Stalingrad, the ‘Death on Volga’ section deals specifically with the weeks of brutal close-quarters fighting through the city’s streets and its three factory complexes.

ARMY LISTS:


Nine army lists are included for the Germans, their Axis allies and the Red Army. These are: German Panzer and Infantry Division battlegroups, Italian and Rumanian battlegroups and the Hungarian 1st Armoured Division battlegroup. For the Russians, army lists for Rifle Divisions and battlegroups created from their new Tank Corps. ‘Death on Volga’ pits specially equipped German assault Stossgruppe infantry battlegroups against the ragged but dug-in and determined ‘Defenders of Stalingrad’.

SPECIAL RULES:


New rules to adapt the core Battlegroup game to the battlefields of the Eastern Front in 1942,

including the Battle of Stalingrad. Recreating the character of the war from the rolling steppes of southern Russian to the twisted wreckage of Stalingrad’s factories. The book includes new additional detailed rules for street-fighting, a new urban combat scenario Stadtkampf and a mini-campaign system for the ferocious fighting for the Barrikady gun factory.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Oathmark: Bane of Kings
description:
Time is the bane of all kings. Always does it march forward, bringing change and challenges, wars and disasters, invaders and internal rebellion.

This supplement for Oathmark: Battles of the Lost Age, focuses on the passage of time and its effect on a players kingdom. While wars and battle still determine their ultimate fate, many other events can affect the armies of a kingdom. Plagues and blights can reduce access to soldiers from specific territories. Attempted coups can cost a king some of his best generals. On the other hand, unexpected alliances might give a kingdom access to unusual troops, or the birth of a new heir might bring wondrous presents.

Along with the rules for the passing of years, this book also presents the option to train your units to fight in special formations, such as phalanxes, shield walls, and skirmish lines. These will allow players to use their existing armies to try out new strategies and tactics to swing their battle in their favour.
This book also includes several new military expeditions, including numerous scenarios, to once again challenge a player's generalship.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Lost Mummy
description:
The mysterious Egyptian sands hide many secrets, all of them lost to time. All of them, that is, except one!

When your grandfather, Howard Carter, discovered the remains of the ancient pharaoh Tutankhamen, he believed there was another tomb connected to the first. A hidden tomb. A Lost Mummy. Now, many hard years and one fateful slip later, you find yourself trapped in that very tomb! Will you escape, or will you become just another lost memory buried under the sand?

The Lost Mummy is a printable escape room game that transforms any space into a kids escape room experience. The game is designed to challenge 10 – 13 year-old children. It combines the teamwork, tension, and puzzle-solving of escape rooms with the laid-back ease of group party games.

Players will work together to escape from an ancient Egyptian tomb before time runs out. Gameplay is centered on a series of sequential puzzle sheets hidden around the room. Each puzzle solved progresses the story, and puts you one step closer to escaping the Lost Mummy’s tomb. Game setup is quick and spoiler-free, and hints are handled by an online hint system that players access on their smartphones. This means that no game master is required to supervise the experience, so you can join the game alongside your players.

The game can expand to accommodate any number of players by dividing your group into teams of 2-4, and then having them race against each other to see who escapes first. In addition, you can edit the game file before printing to customize your own escape room experience.

Will you solve the mystery of the mummy’s tomb, before you’re trapped here forever?
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Children's Game, Party Game, Print & Play, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: Star Wars: Legion – Limited Edition Luke Skywalker Commander Expansion
description:
Luke Skywalker fought on many fronts of the Galactic Civil War, battling the Empire both from the cockpit of his T-65 X-wing and on the ground with his lightsaber and trusty DL-44 blaster. Wherever the war effort took him, Skywalker was a symbol of hope to his fellow Rebels and soon Star Wars™: Legion players will get the chance to experience him like never before.

Fantasy Flight Games is happy to announce the Limited Edition Luke Skywalker Commander Expansion, available soon at your local retailer!

Ready for Action
Whether leading the fabled Rogue Squadron or a small strike team, Luke Skywalker earned his reputation as one of the Rebellion’s most enduring heroes through countless battles and this Limited Edition expansion depicts him as he appeared during one of the most iconic clashes in the Star Wars saga: the Battle of Hoth. Wearing his Rebel flight suit and perched atop the wreckage of his T-47 airspeeder, this version of Luke Skywalker is ready to continue the fight on the ground.

Not only does the miniature included here bring a totally new sculpt of Luke Skywalker to your Star Wars: Legion battles, you have the freedom to customize it to fit your personal taste. The miniature can be assembled carrying either Luke’s lightsaber or his DL-44 blaster and with or without his flight helmet. Additionally, if you decide to include the flight helmet, you can also choose whether Luke enters battle with its visor up or down.

However you decide to assemble your miniature, Luke Skywalker is as skilled as ever on the battlefield. This expansion also contains a unit card with abilities identical to the Hero of the Rebellion version of Luke Skywalker found in the Star Wars: Legion Core Set, but now featuring updated artwork matching his new appearance. Additionally, you’ll also find copies of Luke Skywalker’s command cards My Ally is the Force, Return of the Jedi, and Son of Skywalker featuring this updated artwork alongside the unit card. Finally, to ensure Luke Skywalker is fully prepared for battle, this expansion also contains reprints of four upgrade cards: Emergency Stims, Environmental Gear, Force Push, and Hope.

The Limited Edition Luke Skywalker Commander Expansion will only be available for a limited time. In the Unites States, this expansion will be available through local game stores, each of which will be eligible to receive a small amount. For those of you that live outside the United States, look for more information on distribution in your area soon!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bloodfist Champions
description:
Battle in league 5 vs 5 Arena matches, every-man-for-himself Battle Royale matches, or tour the world with your friends since 3 games come in 1 box with Bloodfist Champions. Bloodfist Champions allows for multiple ways to play.

The original game, Bloodfist Champions, allows players to choose their fighting forces from 45 different teams, each with its own completely unique characters and style of play. Players battle through a league style setting, with each match awarding them experience points and gold for their team.

Bloodfist Champions: Battle Royale pits up to 30 players, each controlling one character, in a massive winner-take-all bout. It includes the same experience points and gold gains as the original, but focus is narrowed to what helps one player in the arena, rather than worrying about a whole team.

Bloodfist Champions: RPG is a tabletop roleplaying game in the world of Bloodfist, allowing players to experience the rich world as a group of traveling Bloodfist players, either as a team or as individual Battle Royale players (or both).

All of this mayhem runs on a system of dice involving uniquely illustrated six-sided attack dice. You roll to attack your enemy, and, if successful, roll again to see if you hurt him. Any time you hit an opponent hard enough to hurt him in any way, you earn, 1, 2, 3, or 5 experience points for the player who performed it, and the same amount of points are scored toward victory for your team (or individual in Battle Royale).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 에어라인 81 (Airline 81)
description:
Currently, Airline 81 is severely underperforming. All players will participate in the game as the new management of Airline 81 Airlines, and must strive to normalize airline performance. Management expects that the new aircraft A81 introduced to normalize its performance will play a role as a game changer.

The goal of the game is to operate the A81 aircraft in an efficient manner, producing high performance.

The game board and auxiliary game board are placed in the center, and the player takes a personal board with the same color as his cube according to the number of players. The game starts with a first player and runs several rounds clockwise.

In player turn, each player proceeds in the order of the next three steps.
1. [Rolling the dice]
The player rolls three dice at the same time in his turn and distinguishes the top color of each dice. Designate A for the same color on the top of each die and B and C for the different colors.
(Example: Yellow+yellow+red = A+A+B / Blue+Purple+Red = A+B+C / Blue+Blue+Blue= A+A+A)
2. [Choose 1 out of 2 tasks]
The player chooses one of the two tasks(flight Service, staff training) in his turn and behavior once.
- Task 1: Flight Service
- Task 2: Staff Training
3. [Moving score markers based on behavior]
Move the score marker according to the player's behavior immediately.

The next player will also continue in the same way in the three-step order, and the round will end when all players play once. As several rounds progress, if the cube is no longer available after one's turn(if there is no A81 reservation), the game ends after only the corresponding round.

At the end of the game, the A81 aircraft management performance(passenger fare score, employee training score, reservation waiting score, checked baggage import performance, profitability improvement performance, marketing performance) is all calculated and the player with the highest total wins.
If the total is tied, the player with more colored cubes in the business class wins. If it is still a tie, more players will win the cube(reserved waiting) remaining on the individual board, and if it is still a tie, they will win jointly.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Simulation

name: Star Wars: Legion – Mandalorian Super Commandos Unit Expansion
description:
Mandalorian Super Commandos bend the galaxy to Maul’s will in this expansion for Star Wars: Legion! Previously members of the notorious Death Watch, these elite Mandalorian warriors now follow Maul because he wields the Darksaber. With them, players have a powerful new special forces option for their Shadow Collective forces. In addition to six Mandalorian Super Commando miniatures and a unit card, players will also find three command cards specifically designed for use with mercenary units in this expansion as well as eight upgrade cards that invite them to customize their units with heavy weapons, new gear, and more!

Contents:
7 Miniatures
1 Unit Card
3 Command Cards
8 Upgrade Cards
14 Assorted Tokens
1 Insert Sheet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Race For The Title
description:
Race For The Title is a deckbuilding football card game for 1-4 players. Every player starts with a weak hand of cards which they attempt to improve upon every round as they accumulate money and play matches against their opponents.

You will look to strengthen your team so to be more successful in matches, but you'll also need to grow your club's finances so you can buy new players. It's a tricky balancing act to achieve and it might be the case that smart decisions only start paying off as the game goes into the late stages.

There are five kinds of cards in the game:

- player cards feature players and you'll use them in matches against an opponent
- formation cards give your playing skills a permanent boost. Keep them on display at all times
- stadium cards increase the money you make when you play a home match
- action cards allow you to weaken an opponent's team or, in some cases, gain extra cards for free
- economy cards give you income you can spend in the Marketplace

You'll only ever have five cards (six/seven if you happen to have a formation/stadium card in play) in play at one time. Your active hand is known as your Line-Up.

To play matches, pick an opponent. Add up your total attacking scores across your Line-Up. Your opponent does the same but adds up their total defence score. Then both managers add a dice roll to your score. Highest combined score wins the match!

The winning team takes three points and moves up the league table. The first team to reach 70 points wins the title!

Race For The Title is the second game by Webstar Games - the first, Counter Attack, is also football themed.

Note: Race For the Title didn't meet its Kickstarter goal in 2022. It has since been redesigned (which is why you'll find two different looks to the game) and is ready for a Kickstarter relaunch soon

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: HeroQuest: The Eyes of Chaos
