Las Ligas de la Ñ Bécquer vs. Irving is a collection of various card games with a theme inspired by the Romantic writers Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer (1836-1870) and Washington Irving (1783-1859). Bécquer vs. Irving is also the third game of the saga Las Ligas de la Ñ (The Leagues of the Ñ).

This collection of games includes:

Role-Playing Game. The game´s director rules; the players abide. Learn to be a role master and put the players to the test, making them face stories and rules of your own creation. Once the game is finished the game´s director will choose the best player or team.
Four Houses. You will be a member of one of the four houses (Chalice, Raven, Lion and Fire). You can be loyal, a mercenary or a traitor. Speak, negotiate and save your cards to accomplish your goals and make more points than your rivals. You can either be a part of a team or follow your own path.
Survival. Make sure you know the game´s characters to survive and make it as far as possible in the game. Sometimes you will need to solve mysteries, or just choose between different paths; from time to time you will get rewards. Prepare to face Bécquer-Irving ´s wrath if you make the wrong choices.
Questions. Face different questions about the Bécquer-Irving universe.
Storytellers. Create your own stories emulating Bécquer, Irving and other Ñ writers.
Contest13. Earn category points using the Ñ value to get at least 13 points in one category. Try to remember the cards included in the decks of all players. If you believe you have achieved the necessary 13 points in one category (Wisdom, Seduction, Politics, Dark force…), check them. If you do not have 13, you will lose all your cards and will need to start the game from scratch. It is a memory and mathematics game. In this game you will learn to use the categories of every card and the Ñ value.
Ultimate Trophy. Are you the chosen one? To win the Bécquer vs Irving Ultimate Trophy you will need to add up more points than your opponents once the six games are finished. Also, you will be put through a final test: a ten question quiz, they will be selected randomly and you will need to get at least five right.



Bécquer vs Irving accepts, to facilitate the game´s playability, any card from any of the two last games (Las Ligas de la Ñ and Las Ligas de la Ñ Galaxia MusiChess.


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Fantasy, Negotiation, Novel-based, Party Game
mechanics: Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Memory, Negotiation, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Storytelling, Take That

name: Oak & Iron: Ships of the Line
description:
This expansion includes 3 plastic ship models.
Including:
1st Rate Ship of Line
2nd Rate Ship of Line
3rd Rate Ship of Line
3 clear plastic ship bases
3 ship cards
All necessary tokens and counters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Pirates
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Broadside:  Empires of Steel
description:
Broadside: Empires of Steel is a fully printable tabletop miniatures game set in the era of the Dreadnought Battleship.

The game is designed for fast, action-packed games between fleets consisting of roughly 7 to 12 ships per side.

The rules allow you to play a game of six turns in a couple of hours with decisive results. They are also designed to be fun, without the need for consulting vast numbers of tables to find out what is happening to your ships.

The game has a Quick Play Rule book, a mission book and five Fleet List books.
The Mission book has twelve missions, six that use objective miniatures and are narrative and six that are designed for fleet battles. The fleet list books help you construct fleets. All the ships have a corresponding card. On this ship card are points to ensure even sided games can be played if your not looking to re-create historical encounters.

2021 has seen the release of the Three Crowns expansion giving players ships and fleet books for Italy and Austria-Hungary. The Kickstarter also unlocked other lists and ships for The Empire of Great Britain, the Empire of Germany and the U.S. Navy.

September 2021 will see the third release for Broadside EOS called Hunting Grounds. This expansion will add the Imperial Russian Navy, new missions, token STL's, aircraft, submarines, upgrade cards, aircraft carriers and a fort.

The game has 116 ships STL's so far.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar General's Handbook Pitched Battles 2021
description:
The essential 2021 General’s Handbook is an invaluable supplement that enhances your games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar. This year’s edition is divided into two separate books – the General’s Handbook comes as a 96-page ring-bound hardback, while the Pitched Battle Profiles book is a 34-page softback.

Inside this year’s General’s Handbook, you'll find…


High-level background information on Ghur, the Realm of Beasts, which is the setting for this General's Handbook and Pitched Battle Season.
A focused description of the war of Thondia, the area in Ghur which is in the midst of desperate conflict. Thondia is key to the current narrative of Warhammer Age of Sigmar, and is part of the setting for this General's Handbook and Pitched Battle Season.
Rules for a new Region of War – The Ghurrish Heartlands – which include two special rules (Predators and Prey and Seismic Shift), one additional Realmsphere Magic spell available to all Wizards (Metamorphosis), and one additional Realm Command which all players have access to (Feral Roar).
Two additional core battalions that players can include in their army in addition to the Core Battalions included in the core rules: Alpha-Beast Pack and Hunters of the Heartlands.
Rules for eight grand strategies that dictate what an army will try and achieve during the battle. They offer additional victory points if completed by the end of the game: Sever the Head, Hold the Line, Vendetta, Dominating Presence, Beast Master, Prized Sorcery, Pillars of Belief, and Predator's Domain.
Rules for eight battle tactics that can be used to determine who won the game. They reflect commands given by the leaders of the army over the course of the battle, and represent the army trying to achieve certain goals on the field of battle each turn: Broken Ranks, Conquer, Slay the Warlord, Ferocious Advance, Savage Spearhead, Aggressive Expansion, Monstrous Takeover, and Bring It Down!
A photocopiable scoring sheet, designed to keep track of the various objectives throughout the battle.
Guidance on the minimum accepted standard for using miniatures in Pitched Battle games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar.
12 battleplans for the Pitched Battle 2021 season: Marking Territory, Savage Gains, First Blood, Power Struggle, Survival of the Fittest, Tectonic Interference, Apex Predators, The Vice, Tooth and Nail, Feral Foray, Power in Numbers, and The Veins of Ghur.
A list of all the official publications which can be used when building an army for use in Pitched Battles.
Updated warscrolls for the following 17 endless spells: Horrorghast, Aethervoid Pendulum, Chronomantic Cogs, Emerald Lifeswarm, Geminids of Uhl-Gysh, Malevolent Maelstrom, Prismatic Palisade, Purple Sun of Shyish, Quicksilver Swords, Ravenak's Gnashing Jaws, Soulsnare Shackles, Suffocating Gravetide, The Burning Head, Umbral Spellportal, Soulscream Bridge, Shards of Valagharr, and Lauchon the Soulseeker.
The Warhammer Age of Sigmar core rules


Please note: The ring-bound design of the General’s Handbook and layout of the battleplans have been designed so that the book can be folded flat to save space, while still providing an overview of the essential information to easily reference once the game has begun.

Inside this year’s Pitched Battle Profiles book, you'll find…


An introduction to Pitched Battle Profiles and descriptions of the four different types of battlefield role: Artillery, Battleline, Behemoth, and Leader.
Details on how to use allies in Pitched Battles in the 2021 Season
Updated Pitched Battle Profiles for every unit, faction, and Grand Alliance in Warhammer Age of Sigmar, as follows:


Order: Cities of Sigmar, Daughters of Khaine, Fyreslayers, Idoneth Deepkin, Kharadron Overlords, Lumineth Realm-lords, Seraphon, Stormcast Eternals, and Sylvaneth.

Chaos: Beasts of Chaos, Blades of Khorne, Disciples of Tzeentch, Hedonites of Slaanesh, Maggotkin of Nurgle, Skaven, and Slaves to Darkness.

Death: Flesh-eater Courts, Nighthaunt, Ossiarch Bonereapers, and Soulblight Gravelords.

Destruction: Gloomspite Gitz, Ogor Mawtribes, Orruk Warclans, and Sons of Behemat.


Updated Pitched Battle profiles for the 17 endless spells from Malign Sorcery and Forbidden Power.


PLUS:
The General’s Handbook 2021 also comes with a card token board, which contains 14 double-sided tokens as follows:


10x Objective / Prime Objectives
1x Battle Tactic Token – Broken Ranks / Bring It Down!
1x Battle Tactic Token – Aggressive Expansion / Conquer
1x Battle Tactic Token – Slay the Warlord / Monstrous Takeover
1x Battle Tactic Token – Ferocious Advance / Savage Spearhead


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Bear vs Bull
description:
Each player will contribute to creating the graph (Candelsticks) of one (or more) quoted Financial Instrument, by playing cards from his hand. In his turn, the player can also decide to open or close positions, betting on the rise or fall of the Financial Instrument. The player will earn from the difference between the price at which he opened the position and the price at which he closes the position.
It is essential to study the intentions of the opponents and hinder them while trying to position themselves strategically. Some Money Management cards help you to better manage your positions and hinder your opponents with the typical dynamics of drawing cards, having them discarded, spying or playing out of your turn.
Attention instead to the Event cards that once drawn are activated and can upset the market (and the wallet of those who have risked too much). Of course, whoever earns the most wins.

The game is designed to have an elementary basic development that mirrors the development on the market of a financial instrument. The player is led to make delicate choices based on market trends, dealing with an emotional state and risk management that are typical of real operations.

In this sense, the game is designed so that statistically the rise in prices is slower than the relative descents (you go up the stairs and go down with the elevator). At the same time it will never be possible to know in a game, if you are in a bear market or a bull market as some random cards are removed from the deck at each game.

The entire game is designed to give food for thought and teaching. The possibility of comparison is in fact a competitive advantage that very often people in the financial world do not use due to the difficulty of dealing with such delicate issues as personal investments.

The possibility of comparison is continuously solicited by combining different financial instruments and players with market situations and risk appetites that are different for each of us.
mechanics: Investment

name: HiFi
description:
In 1974, the band The Meeples broke up during the recordings for the "Vinil" album. The A-side of the unfinished album quickly became cult-followed by fans and critics around the world, turning into one of the most intriguing legends of rock-and-roll history. Fifty years later, the band has finally reunited to finish the B-side with the help of a team of the best musical producers in show biz. That's you!

In HiFi, players start their turn by spinning the record's rondel on the turntable to choose an action within their reach, or they can spend production points to achieve one of the other actions. After resolving these actions, players allocate audio cards to the five studio tracks, earning points based on the buttons in that producer's equalization track and what's in the studio track. When a player allocates a guitarist card, each player who collaborated with the equalization of the guitar earns points. When elements such as sound wave or time-track positions match, players can perform bonus actions.

Each round represents a song recorded on the A-side of the album that will help players gather information to aid B-side recordings. After listening to all of the songs on the A-side — 6-8 rounds depending on the player count — the game ends. Whoever contributed most effectively to the construction of the tracks on the album's B-side wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Rondel
publishers: Grok Games, Mandala Jogos, Smirk & Dagger Games

name: Conroi: The Medieval Card Game
description:
A true tactical card game were every card matters.
Realistic and deep gameplay yet Easy to learn.

Use real battle tactics to outmaneuver your enemy or simply try to overpower them by sheer numbers.

In this card game consisting of 72 cards, two players fight across the battlefield in an attempt to win a best of five rounds.

Each player has 27 differently designed highly detailed Soldier cards and 9 Tactics cards all with quality artwork.

Use your cards at your disposal in the most effective way to undermine your opponent or take them out by outsmarting them.

The game is designed for fans of historical battles and strategic gameplay were no game plays out the same way.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: Revolutions France 1820-1880
description:
In Revolutions, you will relive the political conflicts and major societal choices of the 19th century, in France. You will embody the supporters of an ideology. You will fight and negotiate to win over an electorate, ensure the support of the media and the benevolence of the clergy.

On the benches of the assembly or on the barricades, you will define the bases of a new society!

The game lasts 6 rounds maximum. Each round consists of 5 phases.
PHASE 1: SUPPLY. Players receive ACTION CARDS.
PHASE 2: DIPLOMACY AND BETTING. Players plot, negotiate, promise... They then secretly place their action cards on the "Stakes" areas (NOTABLES, SONGS, CLERGY, PEASANTS (from turn 2), WRITTEN PRESS (from turn 3), WORKERS (from round 3), SOCIAL TENSIONS).
PHASE 3: RESOLUTIONS. The bets are resolved. They allow players to gain votes in the CHAMBER or forces in the CIVIL WAR. Players can also modify the SOCIAL TENSIONS to trigger or counter an insurrection.
PHASE 4: STATE MODIFICATION. Players join forces and compete to modify the STATE by taking LEGISLATIVE ACTIONS (Palais Bourbon) or by succeeding in a revolution :


Modify the Form of the State
Change the National Representation
Overthrow the executive (faction takes control of the EXECUTIVE)
Modify rights and freedoms
Modify SOCIAL TENSIONS: if the marker reaches 15, the phase ends immediately and an insurrection begins.


PHASE 5: VICTORY POINT COUNT - PV. Each player is awarded victory points according to his faction's objectives. If a player reaches a score of "50", he wins the game. Otherwise, at the end of the 6th round, the player with the highest score wins.
mechanics: Negotiation

name: Assault Red Horizon 41: TA/OAS Expansion
description:
The Tactical Air and Artillery Support, is an optional expansion that can be used for the tactical wargame Assault Red Horizon 41.

It introduces artillery strikes and air attacks into the battle. Destroy buildings to take your opponent´s cover and send them running. Use the artillery to smash enemy troops or hinder their movement.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Conquest: First Blood
description:
Conquest: First Blood focuses on a single Character and their entourage, allowing players to experience the world of Conquest through the eyes of a soldier in the shieldwall rather than the eagle eye view of an army Commander.

The first iteration of the rules did a great job at providing players with a fast whirling melee whilst serving as an excellent introduction to TLAOK. However, we felt that the game system did not allow enough room for tactical play and maneuvering and so a decision was made to make Conquest: First Blood! 2.0 a fully fledged competitive, skirmish wargame!

To do that we focused on the nuances of individual Model positioning and intra-Regiment synergies. The rules now treat individual teams of soldiers as building blocks together which form powerful ad-hoc formations. It is each player’s job to find the weak point in their enemy’s formation and disentangle it through smart maneuvering and intelligent order of play.

First Blood 2.0 also offer the opportunity to create a force from a faction you are interested in without committing to a full TLAOK army. A typical First Blood 2.0 Force consists of a single Character, 2-3 Officers (known as Command Models in TLAOK) and an average of about 20 soldiers. Expect every game entity to have about double their Wounds than their TLAOK equivalents, whilst point costs have been rehauled to better reflect the impact of certain Regiments in a smaller scale (and faster) game!
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: The Establishment: Inner Workings of a Secret Cabal
description:
A card-based, story-driven roleplaying game about a secret society controlling the future of a space-faring humanity.

Combining the best elements of a roleplaying game with the benefits of a card game, The Establishment's story-driven, card-based play requires no game master so all players can participate, making it perfect for both RPG newbies and advanced gamers. Like most roleplaying games, players do not complete points-based objectives to win—the goal is to lead the faction and achieve a fitting end to the story.

The game is played over four rounds. Players choose a path they agree with using storyline cards. Players debate, make deals, and support others by playing influencers. A society card, representing the whims of society, may swing the story's direction.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: The Score
description:
"The Score is an all-new kind of collaborative story game that lets you create the world's greatest heist movie with just 18 cards in under 18 minutes of game time. It's a revolutionary take on shared storytelling that needs no GM, no complex rules, no hefty rulebooks and gives you all the idea prompts you need to be the mastermind." (Tin Star Games)

Each player creates a character who has some of the heist Talents the group needs to succeed. The same cards help you pick a location and a target. Then the first of five Acts begin. Each round the players flip a card from the deck, and explain how they use that ability to further the grand scheme. In Acts 1 and 3, everything is going according to plan. In Acts 2 and 4, everything is off the rails (though even your failures look cool). In the final Act 5, everything is up for grabs. Are you prepared to pay the ultimate price to complete the job?
mechanics: Acting, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Storytelling
publishers: Tin Star Games (Board Game), Tin*Star Games

name: Shadows of Brimstone: 2023 Roll to Move Goody Box
description:
A limited edition goody box available on the web store during Roll to Move 2023.

This Shadows of Brimstone goody box includes:


Raijin Storm Lord Roll-To-Move2023 Miniature with 40 mm black plastic base
Storm Hat (P-1022)
Fashionable Top Hat (P-1024)
Skull of Artesh (P-1023)
Crumbling Stone Encounters Set (5 cards, P-1017 to P-1021)
Broken T-Junction Map Cards (Spanish Fort/Jargono, P-1015 and P-1016)
Broken T-Junction Map Tile
Crumbling Stone Counters
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Bayonets on Hold
description:
These are simple and straightforward Napoleonic rules for miniatures, based on orders’ counters placed on the table face down. Orders directly determine unit’s actions and combat outcomes.
The rules are at Regiment’s level, the name by which units were known by Generals, therefore minutia pertaining to the Company and Battalion organization are not directly addressed, they must be considered as factored-in.
The scale and abstraction levels are best represented by 1:100 (15 mm) miniatures or smaller, but card counters can be used instead.
There is minimal use of dice, for marginal effects only.
Army lists are not needed: just take any battle map and setup Regiments as they were deployed in the real situation.
Any basing system will work, no base modifications required.
This edition will be for Continental wars only, From Montenotte to Paris.
There are no markers, bookkeeping or cumbersome tables.
Note: if not using the base offset system proposed, shaken and square markers will be required.

Characteristics:
Miniatures Scale: 1:100 (15 mm) or smaller
Simulation level: Regiment’s level; mildly abstract.
Speed: very fast.
Solo potential: very high.

Available:
https://www.wargamevault.com/product/455626/Bayonets-on-Hold
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Witcher: Path Of Destiny – Wild Hunt
description:
It's not only a new Story, but also a completely new type of gameplay, focused on prediction and cross-plotting, capturing the feeling of pursuit and anxiety. The semi-cooperative game mode allows players to stand on two sides of the conflict - one of you will take on the role of Eredin himself, commanding a group of wraith-like Wild Hunt Generals, while the other will lead Ciri and her companions. The solo mode is also included, in which you will try to face the Wild Hunt alone!

Introduces a new playable character for use only in this variant - Eredin, representing the Wild Hunt.

Wild Hunt is not just another character. It was specifically designed for this expansion and directing it gives you a whole new experience and range of decisions in gameplay. Both the components and mechanics emphasize the scale of the threat posed by these wraiths of Aen Elle.

This expansion also includes a playmat along with 4 miniatures of the Generals - Eredin, Nithral, Caranthir, and Imlerith! Each of these Generals is assigned to one of four colors of cards. After playing the corresponding colors, Wild Hunt moves the Generals forward on the track. By doing so, he gains experience and victory points, but most importantly, he gains access to special Ability cards for Generals, through which he can hinder the game for his opponents.

The other players will cooperate, side by side facing a powerful opponent! Scoring Victory Points collectively, they will do their best to prevent Ciri's abduction.
In addition to earning Victory Points together, players also cooperate in the battle against the Generals - by playing cards of the appropriate color, they can weaken the Generals, moving them back on the track. They receive General Weakness cards for doing so, which they can use to increase their chances in the competition.

There are also entirely new Side Quests for Wild Hunt and cooperating players.

The Wild Hunt expansion also offers solo gameplay - you will take on the role of Ciri or one of her companions to face the Wild Hunt governed by Automa. For the purposes of solo gameplay, we have prepared a special Hunt board, as well as 4 bonus cards, replacing the Generals' Weakness cards. Playing in solo mode also requires the use of the 4 new Generals cards effects
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game
publishers: Geekach Games, Go On Board, Rebel Sp. z o.o.

name: Mines of Dazzak'Oda
description:
Mines of Dazzak'Oda is a game about Dwarves returning to their ancestral homeland to delve into long forgotten mines in search of riches and glory!

Players choose 1 of 6 Heroes, each hero having a unique ability.
At the start of their turn, players draw cards that represent adventuring gear (Axes, Pickaxes, etc.) Once their Gear Cards are drawn, they delve into the mine by drawing from the Mine Deck.

In the Mine, players can encounter monsters and resources, as well as special events. Events can be helpful or detrimental to the player, and some events allow direct player interaction.

The goal of the game is to use your Gear Cards to make your way through the mine, earning Gold Coins by collecting resources, all while avoiding danger! At the end of the game, the player with most gold coins wins!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Move Through Deck

name: The Witcher: Path Of Destiny – Legendary Monsters
description:
Will Leshen, Aguara, Hym, and Katakan fall under your sword?
Thankfully, you're not alone in this fight. Join forces with other characters and companions, and together walk out of this fight victorious.
And most importantly - alive.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Geekach Games, Go On Board, Rebel Sp. z o.o.

name: The Witcher: Path of Destiny – Naglfar
description: Wild Hunt called for help! Naglfar arrives with its crew to help Generals. With its support, pushing a General back will be much harder. At the same time, Players will receive 4 Broken Sextant cards to make Naglfar’s navigation more difficult
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Moonrakers: Starfall
description:
“The shattered star will redeem us all”, they chant in unison. Most of us don’t share their beliefs, or even really understand them. They seem to be looking for a mythical star that is rumored to have splintered eons ago and is now spread across the system. While they won’t tell us more, we reluctantly invite them to our cause. They are erratic and unpredictable, but the relics they carry seem to more than make up for it.

This Moonrakers 25 card  mini-expansion launched with Fractured Sky and features some of it's characters.
mechanics: Push Your Luck

name: STEERY: Steer the story
description:
STEERY is all about storytelling. Players work together to build a story about one or more characters, and they score points based on their contribution to the story.

It consists of character cards and story cards. The first player starts the story by revealing a character card, introducing the character in the story, and playing one story card from their hand to get the ball rolling. From then on, players take turns in moving that story forward by playing one story card each, incorporating the concept of the card they're playing in the story, and scoring points along the way.

STEERY found the balance between strategic and casual gameplay and the sweet spot between collaboration and competition. The game has also been designed to be family friendly, but it can easily take a NSFW turn if players wish to go that way.

—description from the pulisher
mechanics: Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Widgets n' Digit$
description:
Widgets n' Digit$ is a race against the clock engine builder about building your own business!

Each turn you'll make and sell Widgets, using the profits to purchase resources and upgrade your business.
Unique market mechanics allow demand from your competitors to set prices creating dynamic market-driven play!


Only the savviest CEO will come out on top in this quick, fun, economic strategy game!

Widgets n’ Digit$ comes packed with 2 included expansions for a total of 4 game modes allowing you to pick the complexity that’s right for your group!

Worker Wars: Workers are now a limited resource required for growth, but you’ll have to outbid your competitors to hire them! Can you lead the labor market?
Boardroom Battle: Introducing 12 new Upgrade cards with card abilities! Hundreds of possible ability combinations create endless fun!


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Once Around, Auction/Bidding, Constrained Bidding, Income, Investment, Market, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Ownership, Paper-and-Pencil, Passed Action Token, Predictive Bid, Prisoner's Dilemma, Push Your Luck, Storytelling, Take That, Trading, Turn Order: Pass Order, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement

name: Summoner Wars (Second Edition): Shimmersea Fae Faction Deck
description:
Perplex your enemy with an assault as riddled as the tide. The Shimmersea Fae excel at controlling the ebb and flow of battle. They can steal their opponent’s momentum by turning an advance into a retreat. And they can flip between defense and offense with alarming speed. And be warned! Just when you think them defeated, a fae can vanish, only to reappear later in the fight!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling

name: Summoner Wars (Second Edition): Storm Goblins Faction Deck
description:
Revel in the destructive nature of lightning like only a goblin can! Storm the battlefield and discharge bursts of electricity to overcharge your own troops while cooking the enemy to a sizzling crisp. Rush the foe in reckless, goblin fashion, overwhelming them with your numbers and bewildering disregard for self-preservation.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling

name: Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City – Exclusive Edition
description:
Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City is a big box strategy game with miniatures in which gangs fight for control of a city, with the city also being a living part of the game.

1 to 4 players take on the role of ruthless gangs vying for control of the underground in the glittering hellhole that is Night City. Clash with other Gangs in the meat or on the Net, as your enterprising band of toughs seeks to gain dominance over the criminal underworld that rules the streets. Only the boldest will be remembered, and your Street Cred will pave your way to the top.

In Single Player mode, you are pitted against an opposing Gang and an Edgerunner (Johnny or either V's) in a free-for-all for Night City. Similar to the multiplayer mode, the faction with the most Street Cred wins.

In the game, players assume the role of a gang leader, with you organizing your gang members to take power in the city. Your actions affect not only your game and your opponents but the city itself. Each gang has different attributes and goals, giving each player a different gaming experience.

The Kickstarter Exclusive Edition (vs Retail Edition) additionally has:

35 extra Edgerunners sculpts & ability cards
2 Exclusive Single Player AI Edgerunner Opponent ability cards & sculpts
6th Steet Gang (sculpts & player dashboards)
3 story modules
2 modular sets (sculpts & rule cards) for Delamain & Trauma Team
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Ered Mithrin Hero Expansion
description:
In the time since the dragon Smaug’s defeat, the city of Dale has become a prosperous trade hub. The merchants are well-equipped to conduct their business, but when a new enemy rears its head, they must join forces with heroes of Wilderland to defend their countryfolk from this terrible threat.

The Ered Mithrin Hero Expansion for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game includes 8 heroes and contains all of the player cards and customization options originally featured in The Wilds of Rhovanion and the Ered Mithrin cycle of content. Take control of iconic heroes like Bilbo Baggins, Radagast, and Dáin Ironfoot and join forces with the merchants of Dale to protect the people of Middle-earth from those that would do them harm.

This expansion can be used to build or enhance player decks for any The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game scenario or campaign.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Terraforming Mars: Soil Enrichment Promo Card
description:
Spring Season Promo 2024 of FryxGames, which you can buy on its own, or get for free if you order something at their webstore during Spring 2024(starting March 2024).

Promo X67

Soil Enrichment is an event card (red) with a microbe, plant and event tag
Cost 6MC
Spend 1 microbe from ANY of your cards to gain 5 plants.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Sworn Brothers
description:
In the far North, the brotherhood of the Night's Watch keep an eye on any terrors that would assault Westeros. They are the unwanted. The lower sons, the criminals, the bastards, the outcasts. But in the Night's Watch, they find a place and a purpose. Outfitted with rugged, warm armor and massive swords, they fight against Wildings and any other horrors with stoicism born of hard training.

The Sworn Brothers unit box forms the core force for the Night's Watch in the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game. Their strong armor deflects blows and their training keeps them from running off easily. On the offensive side of the scales, their prowess with the greatsword is second to none, dealing critical strikes and sundering even the toughest enemy armor. Meanwhile, the Watch Captain Attachment lets the unit have two Vows assigned to the unit at a time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Bellum: of Mutants and Men
description:
Welcome to the world of Bellum! A world born from the ashes of the old; a world for you to command. Will you take sides with the enduring Sapien Kingdoms in their quest to reclaim the lands promised? Perhaps you will ally with the Gobalos Colonies as they seek new territory to support the ever multiplying brood. You might even fill your Barracks with some impious alliance of the two. Construct your Barracks and wage war across the world of Bellum.

With tactical game play and an industrial fantasy theme "Bellum: Of Mutants and Men" is an exciting strategy card game experience for two players. Each player assumes the role of a commander constructing their own Barracks of Units and Stratagems then battling it out to destroy each other's Keep

*Battle it out in a industrial fantasy world where positioning is just as important as card synergy.
*Play right out of the box with pre-constructed decks or construct your own from the 260 cards available in the box.
*Utilize the unique hand-size resource system which assures that no card is ever a dead card.
*Command your Units and deploy Stratagems across a 5x5 board.
*Destroy your opponents Keep and win the game!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Unconditional Surrender! Western Campaigns
description:
Unconditional Surrender! Western Campaigns (USWC) is an strategic-level game covering World War 2 campaigns fought between the Axis and Western Allied factions in Western Europe. With its emphasis on force projection, players focus on the big picture of managing their military forces. Using simple mechanics and low on-map counter density, players easily handle the action without complicated subsystems or tall stacks of counters.

Plucked from the game Unconditional Surrender! WW2 in Europe (USE), USWC provides shorter, smaller footprint scenarios for those wanting to play the Unconditional Surrender! design but lacking the space and time needed for the much larger USE. USWC also serves as an alternative way to teach it to other players. Owners of USE that have the space and time for it, do not have to buy this game. However, it may be worth it, if you are looking for something much more portable to bring somewhere else to play or for an inexpensive gift for a wargaming friend.

DESIGN HIGHLIGHTS:

Low On-Map Counter Density: The number of counters on the map is incredibly low.
Simple Stacking: No more than one of the same type of unit per hex.
No Factors on Counters: No combat or movement factors on counters.
Single Combat System: One combat resolution sequence and Combat Results Table covers all types of combat, yet the results differ for air or ground combat.
Integrated Movement & Combat System: Units move and fight in a combined activation.
Ergonomically Friendly: Easily fits in extremely limited gaming space.
"Use it or lose it." Economic System: Simple math with minimal record keeping.
Easy to Modify: The relatively simple mechanics make it easy to modify the game.
Unconditional Surrender! World War 2 in Europe Compatibility: The ground and air units, event markers, and combat system are the same in both games. The scenarios are similar except for the elements that were abstracted. If you later decide to play USE, you will have additional rules to learn but little to unlearn.

TIME SCALE: Monthly Turns
MAP SCALE: 30 to 40 miles per hex
UNIT SCALE: Army, Fleet, or Wing
NUMBER OF PLAYERS: 2


COMPONENT LIST
6 8.5"x11" maps
1 Countersheet
1 Rules Booklet
1 Play Book
2 11"x17" Player Aid cards
1 Faction Card
2 6-sided dice
Game Box

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Hamlet: By the Lake
description:
In Hamlet: By the Lake, you take your village building lakeside! Form lakes, build boats, go fishing, and feed your Villagers seasonal meals that give them special abilities. Hamlet: By the Lake adds variability, customizability and more individual control of resources, taking the strategy levels for Hamlet well above sea level.

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Towers of Conquest
description:
Towers of Conquest takes battle elements from games like Heroscape but adds resource collecting and empire building. Start off with a very small force, and try to expand and build an empire while competing with others.
Take Settlers of Catan and mix it up with Heroscape and Risk, also take the aspects from App games like Game of War and Clash of Clans, and PC games like Starcraft, Original Warcraft, and Old School Dune, then you get this board game.

Object of the game: Expand, Build and Conquer. Winner is the First to get a total of 30 Conquest Points. Or Play Optional World Domination, and End the game when you are the last one standing!
Conquest Points are gained by building your own structures, summoning troops and by destroying your opponent’s structures and troops.
Structure Progression: The type of structure owned determines the type of troops that may be summoned. Your settlements can be upgraded to a Fortress and then a Fortress may then be upgraded to a Tower. Ultimate Champions, Titans and Monsters may be summoned when you upgrade to a Tower!
Resource Cards are used to purchase structures, upgrade structures and summon troops. Resource cards are collected by Pathfinders and structures occupying resource hexes.
A rune dice is rolled on each player's turn to determine which resource is collected. All players collect the corresponding resource that is rolled.
Player Turn Sequence:
1. Roll a six-sided Rune Die that determines which resource is collected. All players with a settlement or a pathfinder occupying a hex corresponding to that resource will collect resource cards. (1) resource card for each pathfinder and (1) for each settlement. (2) for each fortress, and (3) for each tower.
2. Move any or all of your troops
3. Attack or use a special ability for any or all of your troops
4. Buy/ Summon Phase: purchase new settlements; upgrade a settlement to a fortress, or fortress to a tower. And summon forces corresponding to your structure tier.
5. End Player Turn
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination

name: Paranormal Research
description:
A paranormal investigation awaits you, you have to collect evidence in one of the most haunted houses in the world, but watch out for the ghosts that are lurking, study your moves well, you won't be able to get out alive! Keep an eye on the EMF detector if the level increases becomes more and more difficult!
Will you face the investigation alone or will you ask your teammates for help to play as a team?
Can you finish the investigation or will you be overwhelmed by the ghosts?
Two game modes: normal or extreme.
Cooperative game for 1 to 5 players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth – Seth Box
description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

This box contains 4 fighters and everything you need to play:

Seth - Seth's mobile play style shifts rapidly between safe pokes and aggressive critical hits. Find the perfect moment to strike down your foe!

Enkidu - Break through your Prohibition and unleash true power! Enkidu gets stronger as he lands his critical attack, building into an unstoppable force.

Vatista - Control the battle with enhanced mobility and economy. Vatista compounds advantages until she's ready to unleash a massive strike and obliterate the opponent.

Nanase - Nanase's non-stop rapid fighting style will keep opponent's constantly on the defensive. Utilize mixups and counters to keep foes guessing.
With the Exceed Fighting System, any fighter can battle against any other, regardless of their origin!
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: AI: 100% Human
description:
In AI: 100% Human, you must choose and develop your Artificial Intelligence (AI)! Integrate new developments of every type (calculation, hacking, game...) and achieve objectives set by the Original AI to obtain the most powerful AI.

AI is a drafting game with a reserve and immediate scoring, all structured around building a tableau.

Drafting with a reserve lets you better prepare your card combinations and chains. Since you immediately score each card played, the reserve lets you optimize your choices and place the best Development card, in the best place, at the best time.
Your AI’s performance is measured by scoring various types of Development cards as they are played, in addition to scoring the Original AI’s objectives at the end of each round. Finally, at the end of the game, you will gain additional points depending on your AI’s specific features.

You will constantly face many challenges, both in terms of creating chains and timing card placement.
After two rounds, the player with the most powerful Artificial Intelligence wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid

name: Passaporte Mundo
description:
Passporte Mundo goes beyond a mere trivia game; it's an immersive and cooperative experience that not only challenges your intellect but also fosters collaboration, creating an engaging and enjoyable gaming experience for all participants.
You and your friends are on the verge of embarking on an exciting adventure where cultural knowledge will serve as your ticket to the next challenge.

—description from the publisher

Passaporte Mundo é mais do que apenas um jogo de trivia; é uma experiência imersiva e cooperativa que, além de desafiar seu intelecto, incentiva a colaboração, proporcionando uma experiência de jogo envolvente e divertida para todos os participantes.
Você e seus amigos estão prestes a embarcar em uma aventura emocionante, onde o conhecimento cultural será o seu bilhete para o próximo desafio.

—description from the publisher (Portuguese)
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Centuries
description:
Centuries is a card drafting, deck building card game.

Taking place during the turbulent but exciting Renaissance, players take on the role of a leader of a city of Renaissance Europe. Players try to construct a Major Construction within their city, collect resources, expand the their treasuries, enlarge armies, develop technology, build structures, establish trade, and colonize the world, sometimes with the help of notables like Leonardo DaVinci or Queen Elizabeth. Be the Leader who exceeds what other Leaders can do and become victorious!

Played in three Centuries, players collect resource cards in order to afford other cards that in turn award the player with victory points. A key mechanic involves deciding which cards to pass to the other Players and which to keep in a modest supply deck. Modular in nature, Players can play from 3 - 6 modules. With the 3 module game, a fun and fairly short game can be enjoyed even by novice players. With the full game, Players enjoy a challenging game that will stretch the skills of the most hardened strategist.

Cards are lavishly decorated with the great works of art from the Renaissance and can be played in multiple ways: either in a basic manner or with an added bonus, played to build the major construction, passed, kept to enlarge the supply deck, or discarded for money.

Centuries is a fast-paced, strategy card game with limitless replayability with no game playing exactly the same.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Jedi Hunters Squad Pack
description:
"Do you know the key to hunting a Jedi, friend? It is patience." -Grand Inquisitor

The last remnants of the Jedi Order tremble in fear as Inquisitors stalk them to the farthest corners of the galaxy! The Grand Inquisitor, a long-lived Pau'an, leads the Inquisitorius at Darth Vader's behest, an elite order of Force-sensitive agents strong in the dark side who hunt those who escaped the Order 66 purge. A former Jedi himself, he turned this fervor to the destruction of his former allies. He is joined in this task by Inquisitors referred to as brothers and sisters, each given a number demarking the order of their initiations.

Reva, the Third Sister, bold and ambitious, nurses a secret grudge against Lord Vader after surviving the slaughter of younglings at the Temple.

Fifth Brother, aggressive and self-sure, is ready to strike down any who stand in his way.

Fourth Sister, swift and deadly, is a hunter through and through. They are the Inquisitors, and the hunt has been called.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: SOE: Lysander
description:
SOE: Lysander is the first of a new set of low-cost, book-based games in the "Special Missions" series that put you directly into the cockpit.

Your mission is as a pilot in Great Britain's most secret aviation unit, "A" Flight of RAF 161 Squadron (Special Duties). You will fly Special Operations Executive (SOE) agents, wireless operators, saboteurs, assassins, political figures, heads of the French Resistance, and others into and out of German-occupied France during the darkest times of the Second World War.

By moonlight, you will navigate your Westland Lysander Mk. IIIA (SD) aircraft across the Channel and over occupied France to find a distant landing zone deep behind enemy lines. You will encounter flak, German patrols, small arms fire, night fighters, and the constant threat of being discovered by the Gestapo.

SOE: Lysander is in the solitaire narrative style and with a small table footprint and easy-to-learn rules. While the gameplay is designed to be straightforward, the challenges you will face are extensive. Your goal is to keep your assigned Circuits supplied -- these are underground partisan cells in the French Resistance. Your operations begin in April 1943 and your mission continues until just before D-Day.

The odds of survival are slim. Do you have what it takes?

Available through Amazon (worldwide): https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0C9SLG2ND/?tag=article-boardgameg...

The boxed set of game maps and assets (game counters and chits) is also available from Blue Panther!
https://www.bluepantherllc.com/products/soe-lysander

—description from designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Card Game, Educational, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Variable Set-up

name: Arbor Falls
description:
It’s time for a change, so you move out of the bustling city, to the quiet, small town of Arbor Falls. You set out to collect quirky furniture to decorate your empty home. Along the way, you help your neighbors, meet new people, and clean up the town. Through Calendar Events, meeting visitors at the Inn, using tools from the Community Tool Shed, Donating money for town renovations, and achieving Town Tickets, you will have plenty to do. You will fit in with the community so well!

Arbor Falls is a 1-4 player worker placement and set collecting game. Over 4 rounds, you will complete Neighbor Favors and save up to buy furniture. The Favors give in-game points and the furniture give end of game points in both theme and color sets.

You can play with all the 5 modules of the game to have the full game experience or remove any number of the modules to make the game accessible to children, non-gamer friends, and family.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Events, Modular Board, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Worker Placement
publishers: Dragon Egg Games, Montage End Games

name: Flesh and Blood Round the Table
description:
Round the Table is a stand-alone game set designed for the multiplayer format of Flesh and Blood.

It contains 4 ready-to-play hero decks with unique playstyles, including three brand-new heroes:

Professor Teklovossen (Mechanologist class)
Melody, Sing-along (Bard class)
Brevant, Civic Protector (Guardian class)
Ira, Crimson Haze (Ninja class)


The decks featuring over 100 new cards with complete new game mechanics for multiplayer games.

It also contains an exclusive rubber play mat (for one player) and a reusable storage box (for up to 1.000 cards).
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards

name: In Clouds of Glory
description:
In Clouds of Glory (ICOG)is a tabletop air wargame that recreates aerial combat during the World War One. The game was developed in Denmark the 90's by 3 friends with a common passion for the WWI "Knights of the Air".

The game features true 3-D action with accurate models of all the greatest planes of this era: SPADs, Sopwiths, Fokkers, Pfalz´es, Nieuports, Hannovers, Rumplers, Albatrosses, Bristols, Gothas, Zeppelins, S.Es...

The game represents individual plane movement and individual pilots.
Each plane is represented by a 1/350 scale model with at 360 deg. nose mount that allows the model to be positioned in all directions. The nose mount is then itself mounted on a four foot long pole made of carbon fibre. The plan can then be moved up and down the pole, thus denoting actual height - No altitude markers here. The pole is sharpened and set directly into the foam gameboards. See pictures.

Each plane also has a "Cockpit" sheet to which the Pilot sheet is attached and where the data (and possible special rules)on each plane type is represented. On the cockpit sheet also contains a speed indicator telling the current speed of the plane, and indicating the amount of energy the plane currently posses. This energy level tells how tigth the plane can turn and its ability to climb or dive. Going fast equals the ability to zoom high up, but turns are wide. Going slow allows for tighter turning but severely limits your ability to get out of trouble by zoom climbing and thus limits the tactical options. In this game speed is life.

Piloting skill can make planes turn tigther than their speed normally allows for, but this drains speed and at higher speeds also stresses the airframe, thus creating a risk of breaking of important bits such as the wings.

The "Cockpit" sheet is also where you record damage to the plane: Structural damage, damage to maneuverability, armament, engine and so on.

Each pilot has a set of 3 basic skills: Awareness (situational awareness), Piloting (ability to make tight turns, avoid or recover from spins and stalls) and Gunnery (hitting your target). A pilots skills are decided by rolling 2d6+6. Pilots also has 2 attributes: Fortitude (hit points and ability to figth when wounded) and Luck (Denotes number of dice re-rolls and Used to check for collisions) found by rolling 3d6. With experience pilots gain better skills as well as possible "Ace abilities" such as Divine luck, Deflection shooting, Aerobatics and so on.

Skill and attribute checks are done with a d20 against a basic target number (for example Skill or Attribute level) modified by conditions (for example deflection angle or target speed). The difference between the target number needed and a the number rolled on a successful check denotes the success level which is then carried on as a modifier to the damage roll.

The full rules including, missions and Cockpit panels and more can be downloaded for free here:http://icog.dk/ICOG/Download.html

1/350 scale planes can be acquired as 3D prints(or hand build in styrene as you see on many of the pictures). A large selection of planes is available for the game. Links to these can be found on the ICOG homepage: http://icog.dk/ICOG/Links.html
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Finding Anastasia
description:
THE STORY
In the year 1918 the Russian people revolted against the Monarchy. It was believed that the royal family was eliminated. However, a rumor claims that the Czar’s favorite daughter, Anastasia, survived and has been in hiding from those that are pursuing her. Her Grandmother, the Empress Dowager, heard the rumors and decided to make it her mission to find Anastasia. After years of searching, the Empress invited those who claim to be or know Anastasia to a party, where the Empress hopes to learn enough to find Anastasia.

GAME OVERVIEW
One player is the Empress, while the rest of the players are guests. To find Anastasia, the Empress and her guests must ask questions of each other. The responses are marked on a central board for all players to see. By listening to the answers and exchanging hidden clue cards with each other players must deduce who is and isn’t Anastasia. As questions are answered, gems are given to players. The gems can be used on a player’s turn to perform actions such as gaining clues, revealing roles, or asking additional questions.

The game continues until Anastasia is found or a role ability causes the game to end. Will the Empress find Anastasia? Will Rasputin's Agent find Anastasia first? What other guests will show up to this party? Play Finding Anastasia to find out.

—description from the designer
categories: Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Targeted Clues, Variable Player Powers

name: New Cold War
description:
New Cold War is a Card-Driven Game based in the most important geopolitical events from 1989 to 2019. Leads one of the four great powers (Russia, China, US, EU) in their fight for the new world order. Semi-cooperative game with individual victory, 1-4 players, 180 minutes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Events, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Almost Words
description:
Do you love word games? Do you hate word games? Almost Words is for you. A lighthearted, witty party game in which players are given a topic and two minutes. Spelling and grammar don’t matter as players trade and arrange uniquely-designed multi-purpose letter tiles to create clever responses. Players pitch their response to the judge, who picks their favourite. Fast-paced and endlessly funny, Almost Words is enjoyed by people of all ages, gamers and non-gamers alike.

Almost Words is played over a series of rounds. Each round is played as follows:

Reveal a Topic
The judge reveals the top card of the Almost Cards deck. This is your topic for the round.
Each other player takes 10 random tiles and places them face down on their presentation mat.

Arrange and Exchange
The judge starts the 2-minute sand timer.
Arrange
Flip your tiles face-up and create a response to the topic.
Your response can be any number of words.
You don’t need to use all 10 tiles.
Spelling and grammar are optional.
Each tile can be used in multiple ways as letters, numbers, pictures or symbols.
Discover creative uses for your tiles. There are no limits, just what the judge likes best!
Exchange
If you don’t like your tiles, you can trade them with other players in real time.
The clock keeps ticking during all trades.
The judge announces when time is up. Then it’s time to…

Pitch Your Nonsense
Each player takes a turn pitching and revealing their response to the table.
On your turn, set up your creation with a little story or sales pitch to explain how it relates to the topic.
Your pitch might be an elaborate tale setting the stage for the perfect punch line, or it might be short and sweet.

Judge your Friends
The judge picks their favorite based on whatever criteria they please.
The chosen player is awarded with the Almost Card for that round.
The player on the judge’s left will judge the next round.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Spelling, Storytelling

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Fokker E.III
description:
From the publisher:

The Fokker E.III was a German single-seat monoplane fighter, the first aircraft armed with a synchronized, forward firing machine gun. This airplane has been also used by the Austro-Hungary Empire and Turkey during World War One. The Fokker E.III was the definitive version of the Eindecker, with larger, newly designed wings than the original Fokker and was piloted by Aces as Max Immelmann, Hans-Joachim Buddecke and Oswald Boelcke. Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW1 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards. This is not a complete game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 1914: Dispatches – Twilight in the East
description:
1914: Dispatches is the first issue of Oregon ConSim Journal (a Charles S Roberts Award winning magazine), is a support magazine that focuses on the Eastern Front during 1914 by expanding on the CSR Award winning WWI simulation game 1914: Twilight in the East (TitE).

During the design of 1914 TitE a great deal of research material was accumulated that was not incorporated due to space (and time) limitations. The Journal allows some of this material to be brought to light, more thoroughly covering the fascinating 1914 time period. The centerpiece of the publication is a collection of three well-researched historical articles that are paired with new scenarios allowing the subject to be accurately simulated.

The time period October–November 1914 contained two distinct campaigns that culminated in very large battles fought in Russian Poland: The Battle of Ivangorod and Battles of Lodz and Krakau. These battles are the topics chosen for two of the scenarios found in the journal. The first, “The Battle of Ivangorod,” is a small introductory scenario that covers the time period 22–26 October when the Austro-Hungarian First Army unsuccessfully fought to clear the Russians from their Vistula River bridgeheads at Ivangorod and Kozienice.

Following the Battle of Ivangorod, in early November the German high command acted to regain the operational initiative and protect Germany from the ravages of invasion. Using their excellent railroad network to transfer large bodies of troops, they launched an offensive to penetrate deep into the main Russian forces’ flank and rear. The epic operation is the subject of the Journal’s second scenario, “The Battles of Lodz and Krakau.” This expert scenario, intended for veteran players, is huge, requiring all five maps and almost the entire counter mix.

A well known military axiom states: mistakes made in the deployment of troops at the start of operations cannot be righted in the course of the whole campaign. At the outset of WWI this was true for all fronts but nowhere was it more pertinent than on the Eastern Front. The Journal’s third article, “Austria-Hungary’s Botched Deployment in 1914” concentrates on that nation’s botched initial strategic deployment.

The game strategy article Playing Both Sides in Galicia details successful opening moves on the Galician front. Based on years of gameplay experience by the designer, the article presents a corps-by-corps breakdown of Austro-Hungarian and Russian armies and offers tested solutions for the challenges they face.

Rounding out the contents are two enhanced, professionally-produced Player Aid Cards designed to speed combat resolution in 1914, Twilight in the East.

Journal Contents (64 pages):


The Austro-Hungarian Army and National Identity 1867–1914



Austria-Hungary’s Botched Deployment in 1914
associated scenario: The Austro-Hungarian Deployment Plan as of Winter 1913/14 (18 counters to be mounted - see expansion counters)




Playing Both Sides in Galicia — Galicia Campaign Strategies



Prelude to Ivangorod
associated scenario: The Battle of Ivangorod (introductory scenario GT 28-29)




The Lodz Campaign: Defeating the Russian Steamroller
associated scenario: The Battles of Lodz & Krakau (complete scenario GT 36-47)




The Polish Legion in 1914



Revised Victory Conditions for the Grand Campaign scenario


Also included: Two replacement Player Aid Cards for 1914, Twilight in the East

See preview pages.

(Source: publisher and BGG user)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Wallenstein: Military Leaders – Expansion Module 3
description:
In the Wallenstein: Military Leaders expansion, each player receives one military leader figure to place on one of his controlled counties. While performing actions in this county, he receives extra benefits, such as reduced costs by 1 when constructing buildings or additional grain when producing it.

At the end of the turn, he moves the leader to an adjacent county under his control, if possible, while leaving a marker at the old location. The more markers you have on the board at the end of the game, the more points you're awarded.

Wallenstein: Military Leaders was presented as a Kickstarter exclusive while also possibly being available at conventions.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Crannogman Trackers
description:
In combat, hitting the enemy without them being able to hit you back is a very powerful ability. In the battles of Westeros, warriors armed with bows can whittle down even heavily-armed foes, bringing victory to one side. In that role, Crannogman Trackers are the unit of choice for Free Folk commanders. They are lightly armed and armored, but that allows them to be quick and nimble. Their skill with their bows means enemies risk dying under a hail of missile fire. When joined by a Crannogman Warden, they become even more deadly, giving them a guiding hand to who to attack next.

The Crannogman Trackers unit box for A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game comes complete with everything a Free Folk player needs to put these harassers on the battlefield. They excel at movement and fighting on enemy flanks. And the Warden Unit Attachment gives them bonuses when attacking foes that have yet to activate.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: The Inmost Sea: The Battle of Lepanto 1571
description:
“…for the inmost sea of all the earth is shaken with his ships.
They have dared the white republics up the capes of Italy,
They have dashed the Adriatic round the Lion of the Sea,
And the Pope has cast his arms abroad for agony and loss,
And called the kings of Christendom for swords about the Cross…”
from Lepanto
by G.K. Chesterton

1571. Suleiman the Magnificent, the law-giver, is dead.

With Cyprus falling to the Turks, Pope Pius V calls the squadrons of Europe together to stop the Ottoman advance. Given the command is the 24-year old Don Juan d'Austria, bastard son of the Holy Roman Emperor. By the end of a fateful October afternoon, the Catholics will have won an inestimable moral victory and Suleiman's son Selim would have to drain his empire’s coffers to rebuild his shattered fleet from scratch.

Thanks to remarkable surviving records of the order of battle, The Inmost Sea simulates this epic clash at the individual ship level. Ostensibly a two-player game, also playable with fog-of-war solitaire rules, or as multiple independent wing commands with three players to a side. Play any of the three wings in separate scenarios, or the entire grand battle. Also includes several alternate history setups.

Game & graphic design by Mark Mahaffey
Cover painting by Radoslav Javor
Leader portraits by Leona Preston
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: War of Ashes: Shieldwall
description:
War of Ashes: Shieldwall is the latest offering from the designers of This Quar’s War and Songs of our Ancestors. Concentrating on command and position instead of unit statistics and abilities, WoA: Shieldwall provides simple rules that bring with them difficult decisions.

Taking the gritty tactics and concepts of the Dark Ages and setting them in the whimsical world of Agaptus, WoA: Shieldwall begins with the Roar Phase in which both sides rally their line and taunt their opponent. The goal of which is generating Froth, a resource used throughout the game to bend the rules and adjust position in the line.

To represent the flowing nature and chaos of the battlefield, WoA: Shieldwall utilizes a blind random activation system in which the commander never quite knows how far he can push his fighters before the momentum of the battle passes to his opponent.

Once two lines have met, the fighting begins. Unlike most ranked unit games, casualties are removed from the point of contact and the lines begin to merge. Each slain opponent brings with him a decision – advance and break their line, or hold and preserve your Shieldwall!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Death Ride Salerno: Herman Goring/15th Panzer Grenadier
description:
This game is the fourth and last installment in the Death Ride Salerno game set. It is set in the Salerno city area and the passes heading north toward Naples. The Herman Goring Division moved south to help 16th Panzer as did 15th Panzer Grenadier and held the British back from moving north. While they tried to push the British back the British were too well supplied with heavy weapons and naval gunfire support. The British were funneled into the passes between the hills leading north and a heavy attack could not be sufficiently concentrated to be successful.

The rules are written using the Seven Battlefield Operating Systems as a framework. They are Maneuver, Command and Control, Fire Support, Mobility and Survivability, Combat Service Support, Intelligence, and Air Defense. They are not complex and make the game easier to understand than most large games. Putting all 4 games together creates a monster of monster games. All together having 4 Allied divisions at company level and 5 German divisions at platoon level.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Bionic
description:
Bionic is a paragraph driven solo adventure game set in an alternate future where those with the resources have become half-machine. Super corporations rule the world from elaborate orbital stations while gangs, governments and citizens struggle to survive on the ever worsening surface of Earth.

In this game you create an Android who is employed by the largest augmentation corporation in the universe - Cyber Tech Revolutions Ltd. Each game you select a Contract from the Data Archives to complete, which will have you exploring the city of Kinacha (divided into Upper Kinacha and Lower Kinacha) completing the tasks set forth by your employer.

The game utilizes a roll and keep mechanic. For any given task there will be a difficulty number and based on your skills and attributes you will roll a certain number of 10-sided dice and then may select to keep a certain number. If your final result is above the TN you act recklessly, below the TN is cautious and matching the TN is the ideal outcome.

The game has been divided into 5 Chapters for ease of printing and playing. Each Chapter will slowly add more mechanics to the game building on the core of Chapter 1 and the Contracts in each successive Chapter build on the story of those occurring before it:

Chapter I is an introduction to the Bionic world and in particular the city of Kinacha.

Chapter II introduces a more fluid Encounter deck (with more cards that can be permanently removed as well as cards that only get added when you achieve certain goals), a new game board (Lower Kinacha) and allow access to the Underground via the Underground Access Status card. Chapter II focuses on the gang war in Lower Kinacha.

Chapter III takes place in the Underground proper and introduces a secondary Encounter Deck and a secondary Item Deck for this purpose.

Chapter IV expands upon what is already in place, and mostly adds a large number of new contracts to move the story towards the conclusion. This story arc features many decision points in the Contracts that will affect future Contracts.

Chapter V is the conclusion, and knowing what the additional components are would be a spoiler!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Boomtown Tycoon
description:
The west is yours to take — if you’re strong enough to take it! You are a prospector from humble beginnings who has journeyed far and wide in search of your fortune. With only a few tools and basic resources, you start mining in hopes of striking it rich. In this wild west, gold-mining, city-building card game, you quickly find that you must be tenacious!

There’s only so much gold in the hills and you must compete with rival prospectors to claim it. This deckbuilding game starts out relatively simple and becomes progressively more complex. Players begin the game with identical decks of cards that consist of basic resources such as labor, brick, lumber, food, and silver. They can use silver and eventually gold to trade these resources for more advanced resources in the market such as pickaxe, guns, leather, and paper. Different combinations of these resources allow players to purchase event cards, wanted cards, and building cards. As a result, these cards give individuals easier access to gold and provide a specified number of victory points.

To outmatch your opponents, your strategy may consist of cunning intellect or brutal aggression. Be the architect of a sluice box, which reduces the amount of labor needed to mine gold, or build a gangster hideout to attack your opponents. When all of the gold is mined, the player with the most victory points wins and becomes the legendary boomtown tycoon!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection
publishers: (Self-Published), IB Games, LLC, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: The Award Goes To
description:
You want to be the most acclaimed of movie producers. The only way to do that is to collect accolades from your industry. To reach this goal, you are going to have to make some pretty good movies. Unfortunately, your fellow producers are onto you, and they want to beat your box office star power. However, if you can collect five awards for Best Picture, you will be inducted into the Producer's Hall of Fame. Can you artfully produce five of the best movies ever made?

This game is a quick fun game with basic math skills required, adding and multiplying numbers by two is required to play this game.

Players are dealt 5 cards. Then a scene and a title card are dealt from their respective decks which give bonuses to actor cards. Players select three of the five actor cards from their hand and play them face down. Once everyone has played their cards, all selected cards are turned over and counted up. The person with highest score wins the round and receives a token.

First to five tokens, wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management

name: Battlemind: A Game of Battle Strategy
description:
Battlemind is a medieval-themed battle strategy game in which two players, each with 10 character cards, try to capture/kill the other player's King. Inspired by the game from George R. R. Martin's A Song of Ice and Fire fantasy novels (HBO's Game of Thrones is based on this series), Battlemind combines the strategic elements of Chess, Stratego, and Blitzkrieg to create a an easy to learn but hard to master game with infinite replayability. This game is for anyone who loves strategy games - not just fans of the books!

What makes Battlemind special? Instead of being played like a typical card game (dealing/drawing), it is played more like a board game, with players setting up a "board" made of terrain cards and moving character cards across them.

Like chess, each character card has a certain number of spaces in which it can move. But that's where the similarities end. Each character has a strength value (1-8) which dictates whether it can capture/kill another character as well as certain advantages and disadvantages over other characters. From the lowly Rabble (rabble is like an angry mob) to the powerful Dragon, every unit has a purpose. How you use them is up to you!

Finally, each terrain type can benefit or hinder your character. Use terrain to slow your enemy down, protect your fortress, and even hide from Dragons!

Ultimately, how you set up your terrain, arrange your army, and advance your units will determine whether you will be the victor or the vanquished. You'll laugh at your opponent when he places a crucial unit on his front line that you are able to capture easily, but will be crushed when that same placement allows him to capture your dragon on his first move in the next game!

Will you create a defensive stronghold and make your advesary come to you? Or will you storm the front lines in hopes of catching your opponent off guard?

It's your decision. The fate of the Kingdom rests on your shoulders. Fight for honor. Fight for glory. But remember: in the game of Battlemind, every move can mean victory or crushing defeat.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Protee 1772 / Eveille 1772
description:
Description from the publisher:

Protée was built in 1772 and designated as flagship of a convoy directed to India, departing with other ships as escort, transporting troops and ammunition. On 23 February, off Spain, the convoy met Rodney's fleet; Duchilleau, commander in charge, tried to lure the British by continuing on the same bearing, while the convoy escaped, escorted by the other ships. The British fleet chased and captured Protée.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the French Artésien Class ship-of-the-line “Eveillé 1772.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: HMS Prothee 1780 / HMS Argonaut 1782 Ship Pack
description:
Description from the publisher:

After being captured off the coast of Spain by Lord Robert Manners, the Protée was commissioned in the Royal Navy as the third rate HMS Prothee. She was converted to serve as a prison ship in 1799, and broken up in 1815. Eight of her small cannons were purchased by John Manners, 5th Duke of Rutland and are currently at Belvoir Castle, Leicestershire. The cannons are still fired on special occasions, such as weddings and the Duke's birthday.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the British Caton Class ship-of-the-line “HMS Argonaut 1782.”

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Wizard's WARdrobe
description:
Description from the publisher:

In Wizard’s WARdrobe, you take the role of an apprentice wizard who has busted in to the Grand Wizard’s magical WARdrobe to battle other wizards for epic loot. Each player starts with 99 Hit Points, two learned spells in hand, and a wizard inventory playmat with 8 color & number-coded body locations for items (2 feet, 2 body, 2 hands, 1 head & as many accessories [trinkets or familiars] as you want). During your turn you allocate 3 actions to cast spells, use items, and grab items from the 8 face-up WARdrobe piles. The more powerful the effect, the more actions it costs, so keep an eye out for boots and familiars that can give you extra actions.

Gear Up!
The more items you are wearing, the harder you are to hit. The innovative hit roll system supports the theme nicely: When a wizard deals damage to other wizards, they roll an 8-sided hit die and refer to the hit location on each affected players’ playmat. If the wizard has an item in that location, it is moved to the junk pile and no damage is dealt. If the wizard does not have an item in that location, then the damage is rolled and dealt to the wizard’s HP.

Throw Down!
There is a vast repertoire of offensive and defensive effects in the base game (over 200 cards), with more to come in the preset expansion boosters. Once your wizard is suited up with synergetic buffs, you are ready to use your spells and items to attack your opponents and defend yourself. The last wizard standing wins!

Wizard’s WARdrobe is quick to set up and very easy to learn: the game pieces laid out almost teach the game itself. It is fast-paced (you can start slinging right off the bat) yet still highly strategic (with dozens of spells and 8 WARdrobe piles to choose equipment from, there are many lines of play). So far, in the hundreds of private and public playtests at conventions and stores, almost every game has been unique and exciting. The few games that weren’t we used to refine the game to its current 5th version, which is running super smooth, fun, and balanced.
