mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Monsters: Don't Treat Them Gently!
description: Monsters, Don’t Treat Them Gently! incorporates the Monsters and Protagonists from the short stories of the 19th century to early 20th century celebrated English ghost writer, M. R. James. The game is set in the fictional parish of Barchester and features 20 typical locations from James’ stories. The game is introduced by means of a mysterious letter which informs the reader that they must lead a team of courageous people to fight back against the malevolent forces that threaten to overtake Barchester. The game can be played with basic rules or with a host of tactical rules as player’s become used to the flow of the game. A player can play a solitaire game where they control the Protagonists with the aim of banishing the Monsters to claim victory (the Monster being played by A.I. mechanics in the game). Alternatively a 2 player game can be played where one side takes control of the Protagonists and the other side the Monsters. Both sides choose a starting team of 15 from their decks; each card has 4 attribute statistics. Each turn take place at a different location, which may allow counters to be played or benefits to accrue. The Protagonist cards can be equipped with Boon cards that can be found at the various locations. The turn has 4 phases: organise, initiate, engage and resolve. The Protagonist and Monster players take alternate turns to hold the location and decide the type of encounter, which is kept secret from their opponent. The responding player must try and guess what strategy is being used and play their hand accordingly. The controlling player can see the card images but not the statistics, so uses their knowledge to try and play the best cards to win the encounter. The cards are then revealed and the statistics compared. An encounter table is consulted to determine the outcomes. The Monster cards can also be played as a stand-alone trump-style game, “Monsters & Miscreants.”
mechanics: Hand Management, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: House Monsters
description:
This adorable card game is about getting rid of those pesky house monsters!

The cards are made up of monsters or items the monsters left behind. Deal out the entire deck to the players. You are getting rid of the cards in your hands by moving clockwise, playing cards on the previous discard. You can play on the same color or the expression the monster has. Some cards have special text that impact the players. The first player to get rid of all their cards wins the game!

A family-friendly, colorful, hand depletion game!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Number
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Spellfire: Booster Pack, Set 10 – Draconomicon
description: July 1996 - Released concurrently with 4th Edition, this booster focused on one theme, and made almost an entirely new booster out of it. We see the first dragon champions that are not monsters, new dragon only spells and unarmed combat cards, and even dragon only items and artifacts. Even if you don't play using dragons, there are many useful cards you could use. Overall, I love this set for the same reasons I loved Artifacts: expantion on a theme. Now, you rarely see a tourney of fun deck without at least 1 dragon. Landmark Cards: Lair of the Shadowdrake (#3); Mount Deismaar (#9); Dragon's Horde (#10); Dragon Raid! (#20); Favorable Winds (#24); Maldraedior, Grwat Blue Wyrm (#29); Tamarand, Great Gold Wyrm (#30); Lareth, King of Justice (#31); The Celestial Emperor (#43); Dragon's Calm (#47); Blessing of Bahamut (#58); Well of Many Worlds (#77); Orb of the Eternal Dragon (#88); Breath Weapon III (#96); Swollow Whole (#97); The Battle Must Go On! (#100); Lernaean Hydra (c#7); Dragon Cultist (c#9); Playing to Lose (c#10); and Underground Lair (#24).
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mob Mentality
description:
"An epic party game designed by adults for adults"

"It will get dirty and you're gonna love it!"

OBJECT OF THE GAME

You want to understand and think like the group you're playing with.

Questions are asked to the party group and the answers will either be what the majority decides or the actual census of the group. Answer correctly to score points and win. Our game is made for kick ass adults who like to party and rule the mob!

For Mob Rules and Mob Blank cards: You do not necessarily answer a question with what you think the answer is but what you think the majority of the group will answer. You want to have a mob mentality. If you guess an answer that is in the majority, you score points.

Mob Census cards: You want to guess the total number of people in the group who have done what the card asks. You want to guess the correct mob census.

The game starts by nominating one person in the group to be an all-time Question Master. The Question Master is tasked with reading all questions and controlling the tempo and tone of the game. If people are talking and having fun, slow the game down and enjoy the moment!

The game is played through three rounds. Whoever scores the most points at the end of the game has the ultimate mob mentality and wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Omen
description:
Omen is a 2-4 players game with an approximate duration of 30-45 minutes. The players represent powerful gods confronted between them to get success in their own divine plans.
In the game, each player has some power tokens that allow them to influence the state of the board that represents humanity, divided by its different alignments: goodness, neutrality and evil.
In order to get the control of the areas of its interest, players will have awesome cards that can play to take advantage and decide the human fate.

In Omen you'll find a simple game with amazing mechanics and interactions, easy to learn, with a lot of strategy but very little chance.

Players must guess their opponents' intentions in order to anticipate them, carefully calculate each of their decisions, and forge strange alliances if they want to rise among the others with more influence points to become the most powerful of the gods.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Survivors: Minutemen Posse
description:
The Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Survivors: Minutemen Posse provides an expansion to your game with new cards for player vs player and AI game modes.

Models: 4 x Minutemen (2 female, 2 male), 4 x Scenic bases

Cards: 2 x Large cards: Unit, AI 10+ Small cards from a range of: Item (Weapon, Equipment, Chem), Boost, Explore, Event, Wasteland (Danger, Creature, Stranger)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simulation

name: Bloody Sails
description:
Bloody Sails is a management/strategy board game, inspired by the 4X genre. It's set in a fictional X/XI century Scandinavia, in which Norse kingdoms compete for power, while threatening the nearby foreign kingdoms with raids and pillages.

The player takes the role of one of the Norse monarchs in the game, each with unique objectives, heroes, blessings and development trees, and leads his/her kingdom in a timespan of 20 to 40 years. Each year constitutes a game round, divided in 4 seasons, in which players may take action. Players will have to gather resources, improve their cities and tribe, explore the seas, build armies and fight against other Viking and Christian empires, to ultimately reach their fate and triumph over their opponents.

Battles are based on hero, unit and combat cards. Units and modifiers enhance the strength of combat cards, that are then played from the hand in succession until a contender wins. Heroes serve as generals, giving the owner unique skills and better combat cards. Fighting is a key point in the game, since it leads to conquest, plunder and glory.

Starting from a small coastal village, players will create great overseas domains and lead their people to greatness, developing their nation with the riches their raids and trades will provide. They will command great armies and famed heroes, proving their worth on the battlefield and earning the favor of the gods. They will have to outshine every opponent and take their place in the sagas.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Civilization, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Pin-up Rummy
description:
In Pin-up Rummy, you are a vintage pin-up painting collector, and you want to have the very best collection that no one ever had.

The game is played over a series of rounds. In each round, players draw fresh hands of cards, take turns playing cards until the round is finished, and then do the scoring. First to reach 100 (or higher) points, wins.

On your turn you have three things to do (in this order): Draw, Play then Discard.

There are 4 different “Asset Cards” and 9 different “Type of Women” cards, each card comes with a unique vintage pin-up girl painting.

A couple of examples from the rulebook:

“Each Conservative Woman counteracts the penalty of one Slut in your Collection.”
“When launching a new set, you may use Sluts to reduce the number of matched cards you need (normally 3).”
“When played a Homewrecker Card, steal a card from a player's Collection.”

Pin-up Rummy was designed to be fun and let players talk about women (and men) during gameplay, expect lots of puns to be made ;)

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Trudvang Legends: Muspelheim
description:
Trudvang Legends: Muspelheim is an expansion that features an all-new campaign that takes place deep below the surface of Trudvang, in the Dwarven kingdom of Muspelheim, represented by a new game board where Heroes below the surface can travel to face new encounters. With the great Bjorvolog gate shut and the northern cities suffering under constant attack, unrest may lead to a civil war, threatening thousands of dwarves. New enemies, new heroes, and a brand new campaign to unveil and stop sinister forces at work await you in Muspelheim!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Push Your Luck

name: The XX War
description:
In a world where most men have died, players have to save humanity by building their harems with the most beautiful and skillful girls.

A war of luck and strategy is about to be fought to see who among the players will have the greatest of all harems.

The girls are separated by levels from 1 to 3.

Each player starts with 3 dice and a level 1 girl, through dice rolls each player must mount their harem by conquering the available girls on the table.

Every 2 girls conquered by the player gives an extra die to him, which increases the chances to conquer and use the powers of the girls he has.

Through the points earned by each girl the winner is the player who can collect 20 points first.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Forsaken Forest: Spirit Uprising
description:
Spirit Uprising is the Ethereal Expansion to Forsaken Forest.

The spirits have broken free from their eternal prison... and they want vengeance! In Spirit Uprising, the role of Spirits changes dramatically, as many cards allow dead players to possess living players, be Reincarnated, and even return to the plane of the living for some ghostly revenge.

Spirit Uprising adds levels upon levels of strategy, mind-games, card synergies, and new mechanics to the game.

Including in the expansion are 10 game-changing new Roles, eight perilous Destinations, eight terrifying Forest Cards, and over twenty powerful Travelers Cards, including a new card type - Contraptions. These cards shape the game in new and exciting ways together.

There are countless new possible card interactions, and predicaments that players can get themselves into.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Hidden Roles, Kill Steal, Voting

name: UltraQuest: Gold, Ruhm! und Ehre! – Das Ogerkönigreich
description:
The Ogre Kingdom
The first in a row of Legendary Dungeons, Hills 98 (Hügel,Hü98)
Expands the entry of Hü98 to a whole new 4 page Dungeon with a possibility of a legendary treasure for the Ultra-Victory in UltraQuest.
Ties in with the Ogre Character Expansion.

Das erste in einer Reihe von legendären Verlies (Hü98). 4 Seiten DINA4 mit neuen Ereignissen welche den Eintrag Hü98 erweitern. Mit einer Chance auf einen legendären Schatz für den Ultra-Sieg in UltraQuest.
Passt zur Abenteuerer-Rasse Oger.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Taoex
description:
Taoex is an abstract strategy game where players use mono-directional tiles to navigate a hexagonal grid to capture opponents’ tiles to create multi-directional towers for greater mobility. Using the 6-pointed compass, that control all direction of play, located in the center of the board, players take turns placing their 12 tiles (2 for each compass direction) in the optimum starting hexes. Once all the 36 starting hexes have been filled the game begins with the players taking turns advancing at least 1 tile into play per turn. Within the board there is a 6-pointed star called The Way where tiles are forced to roll the 10-sided Taoex die to charge the path a tile/tower moves across the board. Regardless of whether the roll is beneficial to the rolling player, the tile must move the roll along the Way if it can. Tiles/towers that traverse board to the far side of the board, if the tile/tower manages to line up with a starting hex, the tile/tower can wrap around the board to come out on the other side once again. An excellent tactic when hunting new directions.

As players begin collecting enemy tiles, by landing on them, they form towers of up to 6 tiles tall, maximum. Anything over 6 tiles the tower’s owner either removes enemy tiles from play or in the case of his own, liberates them and returns them to an open starting hex of the appropriate direction of the tile. The game is won by a player collecting 6 of one enemy’s tiles into a single tower or, if 1 player captures/eliminates all opponent tiles.

Taoex is a challenging and unique abstract strategy game that is very simple to learn and yet offers the players a mental workout as they master their play. Naturally, the rules that govern the game are more complex than the description written above, but it is the nuances in the rules that makes all games more interesting and Taoex offers its fair share. If you are the kind of gamer that enjoys using your mind to defeat opponents rather than just relying upon some lucky dice roll or random chance, then Taoex is a game for you.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Relative Movement

name: The Enigma Experiences
description:
The Enigma Experiences: an artwork turned into a new gaming experience in which creativity, technology and history are combined.
We present you with a unique experience and a new entertainment system, which goes hand in hand with an amazing object in a completely revolutionary game. Imagine for a moment the thrill of being able to investigate and solve great mysteries, while enjoying playing exciting games and solving riddles with your friends and/or family!

What makes THE ENIGMA EXPERIENCES so special?

It is a completely new, unique and original concept: an artwork turned into a new gaming experience in which creativity, technology and history are combined.
It is one of the best games of research and intrigue this year, designed to be enjoyed alone or with friends and/or family.
It has been created in such a way that players can experience and experiment first-hand with technologies such as Virtual Reality (VR), Augmented Reality (AR) and Artificial Intelligence (AI).
It's so easy to use, even our grandmothers have been able to play it! Despite being considered a very elaborate game with many carefully chosen details, no knowledge or preparation is needed to enjoy it.


Our product is going to be manufactured and assembled in Europe. To produce our game and its elements we use materials from Europe and the U.S.
Feel the emotions that will arise from our experiences. Imagine having in your hands the most exciting challenges that the greatest researchers from all over the world have faced, and solve them yourself.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Go Get Fish
description:
GoGetFish is the fishing game for 2-4 players.

GAME OBJECTIVE
Each player assumes the role of a skillful fisherman, who came from around the world to compete for the championship in fishing. Whenever your turn comes up, you may move your ship and select one of the following 4 action options:

Fishing
Collect treasure chest
Docking
Pass


The first player who was able to acquire 12 trophy points or the player who collected all of the 3 Artifacts will be the winner.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Nautical, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Push Your Luck, Race, Role Playing

name: Party Tails
description:
Party Tails is a card game for people that like animals, drinking, and animals drinking – no drinks required! The goal is to knock out your opponents by giving them the total number of drinks listed on their Animal Card. You’ll choose your Animal, hand out drinks, play Party Cards to mix things up, knock out all of your opponents, and win bragging rights for being the ultimate party animal!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Van Gogh
description:
Van Gogh is a game in which we are the inspirations inside the artist's mind, the minigoghs (meeples), beings with different personalities and special skills: happy, dreamy, impatient, melancholic and playful minigoghs.

The meeples rolling mechanism reflects van gogh's untimely, fickle and creative personality, combined minigoghs can be allocated by their positions: lying, on its sides, standing or upside down.

Our goal will be to use the minigoghs in the most efficient way to paint the works, scoring points of prestige.
In the round, players take turns selecting a character card from those on the table receiving a full bonus. After this, every player to receive the simple bonus of the character.

Each space allocation is scored immediately and the winner will be the one who collaborates most efficiently with the paintings at the end of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Kingdom 1183
description:
Kingdom 1183 is a smooth, yet intricate economy and warfare simulator driven by your ever-improving strategy. It is a combination of worker placement, resource gathering, economy management, and combat. Your fate in Kingdom 1183 is decided by your strategy and choices.

You will build and manage your own kingdom. There is no area to control, no shared board. Instead, you can choose from one of seven ways to win including combat-free solely economy-based victories. The game is played alone or with three friends and is expandable to eight players or more. All game modes can be played in team or free-for-all setups. Every night will be very different from the last.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Dice Rolling, Market, Moving Multiple Units, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement, Trading, Turn Order: Progressive, Worker Placement

name: KEPO: A Trait-Guessing Game
description:
This is the big day of 2200!

A declaration of friendship between Planet Earth and Planet Kepo has been announced. Kepo aliens are so excited to study more about human traits. Hence, a big global event is held: A Game of Traits!

KEPO: A Game of Traits is a social party game that helps you reveal what people think about you. It has 3 different game
modes: 1 cooperative game & 2 competitive games. Players will be challenged to test their self-awareness and their ability to observe other players’ traits. With more than 400 traits and 3 difficulty levels to play, every single game will create a unique experience, filled with fun and new stories!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction

name: Goblin Cave
description:
Goblin Cave is an asymmetrical team-based tactics game featuring strategic, card-based combat driven by unique character abilities and player decisions.

Each player takes control of two unique characters, drawing cards with powerful abilities and moving freely around the board. Players will control tactical locations, place traps, launch fireballs, destroy walls, teleport across pits, climb ledges, sling arrows, swing great-axes, steal relics, and much, much more!

Each team of players has their own win conditions, and will go toe-to-toe with their opponents to achieve them through fast-paced strategy-fueled combat. Adventurers traverse the Goblins’ cave in order to steal Relics—objects of great arcane power. Goblins must defend their homes from the greedy invaders who are trying to steal their relics, navigating the cave through tunnels only they can use! Each team is comprised of unique characters with rich lore and powerful specialized abilities, not unlike a board game version of a MOBA (like League of Legends) or hero shooter (like Overwatch or Apex Legends).

Players control two characters simultaneously. On a player’s turn, they draw an ability card from each character's ability deck, roll a die for each character’s movement, then move and use an ability card for each character, in any order they wish. The game ends either when all characters on a team are incapacitated, when the Adventurers escape with a relic, or when 10 rounds have passed.

With 10 playable characters, multiple cave maps, and several planned expansions, Goblin Cave offers a great deal of replayability and long-term support.
mechanics: Area Movement, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Race, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Sudden Death Ending, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes of the Pacific – For the Emperor
description:
For the Emperor is a Battle-pack expansion for Heroes of the Pacific from the Lock and Load Tactical system. Included are eight brand-new scenarios. It features fluid, impulse-based turns, squad-level, and individual heroics. The scenarios span the entire length of the war, starting with the Japanese invasion of Wake Island and the Philippine Islands. From the bloody last days of the Japanese on Guadalcanal to the frustrating static warfare on Bougainville.

We witness some of the last and largest Banzai attacks on Guam and Saipan. The close and dirty work of clearing Japanese cave networks on Peleliu and then things come full circle as the Allies return to liberate the Philippine Islands.

For The Emperor, Battlepack is all about the Imperial Japanese Army, and the US Military forces. Get ready to return to the Pacific with For the Emperor!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Shanzhai
description:
Shanzhai is a fast playing pick-up and deliver, economic game in which you’re a “businessman” dealing counterfeit goods, trying to make more money than your rivals. Get deals from the local traders, complete them by selling the required goods, maybe gamble with the money you make and see if you’re lucky enough to double your income. You need to be fast and witty though, the more deals you complete the sooner the police come, will you bribe them or completely avoid them?

Shanzhai (Chinese: 山寨; pinyin: shānzhài) is a Chinese term that means counterfeit products.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Memory, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Set Collection, Take That, Trading

name: Star Wars: Legion – Shadow Collective Starter Set
description:
The galaxy’s seedy underbelly comes to Star Wars: Legion with the Shadow Collective Starter Set! This set introduces mercenaries to the game, inviting players to hire units from the notorious Black Sun and Pyke syndicates to join other faction’s armies. Alternatively, Maul himself can unite these disparate criminals under the banner of the Shadow Collective and lead them as a standalone force. Alongside his Mandalorian Super Commandos, they form a threat that could bring the galaxy to its knees.

Whichever path they choose, this set gives players plenty of new options for building their armies with 22 miniatures, including Maul, a unit of Shadow Collective Mandalorian Super Commandos, a unit of Black Sun Enforcers, and a unit of Pyke Syndicate Foot Soldiers. Additionally, players can further customize these forces with 30 upgrade cards that unlock heavy weapons, characters like Rook Kast, and more. Finally, this set also includes three command cards for use with the new mercenaries, three new command cards for Maul, and reprints of Maul’s three Separatist Alliance command cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bad Baby Lich Lords
description:
Bad Baby Lich Lords is a fast-paced competitive card game of necromancy and sibling rivalry for 2-4 players

Lich siblings battle it out in this competitive card game inspired by your favorite Saturday morning cartoons. Flip double-sided skeleton cards to raise the dead and activate their powers. Cast dark spells. Wrangle your unruly minions and set off chain reactions and combos. Collect sets of minion cards to meet the requirements to score on realms. Be the first player to make enough noise to wake up the sleeping Lich King!

Featuring over 100+ double-sided cards with full art by award winning artist Taylor Dow.

Choose from 4 factions with unique abilities.
mechanics: Set Collection
publishers: Heart of the Deernicorn, Wonderbow Games

name: BattleTech Legends
description:
Across the centuries, the fate of the Inner Sphere changed time and again with the actions of one MechWarrior and one Mech fighting at the crux of history. Their stories became legends passed down through the years, and now these legends and their Mechs stand revealed as never before.

Battle Legends depicts fifty-two of the universe's most famous -and infamous- MechWarriors and their Mechs from every era of BattleTech including the upcoming ilClan era. Each entry includes gorgeous full0colour portraits of the character and camo specs for their machines, and delves into their battle history as a MechWarrior to reval all-new details never before published. Finally, each era section kicks off with all-new fiction by some of BattleTech's own legendary authors.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Fimbulwinter
description:
The first sign of the Ragnarok, the Vikings’ legendary doomsday, is here: the Fimbulwinter. To survive the harsh winter, the Viking tribes are gathering resources and try to occupy regions.
In the Fimbulwinter game, you take control of one of the Viking tribes and attempt to save it from annihilation during the three years of severe winters.

In the Fimbulwinter game, every player is given a set of 15 dice, each set having a different color. However, the dice are not for rolling, they are used as the warriors of the Viking tribes and put on various regions of the board. The pip value of the dice represents the warriors’ power, determining the winners in the battles.

The game is played through three years. Each year, one of the gods makes an order that needs to be obeyed by all the players for the whole year.

Players, as the commander of a Viking tribe, place their own warriors on the board, reinforce them, fight other tribes, and try to take control of different regions by having the most Viking warriors in them to gain points and bring glory to their tribes.
At the end of the third year, the player with the highest glory will win the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Closed Drafting, Events, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Company of Heroes: Solo / Co-op & Fog of War
description:
The 2nd Edition Solo and Cooperative Expansion is a completely revised product drawing on the strengths of the 1st Edition but now with a much more intelligent A.I to play against or on a human player's team. The A.I. now secures resource and victory control points like a human player allowing for standard victory conditions rather than the previous abstract round limit of 1st Edition. Players can also use the 250 high quality acrylic unit tiles to play in multiple Fog of War modes including the 45 minute Fog of War Lite Mode for quick games.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Dungeon Universalis: The Demon Under the Mountain – A Tribute to the Classics
description:
10 quests that take place in a huge city under the mountain, full of mines, corridors, riddles, orcs, insects and other abyssal creatures.

—description from the publisher

This small campaign book was released as a promo item during the 3rd DUN Kickstarter to recover some of the lost shipping cost on the first two Kickstarters.

—user description
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tricky Goblins
description:
So, what will it be? Bombs, Burning, or Bedlam?
Goblins - start your bickering!

Tricky Goblins is a trick-taking card game for 2 - 4, where players gain gold coins by winning tricks and meddling with dice to align with their secret objective cards, or "plans". The player with the most gold coins at the end of the game wins, and is dubbed the Trickiest Goblin!
mechanics: Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Saqueadores del Mar del Norte: Cartas promos
description:
An authorized promo deck for the Spanish market that contains a selection of 10 cards from the North Sea Runesaga expansion.

1 Hero:
Jorunn

9 Townfolks:
- Artisan
- Assassin
- Beggar
- Blacksmith
- Conspirator
- Farmer
- Labourer
- Thief
- Tyrant
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Star Wars: Legion – Moff Gideon Commander Expansion
description:
The cunning Moff Gideon enters the battles of Star Wars: Legion in this new Commander Expansion! Continuing to serve the Empire after the Battle of Endor as a leader of his own remnant of Imperial forces, Moff Gideon is the cornerstone of a new Battle Force players can utilize in their games of Star Wars: Legion. With the Darksaber in hand and his three signature command cards at his disposal, he’s ready to fight to restore the glory of the Empire.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Six Sided Summoner
description:
The Six Sided Summoner is a game in which players take control of summoners who try to save the fairy world from the onslaught of mysterious shadows that appear in the land with the arrival of night and spread terror among the inhabitants of the land. To this end, players roam the world, actively expanding it with the ability to summon, meet NPCs, complete quests for them and defeat monsters.

During the game, players have 5 main actions at their disposal, with which they will build their game engine and influence the world by collecting resources, controlling zones, exploiting locations, fighting unique creatures, completing tasks and encounters while exploring the fairy-tale world.

Victory conditions depend on the scenario description, which can be played as a campaign or as individual skirmishes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Events, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Zone of Control

name: Dwarves: The Fall Of Karnarak
description:
In Dwarves: The Fall of Karnarak, you incarnate a dwarf clan leader. In order to protect your home, the famous citadel of Karnarak, you must collaborate with the other clan leaders against a powerful dragon trying to take it.

Among clan leaders, you discuss and decide a plan of action, always taking into account the special abilities of each clan, and the functions of each room of the citadel. During the siege, events that can affect your plans will happen, often for the worse.

75 EVENT CARDS: Destabilise your strategy, make spawns appear or siege engin threaten your citadel
60 SPAWN CARDS: Make enemies appear way too close for comfort
60 TROOP CARDS: Allow you to fight the spawns
60 RESSOURCE CARDS: Allow you to buy upgrades, specialists, beer, divine intervention, or forge special items
8 SPECIALIST CARDS: Allow you to work better
8 UPGRADE CARDS: Allow the citadel to work better
5 CLAN LEADERS: Your identity for the game
5 WARLORDS: Your sworn enemies, soon to be defeated hopefully.
1 MAP OF THE CITADEL: Your board, and your home

Defend the fortress against hordes of enemies, upgrade your citadel, hire specialists in your clan, and above all, try to defeat the dragon, together.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Worker Placement

name: Be The Detective: The Dual
description:
Claire Fontaine is excited, as the next chapter in her life is about to start. She's about to graduate college and is engaged to her soulmate Benjamin Hathoway. Suddenly Benjamin breaks off their engagement and refuses to tell Claire why. Claire then goes missing. Eventually Claire's found dead in a partially frozen lake. Her car is found more than 20 miles away.

Claire Fontaine's family was never satisfied with how the case was handled. Now you must re-open and re-examine the case to find the truth.

Pour over evidence and use your deduction skills to solve what really lead to tragic death of Claire Fontaine. Analyze the autopsy report. Spot contradictions in testimony. Establish timelines for persons of interest.

An episodic game with twists and turns over 3 episodes. Answers questions at the end of each episode to prove your understanding of the case.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction

name: Second World War at Sea: Java Sea
description:
Immediately after the attack on Pearl Harbor, Japanese forces began their “Strike South” against the American, British and Dutch colonies in South-East Asia. The combined American-British-Dutch-Australian fleet resisted as best they could, but would be crushed in February 1942 in the Battle of the Java Sea.

Java Sea is a Second World War at Sea series game based on this bold Japanese aggression. There are 180 “long” playing pieces, depicting the major fleet units of both sides: battleships, aircraft carriers, cruisers and fleet destroyers. There are also 340 square playing pieces, half the size of the ship pieces, mostly depicting aircraft but also smaller warships and markers. The game uses the maps and playing pieces from the old Strike South game, but otherwise is completely new with additional playing pieces, a completely new set of 40 scenarios, and Second Edition series rules with full-color play aids.

The two operational maps depict the South China Sea and the East Indies, including all the major ports and airbases. The area covered stretches from Formosa on the north to Australia on the South. The maps overlap with that from Eastern Fleet on the west edge, and stretch to New Guinea on the east where they overlap with those from South Pacific.

All of the battles of the Japanese Strike South are included: the battle of Java Sea and Sunda Strait and Badung Strait, the last cruise of the British battleship Prince of Wales, and many more. There are some what-if variations, like the addition of an aircraft carrier to the British Force Z. The Royal Thai Navy is fully present, along with the French squadron they battled at Koh-Chang in 1940.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Star Wars: Legion – Ewok Warriors Unit Expansion
description:
An iconic race joins the Rebel cause in this new pack for Star Wars: Legion! Natives of the forest moon of Endor, Ewoks may be short of stature and limited to primitive technology, but they are quick learners who cannot be underestimated. This pack adds a unit of six Ewoks and two unit cards that let players decide if they're armed with slings or spears to players' Rebel armies or the new Bright Tree Village Battle Force. Joining them are an Axe Ewok miniature that can fill the unit's heavy weapon slot and an Ewok Trapper miniature that can fill its personnel slot. Rounding out this pack are five upgrade cards that give players options for customizing their Ewoks to fit their own play style.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Legion – Logray and Wicket Commander Expansion
description:
Two heroic Ewoks come to Star Wars: Legion to help bring down the Empire in this pack! The brave and resourceful Wicket W. Warrick and Logray proved instrumental in helping the Rebels bring down the Imperial shield generator during the battle of Endor and this pack adds these iconic Ewoks as new Commander choices for Rebel armies and the new Bright Tree Village Battle Force. In addition to miniatures of these characters and their unit cards, this pack also provides players with new unit cards for C-3PO and Chewbacca that reflect their time on Endor during Return of the Jedi, giving players even more ways to use them in battle! Finally, five upgrade cards round out this pack, inviting players to further customize their Ewok forces.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Legion – Geonosian Warriors Unit Expansion
description:
Geonosian Warriors join the Separatist cause in this new expansion for Star Wars: Legion! Relying on their sturdy exoskeletons to protect them from harm and their great numbers to swarm their opponents, Geonosian warriors are an imposing new Corps option for the Separatist Alliance. This expansion adds seven Geonosian Warrior miniatures to players’ armies, including a Geonosian Warrior leader and 4 Geonosian Warriors armed with powerful sonic blasters that are devastating at close range. Joining them are a Force Pike Warrior and a Sonic Cannon Warrior who can be added to the unit as heavy weapon options.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Legion – Sun Fac and Poggle the Lesser Commander and Operative Expansion
description:
Two high-ranking Geonosians lead the warriors of the hive into battle in this new expansion for Star Wars: Legion! Poggle the Lesser has the vast resources of the Geonosian droid factories at his disposal and this pack brings him to Separatist Alliance armies as a new commander option. He is joined by his loyal lieutenant Sun Fac, who is ready to carry out Poggle the Lesser’s will as a Separatist Operative. In addition to these two miniatures, players will also find the command cards for these two characters in this expansion, allowing them to further shake up their strategies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Vignette of Death: Killennium Butcher
description:
Vignettes of Death are a great diversion from the intensity of Monster campaigns or an easy way to introduce new players, dipping their toes into the fathomless ocean of Kingdom Death: Monster.

Play as four wish seekers pursuing the Killennium Butcher to steal a wish granted by the frozen star. The awakened monster will not give up its boon easily, attacking the survivors with an intensity of rage that freezes the very air. The new larger-sized vignette rules reveal branching outcomes of your showdown determined by who's left standing when the snow clears.

Using ready-to-play gear grids, survivor vignette cards, and limited components from your Monster core game makes the vignette a quick way to dive into a brand new story.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Magician's Challenge
description:
Magician's Challenge is a card game where "you don't take tricks, you PERFORM them!"
Each player holds a hand of magic props cards; six different types of props, including birds, balls, rabbits, rings, ropes, and wands. Each card has a point value of 1-6. Collect sets of props to "perform" 9 different Tricks. For example, playing your Rabbit Props to get points for the Rabbit Trick.
Each player takes the role of one of six magicians, each having special powers to make one of the prop types wild. So, the magician, Wanda Wands, may use her wild Wands Props to add points to her Rabbit Trick.
Magician's are sneaky and may play SNEAKY cards to gain minor advantages over their opponents, such as pick pocketing Props cards from another magician's hand.
Perform each trick once and add up the scores to see who will win Magician's Challenge.
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That

name: Quests: Heroes of Sorcado
description:
Quests: Heroes of Sorcado is an epic fantasy cooperative campaign for 1-6 players. In each of eight adventures (plus a bonus training adventure) you'll build your character, acquiring powerful spells and weapons, and increasing your abilities by defeating monsters, evading traps, and forging your path through choice-driven events, traps, and side quests.

Add up your Hero's character, weapon, and magic bonuses, and roll dice for damage against fearsome foes, with each Adventure culminating in a boss fight that will require all your best items, potions, abilities, and a bit of luck. With a 60+ page campaign story and 140+ pages of additional story events and choices, players can immerse themselves in a world beset by a demon lord bent on total destruction. Choose your destiny, hone your weapons, and find out if you have what it takes to save Sorcado from utter destruction at the hands of the Dark Lord.



-=-=-=-You can try the Demo/Prequel adventure on TableTop Simulator : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=24353...
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: POWER62 DELTA
description:
In the hybrid chess game 'POWER62®DELTA', your objective is to capture the opponents' EPK (Eranium Processor Key) or eliminate the opponent's Emperor. Players start out on opposing sides of the playing board placing their characters — EPK, PTxCreatures, BLACK HOLE and Terrain Obstacle pieces — in a pre-set position. From there they take turns trying to out-strategize their opponent to win the game.

There's only one strategy game that has withstood the test of time: CHESS. Using that as a foundation, we built up a set of new gameplay mechanics to create the next generation of chess. Unlike in chess, the movement of your pieces are controlled by a deck of Move Cards. For additional offensive and defensive capabilities, the Power Cards help randomize gameplay. And then, there are dangerous obstacles like Terrain Obstacles to worry about, and the SPR-8 Markers are the Mother of All Game Changers for each player. It's like chess on steroids. Finally obstacles like Black Holes and Terrain/Obstacles, featuring some of the exoteric landscapes and flora seen in our soon-to-be-released online comic! (Coming 12/2021).

Another innovation for the game play is the added QR code in the cards to help define the movement of the piece, quickly.Even if you play the same deck multiple times, the outcome will differ. "Luck of the Draw" on the Move cards, Power cards and SPR-8 markers has a huge factor in whether your strategy works or crumbles.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Points, Different Dice Movement, Hidden Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: The Things
description:
The Things is a game for three or (ideally) more players, and simulates the paranoid members of an antarctic research facility being overrun by - or conquering - an invasive shape-shifting, human-killing alien. A standard deck of cards is used, with the different cards having different abilities. Players are either Things or Humans.

A random player is chosen to start, and turns progress in alphabetic or clockwise order. On each of their turns, a player may choose either to Search (draw a single card from the draw pile which they may or may not be able to keep), Converse (trade with other players), perform a Blood Test (force others to reveal cards)or Attack.

Game End and Winning:
For Humans: A Human player may, at any time, decide that the camp has been cleansed and that it's safe to radio for a rescue plane. That player reveals their hand, and declares that the game is over. All other players then reveal their hands. If any Things are shown to be still alive, then they are unleashed upon civilization and win the game. If only Humans remain, however, then the Thing has been vanquished and the Humans win the game.
For Things: A Thing player may, at any time, decide that the camp has been cleansed and that it's safe to build a two-seater flying saucer and head for civilization. That player reveals their hand, and declares that the game is over. All other players then reveal their hands. If any Humans are shown to be still alive, then they manage to sabotage the saucer and destroy the Things in the process. If only Things remain, however, then they merge into a single two-seater blob and fly off to conquer the world.
mechanics: Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes vs. Warlords
description:
Heroes vs Warlords


is the title of our new upcoming fantasy strategy game. Heroes vs Warlords will relaunch on KickStarter 2019.

Heroes vs Warlords is a fantasy strategy game set in the world of Pangea. Pangea is inhabited by clever Amazons, mighty Knights, wild Barbarians, and Neutrals. The Neutrals guard the treasures found in Pangea. The world of Pangea is largely unexplored. Vast lands, where no civilized soul has ever been before, are waiting for you.

Are you up to the challenge? Will your hero's army gain new riches for your empire? Will you crush the enemy hordes? Or will you fall victim to the monsters that are hidden in the various towers, ruins and mines scattered across the land.

Heroes vs Warlords is about the eternal struggle for supremacy. In this 1,2, or 3 player game you get the chance to see if you succeed. Will you be the ruler of Pangea?

Heroes vs warlords is inspired by the classic PC games of exploration and evolution of a hero and his army.

The game can be further expanded for a nearly unlimited amount of players with several upcoming expansions. A solitaire mode can be reached without extra cost just with a Kickstarter Stretchgoal.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Merca-Tiny
description:
A new market has opened in the city square. Great business opportunity awaits the most enterprising merchants.

Who will be the richest of the square (the winner), in the end?

As a trader, each player on their turn can open new stalls (place one or more stall-tiles) following the strict municipal rules or bring new customers to the market (move a customer). In the city, customers have a somewhat extravagant and habitual behavior: they always walk straight ahead until they meet stalls, then they always turn around counterclockwise; they buy clothes and shoes in any order, but only vegetables or fish after buying vegetables, and only other fish, after they buying fish. Obviously customers buy only products that are on their shopping list.
Try to open your stalls in strategic position and keep an eye on price trends: the best selling goods will be more expensive in the next rounds. But stalls of a goods type can inflate that goods.

Meanwhile, beware of thieves, workers, policeman and many other characters that could benefit (or damage) your (or opponents) business: You have action disks that can be spent to pick-up and/or use special actions of such characters.

Be careful to plan your actions in time, as the market is divided into phases, marked by the opening of increasingly modern stalls: during the game the old stalls will be scrapped. When all the stalls are exhausted or when at least one of the goods has reached the maximum price, the market will be closed and the game will be over.
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Gnomes and Wizards
description:
Gnomes and Wizards is a fantasy-themed skirmish game where players assume the role of a unique tribe of either gnomes or wizards. The object of the game is for a player or team to have the most points at the end of 10 rounds. These points are mostly gained by defeating enemy units. Each tribe has multiple units that can be summoned onto the board to be used in combat. These units have unique abilities that can be charged and cast with the use of the resource called Power Crystals. As more units come out onto the field, players will roll additional dice to increase their base stats and other core actions. Half-way through the game, the ground becomes unstable and starts to collapse in on itself. At this point, players will start their turn by flipping two tiles from the outside of the board, forcing battle into the Crystal Mines in the center of the board. Gnomes and Wizards is a game that is easy to learn but is hard to master and can be played with a wide variety of skill levels.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, Map Deformation, Map Reduction, Modular Board, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Re-rolling and Locking, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Fighting Wings: Tactical Air Warfare in WWII (1936-1945) (Third Edition)
description:
Fighting Wings is the latest version of COA’s well-received Fighting Wings (FW) WW-II air combat series game rules, as released in Wings of the Motherland.

This edition incorporates 15 years of minor improvements from second edition rules play, all the second edition errata and also introduces some major revisions to certain aspects of play for increased modeling accuracy and ease of play.

Sections having major changes include Defensive gunfire modeling, heavy anti-aircraft gunfire modeling, air-to-air rocketry modeling. In the flight and combat model, new rules additions take into account the effects of high aircraft speeds on induced drag when turning, excess firepower points, lift-vector aiming effects and much more. The night combat rules and night fighting rules have been greatly expanded to better model the cat-and-mouse aspect of the night war. All in all, you will want to catch up to the state of the art with this rulebook.

Note that the aircraft data cards from all of the previous games and FW supplements are still usable, as are the scenarios from the previous games, although, with regards to the scenarios, you will have to interpret from the scenario description the flight attitude that the planes are likely starting with.

In the future, updated scenario books will be available to bring the Over the Reich, Achtung! Spitfire!, and Whistling Death games all up to third edition standards.

This Rulebook also includes the updated Third Edition Play Aids Booklet.

This 32 page booklet contains all of the game tables, play aid guides, etc. to model air combat, aircraft flight, air-to-ground combat and air-naval combat.
These tables are for use with the THIRD edition Fighting Wings game rules. You must also PURCHASE or own the third edition rules to understand and use these tables. Many sections are not backwards compatible with earlier edition game rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: DropMix: Playlist Pack (Phase)
description:
Comes with 15 DropMix cards plus 1 hidden track card.

This playlist includes music from: Axwell /\ Ingrosso, Paul Van Dyk, Jamie xx and Bastille.

Theme: Dance/Electronic
categories: Card Game, Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Music, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Nightmare Ram Expansion
description:
The Nightmare Ram, with its claustrophobic garden dungeon, function together to make one utterly insane fight. Survivors will be impaled, rammed into spikes, crushed in avalanches, and get doused with boiling water (from the Boiling Water bug minion of course!). The Nightmare Ram has full control of its garden dungeon and will often re-arrange it during the showdown! Survivors risk being buried alive deep in the inverted mountain.

This expansion adds something totally new to Kingdom Death: Monster...a dungeon! It includes a dungeon deck, dungeon tiles, minion spawning cards and more. Get ready to die in a whole new way!

Includes:

1 Nightmare Ram Miniature
4 Narrative Sculpture alpine armor survivors
8 Boiling Water Bug minions
26 page rulebook
1 Weapon Mastery
1 Armor Set card
35 gear cards
30 AI cards
1 basic action card
8 Dungeon cards
5 Disorders
8 Dungeon resources
16 Treasure cards
12 Dungeon tiles
4 Egg Charge cards
8 Fighting Arts
16 Hit Locations cards
8 Hunt events
3 Innovations
13 Minion cards
5 Rare Gear cards
17 Monster resources
1 Settlement location
5 Secret Fighting Arts
3 Terrain cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Bertin 1761 / Berryer 1759
description:
The Bertin was an East Indiaman used for long–distance trading during the eighteenth century. She was later converted into a ship of the line, taking advantage of her design, already suitable for a warship. When, in 1770, she was commissioned into the French Marine Royale, under King Louis XVI, her armament was doubled – Bertin became a fourth rate with 56 guns and a crew of more than 300 men.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the French ex–merchant ship “Berryer 1759(1770)”.

Ship pack contains a new ship with base, ship card, ship log, and specific deck of maneuver cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Death Ride Kursk: III Panzer Korps
description:
III Panzer Korps: this game is the Base Game for the AD Kempf Game Set. Scenarios for this game start on 4 July and through 13 July when they failed to meet up with the IISS Panzer Korps at Prokhorovka.

Inside this base game is a larger amount of material than in past base games. The reason is that there are 4 full German Divisions involved and all in one game. That makes this a 2 box set. It will be very worth it though with all those units inside.

III Panzer Korps - Base Game - comes with (in Full Color):

(34) Map Sections of the Donets River Area of Operations (maps AA1 to AA2, BB1 to BB2, R1 to R4, S1 to S4, T1 to T4, U1 to U4, V1 to V4, W1 to W4, X1 to X4, Y1 to Y2)
(10) Scenario Cards
Order of Battle Cards
Task Organization Cards
5000+ Unit Counters and Markers


(description from publisher's website)
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Tri To Win
description:
Tri To Win is the thiathlon card game where players build their own board game to race on.

It is played in two phases. In the first phase of the game players draw and play one card per turn to build up their athletes’ skills, create the race courses, and a little bit of card and skill thievery. Skill cards are played face down next to your athlete, only you know what skills you have. All other cards are played face up, the Course cards are played along the corresponding course. Action cards are used to cause some mischief, with Action cards you can steal skills, cards, remove pieces of the race course and stop other players actions. Phase one ends when a player uses their turn to play the 'Start The Race' card at the end of the running course.

In phase two, players use their accumulated skills to race on the course they made in phase one. The Course cards are used as a board game with coloured player tokens that match each athlete. Add up all skills your athlete has gathered and these are now your movement points. Each player takes turns moving their token the number of swim points they have, then cycling, then running, stopping at each race transition until their next turn. The winner is the first player to make it past the finish line to the Gold 1st place position at the end of the running course. Keep playing to find out who comes 2nd and 3rd!

-description from designer
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Resource to Move, Simulation, Track Movement, Turn Order: Progressive

name: The Age of Eagles: Napoleon vs. Europe 1813-14
description:
This is the first scenario book specifically to The Age of Eagles original and 2d Edition, aka Napoleonic Fire & Fury. It covers the 1813 German campaign, the 1814 campaign in France, and Wellington’s invasion of southern France. This is a scenario book only. Age of Eagles is required to properly play this game. It contains conversion instructions for many other fine rules such as Napoleon's Battle, plus a glossary of Napoleonic terms, a bonus French Revolution scenario (Hohenlinden) and more. The publication is black and white with full color front and back covers.

Befreiungskrieg 1813 – 14 (War of Liberation 1813 – 14) scenarios include:

• Battle of Gross Beeren - 23 August 1813, Oudinot vs Bernadotte.
• Battle of the Katzbach - 26 August 1813, MacDonald vs Blucher.
• Battle of Kulm - 30 August 1813, Vandamme vs the Czar.
• Battle of Dennewitz - 6 September 1813, Ney vs Bernadotte.
• Battle of Wartenburg - 3 October 1813, Bertrand vs Yorck.
• Battle of Leipzig (two scenarios) - Leibertwolkwitz, 14 October 1813 and Mockern on 16 October.
• Battle of Hanau - 30 October 1813, Napoleon vs Wrede.
• Battle of Schestedt - 10 December 1813, the Danes vs the Russo-German Legion.
• Battle of La Rothiere - 1 February 1814, Napoleon vs Blucher.
• Battle of Orthez - 27 February 1814, Wellington vs Soult.
• Battle of Toulouse - 10 April 1814, Wellington vs Soult Round 2, the last battle of the campaign.

The AOV product line is sold direct thru digital distribution, though hardcopy versions are available from certain retailers. It is 80 pages long. Kindle formatted products are sold exclusively thru Amazon, while digital downloads exportable to PDF format may be purchased via Google Play.

Online, public research portal for this game and its historical period (to include flags for miniatures, official histories, Public Domain military maps, images and publications - all copyright friendly and FREE to download) at https://tinyurl.com/AOE-Napoleonic-Research-Portal.

-description from the designer.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random

name: Oak & Iron: Blackbeard's Revenge
description:
This expansion includes 2 plastic unique named ship models. Including:
Queen Anne’s Revenge
Revenge
2 clear plastic ship bases
2 ship cards
1 Stede Bonnet captain card
All necessary tokens and counters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Pirates
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Cranium 25th Anniversary Edition
description:
Can you sound like a rainforest, perform glass blowing, sculpt a taco, or draw a motorcycle with your eyes closed?

Cranium 25th Anniversary Edition will have you sketching, acting, humming, sculpting, picture-puzzling, and word-unscrambling in a party game that features eight hundred new questions across eighteen diverse activities.

This new edition of Cranium includes "Cranium Clay" and dry-erase whiteboard to help you craft your original works of art.
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Singing

name: Townsfolk Tussle: Foul Neighbors
description:
Word of the sheriff's demise has finally reached our neighboring towns, and their residents are lookin' to take advantage of our little slice of heaven. Foul Neighbors features a combination of Ruffians from Misty Bluff and Sprinkle Falls, alongside a couple new heroic townsfolk. You'll face off against hungry cannibals, dodgy salesfolk, diseased doctors, and plenty of other unsavory fellas this time around—each with their own unique method of making your lives miserable!

Foul Neighbors is a combination of the Ominous Skies and Eerie Neighbors expansion we had originally planned; by combining the two, we’re able to cut down on materials and reduce waste.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Square Grid, Team-Based Game
publishers: Frosted Games, Lucky Duck Games, Panic Roll

name: LURE
description:
You are rival naturalists aspiring to gain official recognition from the Queen by luring the best animals from her royal gardens.

Animals require different Bait or Traps depending on what they prefer to eat and where they are in the Garden. Many of the Animals have special quirks that alter the way the game is played and lead to incredible combos!

Earn as many points as you can by collecting Animals before the Queen arrives. The highest score wins.

OVERVIEW

Use your turn either accumulating Bait or using it to lure Animals from a shared area. Animals require different Bait depending on what they prefer and where they are in the Garden. Earn as many points as you can by collecting Animals before the Queen arrives. The highest score wins!

QUICK THINGS TO KNOW ABOUT THE GAME


Fast turns, interesting decisions!
Easy to print: 90 cards, nothing else
Allows for clever, evolving strategies
Each Animal is unique and interesting
High replay-ability (due to setup randomness)
Simple, inviting images/theme


—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Invincible: Escape from Mars
description:
Invincible: Escape from Mars is a social deduction game for 4-10 players where your objective is to find your teammates, get on the rocket, and escape from Mars. But loyalties can change at any moment, including your own!

Based on the hit animated series from Robert Kirkman, Corey Walker, and Ryan Ottley, this game puts you in the position of either a hero or an astronaut attempting to escape Mars and make it back to Earth without bringing a world-destroying parasite home with you. No pressure!

Each round players will be faced with an obstacle that they must overcome as a group. On their turn, a player may contribute a card to the obstacle, place a card on their own personal setback, or play a card for a special ability. At the end of each round players will resolve the obstacle in either an astronaut victory, a sequid victory, or a neutral outcome. If the astronauts or sequids achieve 3 victories they immediately win. If neither team reaches 3 victories before round seven, players have a chance to launch the rocket. Every player that has completed their personal setback boards the rocket and attempt to make it back to Earth. Before the launch though, players will have one final chance to vote off any infected players that have infiltrated the rocket.

Depending on skill level, players may elect to play a simple game as an astronaut trying to escape Mars, or a more challenging game as one of 9 unique superheros attempting to protect those astronauts. Superheroes have more power, but they’re playing a tougher game. You know what they say about power, responsibility, etc. Each player’s choice to be an astronaut or hero makes no change to the overall balance of the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Negotiation, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Multi-Use Cards, Voting

name: Age of Dogfights WWI: Additional Aircraft Types
description:
This expansion provides you with 40 important aircraft of WWI.
There are two aircraft of each type, bringing the number of aircraft tokens to 80. A player aid and control panels for all aircraft are included.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Bias, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Stat Check Resolution, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Cthulhu: Death May Die – Fear of the Unknown: Ithaqua the Wind-Walker
description:
Ithaqua the Wind-Walker is an expansion for Cthulhu: Death May Die. This box brings a brand-new Elder One for you to use in combination with any Episode (from any Season!) creating a whole new gaming experience as you try to vanquish the perils of the Wind-Walker and his Shantak followers!

The Ithaqua the Wind-Walker box comes with:


1 Ithaqua figure
2 Shantak figures
8 Mythos cards
5 Elder One cards
Tokens


Ithaqua, the son of Hastur and Lord of the Winds is a powerful Great Old One in his own right; a horrifying giant that stalks the frozen wastes and slays whoever he comes across in pursuit of his goal to free the other Great Old Ones. His is the power to gather and control blizzards and violent snowstorms, and it is no different in Death May Die, for whenever Ithaqua is the chosen Elder One, a blizzard token is placed on the board, forcing any investigator who enters it to fully max out stress and be unable to heal it. Worst yet, every time Ithaqua advances, the blizzard moves toward the investigators, summoning a Shantak from amidst the storm. From there on, things only get rougher for the investigators. As Ithaqua edges near our realm, the blizzard grows more intense, moving more frequently around the board, causing more stress, damage, and preventing movement. Of course, as the Lord of the Winds, all of his cultists are completely immune to the freezing weather, and roam free to attack the investigators. Ithaqua brings with him his devastating weather effects to the board, offering a whole-new experience in fighting the Old Ones.

Shantaks are enormous avian monsters with horse-like heads that attend the Old Ones. These creatures are incredibly tough, and their resilience makes it hard for investigators to eliminate them quickly. With their long affiliation with Ithaqua, Shantaks have learned ways to utilize the Great One's violent blizzards to enter our realm, and worse yet, as long as they're near a blizzard, they are at their more frightening form, forcing investigators to take stress before they attack or are attacked. Thus, Shantaks are constantly ticking down the investigators' stress, hampering their ability to manipulate dice rolls. The faster you get rid of these monsters, the better - which would be a lot easier if not for their aforementioned resilience...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Guillotine Games, Portal Games, REXhry

name: All-American Football Game
description:
This 1935 title uses dice to determine the results of plays. The board has two folds, with the field in the center section and the list of plays and results, and dials for downs, quarters and yards to go on both side panels, one facing each end of the field.

Kickoff, return, reverse, lateral, line buck, off tackle, end run, pass, punt and spinner plays are resolved with two dice which are read lowest digit first, for 21 possible outcomes. Results of punts, field goals, try for point, free kick after safety, fumbles, blocked kicks and interference penalties are determined by a single die.

There is no defensive play choice. Instead, the defensive player is responsible for looking up the results and keeping tabs of yardage and downs while the offensive player considers his next play. The offensive player must choose his next play within 10 seconds or is hit with a five-yard delay of game penalty.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: La Bataille de Lindenau 1813
description:
The Battle of Leipzig, fought in 1813, is one of the largest conflicts ever and involved many countries / kingdoms fighting against each other. This included a coalition of Russia, Prussia and Austria committed to defeat France and its allies, forging a domination of Europe that would lead to the Nationalism of Germany. While historians have drawn a myriad of contrary opinions about who were the good guys and bad guys, the battle encircles the city of Leipzig with 500,000 man armies facing each other.

The sheer size of this conflict can truly test a designer’s skill when representing it at a battalion level. However, Leipzig is actually a series of smaller battles fought west, east, south and north of Leipzig as the Coalition armies concentrically move toward the City. La Bataille de Lindenau 1813 is the battle southwest of Leipzig.

La Bataille de Lindenau recreates the furious battle between the Hungarian Ignaz Gyulai,and his IIIrd Austrian Corps, and their attempt to wrest the crucial town of Lindenau from General Bertrand's multinational IV Corps, as it defended the French lines of communication on October 16, 1813 just outside Leipzig. The battle places Bertrand on the horns of a dilemma. On the one hand, Lindenau must stay in French hands if Napoleon has any hope of defeating the Coalition. However, Bertrand also has an imperative to send as much of his able corps as possible to assist Napoleon on the Leipzig southern front. Gyulai's task is to disrupt both French goals.

The player will note immediately the differences in the different formations and how each must be managed to achieve success.

Each 20 minute turn starts with a Command Phase for both sides followed by the French Player sequence and then by the Prussian Player sequence. The sequence includes movement, cavalry charges, fire and melee. During each, morale plays a decisive role. This is a great one player on one player game but will also accommodate two players on a side also.

The original rules have been updated but not expanded to any extent. The original designers of the La Bataille Series believe the Premier Rules facilitate / expedite the most accurate and competitive play. The new Premier Rules are an update of the original rules but make it easier to find specific topics and includes some user requested rules such as command control.

The special rules also feature an essay on Count Bertrand, Napoleon's close confident who is buried next to the Emperor at Les Invalides in Paris, and who was so crucial to the French efforts in the 1813 campaign. The French must also wrestle with using German "allies", who have become unreliable at this stage of the campaign, and figure out how to keep Germans engaged in a favorable way to enhance French strategic efforts.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Dust Tactics: MIL MI-45K – "Air Ambulance"
description:
The Sino-Soviet Union has been the first of the three bloc to develop the technology of helicopters. Since then the other bloc, mostly the Allies have followed. But the SSU still has a nice advance in this cutting edge technology.
Although the Soviets mostly use their helicopter for combat missions or to deploy troops, they also have transformed some to carry back wounded personnel to the safety of the rear lines. Thanks to these, the SSU has greatly increased the life expectancy of its soldiers.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Bay of Bengal
description:
"Bay of Bengal" simulates the World War II carrier struggle for control of the northern Indian Ocean. It includes the historical Japanese Indian Ocean Raid, but also examines other hypothetical options, in the period from April to November 1942. One player commands the Allied (largely Commonwealth) forces and the other the Japanese. Victory is obtained by destroying the opposing fleets, bombarding ports or airfields, interfering with merchant shipping, and possibly even supporting amphibious invasions or decoy operations.

Based on the system of the prize-winning Solomon Sea, Bay of Bengal is a double blind 2-player game, which means each player moves his task forces, air strikes, and search planes on his own map, and tells the other player about the hexes he searches. Combat is resolved by a series of dice rolls. Each hex represents a diameter of 100 nautical miles, with 3 hours per turn. Each counter represents 6 to 10 planes, individual carries, or groups of smaller ships. Historical chrome includes rules such as radar equipped planes for night search and strikes, rescuing of survivors, leaking battleship boilers, armoured flight decks, and the secret British naval base. Eight historical and alternate-history scenarios are included.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 6 Little Postmen
description:
A funny game that helps children to understand the job of post office men, and the different kinds of letters, parcels etc.

The game is played with 2-6 players. At the start of the game you receive some cards which represent the letters and parcels. The number of the cards depends on the number of players. Then you have to roll the dice and move in the board, in the direction which is the fastest and more convenient for you to deliver the letters. But some times you may land on "best" spots, which might not be the best for you! The winner of the game is whoever delivers all that he's got and get back to the post office first!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move

name: Iron Fists of Our Fathers: Korean War
description:
“Iron Fists of Our Fathers: Korean War” is a war simulation system covering the period from MacArthur’s triumphal advance towards North Korea to the disastrous retreat of the US Army in December (referred to as the First Phase and Second Phase Offensive by the communist side). The game includes the tactical and strategy concepts of this war, and has special written Optional Rules to simulate some particular characteristics of this war.

The game as a base package including only the "Chungchon campaign” part. It is to be followed by expansion packs on Chosin Reservoir, the recapture of Seoul, the Triangle and 1950 North Korean offensive.

In this game, each turn represents 3 days in real time; each hex equals 4.5 km, unit size ranges from regiment to division in general, each SP equals 1000~1500 men for UN side, 3000 men for PVA side.

The game includes the rule book, one A0 sized map, 192 counters and 3 Player Aids.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Colonial Space Wars: Collector's Edition
description:
Deluxe box with the full version of the boardgame Colonial Space Wars, including all the stuff published (CSW New Horizons plus CSW Flesh & Steel) to date.

The box contents a CSW Advanced Rulebook, with 52 pages full color in Spanish, 2 Modular board kits (double sided with two different war scenarios), +300 game pieces belonging to the four factions (Ascaryan Yellow, Centauri Red, Heimdall Green, Terra Blue), +100 activation/impact/special tokens and Terrain Stickers.
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Familiar: Mythic Arena
description:
Familiar is a tactical player vs player pet battling game! You and an opponent build decks with your choices of magically bonded Familiar companions, commonly called pets. Take turns putting those pets into one of 3 rows of the Arena, enhancing them with magical Elyth, and getting boosts from Rune and Item cards. The fastest pets go first in Battle and roll dice to see if damage is dealt. The first player to earn 3 Victory points wins!

The fantasy game world of Familiar takes place in the 12 realms of Elytha Tira. Those who live there are skilled in the use of a magical power source called Elyth. With it they can perform heroic feats, cast powerful spells, or tame fantastical beasts which can become their familiar companions, commonly called pets. The Mythic Arena is where you join in friendly battle competitions against your opponent’s familiars!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: JUST RUN
description:
JUST RUN is medium-weight, card-driven, tile-placement board game, with both cooperative and competitive scenarios, from Mr. X.

You are survivors of the zombie apocalypse, trapped in an abandoned, treacherous, and unfamiliar building. Somewhere in front of you is safety. Right behind you, a growing horde of the undead. So quickly gather whatever gear you can find--and run.

In the first game phase, you compete with other players for item cards in a panic-inducing timed round. You can use each item in very different ways, including combining it with another card to create new and improved gear.

In the second game phase, each survivor has two actions to do things such as--

Investigating and revealing new room tiles to build your path to escape.
Searching for even better gear or, if you are unlucky, a catastrophic event.
Using your gear in novel ways to get out of sticky situations.
Fighting zombies--and sometimes other survivors.

The zombies, meanwhile, keep spawning and keep coming.

JUST RUN has six scenarios, ranging from cooperative search-and-rescue missions to everyone-for-themselves sprints. And you can play scenarios individually or combine them to create more challenging missions.
