Winners must complete the scenario’s mission, escape with at least one health point, and reach the rescue chopper before it fills up.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Tile Placement

name: Necromunda Underhive: Intrigues and Rackets Card Pack
description:
This set contains 52 Intrigue and Racket cards for use during a Law and Misrule Campaign as presented in Necromunda: The Book of Judgement.

To use the contents of this pack you will need a copy of the Necromunda Rulebook, Necromunda: Gangs of the Underhive, and Necromunda: The book of Judgement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Necromunda Underhive: Underdog Card Pack
description:
This set contains 26 cards for use in Necromunda games.

13 Underdog Tactics cards, 12 Gang Tactics cards and a rule card.

You will need a copy of the Necromunda Rulebook and also Necroumunda: Gangs of the Underhive to use the contents of this pack.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: New England Volunteers Playpack 1
description:
New England Volunteers Playpack 1 is a 5 scenario pack that only requires ASL Starter Kit #1 to be played. The five scenarios in NEV Play Pack 1 are listed below:

NEV1 Taking San-Stefano, American vs. Germans, Sicily 1943

NEV2 Bridgehead over the Venta, Russians vs. Germans, Latvia 1944

NEV3 Battle in the Ardennes, American vs. German, Belgium 1944

NEV4 Hedgehog, Russian vs. German, Russia 1944

NEV5 The Factory “Aprilia”, American vs. German, Italy 1944

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Conscious: A Voyage to the Mystic Realms
description:
Theme:
Inspired by the ancient wisdom of the Vedic seers, this game attempts to introduce the properties of Chakras. Chakras are centers of consciousness and vitality. They are the energy vortices on the etheric body which envelops the physical body. When understood, mastered and balanced, chakras invoke certain abilities that allow us to become adept in the respective fields. This game deals with 6 chakras and their associated properties. The knowledge of these properties is a step towards obtaining the key to different realms.

Objective:
Aim of the game is to collect and make sets of cards associated with properties of chakras, thus symbolically attaining the knowledge with properties of all chakras to become CONSCIOUS of oneself!

Gameplay:
Chakra property cards are dealt to players who then attempt to make sets of cards. Basic and advanced versions define the nature of these sets. The game is played across multiple rounds, where each round focuses on claiming one chakra and use the associated ability (unique for each Chakra) in the subsequent round. The player to claim all the Chakras wins the game. Variants have also been suggested to alter gameplay length and/or complexity.

The subject of the game is suitable for all ages, making this a family-friendly game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: JailBird
description:
JailBird is a bird-themed party card game where the main objective is for you to be the last bird standing, leaving all your avian accomplices in the custody of the Bird Police while you fly free.

You and your bird friends have committed heinous crimes, but not very well. In the deck of cards are evidence cards which prove you have committed these crimes. Use action cards to get rid of evidence cards in your hand.

Get rid of them now, because once someone draws a Bird Police card, all hell breaks loose! When that happens, a police raid takes place. The person with the most evidence at the end of the raid is sent to jail and is out of the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Vs. System 2PCG: The Frightful
description:
The last issue of the First Family story arc, The Frightful, includes a dastardly list of evil doers that have crossed paths with the Fantastic Four. Such a list would not be complete without the insatiable Devourer of Worlds and master of Heralds, Galactus. Add the time-traveling tyrant Kang the Conqueror to the mix and you can now complete an epic deck of destruction.

• 55 Playable Cards
• 1 Rulesheet

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Vs. System 2PCG stand-alone game is required to play.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Godtear: Maxen, the Artificer & Gearhawks
description:
Unleash the firestorm with Maxen, the Artificer.

Possessed of a brilliant mind, Maxen easily grasps concepts beyond mortal understanding. Proof can be seen in his flock of mechanical Gearhawks. These helpful clockwork creatures perform tasks and may even be used as ammunition, in a pinch.

Inside this box is everything you need to add the Slayer champion Maxen, the Artificer, to your Godtear warband. Use this expansion with any Godtear starter set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: CoderMarz
description:
WELCOME TO PLANET MARS!
It's the year 2090. Your spaceship has just landed on Mars. Captain Capability, Captain Courage, Captain Creativity, and Captain Compassion need to be able to train themselves on Mars to collect supplies in order to help them settle. But here's the twist - to help the astronauts survive, you are the Master Mind. Your astronaut needs to collect all the supplies and essentials to survive on Mars and you can use your predictive instincts to do so.

Building on the core game mechanics of Coder Mindz, this game adds set collection and learning about the planet Mara and space exploration to combine both AI and astronomy education. The idea is easy - play a board game, help the astronauts explore Mars, visit various places, collect necessary supplies, and a lot more. All in a fun and exciting Martian Adventure!

Learning Coding and AI concepts help you connect with real coding and AI.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Star Wars: Legion – Raddaugh Gnasp Fluttercraft Unit Expansion
description:
Defend Kashyyyk with the Raddaugh Gnasp Fluttercraft Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! A compact scout craft used to patrol the dense wroshyr forests of Kashyyyk, this fluttercraft is fast, deadly, and packs a nasty sting. Whether harrying the enemy with bowcaster fire or expertly- lobbed grenades, the fluttercraft is a formidable addition to the Wookiee arsenal.

Within this expansion, you’ll find everything you need to add a Raddaugh Gnasp Fluttercraft to your Republic armies as a support unit. A beautifully detailed, unpainted hard plastic miniature brings this unit to life on your tabletop, while a unit card outlines all of its capabilities, including the new Overrun keyword. Finally, five upgrade cards invite you to choose exactly how this unit behaves in combat.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: World Challenge Game
description:
The first board game that rewards your knowledge!

World Challenge Game is a game where all players will answer questions and will conquer countries simultaneously. Depending on the chosen game mode "Conqueror or Attack" the game will end sooner or later. Fight to conquer the world and show that you are the one who knows the most! Answer questions, think carefully about the territories you want to conquer and learn while you prove that you are the best in World Challenge Game.
Choose one of two game modes:

- Conqueror, where you conquer as many countries as possible before the end of the game or Raid, where you attack and win the countries conquered by other players to take over the entire continent. In this mode you can conquer a country that another player has won.

On each turn, a player will take a card and choose one of the two existing questions, which they must read aloud, along with the four answers. The other participants will write on their card the answer which they consider correct, marking an "X" in the options A, B, C or D. When everyone has answered the question, the answers will be revealed, starting with the player to the left of the one who read the question. If the answer is correct, the player can place a conquest token in an available border country and the same for the rest of the players.

The Conqueror game will automatically end once the last country on the continent is conquered. At that time, the countries that each player has conquered will be counted, so the player with the most countries conquered will be the winner of the game. If there are two or more players who have the same maximum number of conquered countries, questions will be read to them as a tiebreaker. Players who cannot answer the question lose.

- The Attack game will end when there is only one player left on the continent and they will be crowned the winner. If the question cards run out, the game would end and the one with the most countries would win. There is also the option in case you want to continue the game, you can use the questions available in the APP, choosing the "Board game questions" section.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Collectible Components, Educational, Trivia
mechanics: Area Movement, Player Elimination, Questions and Answers, Set Collection, Take That, Zone of Control

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Brotherhood of Mutants Affiliation Pack
description: Bringing together highly detailed miniatures of Magneto, Mystique, Sabretooth, and Toad in one package, Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Brotherhood of Mutants Affiliation Pack gives players everything they need to begin playing with the Brotherhood of Mutants Affiliation. Along with these miniatures, players will also find the stat cards for these characters featuring new graphic design. Rounding out the pack are the Asteroid M, X-Ceptional Healing, Weapon X Program, Magnetic Refraction, Magnetic Crush, Heave Ho, The Books of Truth, and Deception Team Tactic Cards, ensuring players have everything they need to cut down any who oppose their Brotherhood.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Star Wars: Legion – Clone Commander Cody Commander Expansion
description:
One of the Galactic Republic's most dependable Clone Commanders comes to the table in Star Wars: Legion – Clone Commander Cody Commander Expansion.

As the commander of the 7th Sky Corps, CC-2224, known as "Cody", has developed a distinguished reputation as a skilled strategist and fierce fighter. This pack brings him to the tabletop with three miniatures that can be assembled in a variety of poses and with multiple weapon and head options. In addition to making use of Cody's skills on the battlefield, players can also alter their strategy with his three signature Command Cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Conquest: The Last Argument of Kings II
description:
Conquest – the Last Argument of Kings is a mass battle wargame produced Para Bellum Wargames. The rules of the game have been written by one of the industry’s lead game designers, Alessio Cavatore and his studio Riverhorse. The rules are quick and easy to learn for a new player but are still able to offer a new and complex strategy to master. Conquest does away with player turns and army deployment. Instead, it focuses its play around the command stack mechanic, where each player determines at the beginning of the round what order his troops are going to be activated in. Coupled with a unique escalation reinforcement mechanic where light, medium and heavy troops each have their roles, the fog of war is a very real thing.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Cave Evil: Chaos Pack 3
description:
CHAOS PACK 3

EXPANDS: CORRODED CORRIDOR including CAVE EVIL & WARCULTS

We rally cried for players to create a Chaos Pack and they delivered! We received many submissions for art and card text, it was wondrous to behold. All cards are as close to the actual submission as possible.

45 New Player Created Cards!!
Add cards to Conjuration and other Decks

3 - 11” x 17” Mini Maps!
THE PITS and DOUBLE TROUBLE TUNNEL (2 map challenge)
Maps can be played on its own, added on top of other maps, or can extend maps.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Mature / Adult, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Multiple Maps, Player Elimination

name: High Frontier 4 All: Module 5 – Economy
description:
Module 5 Economy allows you and the other players to buy and sell shares in aerospace companies whose value is tracked in a matrix called the stock market. The players themselves are the customers for these companies, and with more customers for a customer service, the more capital the company can purchase and the higher their share value. If you own the most shares in a company, you are its chair and decide if dividends are paid out to the shareholders or instead the funds are reinvested into company capital allowing them to have cheaper services. Players buy shares in companies that are likely to rise in value and sell them when their cash could be better used elsewhere. Because shares are so easily bought and dumped, and they retain value after an Aqua crash, holding shares is generally superior to holding Aqua.

—description from the publisher
categories: Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Investment, Market, Ownership, Stock Holding
publishers: Ion Game Design, Sierra Madre Games

name: The Skirmisher #4
description:
The Skirmisher #4 is the fourth magazine in the award-winning Great Campaigns of the American Civil War (GCACW) series of games.

Skirmisher #4 is centered around the reprint of Stonewall Jackson's Way II (SJW2), so players should own this game (or the original SJW) to fully enjoy all the elements of Skirmisher #4.

Skirmisher #4 contains the following scenarios and articles:

“The Skirmish Line” which discusses upcoming GCACW plans and games.
Lee’s Last Offensive, a mini-module on the Bristoe Station and Mine Run campaigns in the Fall of 1863. Designed by Niall Taylor there are 4 basic scenarios, 3 campaign scenarios, and a detailed “Game as History” article. These scenarios use the SJW2 maps.
A colorful set of playtest reports on the Lee’s Last Offensive scenarios.
Battle for the Gaps, a cavalry scenario in June 1863, when the Confederate and Union cavalry engaged just west of Aldie (on the SJW2 north map) as the Gettysburg campaign was developing.
A detailed strategy article on optimal ways to play the All Green Alike campaign.
A lengthy replay of a SJW2 scenario, filled with images to be easy-to-follow.
An article on battlefield staff rides that Joe Balkoski conducts for the army.
A listing of all that is GCACW on-line, tournaments, etc.



Skirmisher #4 components list:

56 color pages
A half counter sheet (140 counters) for the included scenarios


-description from publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dragons Down: Desolation
description:
The first expansion for Dragons Down. Now you can adventure in the sinister swamps and perilous plains... or add them to your existing base game to create an epic experience.

Allows for up to 6 players
Two new terrain packs (Sinister Swamps and Perilous Plains)
12 new map tiles
30+ new monsters
8+ new natives
25+ new treasures
12 new missions
10 new items
6 new lineage cards (adding the Half-elf and Half-orc lineages)
10 new classes (assassin, bard, battle mage, black knight, executioner, paladin, ranger, runesword, soulless, and trickster)
2 new civilization locations
3 new merchants

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Alliances, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Movement Points, Pieces as Map, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simulation, Turn Order: Random, Variable Set-up
publishers: Active Magic Games, Mr. B Games

name: Nightfall at Camp Havenwood
description:
Description from the publisher:

Nightfall at Camp Havenwood is a horror/slasher themed co-op, survival game using the programming mechanic. The game plays 2-5 players with a game automated horror character. Set in 1985, in the northeastern U.S., you play a group of campers who are fighting for their survival. Several bloodthirsty horrors await you in the woods and you will need to work together to either kill the horror or discover the secrets of the camp that will allow you to survive. Welcome to camp!
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Punkapocalyptic
description:
Punkapocalyptic is a 30 mm miniature game, created by Bad Roll Games, that involves skirmishes between gangs in a pimp and lethal post-apocalyptic world.

The rich and mighty have created mega-cities for themselves and left the rest of the world devastated. The struggle for resources and survival is fierce. Life is worthless. Bands of gangers raid villages, dangerous mutants lurk in the ruins ... Welcome to the Wasteland, welcome to Punkapocalyptic.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling

name: Super Team
description:
Super Team is a highly-tactical football game featuring unique deck of cards for each team and captain, containing offensive and defensive tactical moves along with amazing skills to create a fast and exciting match.

On a turn each player simply plays 1-3 cards from their hands, resolving each card’s actions by rolling dice. The number of dice a player can roll for each action relates to that action’s stat set by the player at the start of each half of the game.

Super Team is also a game of resource management: each team gains morale(stars) by performing tactic cards and can spend those stars on critical events such as a perfect pass through, saving a chip shot or simply an extra movement!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution

name: Cave Evil: Chaos Pack 2
description:
18 new cards to add to Conjuration and other Decks

1 Mini Map "King of the Hell" 11" x 17" map that can be played on its own, added on top of other maps, or can extend maps.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Mature / Adult, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination

name: Capital Campaign
description:
Capital Campaign is a heavy worker placement/tableau-building game featuring variable abilities, unique worker roles, a rapidly-escalating scale of play, and many paths to victory.

The signature mechanism that drives the game is gathering and planning out your resource management within a limited number of turns before they are gone and you start the next year fresh.

Capital Campaign allows players to immerse themselves in a deep, rich world of philanthropy and doing the most good to come out on top.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Set Collection, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Krypto-nine
description:
Krypto-nine is a strategic 3-5 player family-style card game.

How to Play: The game is played in two parts. Players take turns playing combinations of cards from their hands in sums of 9. (See example images). The goal is to play all the cards in your hands before your opponents, so using a higher combination of cards per turn is recommended.
As soon as a player manages to play all their cards, they win that round and are awarded with a Victory Card.

Victory Cards allow players to manipulate the game by adding their own personality and creativity to gameplay. Players build their own unique strategy, create/change rules, and destroy any opposing strategy when they're used the right way.

The first player to successfully play 9 of these Victory Cards wins the game!

Krypto-nine features ambidextrous playing cards for both-handed players, basic math skills to help the younger players have fun learning, and offers a wide range of playability to ensure it’s a great time for all fun-seeking individuals!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Math, Party Game
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Points, Command Cards, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Enemy Traits Pack #4 – Masters of the Void
description:
Trait cards are used to give a particular enemy type more diversity (and often a bit more danger). This is the fourth in a series of Trait Packs that re-visit established enemies from Shadows of Brimstone, adding unique new traits to them, and making them feel different each time you encounter them! This Card Supplement contains a set of trait cards for each of the enemies from the Shadows of Brimstone: Masters of the Void Deluxe Enemy Pack: Void Sorcerers and Void Hounds. It also includes 5 new Void Magik Spells!

Contents:
10 Enemy Trait cards
5 Void Magik spell cards
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Congress of Vienna
description:
Congress of Vienna (CoV) is a diplomatic Strategy CDG for one to four players. It is based on Churchill, the superb, award-winning Mark Herman design, and was well received during GMT’s Spring 2019 Weekend at the Warehouse and June’s CSW Expo in Tempe, Arizona. It is the third game after Churchill and Pericles in GMT’s “Great Statesmen” series.

CoV creates an enthralling gaming arena. It allows players to become the main characters of the dramatic, titanic struggle between the struggling Napoleonic Empire and the coalition of Russia, Austria, and Great Britain (with their Prussian, Spanish, Portuguese, and Swedish allies).

The game starts after Napoleon’s disastrous 1812 retreat from Moscow, covering the decisive years of 1813 and 1814. The abstract game map involves a strategic theatre portraying Europe from the Iberian Peninsula to the boundaries of Poland and Prussia. It also includes the secondary front of Italy, an area for depicting maritime warfare and the British/American War of 1812. This game by designer Frank Esparrago and developer Dick Sauer (with much appreciated input from Mark Herman) has been created to be played as both a diplomatic and strategic military conflict without losing the taste of the Napoleonic era’s great battles.

All tables necessary for gameplay are printed on the game board. Congress of Vienna reproduces the spirit of Churchill in the mechanics and organization of its rules, diplomatic display, and its military map.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Tug of War

name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Across the Wastes – The Rescue: Part 1
description:
A desperate mission sends the rangers deep into the trackless desert north of Alladore. Somewhere in that wasteland is a hidden entrance to the Shadow Deep, an entrance that could prove the only chance for a daring rescue…

This book is the first of three that together make up a single mission called ‘The Rescue’. It includes 4 new scenarios designed for rangers of level 10 and above, as well as a pair of unique companions, and a host of fearsome new monsters. The book also includes a section on Advanced Herbalism that greatly increases the number of herbs that are available to rangers and gives new rules for using them and searching for them during missions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Tabletop Wargaming: 3rd Edition Rules
description:
Heavy Gear Blitz! is a tabletop miniatures wargame with over 20 years of heritage and success.

The colony world of Terra Nova continues to be in a state of constant conflict. Massive polar nations, invaders from Earth and even armed gangs have turned its arid landscape into a never-ending battlefield. Old grudges and fragile alliances set the stage for complete chaos while the Northern, Southern, Peace River and NuCoal Factions fight countless wars in the name of power, profit, revenge or mere survival.

Having failed to conquer Terra Nova once before, Earth has added her subjugated colony worlds to a new Colonial Expedition Force (CEF) invasion force of GRELS, FLAILs, and Hovertanks. Ships blacken the sky, unleashing unending waves of would-be conquerors onto Terra Nova’s war-torn surface. Even Utopia’s newest technological marvels of war have joined the CEF to claim a piece of the planet. Will the factions of Terra Nova unite as they did in the first invasion? Will that be enough this time? Or will Earth grind another planet under her iron heel?

The War for Terra Nova has only just begun... Gear Up and join the battle!

With the Heavy Gear Blitz 3rd Edition Rules you can:

Enjoy a fast paced, alternating activation game that leaves no player waiting as every action can be reacted to. Choose to play a casual skirmish game with as little as four models or an intense competitive game with 20 or more models.
Build a force from 10 different Factions and 36 Sub-Factions drawn from multiple worlds of the Heavy Gear Universe.
Use a “combined arms” approach to future warfare that includes Gears, Striders, Combat Mounts, Hovertanks, Tanks, Infantry, VTOLs, and Aircraft.
Select from a diverse array of weapons, electronic warfare tools, and many other options to destroy your opponent.
Wage war using a highly flexible system with customization options for commanders, forces, or even individual models as veterans and duelists.


3rd Edition Rules also includes introduction to the Heavy Gear Universe, objective generation, weapons recognition, reference sheets, and game tokens sheet. Plus model lists for the new plastic miniatures included in the Northern, Southern, Peace River, NuCoal, CEF, Caprice, & Utopia Army Boxes.

Also included are pdfs of the tokens sheet, force record sheet, Terra Nova maps, badlands buildings and stoneheads terrain flat sheets. And our collection of Heavy Gear Blitz paper terrain that you can print on cardboard/cover stock, then cut-out and glue together for some quick tabletop terrain.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Spellwards
description:
A card based word game for 2 to 10 players that plays in 5 to 10 minutes. Spellwards offers a lightning fast word game experience unlike anything you've played before!

To play a card, players must say a word that:

Starts with the letter on the centre card
Ends with the letter on the card being played
Has word length specified by number on card being played


There is no turn order in Spellwards, players may jump in and play a card whenever they are able to come up with an appropriate word. After a card is played, it becomes the new centre card. The first player to play all their cards wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play, Real-time, Word Game
mechanics: Race, Real-Time, Spelling

name: Zombicide: 2nd Edition – Monty Python's Flying Circus: Gumby Pack
description:
An exclusive set for those that pre-order the Monty Python Flying Circus: A Rather Silly Expansion through CMON's website.

The Gumbys can be used in several different ways in your game:

Abomination: The mob of Gumbys work as a single Abomination, moving as a loud and clueless mob that can be taken out one by one. Their strength is in numbers, as they can overwhelm Survivors with their sheer stupidity (or a lucky brick to the head).

Companion: As ghastly as that may sound, the Gumbys can follow Survivors around as Companions, helping pummel zombies with their angry little clenched fists (it’s like throwing lemmings against a blender).

Survivor: If you gather enough Gumbys you can kinda make one half-decent Survivor. All 6 Gumbys together act as a single obnoxiously loud Survivor. The more there are, the more damage they deal hurling bricks, though each wound takes one Gumby out. Be careful though, as these guys are very prone to getting in the way of friendly fire.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Five-Hole Crokinole
description:
Five-Hole Crokinole is played on a specially-drilled board and was popular in Canada in the late 1800s. The board is sized like a standard board, but in addition to the center hole it has a hole in the center of each 10-point area.

Play is similar to standard Crokinole, except that any disk pocketed in one of the 10-point area holes is removed from play and counts -10 points. This allows for both offensive attack and makes tricky shots more risky. As a result, scoring is usually more chaotic and variable.

This game can be bought in five-hole form, or often a standard board can be retrofitted to make this version. That retrofit is almost always one-way, though!
mechanics: Team-Based Game

name: Deadball: Year III
description:
Deadball: Year III is an expansion to the bestselling Deadball: Baseball With Dice. Inspired by the cheats and scoundrels of baseball history, Year III features Steroid Era all-stars, rules for throwing the World Series, and fully-updated rosters for the wonderfully bizarre Southern Circuit. It requires either the original game or Deadball: 1909 to play.

What Is Deadball?

Deadball is a fast-paced baseball dice game for one or two players that uses real statistics to bring the ballpark to your tabletop. Its elegantly simple rules are intuitive to die-hards and casual fans alike, allowing you to simulate a game between real or imaginary teams in about twenty minutes. Check out the free quick start guide to see how fast and fun it plays.

What's New In Year III?

One hundred years ago, a group of Chicago White Sox players attempted to throw the World Series, creating a scandal that ended their careers and changed the sport forever. Deadball: Year III allows you to simulate a game or series in which one or more of the players on the field are deliberately trying to lose, and to find out how it feels to throw the most important games of your life.

Along with the rules for fixing a series, Year III includes:


An oddities table that seamlessly integrates incidents like balks, fan interference, botched calls, and animals on the field—without slowing down play
New rules to simulate modern bullpen usage


A revised Deadball scoresheet that makes it easier than ever to keep track of the action

Rosters for the notorious All Stars of the Steroid Era


A history of baseball’s bans and blacklists by John Thorn, the official historian of Major League Baseball; a meditation on losing on purpose by USA Today’s Ted Berg, and a poem about the dead ball era by Nicole Callihan

In Year III, cheaters never prosper—but they still have a marvelous time.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Zord Pack #1
description:
With the assistance of the legendary Ninjor, the Power Rangers acquired the Ninja powers and the accompanying Ninjazords. Add the Ninjazords to Heroes of the Grid with this pack of 6 new zords and 2 megazords.

Includes:
Black Frog Ninjazord card
Pink Crane Ninjazord card
Blue Wolf Ninjazord card
Yellow Bear Ninjazord card
Red Ape Ninjazord card
White Ninja Falconzord card
Ninja Megazord card
Ninja Megafalconzord card
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Batman: The Animated Series Adventures – Stretch Goals & Exclusives
description:
Contains all the Kickstarter stretch goals and exclusive items for the Kickstarter version of the game. The box includes new gameplay elements such as the Episode Guide book which contains new missions, more characters as well as their abilities available to be played, new gadget cards the characters can use as well as new punch-out tokens which represent new effects characters can suffer from.

Contents include:

35 Plastic miniatures
18 Hero specific Action dice
8 Battle dice
6 Double-sided map tiles
8 Hero Boards
8 Life Dials
22 Punch-out tokens
19 Character sheets
109 Skill and Ability cards
2 Ally cards
21 Initiative cards
20 Gadget cards
1 Episode Guide book
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Six Points College Football
description: Six Points (as its name implies) is a college football board game. Each team is represented by a series of tables representing rush and pass defense, special teams, all facets of the offense, and some miscellaneous tables. Results are obtained by having the offense pick a player and a play (pass or run). The offense rolls a die or dice for a result. The defense then rolls on the appropriate table to modify the result. Optional rules add defensive play calling to the game. Seasons are known to exist from 1975 through 1981.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Erosion
description:
Each player tries to erode their mountain and generate the most amount of sediment in their delta. Players erode their mountains with the processes they successfully bid on and acquire. The sediment supplied to the delta becomes the coinage used in the bidding process. Mountains uplift 1,500 meters per turn until one player reaches 8,000 meters, or until the "Active Uplift Shutdown" event card is drawn. Then, it's a race to see who can erode their mountain away the fastest. When a player successfully erodes their mountain, the game ends. The winner is the player with the most sediment in their delta, after subtracting any sediment that remains in their mountain.

To the play the game, you need to print out a copy of the rules, the bidding row, the game cards (the card types include event, process, mountain front, and mountain type), and enough game boards for the number of players that will play. A cool rock and a cup to hold the sediment is also needed. You will also need to buy a couple boxes of Jujubees (you can eat them while you play), as they are the "sediment" used in the game.

The designer recommended printing the game materials (except the rules) in color, on 11" x 17" cardstock. To make the game, the designer recommended using a paper cutter, a glue stick, scissors (for minor clean up), and scotch tape.

The "Erosion" v. 1.0 ZIP file was available for download as of May 9, 2008 at the designer's former webpage

The files have been unavailable since Sierra Madre Games announced that they were publishing a revised version of Erosion in 2009.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation

name: The Tabloid News
description:
The Tabloid News is the first in Warcoach Games new "10 Minute Game" series.
The Tabloid News is a new take on an old concept. Players make wild headlines that can even include custom cards with the players name and his friends on them. Never have tabloid lies been so much fun!! In this game you can make the headlines, literally.
To play the game, players lay down cards in order of color code from their hand to form a 5 card headline. The player to complete the headline gets all 5 cards and the points they are worth. Each card has it's own point value. When the first person runs out of cards, or the draw deck is empty, the game is over. The player with the most points wins. Quick & easy.
The game generally takes less than 10 minutes but provides hours of fun. The first edition (called the Morning Edition) is out now. A second edition is expected by fall (the Evening Edition).

(From the publishers release information.)
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Fallen: Outlands Bonus Pack
description: Set of seven promotional cards offered to people who pre-ordered the Cursed Sands and Depths of the Glarr expansions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Storytelling

name: Lucha Pioneros
description:
In the first half of the 20th century in Mexico, local promotions bring to light new masked heroes with the birth of a new cultural phenomenon: Lucha Libre! Impersonate those pioneers in their conquest of the crowds by inventing and popularizing new match types!

A race for innovation takes place: inventing new match types rewards you with Glory Masks, but popularizing an already invented match can also make you steal it from your opponent. When a player popularizes 2 different match styles, the game ends.

On a given turn, a player will first get the chance to hire the best available Luchadores from the Lucha Gym to join their Promotion. Then, players are invited to choose between actions to build their Promotion or to challenge rival promotions by proposing a match. When choosing to build, a player can hire managers, invent new match styles, create Championship titles or use their Luchadores's family influence to collect member of the same family/clan.

When proposing a match, rivals have to match the style of your match-chosen luchadores in order to answer your challenge. If a successful Luchadores matching is made, players will go head to head in a dice rolling battle to earn the 3 count!

The Promotion having the most Glory Masks at the end of the game is declared the winner! Bonuses are given to the first player having completed the race, for each family/clan re-united and for each Championship Belt won in the matches. In that regard, the game proposes multiple strategies and paths to victory. With the memorization aspect of the families and wrestlers style, as well as the quick game turns, there is no downtime and plenty of room for strategy.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Hearts of Iron: The Board Game
description:
Hearts of Iron: The Board Game is a game of grand strategy warfare, tactical battles, and shrewd diplomatic choices based on the popular Hearts of Iron video game franchise released on PC by Paradox Interactive. The board game takes place during the WWII era, and with the expansions, allows for players to battle for territories across the world. Get ready to change the course of history and forge your nation's path to victory and glory!

This is the core base game and features the Eastern European war theater.

—description from the publisher
categories: Territory Building, Video Game Theme, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Of Dreams & Shadows: Spirit Charm Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for Of Dreams & Shadows.

"Spirit Charm" is a new resource card that you add to the resource deck at the beginning of the game.

It is an "Item," with a cost of 3, and the following ability: "Immediately discard any Cursed or Madness Afflictions that have attached to this Champion."

It was released in Game Trade Magazine #224 (October 2018).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing

name: Cyber Siege
description:
About: In Cyber Siege everyone is a hacker trying to gain control of the system through use of programs, once you have uploaded or install all your bytes of data to the system you have taken control. Cyber Siege is a game that uses temporary alliances, strategy, and program actions to advance your own agenda, or slow down your opponents. Discussion, deals, persuasion, and even temporary treaties are allowed and encouraged. Turns are fast in this game and everyone stays engages the whole game. The rules are simple to understand but there is still strategic depth. Players will attempt to take control of Programs by installing more bytes of data then their opponents.

Victory Condition: Be the first player to Upload or Install all your bytes of data from your hard drive into the System!

Game Play:
Cyber Siege consists of several game rounds separated into three phases:

Install Phase: Players take turns installing bytes of data into one of many programs in order to take majority control and take the programs action.
Execution Phase: Players take turns executing programs. Each program has a special ability that either helps yourself or hurts one of your opponents. But because the scoring is hidden no one knows for sure who is winning, therefor deflection and collusion to change who to attack is an open table discussion.
Packet Generation Phase: Players simultaneously generate there data packet (the number of bytes of data they will get to install on the following round) based upon the actions executed by the program.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Kampf gegen das Bünzlitum: Shötli-Erweiterung
description:
The Shötli-Expansion is here!

100 new and vitriolic cards and an additional gamemode for drinkhungry jerks!

This time we didn't have help from comedians to text the new cards. As in the main version, the cards are made by us and cover themes about current topics, personalities and... alcohol !
That's why we also added a new, totally reasonable gamemode for drinkhungry jerks. Because we wouldn't want anyone dying from dehydration while playing.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Smirkle: the saracastic "sorry about that" dice game
description: Smirkle is a dice game that is as fun as chasing chickens. The points add up fast and the risk is very high. Shoot you might as well get the pickup or risk it for a biscuit. You always start with the smirkle dice and then roll the 8-sided dice. Get three of a kind and other combinations to win quickly.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Infinity Deathmatch: TAG Raid
description: TAG Raid is a 2-to-4-player game with miniatures that recreates skirmishes and multiplayer combat in the Infinity Universe, a science-fiction, high-tech universe that portrays an exciting, action-packed near-future setting with manga aesthetics.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Agents of War
description: In Agents of War, players are rival governments seeking influence over modern battlefields. Use whatever resources are at your disposal, whether its drones, blackmail, or an allied dictator. Agents of War doesn’t determine who’s right, only who’s left.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Heroes of Three Kingdoms
description:
It was the end of Eastern Han Dynasty, which chaos in the court and starvation among people. AD 184, Zhang Jiao the leader of Taiping Sect incited his suffering believers to raise an uprising called Yellow Turban. For a time, the flag of "the sky is dead, and the yellow sky is ready" rose everywhere, sweeping the Central Plains. Start with crusade against the Yellow Turban, co-existence of heroes and the separation of vassals joins the "Three Kingdoms".

The heroes with vivid images and distinct personalities are shining and falling on the stage one after another, and the greatest charm of this era is also bursting out. The story of the Three Kingdoms has been deeply rooted in people's hearts through the records of the Three Kingdoms and the Romance of the Three Kingdoms. It has become a well-known legend of heroes and is still one of the most attractive times in ancient China.

This game uses hexagon map, makes location of each city more precise, bring more flexible for different armies and tactics. In the vast map, the player's strategic vision will be more reflected.

—description from the back of the box (translated)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Hello There Squad Pack
description:
"The burden is on me not to destroy all the droids until you arrive." -Obi-Wan Kenobi

A Jedi Master battles to maintain the Republic! With the Republic under attack from all sides, the noble Obi-Wan Kenobi steps forward to contain the Separatist threat. At his side are the Clone Marshal Commander known as "Cody" and the Phase II Clone Troopers of the renowned 212th Attack Battalion.

United in their resolve to preserve the Republic, they battle the Separatist threat throughout the galaxy. Known for their ability to strategize even in the thick of battle and ferocity in combat, Kenobi, Cody, and the 212th represent one of the Republic's best chances to restore peace to the galaxy. . .

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Krieg Eterna
description:
A game of Krieg Eterna is divided into three separate rounds of play, where your objective is to win more rounds than your opponent. Each player's side of the field is split into three rows: melee, ranged, and siege. At the end of each round, the player with the most total strength across all of their rows wins that round. Players take turns playing cards until all players say "pass", after which they score the field, discard all cards on the field to the graveyard, and then start the next round.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kampf gegen das Spiessertum: Fan-Erweiterung
description: A hundred new cards for "Kampf gegen das Spiessertum" choosen from the community ideas.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The War of the Worlds: One More Day
description:
A solo story driven, deck building, exploration and survival game - based on the events in the novel The War of the Worlds, by H.G.Wells.

Take on the role of a journalist or infantry soldier during the Martian invasion of Victorian England. Explore various locations around London as you play through one of six challenging and varied stories.

Build your deck each turn to improve your chances of staying alive against the events and engagements that threaten mankind's survival. From Martian fighting-machines and heat-rays, to black smoke and red weed, ruffian gangs, Martian harvesters, packs of savage dogs and more!

Finish the story by completing objectives and overcoming challenges, before learning about the weaknesses of the invaders and survive long enough to witness their death!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: PitLane
description:
PitLane is a boardgame that simulates a Formula 1 race. The race is a sequence of game rounds, which are divided into planning and movement. It is a game where strategically planning your movements is essential. Every driver has his own deck of "movement cards" which include straight lines, curves, braking and overtaking cards. Each round you may pick up a maximum of 4 cards, in the order you wish to play them, you then move your driver's car according to the cards directions, around the track. But be careful, picking all 4 cards every time could result in collisions with other drivers, going off the track, or running out of fuel.

Before a race begins, you must choose your fuel load and tyre types according to different variables, such as weather conditions, where warmer temperatures result in quicker tyre wear, and also your fuel strategy, as you must choose your race fuel for qualifying. To make these decisions, you look at the various statistics on your driver's information cards, and place markers upon the starting fuel load, and reliablity statistics, which change over the course of the race.
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Charge! Or How to Play War Games
description:
Originally published in 1967 in Britain, Charge! is one of two foundation texts establishing the modern miniatures war game hobby. Many of those who play miniatures began with this book and almost all existing rules systems can trace their lineage back to this book.

The book is a detailed building up of rules for playing a war game. It contains detailed discussion of the rationale behind these rules, grounding them in military theory and history. The book contains two sets of rules: an elementary set for playing simple games and an advanced set of rules to provide a richer simulation. It also contains one scenario, a mythical 18th century battle, which is played out step by step in the book.

These rules define the "Old School" of war gaming: individually based figures in large units with written orders to sub-commanders, etc. Despite its age, there are groups of gamers who continue to base their encounters on the spirit of this book if not its strict letter.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation
publishers: A.S. Barnes, Athena Books, Morgan-Grampian Books

name: Doomtown: Welcome to Deadwood
description:
Welcome to Deadwood is Pine Box Entertainment's fifth expansion for Doomtown.

A small determined posse moves on from Gomorra and Tombstone, riding toward their destiny in a boomtown surrounded by the Black Hills of the Dakota badlands. Meanwhile, Jonah Essex continues to flee powerful enemies. Is he prepared for an unexpected welcome in Deadwood ?

This new Doomtown expansion features 4 copies of 56 new cards, including historical places and people including Seth Bullock, Al Swearengen, The Gem Theater, and the No. 10 Saloon.

-description from publisher
categories: American West, Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: ignition:core
description:
ignition:core is an anime themed, miniatures based, skirmish tactics game of combat and board control.

Each player assumes the role of Armored Fireteam Leader (or Armored Raid Leader) commanding a team of combat specialists in a mission to claim valuable resources and territory on behalf of their faction/benefactors in the world of Isalia.

Destroying all that you see may seem appealing, but the narrow road to victory will demand smarter tactical decisions. Understanding the mission, your environment and the terrain and resources is key to victory.

ignition:core is a low model count, high model quality approach to tactical miniatures gaming in an ever evolving world. All rulebooks, data-cards and updates are free.

—description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Points, Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Re-rolling and Locking, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Zone of Control

name: Ship Adventure
description:
Do you want to explore cities, temples, jungles and islands? Hunt treasures and a lot of gold? Fight pirates and players? Go for an epic conquest of the Caribbean? Then Ship Adventure is made for you! The board of Ship Adventure is made of 36 tiles that allowed an unimaginable number of board combinations to make each playing experience unique.

Ship Adventure is a 2 games in 1 with a treasure hunt mode and a conquest mode.

In Ship Adventure - Treasure Map, players move their ship and crew on the board, choosing the quickest itinerary to reach cities, temples, treasure tokens and pieces of treasure map. Along the journey, they are going to purchase equipment to boost their ship so they perform better score when launch their dice during fights. The game end when a player has gathered the 4 different pieces of treasure map and has reached the coordinates indicated on the puzzle formed by the 4 pieces on the board.

In Ship Adventure - Caribbean Conquest at each turn player move their fleet and armies on the board in order to take the control over strategic points. Each strategic points gives gold coins at the end of the turn which are used to purchase equipment and new units. The game ends when a player controls the majority of the strategic areas or when a player has been eliminated.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Nautical, Pirates
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Kill Steal, Modular Board, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Tainted Grail: Kings of Ruin – Black Goat of the Moors
description:
Additional companion (Goat of the Moors) expansion with high-quality miniature and with its own small personal side story.

Contains:
- Black Goat of the Moors Story Entries
- Miniature
- Rules Card

-description from campaign
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Middle-Earth Play-By-Mail
description:
Middle-earth Play-By-Mail is an award-winning strategic game set the world of J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth. In it, you take on the role of the heroes (and villains) of Middle-earth, leading armies, undertaking perilous adventures, governing your cities and towns, and making all the decisions that affect your empire.

Middle-earth Play-By-Mail is a team game, where you work together as part of either the Free Peoples in defending the innocent against Sauron's hatred, or as a Dark Servant, a hand of Sauron.

Middle-earth Play-by-Mail is a turn-based game. This means that rather than playing online, you have the luxury of time in which to consider and plan your next move, before submitting your new orders.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Camp Grizzly: Camp Grounds
description: 5 Expansions to Camp Grizzly
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination

name: Dust Tactics: Steel Guards Sniper Team – "Silent Death"
description: Equipped with the best SSU technology, there veteran are now returning to the battlefield. The deadliness of the Steel Guards Sniper Team is enhanced by the incredible range of its powerful 20mm Heavy Rifles and by advanced targeting mechanisms which grant both soldier the Spotter skill.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Siemens-Schuckert D.III
description:
From the publisher:

The Siemens-Schuckert D.III was a German single-seat fighter built by Siemens-Schuckert Werke. The D.III was a development of the earlier Siemens-Schuckert D.IIc prototype, and it was appreciated by enthusiastic pilots for its handling and its rate of climb. It was flown by a number of famous aces, such as Helmut Lange, Josef Veltjens and Oliver Von Beaulieu-Marconnay.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW1 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Panzer Strike: France 1940
description:
Panzer Strike: France 1940 represents a tank battle in some French town during the Battle of France in May 1940. Each side (French and German) has one type of tanks.

The game is played by moving figurines into positions to shoot at enemy tanks. Dice determine the number of fields tanks can move. When in shooting dice determine was that a hit or a miss (depending on distance and tank armor).

The goal of the game can be to destroy all enemy tanks or a special scenario.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Square Grid, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Set-up

name: Journey to the Overland (2nd Edition)
description:
The King is old. The kingdom is divided and the great Wizard Morcai is mustering an army atop Fire Castle. From every town in the land the call goes out for heroes to take up the quest for the Five Weapons of Power. Ancient artifacts of immense power capable of giving their wielder the power to be...king! You must heed this call but your quest will not be easy. You must leave your home with only a small supply of modest provisions and brave the Overland's dangers as you seek news and information of the Five Weapons of Power. Along the way you will brave harsh weather, get lost in unfamiliar terrain, encounter powerful and sometimes hostile strangers, enter new towns, visit great castles, make loyal friends and do deeds that will make you a legend. And only if you survive all that will you be worthy to vie for one of the Five Weapons of Power.

Journey To The Overland is a solo tabletop role playing game where you assume the role of a lone traveler journeying throughout the Overland in search of Five Weapons of Power. Play begins in your hometown which will be determined by the race you choose for your character – human, dwarf, elf or native Overlander. From there you will determine your character starting characteristics, starting equipment and first daily action. Each day you must select a daily action that will either involve traveling, resting, working, training or visiting towns and castles to obtain news and information with the ultimate goal being to track down one of the five legendary weapons with the power to make you King!

In this revised 2nd Edition of Journey To The Overland the core rulebook has been completely reorganized for easier reference. The rules themselves have been expanded to include all new content for Kings Harbor (News & Information, Tavern, Audience with the Harbormaster); new taverns, an expanded supply and equipment table, new distinct News and Information for each town or castle; optional Encumbrance rules to replace the seldom used 'weight' rules; new jobs; a new race (Halflings), a new section on 'Feats', new NPCs, an expanded Ocean Encounter Table, revised rules for falling unconscious and new audience tables for Audiences with King Overlord and the King Thorond of Dwarfhaven.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Quest for the Lost Pixel: Risk and Reward
description:
In Risk and Reward, you are given brand new choices to push your luck for great rewards. Everything in this expansion leaves you with difficult choices. Plus this expansion offers a reinforcement set of monsters, treasures, spells, events and more. Lastly, it has a few treasure fixes that replace old cards.

Risk and Rewards offers new Dungeon Areas for your heroes to explore. But why risk the time into exploring these new areas? BRAND NEW SET TREASURES. These get better the more of the same set that you have. Unfortunately, each new area can be very dangerous as well. Also, you will receive PETS that will give you a permanent buff until you decide on discarding your pet for their one time great ability. Lastly, there are 5 new heroes to choose from.

NEW HEROES: Blood Mage, Psionic, Spell Blade, Time Bender, and the Duelist.

Lastly, almost all decks receives tons of new cards from monsters and events to treasures and artifacts. Plus so much more.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Many Arrows Faction Pack
description:
The Many Arrows Faction Pack expands your games of D&D Onslaught with an aggressive, hard-hitting faction largely comprised of Orc warriors and their allies. The Many Arrows specialize in Rooting and Slowing their foes, keeping the opposition from vital objectives and within range of powerful, short-ranged attacks.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Timer, Critical Hits and Failures, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Makara
description:
Makara, tailored exclusively for the Turkish market, is a dynamic party game inspired by the public domain game Celebrities. It stands out with its strong focus on Turkish cultural nuances and humor, making it particularly enjoyable and relatable for those familiar with Turkish traditions and jokes.

The game boasts an extensive collection of 250 cards, each card being a gateway to laughter and fun. These cards are divided into 7 distinct categories, encompassing a wide range of words that resonate with various aspects of Turkish life and culture.

In the first round, players try to describe these personalities or concepts without mentioning their names, weaving in culturally specific references and humor. The second round challenges players to convey the same with just a single word. Finally, in the most exhilarating round, verbal communication is completely off-limits, and players must resort to gestures and charades, often drawing upon shared cultural experiences and jokes unique to the Turkish audience. This structure makes Makara not just a game of guessing but a celebration of Turkish culture and wit.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Memory, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – SPAD S.VII
description:
From the publisher:

The SPAD S.VII was the first of a series of highly successful biplane fighter aircraft produced by Société Pour L'Aviation et ses Dérivés (SPAD) during the First World War. The S.VII was renowned as a sturdy and rugged aircraft with good climbing and diving characteristics. It was flown by a number of famous pilots, such as the French ace Georges Guynemer and the American pilot Robert Soubiran.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW1 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Byline
description:
1960. The world is brimming with news waiting for independent reporters to capture them into newsprint. Byline puts the player into the role as an independent newspaper reporter trying to elevate their reputation and as well as the popularity of the major newspaper outlets. Over the course of seven days, players will pack each workday with seeking out sources, validating leads, and delivering stories just in time to meet the critical deadline.

Byline, at its heart, is a worker placement game with a twist. The game plays one to four players in 60 to 90 minutes.
mechanics: Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Winds of Numa Sera
description:
A Kingdom-Building Strategy Board Game for 2-4 players that shares the same world and characters as the acclaimed graphic novel from Dark Horse.

Each player controls a different kingdom that comes with a trio of unique heroes to play as and customize. There are multiple ways to win the game, and whoever is first to any of them, wins.

Vast, beautiful, and dangerous, the world of Ethera is full of unique cultures and kingdoms -- all vying for control of the landscape. From the ordained bloodline of Numa Sera, to the valiant knights of Dena Vale, to the “Cat People” of Meran, and the Pillaging Hordes of Siaa De’e. Each force will stop at nothing to advance its power.

As the leader of your people, your goal is to amass resources and create the most powerful kingdom in all of Ethera, so that your name will be remembered long after you are gone. There are several ways to achieve this: by conquering strongholds, slaying your opponents’ heroes, mastering skills, or earning new class titles. You can rule benevolently, cruelly, or anything in between. The choice is yours.

Whichever path you take, you will need to acquire assets to advance your heroes and grow your kingdom. Through exploration of Ethera’s many distinct environments, you will uncover rare items and enlist new allies to assist in your campaign. But exploration also has its risks: Ethera is a dangerous place, full of ancient secrets and hidden obstacles. So be ever vigilant…

The Winds of Numa Sera are blowing.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, City Building, Fantasy, Medieval, Political
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Oracle
description:
Oracle is a thrilling blend of battle and social deduction. Perfect for casual meetups and parties, it is extremely easy to learn and play, with simple rules and a playtime of 15-30 minutes.

In Oracle, each player is given a secret role card. On it is an objective to eliminate specific players, but the catch is, no one knows who is who. Through observation alone, you must deduce who those players are.

Use your cards to construct powerful buildings, launch strategic attacks, and defend would-be allies, all for the sake of completing your objective before anyone else.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination

name: New Beeginnings
description:
Description from the publisher:

New Beeginnings is a 2-6 player strategy exploration (4X) game without the usual 4X time committment. If you like Hive, Tak, or Chess, you'll love this game.

It is Springtime in the local beehive and the queen is ready to swarm with a portion of the hive to seek out and establish a new home. To prepare, she is holding a competition for the hive to see which bees are best fit to go with her. As a player, you take on the role of a team of bees competing in this game. Can you be more efficient than your opponents in collecting resources for the hive, manage new growth, and protecting the hive from danger and disease? Only the best will get to go with the queen on this new adventure!

Control your team of bees to explore the flower field and collect valuable resources for the hive. Analyze your opponent's moves and strategy to outwit the other teams and fight your way to victory. Take covert actions to accomplish the secret mission assigned to you by the queen herself.

Players move bees and collect resources with action points and free abilities based on each bee's role. All players begin with Drones and must manage the population and roles within their hive to collect resources more efficiently than other players. The game has three different game ending conditions, allowing the players to choose a strategy to be the winning team.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Valor of the 13th
description:
Into the Endless Plains of Russia

Valor of the 13th Expansion is an expansion for Heroes of the Motherland from the Lock ‘n Load Tactical system.  It features fluid, impulse-based turns, squad-level actions, and individual heroics.  The scenarios inside represent the efforts of the Soviet 13th Army to defend the area around Ponyari during the vital crucial days of July 6th through July 12th of 1943, during the German Operation Citadel-the fight to eliminate the Kursk salient. The scenarios focus on the battles around Hill 253.5 and the plains to the east of the hill. Massive infantry and armor engagements rage and flow around these battlefields, as both sides scramble to gain an advantage.  Also included are a new set of Vehicle rules that expand on the existing Vehicle rules presented in the Lock ‘n Load Tactical System Core Rules and were designed for this expansion pack. They now allow you to damage and destroy the mobility and combat capabilities of vehicles.  Included are ten brand-new scenarios, two giant maps (one 34" x 22", and one 22" x 17"), and a counter sheet with over 100 counters. 

The Defenses of Kursk beckons you back to  Heroes of the Motherland!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Warmachine: MKIV
description:
The newest version of the full-metal fantasy miniatures game, with new armies, new rules, and new heroes. New rules include Command Cards, warjack customization, spell list customization, and new army construction rules!

Warmachine is a fast-paced 32mm skirmish game for two or more players in the Iron Kingdoms setting. After collecting, assembling, and painting your miniatures, you'll compete against your opponent to accomplish scenario objective and to destroy their forces in a quick-moving game.

WARMACHINE MKIV simplifies and streamlines the rules from the previous edition of the game, breaking factions into finite, closed armies, while changing several rules people have learned to use over previous editions. Facing and free strikes are gone. Templates are gone. Movement is simpler and faster. Hills are back. And new factions enter the fray, as the battles for the Iron Kingdoms begin anew.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Clank! Legacy 2: Acquisitions Incorporated – Darkest Magic
description: CLANK! Legacy returns with an epic sequel — Clank! Legacy 2: Acquisitions Incorporated - Darkest Magic Play co-operatively and competitively in the world of Penny Arcade's Acquisitions Incorporated!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Legacy Game, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – The Delve
description:
If any have escaped the hidden realm of The Caretaker, their tale has never been told.

The Delve is an adventure for 2-4 heroes in which you must explore and survive the realm of the Caretaker. Collect loot and gain skills as you advance through a collection of randomly selected stages. As you expand your Descent 2nd Edition collection, you unlock new maps, monsters, and boss fights—untold combinations of heroes, classes, monsters, stages, and loot await. Experience a unique adventure each time you enter, and hopefully exit, The Delve!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Map Addition, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Erune: Light & Darkness
description:
Enter the world of the 1st expansion for ERUNE and roam through its darkest dungeons... New Adventurers, new epic quests, new monsters and thwart the Master of Shadows' evil plans!

Erune is a Dungeon-Crawler for 1 to 5 players.

The Spirit of Erune is the privileged companion of your adventures. Guardian of the ancestral knowledge of the world of Erune, it resides in each and everything. Impartial, it does not take part in the conflict between the Adventurers and the Master of Shadows.

The Spirit of Erune is the narrator of your adventure
It allows you to speak with the characters you meet during your adventures.
It punctuates your quests with all kinds of events.
Beware! Your choices have consequences that influence your story!

The Spirit of Erune is a source of knowledge
It will answer all your questions about the rules of the game and the objects of the world of Erune down to the smallest detail.

The Spirit of Erune is luck
It unveils the treasures, the traps and the effects of items among thousands of possibilities!

The Spirit of Erune makes you evolve
It reveals your earnings when you level up, your quest objectives and the winner of the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Medieval, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sinoda
description:
Sinoda is an abstract strategy game played using 4-sided dice as the pieces on a beautiful "flower of life" pattern board. Players must capture the most points worth of pieces from their opponents.

On their turn, a player may either move a piece exactly the number shown on the top at the piece, or they may rotate a piece to increase or decrease the top number by 1. The number at the top is the piece's movement value, indicating how many spaces it must move (should you choose to move it), but it is also the points value of the piece, awarded to the opposing player if they capture it. Captures are made by finishing a move on top of another player's piece. During a move, a piece may not move over another piece, or backtrack through a space it just went through.

In a 2-player game, the game ends when one player has lost all of their pieces, or when both players have only a single piece left on the board.
In a 3+ player game, the game ends when one player has captured 6 opposing pieces.

Once the game ends, players add up their captured points. Since the winner is the player with the most captured points, and not the player who has captured the most pieces, it is possible to lose all of your pieces and still win!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement

name: Enemy Weapon
description:
Enemy Weapon is a card-based party game for 3+ players, where you and your fellow players will be engaging in a series of epic battles, facing off against a variety of powerful enemies.

To aid in your fight, you'll have access to an assortment of legendary weapons. Each round you must examine your arsenal closely, and choose the artifact or special power most capable of vanquishing the current foe.

With weapon in hand, each player must weave their own tale of glorious battle, arguing that they alone possess the tool necessary to defeat the enemy. However, only the warrior who presents the most unique (and hilarious) plan of attack will earn the favor of the almighty judge, and claim victory.

Warrior, the time has come for you to abandon the tired distractions of lesser men. Steel your resolve, summon your courage, and prepare your butthole for the glory of Enemy Weapon.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Player Judge

name: Odkrywcy Kultur
description:
Odkrywcy kultur is a game of cultural discovery that takes you around the world in just 40 minutes!

We all love to travel, explore exotic civilizations, and gain a greater understanding of the cultural heritage of others. But discovery isn’t always easy, and there’s always that chance that missteps might offend rather than open doors.

Did your host in Japan reach for her samurai sword when you plunged your chopsticks into the rice bowl? Did the guys in an English pub take a swing at you after you gestured to the bartender asking for two beers?

Odkrywcy kultur takes players to new and exciting places around the world while showing them how to behave to avoid confusion, conflicting signals, and even real danger. During the game, participants visit all continents and discover hundreds of unwritten rules of social behavior: how to gesture acceptance in India, what to avoid in Egypt during Ramadan, and how to successfully conduct business negotiations in Brazil.

Odkrywcy kultur is a unique mix of a modern board game and a handbook on cross-cultural communications. As players race to pick up souvenirs across the globe, they must think tactically to plan their trip, quiz others on potential cultural faux pas, and quickly react to opponents’ moves. As with any game, a bit of luck always helps.

When players correctly answer an opponent’s question they win chips with souvenirs and can then travel to another country, opening a treasure chest of knowledge about the new region. The game’s questions were designed and arranged to offer interesting and practical information about our “global village” during play.

The rules of Odkrywcy kultur were designed by Karol Madaj, designer of 303 as well as Kolejka (Queue) and Lukasz M. Pogoda. The questions and answers in Odkrywcy kultur were drawn from the decades of travel experience and cultural exploration of Halina Grzymala-Moszczynska, PhD, professor of Jagiellonian University in Cracow, and Witold Sekudewicz, the game’s author and managing director of The Link School of Foreign Languages and Intercultural Communications. Mr. Sekudewicz and Ms. Grzymala-Moszczynska worked closely with a panel of widely traveled experts from universities on five continents in creating the game.

Odkrywcy kultur is a must for anyone with an interest in our multicultural world and a love of sharing fun and excitement with friends and family. It’s a great pastime for both seasoned explorers and those who only dream about faraway places. Also, it is a storehouse of practical knowledge for any business traveler: Don’t risk a blunder and failed deals because you misread the signals when you’re away from home.

Before you buy your plane, train, or boat tickets, learn how to sidestep unpleasant situations and awkward apologies and avoid offending your hosts. Yes, even a journey of 10,000 miles begins with a single step. Odkrywcy kultur is the step you’ll want to take first.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Voting
publishers: The Link School of Foreign Languages and Cross Cultural Communication

name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Draft Starter Pack
